1.content:
Okay, so I've never really been good at "this" kind of thing. I suck at first impressions, so let me just lay everything down on the table for you right now:

My name is Melanie Carlyle, I'm a Saggitarius, I've got long blonde hair, and I'm fat.

In fact, I'm probably the biggest girl you'll ever meet. So 'fat' is kind of an understatement.

I'm huge.

The last time I weighed myself, I was somewhere around four hundred pounds. And my belly was so big that I had to get my little sister to look at the scale for me. I've put on three hundred pounds since my freshman year at prep school, and by the time I graduated I could barely fit through the front door. So yeah, I'm pretty fat.

I know, I know. Heart disease, diabetes, whatever. Who gives a crap. I love my body—and I mean I really love my body. Back in my Buttercombe Academy days, I was the hottest piece of ass to waddle down the hall, and it was because of my weight. You'd be surprised how many heads you can turn at my size.

The thing is? It's not enough.

I want to get bigger. Is that crazy?

I mean, I'm already the fattest girl I know. I spend more time eating than I have any right to, and it takes just as much food to feed my parents and my little sister to fill me up at any given meal—sometimes more. I love to eat. I love how people look at me when I waddle down the street. And, probably most importantly, I love the look on my Mom's face every time I break a chair or pop a button at the dinner table.

So the long and short of it is: my name's Mel Carlyle, and I want to get as fat as humanly possible.

Which is probably good for me, because…

11.content:
I mean seriously, have you ever tried to NOT put on weight at college? From what I hear, it's pretty hard. And that's for people who AREN'T trying to break the four-hundred-pound mark.

I spent most of my high school years away at Buttercombe Academy getting fat, coming home only for holidays and summers while I pigged out for pretty much the rest of my time there. Which worked out great for me, because while I didn't have to hear my Mom constantly bitch and moan about how much I was eating, I also developed independence that helped ease the transition into a more "permanent" living arrangement away from my parents. So, go me I guess.

I don't know what I was expecting, but the dorm rooms at Stuffington U weren't very nice. Kinda small. But then again, I guess the people in charge of housing probably just thought I was "too big." Pfft, whatever that meant.

My parents weren't gone five minutes before I flung myself on top of the bed, the springs inside screaming as I forced all of my weight on top of it. They'd helped me move all my stuff in, even if my Mom was super snarky about how "even my clothes were heavy", and the whole ordeal had left everyone (but especially me) totally exhausted. Everything was still packed up, and I was already a couple hundred calories short of having the energy to do much of anything about it at the moment.

I was still dressed in my "please like me I'm new" clothes, but I managed to peel off my big burgundy sweater and fling across the room, landing on the unclaimed bed on the other side. My belly hung out by a wide margin from the tank top I had on under it, even as it sagged under its own weight when standing upright. My fat ass bubbled out from my jeans, meaning that basically my entire lower roll was just out and about for display.

I glance over to the empty bed.

"Hope my roommate doesn't mind a show." I thought to myself, my hands coming to cradle the expansive belly blob in front of me, "She'd better get used to it."

As I wrestled with the decision as to whether or not to remove my pants as well (y'know, getting comfortable and all), I hear my door handle turn...

So that's how my new roommate meets me--splayed out on the bed fondling my belly blubber.

Admittedly, this was probably going to happen sooner or later, but it's not always best to start with all of that on the table. Especially when all of "that" was about three hundred extra pounds or so. I mean, I like to fondle myself as much as the next obesophile, but there were... boundaries, y'know?

Anyway, back to my roommate. She was your tall, conventionally-pretty type. Bright red hair, freckles with green eyes and really strong features. Tight waist, narrow hips with a big chest. Is it weird that I stared at her chest? I hope not. It's really kind of hard not to.

I mean just... damn.

Look, normally I'm not the kind of girl to just stare at another girl's tits, but they were... stareable. Other than her sweatermelons, this girl was built like a stick. Narrow waist, very slight curvature for her hips, and no ass from what I could see. But then, up top, it was just like "oh, here's where all of my body fat goes!" That's not normal, right?

So I wriggle my way up to a sitting position which, given my rampant obesity, is beginning to become something of an issue. I couldn't really make it over the overbearing swell of my belly rolls, and my own chest was still pounding from the exertion of having to haul myself from Dad's car down the hall to the elevator two or three times. I make a few pathetic attempts at sitting up, but eventually I just kind of roll myself onto my side and push up a few times.

Needless to say, that's a lot of work for big ol' me.

"Hi." I'm a sweaty panting mess by the time I actually make it up, "I'm Melanie Carlyle... call me Mel."

She opened her mouth and replied...

I laughed to myself a little on the inside. Nice save Amy, good thing you didn't call me fat! I would've been crushed over it. Oh wait, that's the ton of lard that was already crushing me!

11122.content:
A bodybuilder this girl was not. I could feel Amy's muscles quiver and shake beneath her sweater as she struggled to keep me steady. I couldn't really blame the poor girl. I did weigh about four hundred pounds at that point, and aside from her enormous shoulder boulders, Amy was pretty much a waif. Somehow though, we managed to get me moving; whereupon I asked the ever-important question when it comes to getting to know any of my roommates:

"So... who's hungry?"

***


Amy guided me to the Campus Life Center—this big building that apparently served lots of other functions but was, for all intents and purposes, the cafeteria. We swiped our student ID's and headed inside to a large room with plenty of round tables scattered about. It hardly measured up to Buttercombe Academy's grand freakin' dining hall, but there were a few amenities that I was familiar with, thanks to my background with a posh preparatory school.

There was a self-service station (though it looked like this one only catered to burgers, at least today) off in the corner, with a small line forming behind this one fat guy who was loading up his plate. There were three different service lines, all with different entrees. The first had the standard college-kid fare, pizza, pasta, french fries, et cetera, while the second was Mexican-themed. The third had some gross vegetarian shit, so I didn't really even pay attention to that.

"Isn't this great?" Amy said happily as she handed me a plate, "They change the menu every three days, so if you ever get tired of anything you can just live on Jasmine's or Wholly Habanero."

"The what now?" I asked, taking a small step forward in line at the first service station

"Oh, they're like two little restaurants. They're in the bottom of the Horace building."

"Sweet." I said with a small nod of affirmation, making sure to remember that I could mix up my palate a little, "Can I use my card to get in or do I actually have to pay for it?"

"Nope! You can use your card." Amy said with a big-girl step forward as the fat chick in front of us finally left the line, "You live on campus, so it should be free."

Okay, so far, not shaping up to be too bad, right? A nice cafeteria with plenty of variety. Free food from almost every angle. Plus, with all the vending machines on campus, I could conceivably spend an entire day eating without having to spend too much of my own money. Not to mention the standard pizza delivery or all the places in town there were to eat at; it would never beat Buttercombe, but I could already see myself getting comfortable at Stuffington University.

So anyway, we got our food (it took me a whole five minutes to get everything I wanted in a first course—people were so pissed!) and headed out into the dining area...

My tray groaned with food as I dropped it onto the table. There was a pile of pizzas which were supposed to be served one slice at a time, but I didn’t see that policy lasting long with me around – instead, they were stacked like pancakes. There were a couple of towers of burgers, and a few coops’ worth of fried chickens arranged artfully to make them take up as little tray as possible for the sheer mass of greasy meat they represented. I had to admire the skill of the people who worked behind the counter – of course, this didn’t stop me demolishing their work at once and stuffing it into my face.

I folded up each large pizza like a taco, and opened my mouth as wide as it would go, my chins squishing together and my cheeks bulging to admit the mounds of cheese. I stripped the meat off the chicken drumsticks like a ravenous wolf. I grabbed the burgers two at a time, cramming them into my mouth with alternate hands. Whenever I got tired of chewing, I’d wash it all down with a huge glug of thick chocolate milkshake, and keep on going.

Even as I gorged myself senseless, I was surprised by how much Amy could pack away. She wasn’t up to Mel Carlyle standards by any means, but she didn’t waste a moment, her slim fingers always questing for the next slice or morsel, and volume-wise too I had to admit she was some eater, especially for a skinny girl. She wouldn’t have been out of place at Buttercombe – well, not her appetite, anyway.

Still, she was way more captivated by my appetite than I was by hers. Every time I glanced up she was surreptitiously watching me, taking note of every detail. She almost rocked backward in her chair when I first deployed the pizza-taco move, but covered it well by adjusting her top, which she did often. If I thought I had trouble containing my belly, it was clear Amy’s breasts were just as rebellious, quaking and shimmying with every move. I wasn’t sure what was attracting more stares from the other students – my epic feats of gluttony, or Amy’s ongoing jiggle show.

“Wow,” said Amy when we were done, leaning back in her chair. I couldn’t tell if she was impressed or stuffed – most likely extremes of both. “Damn, girl, you can EAT.”

“I – rp– know,” I said, leaning back myself with a creak of timber and rewarding my bulging belly with a slow, two-handed blubber-stroke. “But you’re not so bad yourself.”

Amy blushed. “So, um… you want some dessert?”

1112212.content:
A few weeks into the semester, I was waddling back to my room, a hand resting on the tightly stuffed gut that was leading the way. I stopped outside my room, where one of our neighbors was manhandling a heavy-looking cardboard box. Milo was a jock, plain and simple, although he took pretty big advantage of the dining hall too (not as much as me, obviously). Still, I did wonder what it would be like if he didn’t have to burn off so many of the precious calories.

“Oh, hey, Mel,” he said. “I saw you got a package so I thought I’d bring it up for you.”

“Thanks, dude,” I said, swiping my card to open the room and letting him carry it in. Milo put it down carefully in the middle of the floor and looked around a little wistfully at the empty room. Like a lot of guys in our dorm (and beyond), Milo would take any excuse to be around Amy. In the last month, she had only grown more ample, stretching her tops and sweaters to a quite distracting degree.

“Amy’s in class. She has a screening for ‘Women in Cinema’ til 7 tonight.”

Milo nodded nonchalantly. “Oh, cool. So, uh, what’s in the box?”

I looked at the return address: PENSATUR METRICS. “Aha!” I said. “It’s my new scale, I’ve had this on order for weeks.” I tore open the box to reveal the large, shiny-looking device.

“Hey, we have one of these at our gym,” said Milo, and without being asked he took it out of the box and began setting it up in the corner. It was a pretty big job, as it came up to eye level and had one of those round dial-type displays, but Milo was pretty handy. I grabbed a box of chocolates from under my bed and sat back with a creak of springs and munched away as he worked, muscles bulging whenever he reached around to tighten a bolt. Soon, the gleaming scale was ready to go, and Milo stepped back to admire his handiwork.

Just then, Amy came in, dropping her bag on the floor and flopping down on my bed next to me exhaustedly. Her breasts bounced outrageously, clearly one wrong move from popping out of the lacy bra that was outlined against the fabric of her skin-tight, plunging v-neck. She grabbed a chocolate from my box and took a large, hungry bite. “That movie WOULD NOT END,” she groaned. “Hey, Milo, what’s going on?”

“I was just, uh. Helping. With the. When it’s. There’s a. Box! Delivery. And it, you know, with this.”

Even a popular, good-looking guy like Milo tended to get a little side-swiped by Amy if there was no warning.

“Hey, thanks, Milo,” said Amy with a dazzling smile. “So, I gotta get changed, do you mind? We’ll see you later.”

With a look on his face as though Christmas had been cancelled, Milo left, and with a speed and dexterity that would put a superhero in a phone booth to shame, Amy pulled off her top and unhooked her bra. “I swear, this thing is killing me. I really need to size up,” she said, dropping it on the floor.

“Again??” I said. “Ames, what is happening with those things?”

“I don’t know!” she insisted, weighing one big, round, bowling-ball breast in her hand.

“Hey, I’ve got an idea,” I said, and stepped up onto the scale. Groing went the mechanism and the needle spun around to my new weight – 445 pounds.

“So you’ve been stuffing your face for four weeks straight, big deal,” Amy laughed. “YOU of all people shouldn’t be surprised by the freshman fifteen – sorry, fifTY. How does that help me?”

“It doesn’t, I was just, uh, testing,” I said, and stepped off again. “Now you.”

Amy stepped up, and the needle made its considerably shorter journey to 160 pounds – still pretty heavy, though, for someone who still fit into the designer jeans she’d arrived with.

“I’ve gained 20 pounds?” she exclaimed. “How?”

“I could introduce you to a few trips to the sundae bar who’d be able to explain,” I chuckled.

“Well, I’ve noticed my pants getting a LITTLE harder to button,” she said reluctantly. “But not 20 pounds harder.”

“It’s not going there – not most of it, anyway,” I said, staring at her tits as I so often had occasion to do. “It’s settling north of the border.

“What am I going to do?” said Amy in consternation. “I mean, I like being busty, but it’s getting beyond a joke. And this has only been a month! It’s not normal.”

“Well, you could –” I winced. I couldn’t believe I was suggesting this. “Try to lose it. Like with a… diet?”

Amy looked horrified. “I’ve NEVER dieted. What, you want food and you don’t eat it? How does that even work?”

“No, me neither. It’s downright unnatural, if you ask me.” In that moment, I was hit with a revelation, like the first bite of a steak and bacon burrito. “What would you think about going the other way, trying to even it out?”

Amy sat down on her bed, unsupported bazongas bouncing. “I’m listening.”

“It seems like all your weight gain is going to your tits. But most people aren’t like that. You’re going to gain weight – unlimited meal plan, ME for a roommate, it’s just a fact.”

“And I’m cool with that,” said Amy, “I mean, I was expecting to thicken up, but not like this!”

“So we fix it,” I grinned. “Hey, if there’s one thing I know, it’s, how to grow a belly and get a fatter ass.”

I opened up my laptop and googled, “foods to gain belly and butt weight” with my non-ice-cream-eating hand. I had to change my search terms a few times and scroll through a few pages of articles telling you how to AVOID these things, but eventually I found what I was looking for.

“Okay, it says here bread – baked goods – potatoes,” I said. “I have to say I haven’t seen you eating much of any of those.”

Amy shrugged. “ I’ve never really developed a taste for them. I was always more of an ice cream gal. Or chocolate. Ooh! Or fried chicken...”

I mused for about half a pint. “Okay, here’s the plan: you’re going on a cake diet. You’re gonna add an entire cake to every meal.”

“Really?” she said. “I’m not sure I like cake that much.”

“Okay, well, that’s just completely insane,” I said. “Here.” With a grunt of effort and a wail of springs, I leaned over and took a large pink box out from the midnight snack supply under my bed. I opened it to look at a heavenly triple-layer chocolate fudge cake. My sausage fingers itched to grab two of the pre-cut slices that second, but I held firm and passed it to Amy. Skeptically, she lifted up a thick slice and took a bite.

“Holy –” she couldn’t even finish her expletive before grabbing another, and another, and another. “Unf,” she said finally, leaning back on her bed and tossing the empty box aside. “Cake is AMAZING!”

“You may be a little late to the party on this one,” I said with a belly-quivering chuckle. “But it looks like this plan can work. I think the bakery where I got this down the street delivers.” Amy paused from licking frosting off her fingers and looked over at me with raised eyebrows. “Fine, I know they do. I’m going to see about placing some sort of regular order. And we should go down there at least once a day.” I licked my lips hungrily. It was good to help out a friend.

11122121.content:
Okay, so for the next few weeks, the folks down at Cake Street saw a lot more of me than they bargained for.

Most days after classes, Amy and I would call up and order ourselves personal size cakes to be delivered to our dorm room. On days when we were feeling particularly indulgent (which were, as I slowly turned my roommate over to the Fat Side, becoming increasingly common) we would skip a class or two so we could pig out on an extra helping of carbs. Sometimes when we were feeling adventurous, Amy talked me into actually going my fat ass down there so we could wedge ourselves into the booths they kept at the window and just stuff ourselves more conveniently. And we would eat all kinds of flavors; pound cakes, strawberry shortcakes, chocolate, double fudge, sometimes just plain ol' vanilla cake. Before the end of the month, we'd had every kind of cake on the menu! So we moved onto profiteroles, cupcakes, cookies and pies... anything with carbohydrates and yeast to help foster Amy's (and my own!) growing belly.

"Ugh! This isn't working!" Amy announced one day, standing on the scale that I kept proudly displayed in our living room, "My boobs are still getting bigger!"

"Duh. Cuz the rest of you is getting bigger, Amykins." I extend one wide wobbling arm to palm the crest of Amy's blossoming belly and give it a good shake, "It's only natural those titties of yours are gonna keep growing while the rest of you porks out. We're trying to curb the growth here, not play God with your body."

But good God if this girl wasn't a pro. If I hadn't gone to an all-girls school where gaining forty pounds in two months was just shy of abnormal, I might have actually been worried about my redheaded roomie!

We had made a habit of having our weekly weigh-ins. It was only fair that I did what I could to help her on her quest to even out. And other than tell her what to eat (everything, extra starch) and when to eat it (all the time) there wasn't a whole lot I could do. I figure the least I could do to help was tell her how good she was at putting on weight, and the scale did most of that work for me. Besides, it helped alleviate her questions as to why I bought the damn thing in the first place, and that was always helpful when it came to the topic of how I knew so much about packing on pounds like we were going on a trip.

"It's not enough though." Amy said with an unmotivated roll of her eyes as she took hearty bites of her latest cupcake, "My breasts are still getting bigger, faster than the rest of me."

Amy made it a habit of weighing herself naked in the living room. Aside from getting an "accurate" representation of her weight (a not-so-modest gain of another twenty pounds. My roommate would be at the big 200 before she knew it!) it also gave her an idea of how heavy her titties were in comparison to the rest of her. She would prop one of her massive mams up with one hand, roll it around a little with her fingers while she snacked freely on whatever we had laying around the dorm room.

"Boo-hoo." I stuck my tongue out at her, "Have you ever tried having a butt big enough to crush furniture? It's not fun."

Correction, it's very fun.

"I need more cake." Amy said through bites of dough, "We've been slacking. Eating cookies and stuff. We need to go back to one cake a day. A whole cake. Maybe two."

I could honestly watch Amy stress-eat all day. It was just so cute watching her freak out over school, her homework, and the fact that her breasts were growing faster than most people's student loan debt. I had her eating almost all the time now. She wasn't quite on the Mel Carlyle diet yet, but I was working her way up there. I had almost forgotten what it was like to have a roommate who was just as obsessed with their figure as I was! In a slightly different way, of course...

"I don't know, Amy." I pinched the side of her belly, which was starting to cut into distinct rolls by this point as it lapped over her panties, "Two cakes? You might start to get kinda chubby."

"Ha ha." Amy bit into her cupcake, smearing bright blue frosting over her lips, "Just for that, you can drive us back to Cake Street."

111221211.content:
University is one of those times in a young person's life where they should be out, making friends, socializing, really exploring their new home away from home for the next four to eight to ten years. I wasn't really one for roaming, so the various trails that wound their way through the campus like so many snakes, all leading to various buildings that could've held any sorts of surprises for prying eyes of young adults, would probably remain unseen by me...

Unless I had a good reason to explore. Like the one Amy presented to me that night.

It was a Friday, which meant I had the entire day free after 11 in the morning- that is, if I actually managed to haul my fat ass out of bed for my Macroeconomics course (Don't ask- I requested a new counselor for next semester- I'm not going in to Economics, no matter how hard they push it on me). Amy wasn't so lucky- for some reason she decided that a lighter schedule earlier in the week and a heavier schedule on Friday was a good plan? So she was usually out until after dark, if she didn't play hooky at some point to come back to the dorm to stuff her face with whatever I had dragged in throughout the day.

So, when I heard a frantic banging on the door around 3 (and I was finally getting into Friends, dammit!) I assumed Amy had skipped class, or busted open her blouse and killed someone with the projectile button, or something. What I wasn't expecting was a very out of breath Milo.

"Shit, dude, where's the damn fire?" I exclaimed as he launched himself into our room. The dude was literally out of breath- a rare feat for a guy as cut as him, who usually picked up things like, I dunno, industrial sized scales with no effort.

"Mel, you- you gotta..." He dramatically threw a hand out, one finger extended- at which point I realized that a few other guys from the dorm had crowded around the open door.

"Amy isn't here, guys." I said in a flat tone. Seriously, Amy had to be the only woman on the planet who could pack on twenty pounds in a few weeks and still attract more male suitors than... I dunno, Milla Jovovich in her prime, or something. However, the crowd didn't disperse- which is when I realized they were staring at me.

"Mel." Milo had recovered, apparently, and he now stood, any trace of fatigue out of his system already. Damn, that dude was fit. Seriously. Like, I would take longer recovering from walking up the hallway! "We're... Kinda in a pickle. Uh..." That's when I also realized that the group of guys outside our room weren't the usual suspects. For one, they were all as fit- if not fitter- than Milo.

One of them- a tall, blonde dude who looked like he could actually pick me up- stepped forward. "Our Fraternity is entered in the annual cupcake eating fundraiser that Stuffington has every year. I'm Brock, by the way."

"Charmed, I'm sure." I quipped, taking the hand he extended and shaking it cordially. I had to admit, it was pretty obvious where this was going- and I wasn't a huge fan of being utilized as a tool. However- and you might find this hard to believe- I really had grown to like cupcakes.

"Nice to meet you." Oh, and he was polite! Be still, my heart. "Anyways, Milo here-" He pointed a finger at Milo, who bowed his head. Holy shit, this dude had Milo wrapped around his finger. "-Wants to get into our Frat. And so he claimed he could sinch us the win in this cupcake eating fundraiser. Said there's no way in hell we'd be able to lose with his 'secret weapon', which I'm assuming is you." I nodded. Yup, this tracked, alright.

"Mel!" Milo shouted, his drooped head snapping back to attention. "I hope you don't take offense- I just saw how much you and Amy have been getting from Cake Street- I just... Uh..." I was really milking it at this point, shooting what I was sure came across as a comical stinkeye in Milo's direction, but the poor guy wilted like a flower. So I turned back to Brock. Brock. Seriously? What a jock name. Jock Brock.

"Well- he isn't wrong. I can eat sweets like a motherfucker." Brock nodded, and a few of his jock posse fistbumped behind him. Be more of a cliche! I almost yelled, but held back.

It also dawned on me at this point that I was, in fact, wearing a sweatshirt adorned with a large set of "S&U" letters that were covered in crumbs from my latest meal- an entire cookie sheet cake. It also dawned on me that I was wearing booty shorts that, from the front, could not be seen, giving all the men in my hallway and dorm the impression that I wasn't wearing pants. To disperse these rumors, I waddled back to the couch, giving them all a clear view of my clearly clothed rear.

"I'm in." There were a few audible whoops at this. Apparently, just seeing a fat girl was enough to instill the belief that I could eat more than anyone else, I guess. Of course, my daily trips to the various eateries around campus meant that at least a handful of these dudes had seen me gorge myself at one point or another. Turns out being the token unashamed fat girl on campus came with a reputation. "And if I beat the competition?"

"Well- Milo would get in to the Fraternity. Which I'm assuming-"

"I'd owe you like, a million favors Mel! A billion!" Milo interrupted.

I giggled. "Woah, cowboy. We'll cross that road when we come to it." I turned to face Brock again. "Any other perks to this job?"

Brock shifted slightly on his feet.
111221211.title: When Your Rotund Reputation Proceeds You

choices: Eating Contest?  More like Eating CON.  I absolutely destroy the competition!
Turns out, Milo's future Frat wasn't the only one who got a fat girl to compete
1112212112.content:
"You gonna give me the low-down on these perks? Because I am a fan of perks." I didn't mention that most of the 'Perks' I had seen in my day were in form of "Buy 9 Subs, Get the 10th Free" or "Every fifth carton of ice cream is free" type perks. Y'know, the good ones.

"Well. Our Frat has bi-weekly 'gatherings', and if you pull through on this, you'd get free access to all of them. Normally, there's a cover." He glanced at me for a second. "Yeah... You look 21 enough. So free booze, basically." I nodded. That sounded alright. "And, uh. I mean, we have a big brunch buffet every Saturday in the commons building. You'd get into that for free too. And, of course, we have a few... Connections, around campus." Well, that certainly sounded suspicious. "We can talk about that later- If this works out."

"Dude. Look at me. It'll work out. And I'm in, if that wasn't obvious." Milo whooped, and Brock grinned.

"Tight. Be at the courtyard by the clock tower tomorrow at noon. And, uh..." Brock shifted awkwardly on his feet. "You're gonna have to wear one of our shirts. You're gonna need... Uh..." He waved his arms lazily in the air.

"Brock. Just get the biggest size you can. I'll make it work." He coughed awkwardly- For being a jock that looked like he was chiseled out of granite, he sure did crumble like a cookie when it came to discussing a woman's shirt sizes. I got the impression he had tried to guess a woman's size before and it didn't go well.

He nodded once more, then him and his group of dudes shuffled back down the hallway- except for Milo. "Mel, I seriously can't thank you enough. I'll stop by tomorrow to walk over with you."

I groaned. "About that. That's like... five miles."

Milo laughed. "Good one Mel, it's like 200 yards from here." I stared him down. "Oh. Um. I'll see if I can borrow a golf cart or something?"

"Yeah. You better. Remember, you owe me." He did a mock bow and backed out of the room, still bowing.

"Of course, Mel. Anything for my new best friend."

"If you're offering... I'd definitely take a pizza right now. Or like, three."

"I'll see what I can do!" Milo shouted from the hallway. I silently hoped he wasn't still bowing- even as Amy wobbled her way into the room.

"Why is Milo walking backwards while bowing? And I thought I was your best friend!" She pouted as she flopped down onto the couch next to me, causing both the couch and her horribly strained blouse to creak loudly. I shot a side eye at my busty, bloated roommate. The gap between every button was... pronounced, to say the least, meaning both her pale belly and double-enforced bra that probably involved at least three letters were pretty visible- of course, both probably weren't noticed due to the top four buttons being undone, leaving her with an ocean of cleavage that could probably turn the gayest dude on the planet straight- or at least bi-curious.

"Okay, a few things. One, you are my best friend, don't worry." I ruffled her hair. "Two, Milo is bowing to me because he owes a million- no, a billion favors, because I'm getting him into a fraternity, because I am a good person who does good deeds. Three... You honestly need to give up on blouses, dear, because they aren't doing you any favors. Seriously, someone could fall into the cleavage and not be found for two weeks, all cutting their hand off to escape like in 127 Hours..."

Amy pulled a face. "Why'd you gotta get all gross!" She looked down and sighed. "And... Yeah. Why do you think I'm home early?" She grunted as she pushed herself off the couch, swiftly discarding said blouse in a rather practiced motion. "My professor said it was... Distracting. And also... I may have lost three buttons since I put it on. I wasn't exactly flaunting these things when I first got dressed. That was a little more cleavage than even I was comfortable with."

She flopped back down, now shirtless. "And yet, here you are, not wearing a shirt." I had to admit, those things were powerful- Even I couldn't break my stare to see whatever hilarious thing Joey just said, watching those sweater puppies wobble in her reinforced bra was absolutely hypnotizing...

"Yeah, well- you're not gonna 'accidentally' trip and grab a tit, regardless of how much or little I show off. The only reason I'm keeping this bra on is because I'm pretty sure I heard Milo say something about bringing pizza- which again, begs the question- what did you do to get that guy so hot on you? I'm guessing you didn't seduce him or whatever."

"Amy, if Milo sees you in a bra, I think he will literally die. Like, his brain will stop functioning, turn to liquid, and fall out his nose."

She fake wretched. "Why are you being so gross today!?"

"Because I don't want you eating all my damn pizza!" I shoved her, only to get entranced once again by her wobbling assets. "And Milo owes me because..." I proceeded to explain the entire situation to her- and had just finished when there was a knock on our door. "Are you seriously gonna sit here in a bra? Because if Milo dies because his head explodes like in Scanners, this whole deal presumably goes out the window."

Amy grunted. "Fine, let me know when he's gone." She stormed off into her room. Despite the pounds she had accumulated over the past few weeks, I had to admit- this girl did not pack much in her lower half- she barely even had a muffin top!

"It's open!" I shouted once Amy was safely concealed.

"I hope, uh... Cheese is okay." Milo muttered as he pushed his way into our room. "I got three, but... It's like 3:30, so they didn't have anything else." He walked in, deposited the pizzas on our coffee table, and immediately spotted the blouse on the ground. "Oh, shit, is Amy here?" I rolled my eyes.

"No... I thought maybe I could fit into her shirt. Wanna watch me try?"

"Uh... I'll just see you tomorrow, okay? Goodnight Mel!" Milo was blushing, hard. I guess it was pretty rare for him to have woman offer to try on clothing in front of him- even if they were rapidly approaching 500 pounds.

"You're-" I paused. Could I really spare a pizza? Amy did say I was her best friend... Yeah. That was a good move on her part. "You're good Amy!"

"Thank God! I can smell that pizza, and I haven't eaten since noon!"

"Don't get too excited." I said, pulling one box off the pile and sliding it under the couch. Stealth pizza. Whaddup. "It's just cheese."

Amy walked out- she had exchanged her bra for a "loose" tank top which showed off, somehow, even more cleavage than her bra, while also allowing her boobs to wobble much more aggressively than the bra did. "Pizza is Pizza. Know who said that?" I grunted, a slice of pizza already crust-deep in my mouth. "Ghandi, probably. So anyways... You're seriously gonna have some hookups around campus? And you're, uh... I'm in on this, right?"

My third and fourth slices were gone at this point, so I could actually respond. "Dude. Of course. If I can't get you in... I'll bring home a can or two for ya. Maybe even three, if I'm feeling generous."

"Mellllllll..."

"Amy, I'll get you in. Don't worry about it." I sandwiched three slices together, which elicited a shocked gasp from Amy. "I'm in training!" I said dramatically.

"Yeah, like you need training."

I attempted to hum the Rocky theme as I shoved triple-stack into my mouth, and failed miserably, instead shooting crumbs out of my mouth in a comical fashion. "Look, who's getting us the hookup? I am. Me. So don't berate me, or I'll revoke your underage drinking privileges."
1112212112.title: Fratenizing with Frat Perks

choices: Day one on Fraternity Duty: It was Sunday Night Party Time!!!!
Brock decided to get a little more direct with me.
11122121121.content:
I arrived in my gilded chariot- a phrase which here means, a golf cart with Stuffington University's logo spray-painted on it- at 11:46 AM. An early hour, to be sure, but worth it for the future pay-off. Plus, I had already been up for almost two hours. I currently was adorned in my eating gear: The largest t-shirt I had, which actually had a bit of give to it still (I had bought it as a joke like, six years ago, when it fit my frame like a loose dress- Oh, how times had changed. The thing has at least eight X's in the size) and a pair of sweatpants that could probably encapsulate a compact car. I wasn't oblivious to the fact that said golf cart was listing pretty hard to the right, IE my side, and when we 'parked', I turned and saw a deep rut left in the grass leading up to the clock-tower courtyard.

"You feeling confident, Mel?" Milo asked, innocently enough. Oh, you sweet Summer child. "I mean, you did kinda devour like, five bagels today..." Milo had, ever so kindly, invited me to the brunch that his future Frat held. I had abstained from bacon, scrambled eggs, and pancakes, because I was a good glutton and didn't want to load up on calories. However, when the five-hundredth (or second, but who can keep count) frat boy walked in front of me with an Asiago bagel... Well, I kinda lost my cool. And ate like.. Five bagels. Or six- Milo ran to the bathroom at one point.

"Milo. Sweetheart. That was almost two hours ago." I patted his shoulder with a pudgy hand as we approached the event. "I can do this." We made our way through the handful of people who actually bothered to show up for this thing, at which point Brock came sprinting up. He was wearing black trackpants with a matching black t-shirt that proudly displayed his Frat's logo- some Greek letters that I didn't recognize beyond their Greekness. "Mel! Milo! You made it!" He thrust a shirt in my direction. "Mel, this is the biggest we had in our storage... I..." He looked uncomfortable. "It's not that big." I unfolded it and nodded. It really wasn't. Still... When in Rome.

Or Greece.

Whatever.

I pulled it over my head, wiggling my arms through the sleeves- and feeling my arm fat get pinched. Not a great sign. I pulled the fabric down, not hard, but forcefully, and managed to get the fabric down to about five inches below my fat tits. Brock looked away, Milo stared. "It's a perfect fit!" I exclaimed, waving my arms in the air. "Seriously, I could get into Penthouse with this look. Wait, do they still publish Penthouse?"

It was at this point that the loudspeaker went off. "All fundraiser contestants, please report to the stage! I repeat, all contestants for the 'Annual Stuffington Cupcake Fundraiser', please report to the stage!"

"That's my cue!" I shouted, and slowly made my way to the stage. This shirt? It didn't fit. I was rather thankful for my oversized undershirt at this point- It wasn't exactly warm out- and despite what they say, fat people get cold just as easy as skinny ones.

As I slowly made my way on-stage, I could tell that I was gonna win. I wasn't the cockiest person in most situations, but these girls? They couldn't eat their way through fifty cupcakes if their lives depended on it.

It was obvious that this 'contest' was an excuse to flaunt the Fraternity's ability to attract the hottest girls. As I slowly stumbled onto the stage, the other girls turned and stared like this was the first time they had seen a female that weighed more than 120 pounds soaking wet. There were various t-shirts, boasting different Greek letters, but they were all tightly stretched against C to E cup bras that sat above flat tummies. Shit, if this was a tits competition, Milo backed the wrong horse- Amy would've cleaned house in this category.

Still, they were nice. A bit vapid, but nice. They didn't know how to respond to a girl that weighed more than all of them combined, so they just awkwardly waved at me. My eyes were focused on one thing- the cupcakes, which were comically piled up in a pyramid shape. As the announcer rambled on in the background, I sized up the crowd. Lots of dudes, lots of various Fraternity shirts that matched the colors and letters of the girls on stage. Too bad they wouldn't be winning the cupcake crown.

When the whistle blew, I began. Cupcakes were kind of a joke- given how many cakes I had devoured in mere minutes, Cupcakes could've been potato chips, given how fast I ate them. One by one, the skinny, busty blondes and brunettes "conceded" while I continued to devour. I ate and ate and ate. At one point, I saw Amy cheering me along, her massive chest wobbling in time with her fist thrusts and attracting the attention of numerous frat boys. I only stopped eating when I reached for a wrapper that held 1/3 of a cupcake, only to have a trophy slapped on top of it.

"Congratulations are in order, for..." The guy with the mic paused for a second while he was handed a cue-card. "Mel Carlyle... For beating our previous record by... Almost fifty-five cupcakes! A round of applause for her, and her Fraternity, who... Clearly... Picked a winner this year..." The disappointment? Palatable I could tell by the announcer's voice that they weren't used to girls showing up who actually knew how to eat- and had the body to prove it. I had a nagging feeling that next year's rules might be a little more strict.

Brock had gotten up on stage at this point, while the various busty beauties walked away. "I knew you would come through. And you have. You, and anyone you know? You're cleared for every event we have for the next year. And if you ever need... Well, a bunch of dudes. You know how to reach me." Brock held his hand out, and I was surprised to see a sticky-note with his number and his university e-mail on it. "Seriously. You really killed it up there."

And with that, he was gone.
11122121121.title: BREAKING NEWS: Skinny Girls Can't Eat

choices: We drink, we eat- The night goes on, and the party gets pretty rowdy...
My eating reputation gets put to the test when I meet a new challenger...
111221211211.content:
So, this might come as a bit of a surprise, but I was never really a partier back at Buttercombe or at home. I mean, sure, I had done the whole "sneak a beer or two from the six pack of beer from the fridge and hope no one notices" routine once or twice- my Dad usually noticed but didn't say anything because he's a cool dude. Of course, a few cans of Bud Light does not a drunk Mel make.

And I knew some girls at Buttercombe who were 9 to 5 teetotalers and 5:01 to 2 AM drunken sailors, so I could've had my pick of any sort of flavored schnaps and vodkas. But I was more interested in stuffing my face than getting blitzed, so it just never naturally came up.

I guess in that regard, Amy and I were pretty different.

"Fuck, Mel! I'm so excited! Free booze!" She waved her arms wildly in the air as we made our way to the frat party- I could hear the bass thumping from our apartment, which was the only reason that I had agreed to go in the first place- the party was practically next door to our dorms. "I haven't had a drink since I got here!"

I rolled my eyes. "What a burden. Sobriety truly is a cruel mistress, Amy." I wasn't gonna lie- I wasn't in the best mood for this. We had made our daily voyage to Cake Street, but the dude behind the counter had recognized me from the cupcake thing the day before (what can I say, I'm basically famous around campus now) and hooked us up with several free cakes on top of our order. Which was awesome, don't get me wrong. What wasn't awesome was taking a bet with Amy that I could eat a cookie cake faster than her, then winning, only for her to want to do best two out of three, and then eating another triple fudge cake on top of it- my sugar rush had been the stuff of legends- I actually walked down the hallway to the vending machine instead of making Amy go- but that buzz was long gone, leaving me fatigued, grumpy, and most of all- hungry.

"Mel! This is gonna be awesome! Free booze!" She bounced on her feet, doing some sort of pathetic skipping thing for about four feet before stopping and arching her back. "Fuck, that hurt!"

"Yeah, you better keep careful with those things at this party, or you'll concuss someone. And if you get too drunk, I'm just leaving you there, I can't carry your fat tits home." I had put on my usual wear- sweatpants and a sweatshirt, because it was a fucking frat party and it didn't matter. Amy, however, had gotten dressed up- which, with her fatter frame and humongous melons, meant she has crammed herself into a cocktail dress that was one wobbly step away from shredding into confetti. Seriously, her boobs were oozing out of the top like overproofed bread dough.

"Mel, lighten up! And I'm not gonna get too drunk, don't even worry." By now we had arrived at the party, and I was slightly winded, while my roommate was starting to act like she was gonna develop a bad case of the shakes if she didn't do a keg stand in the next five minutes- something which I warned her against doing, lest she flash the entire party when her ballooning chest burst out of her dress. She assured me she wouldn't literally do a keg stand, which I took as truth- I honestly don't know if her larger frame would even let her.

The dude at the front door didn't even glance at Amy- just scribbled on her hand with a sharpie while getting a nice eyeful of her cleavage. When I tried to walk in behind her, he put a hand up to stop me. "You gotta pay. Ten bucks." My jaw dropped. Cool, my boobalicious roomie gets in without a second look, and I get fucking stopped by the party gestapo? I didn't think so.

"Hey, fuckface, I don't know if you're aware, but I won this frat bragging rights for the next year for some dumb cupcake thing, so I suggest you let me in before I give Brock a call." It was hard to tell with the bad lighting and black lights, but I'm pretty sure the dude went completely pale.

"I-I-I... Sorry, Mel. It's... Really dark. Hard to see. Pleasedon'ttellBrockohmyGod." He scribbled on my hand, then shuffled out of the way so I could actually fit through the doorway- if he stayed where he was he probably would've been crushed against the frame. I still hip-checked him on the way in, with a little too much force- he toppled backwards into a bush.

"Oops, sorry. Maybe next time don't be a dick to the fat girl, though. Just a thought."

I stepped into the dim living room of the house that had been turned into party headquarters for the night. It honestly looked a lot like the cliche college parties they show on television. A shit ton of balloons and streamers (seriously? I didn't realize we were in Kindergarten) several kegs set up around the perimeter, a few drunk people making out on the couch. Oddly enough, the music inside seemed almost quieter than the music that seemed to be permeating throughout the campus. I made a mental note to ask Milo or Brock if they did that on purpose the next time I saw them. "Oh shit!" Someone shouted from a corner. "It's Mel! Mel!" A bunch of people looked up at me as I searched for who called out to me- only to spot Brock walking towards me. "Hey, everyone! Shut up for a minute!" The room got quiet, leaving only the music playing in the background. "This is Mel Carlyle, and she put us on the map this year. You see this girl around campus? You say hi. Be nice. If she wants something, she gets it. We take care of our own, and if we could sign you into our house, we would. But we can't, so... Yeah." Weak finish to the speech, Brock, but the sentiment was appreciated. There was a smattering of applause, and then everyone went back to what they were doing- mainly making out or trying to get drunk.

"Well, that was very sweet of you Brock. You're quite the charmer." I winked at him. He took a long pull off his beer.

"It's the least I can do. We've struggled in the past in the community events around campus. Getting that cupcake fundraiser win upfront was a pretty good power play for the year. Oh, shit, you need a drink!" I started to protest, before realizing I really didn't have any excuse. "We got plenty of beer, but you don't strike me as a beer person. Lemme... Hold on." He walked off down the hallway. I looked around, realized I couldn't see Amy anywhere, and decided to follow. Besides, a few people were still staring at me.

I waddled down the hallway into a weird kitchen set up- there was a small corner with a stove and a sink and a microwave, but the main attraction was a massive table that was covered from end to end with bottles of booze. And among the smaller crowd in here was my lovable roommate, Amy, conversing with some scrawny dude that I had never seen before and a short chubby girl that I vaguely recognized from our dorm. He was currently mixing a drink for her, which was impressive since his eyes were firmly locked on her tits, while Amy laughed and conversed with the shorter girl- and sipped on a beer. Boy, she sure moved quick. "Mel!" She shouted, waving at me as though I was across a crowded room and not standing six feet away from her. "C'mere! You gotta meet my friend, Sasha! She's awesome, I have class with her!" Brock was talking to the scrawny guy, who finally broke his endless gaze at Amy's mammaries to talk to him. When he finished pouring whatever clear liquid he was dumping into the solo cup, Brock grabbed it out of his hand, took a sip, then handed it off to me.

"This is Ray. He's kind of our bartender, usually until everyone is drunk enough to not care about what they're drinking. This is... Uh, what do you call this again, Ray?"

He was staring at Amy's boobs again. "It's, uh... It's kinda like a Fog Cutter, but we didn't have any sherry, so I used bourbon. Yeah." I didn't know what a Fog Cutter was. Or, honestly, what sherry was. I think you use it in cooking sometimes? Still, it didn't smell half bad, and when I took a sip, I was pleasantly surprised with how it tasted. It was boozy, for sure, but not overly so.

"It's good, dude. Hey Amy?" She slammed back the rest of her beer and threw the empty can into a large trash can that was sitting in the corner.

"Yeah!" She said eagerly. Oh, God. It occurred to me that my top heavy roommate might be a light weight when it came to the spirits. If she was that fucked up on one beer...

"How long do you wanna stay at this thing?" Brock had been pulled aside by the shorter girl, and Ray was back to making another drink, presumably for Amy. "I mean, I'm cool for free drinks, and this weird Fog Hat or whatever it's called is good, but I'm hungry." Amy stared at me wide eyed, before giggling.

"Do you really think they don't have food here?" I looked around the kitchen and shrugged.

"It sure doesn't look like it, and we are in the kitchen." Amy giggled again as Ray handed her a drink.

"Thanks, Ralph. Follow me, Mel!" Ray didn't seem phased that his busty crush didn't even know his name, instead watching longingly as Amy ran off down another hallway that lead away from the kitchen. I dutifully marched after her, sipping at my drink- and that's when the smell hit me. There was pizza in the house! I guess the smell of empty beer cans and open booze bottles distracted me, but I'd know that smell anywhere. I hadn't quite mastered the smell portfolio of the wide array of pizza places around the campus, but the strong garlic scent just screamed Luigi's Pizza... Or maybe Quick Slice? If it was Quick Slice, I hoped and prayed they got a few deluxes. If it was Luigi's... Well, their meat lover pie was the stuff of legends.

Turns out, they bought both. We emerged into yet another room- much like the booze kitchen, there was a massive table overloaded with goods- but this time, it was pizza! Pizza, garlic knots, cheese sticks, chicken wings... A true spread. A spread that was made for me.

"I guess we can stay a while."
111221211211.title: Tip Toeing the Party Line

choices: Amy returns shortly later, two drinks in hand.  Hooray!
Someone else comes up before Amy... Uh-oh...
1112212112111.content:
Look. I could've eaten all the pizza, and cheesy bread, and wings, and garlic knots, and the sliders from White Castle that some dude drunkenly deposited on the table after I cleared off a few boxes... But I didn't.

It was mostly because I felt that all the skinny women and horny frat boys probably wouldn't have appreciated my skills, but also because I didn't feel like passing into a food coma on the couch and being rolled home, Willy Wonka style. So I abstained from glutting myself, instead eating a few appetizers and a pizza by myself before forcefully shoving myself off the couch and slowly making my way through the house to find Amy again. It was when I went into the living room, scanning the various faces of boys and girls (and boys and girls and boys and girls, I thought in my head- fuck, that song was catchy) when a visibly drunker Brock stopped me. "Mel!" He shouted, waving his brightly colored drink in the air. If I had to guess, I'd say it was Midori (yuck) and lemonade? It was a mixture of green and yellow, at any rate- and alarmingly neon-colored. "Mel... Did you know... That I'm... Just..."

I put a finger against his lips. "Brock. I won that contest. I can win other ones. I just want to find my friend. You see, she's-"

"Amy???" Brock shouted, and I swear to goodness, his eyes literally turned into question marks- like a cartoon. This dude was in no mood to talk in front of a billion of his peers, so I guided him by the hand towards a hallway that seemingly hadn't been filled with horny college-goers. "Mel, I-"

I stopped him again. "Brock. We've known each other for like, sixty hours. I just want to find my friend."

He stared at me, slightly glassy eyed for a moment, before continuing. "I wasn't gonna hit on you, dummy!" I narrowed my eyes. "Sorry! Sorry! I'm drunk, Mel. I was just gonna thank you again. You got me a lot of cred by wining that competition, you know?" He took a long sip of his drink. "Uhm... Amy is, uh. With one of our younger members. A real suave dude. I think his name is Jason? Jack? Uh.... James?"

I rolled my eyes. "It starts with a 'J'. Got it. Thanks, Brock." I started to walk back down the hallway towards the main party, only to feel a hand grab me- I turned around, ready to punch Brock in his drunken face, just for the fun of it- only to spot Ralph- Er, Ray.

"Mel!" He said simply. It was clear he hadn't been imbibing in his own creations... Heavily, anyways.

"Hey, Ray. How's it going?" I asked, trying to keep it casual. My stomach was already beginning to rumble for more of the pizza and accoutrements provided, which meant I needed to wrangle up Amy before I really lost my patience and devoured... Well, not all of it- it was enough food to feed at least forty people- but I would've made a dent in it, for sure.

"It's fine, I just-" A cold solo cup appeared in my hand, almost by magic.

"-Need a drink. I get it." He nodded sagely.

"No, I need to know where Amy is! I wanna go home, and she's my roomie!" Ray's eyes went wide. "Don't get weird, dude."

"I'm not..." I clearly offended the guy, and I started to stutter out an apology, but he cut me off.

"She's upstairs with Janus..." I barely managed to hold back my groan of disgust. "Who even names their kid Janus, anyways? See you around, Mel." I made a note to keep Ray on my good side as I sipped whatever drink he gave me. It tasted like heaven, even as I climbed the stairs (my mortal enemy) to find Amy. Thankfully, the second floor wasn't filled with groans of sexually-repressed young adults, and I began the laborious process of opening every door on the second floor and weakly calling out Amy's name as I did so. Finally, after several failed attempts- and miraculously not busting into any mid-sex scenes- I found Amy... Sitting alone on a bench.

"Amy! We gotta go home soon..." I shouted, before finishing off my drink and lazily throwing my now empty cup behind me.

"Okay!" She shouted from the bed, apparently in good spirits.

"Um..." I paused for a moment. "Where's, uh, Janus?" I felt hotter than usual- I realized my drink was probably plenty boozy. Amy scowled at me.

"Janus? Oh, that douche? Trust me, his hands got on these things-" She grabbed her tits (I would've assumed, of course) for emphasis. "- And I said goodbye." I plopped down next to her- too aware that my entire left ass cheek hung off said bench, even with her (relatively) frame staying on next to my massive right cheek. "He was... A pervert."

"Well... Are you ready to go home?" I offered helpfully. "I mean. I am..." My head was starting to spin lightly. I wasn't used to feeling drunk, since my body fat tended to absorb most booze- whatever I had been given clearly was strong. To my surprise, Amy was shaking her head.

"I just wanna... Get drunk." She muttered. "Forget about the fact that most dudes just like my tits. There's more to me than that! You know?"

I nodded in agreement. "Trust me, I've got the tits of a-"

Amy sighed. "-A fat girl. I know. You just have... All the other stuff. Of a fat girl. My fat goes to my tits. Whatever." Amy stood up, before pulling me to my feet. "Look, I need another drink. I'm getting you one, too. Then we can talk more. Okay?"

I nodded in agreement. I felt good on the couch, and I didn't want to get up- and I definitely didn't want to back down the stairs- so I simply watched as my top-heavy friend stumbled down the stairs...
1112212112111.title: I'm Breaking My Own Rules, Becoming Someone Else

choices: A fight breaks out- Party's over, I guess.  We head home.
Ray brings more drinks- Things start to get a little hazy after that...
11122121121111.content:
I sat on the couch/bed/bench hybrid, trying desperately to think of the name of the thing I currently was (mostly) seated on when I spotted Amy wobbling her way back to me. "Futon!" I shouted happily as she handed me one of the two solo cups she carried.

"Uh. Okay." She flopped down next to me, and I- much to my surprise- felt my entire form wobble a little. Was she seriously getting big enough to start acting as a counterweight to my own massive form?

"We're on a futon! Sheesh, these drinks must be getting to me, I kept calling it a bench, and a couch, and a bed..."

Amy took a long drink from her cup. "Yeah, wow Mel- are you sure you don't wanna tell that story to the entire party downstairs? They might name you Party Queen or whatever with a riveting story like that..." I frowned.

"Why are you so grumpy? Sheesh, I hardly think that's the first time you've been groped by a drunk dude at a party before. And hey!" I poked her in the boob, causing her to wince as my finger sunk knuckle deep into her fleshy upper half. "You're the one who wanted to come here, remember?"

"Yeah well, first of all, you're not wrong. But... I just... Ugh." She took another drink from her cup.

"Slow down, killer- I warned you before, I'm not carrying you home. I mean, I couldn't, anyways. I'd probably just hide you in the bushes and come back in a few hours to wake you up... Because we're friends and all that."

"That's part of the problem! Before I started bloating up like a balloon from some perverts fantasy land where all your weight goes to your tits, I could get a nice buzz off of like, ONE drink! I've had four of these and I just feel... Kinda hungry."

I nodded sagely. "Welcome to the life of a fatty. It's hard to get drunk when you have an extra hundred pounds or more of flab to soak up all the booze. I know that's not technically how it works, but... Even someone like me who's never really gotten rowdy off anything but beer before can tell you it takes a lot more get to a fatass drunk."

"Yeah, I guess." She pouted. I put my arm around her shoulder- resisting the urge to bury my face into her mesmerizing chest (in a platonic way, obviously), I instead leaned my head on her shoulder.

"Alright... You're my roomie and my best friend and I don't wanna see you all depressed... What's wrong?"

"I just... God, I just honestly thought that Janus dude wanted to come up here and talk or something! I just wish there was literally one person that didn't just stare at my tits the entire time I was talking!" I briefly stopped watching Amy's tits wiggle to let out a small noise of affirmation. "I... Ugh, I know I'm just being a dumb baby about it. Like I said, I don't even feel drunk! I just feel kinda... Weird. And I know you don't wanna stay much longer, so let's just finish up and head back to our room. We can get pizza or something."

I stood up off the futon and held my hand out. Amy stared up at me- and for a second, I sympathized with Janus. That girl's cleavage could hold a potted plant between it.

"What?" She moped, staring into her drink.

"We came to party. Let's party. And also I want more pizza, and I'm not waiting for delivery- and I think you do too. Drink your drink, and let's get another." She grinned up at me.

"Are we gonna get turnt, Mel?" I groaned.

"Say 'turnt' again and I'm leaving." She frowned at me again, before finishing her drink and taking my hand. I hefted her up, partially to prove I was still the heavier counterweight in the equation- and I was... For now. I made a mental note to think about this more when I wasn't lightly buzzing on booze-juice.

Thankfully, my boy Ray was still tearing it up at the drink table. "Ray!" I shouted, shooting him a grin and hoping that me dragging Amy back into his line of sight was a good way to make up for my social faux pas earlier. "Look who I found, and she wasn't even hanging out with Janus!" He grinned at me and I took it as a good sign, so I walked up and whispered in his ear for a moment. He grinned and got to work. "Yo, Amy, pizza!" We ran into the food room- while a major dent had been made in the table (including, much to my disappointment, the sliders were gone. Hot commodity, I guess), but there was still plenty of greasy goodies for us to go to town on- which we did, with pleasure. Ray showed up in time, handing off drinks to Amy and myself- and now I could tell he had given up on hiding the booze. Amy's eyes went wide at her first sip- and I won't lie, it made me a little proud to watch my fatass roommate hold her drink in one hand while expertly chowing down on a double-stacked slice of pizza.

I drank my own drink at the same rate as her- and if there was any doubt that I was getting drunk in my mind before, this definitely cemented it... And made me remember why I tried not to drink that much. It was like my hunger had multiplied by a thousand, and soon I had resorted to my pizza burrito technique, audience be damned. Amy was off giggling in a corner while talking to Ray, which I counted as my good deed for the night- although I honestly barely noticed the two chatting as I continued to plow through the pizza table. At some point I became aware of a very tight feeling in my chest- and immediately let loose the loudest belch I had ever released in my life. It was like the air had been sucked out of the party- Only for a few "Wooo" shouts and some light applause to occur. However, it definitely snapped me out of my drunken gorging- which made me realize just how full I suddenly felt. I waddled slowly over to the nearest ratty couch and flopped down on it- it let out several cracking noises and I was sure I had broken it- something I confirmed when I saw that one side now rose slightly in the air. Whoops.

Ray had disappeared, and Amy wobbly walked over to me. "Thank you Mel!" She shouted- clearly, she was over the fence. "This is great, Ray went to get me another drink!" I tried to smile, but I was too full, so I just moaned and rubbed my bloated belly. "Yeahhh, you really went kinda nuts on that pizza..."
11122121121111.title: Partyin' Down to Party Town

choices: The next day, I get to deal with a VERY hungover Amy.  Oh joy.
Amy starts acting a little weird as the night goes on...
111221211211111.content:
I groaned miserably as I tried to calm my roaring gut- the fact that two different guys had brought me and Amy a beer in the past half hour really wasn't helping- and because I was a glutton (both for punishment and in general) I couldn't just say no. So I spent however long it was that we sat there belching as subtly as possible, eager to calm my stomach which was less than happy with the amount of gluten, cheese and tomato sauce I had crammed into it over the past few hours- and I doubted very much the booze was helping.

I was starting to feel as though I could actually stand again when there was a loud thud from the front entrance area, followed by a lot of shouting. "Oh man, I wonder if there's a fight?" Amy slurred, launching herself up from the couch- only further heightening my fear that she was going to explode out of her dress. While her boobs were still oozing out of the top of the thing, her belly was bloating out further and further as the night went on- and if there wasn't so much noise coming from the front, I swear I would've heard a stitch or two tear. Groaning, I slowly stood up from the couch, pushing down on the armrest, wincing as I heard the flimsy thing crack loudly from my weight being pushed against it.

We wandered out to the front where a small crowd had gathered- one guy sat, looking dazed, in the middle of the group, while Brock held back another guy. "That's Janus!" Amy gasped, dramatically, pointing at the sleezebag that Brock was currently holding back.

"Man, FUCK you!" He shouted- his face was red and he clearly had had too much to drink tonight.

"I didn't even do anything, jackass!" The guy on the ground shouted back- his nose was bleeding. This sucked.

"Both of you, shut up! Janus, go the fuck home- and you're not coming to anymore parties!" Brock shouted, before looking out the window and noticing a blinking blue light. "Seriously, someone called campus security? Fuck!" He let go of Brock, who huffed off out the front door. "Alright, everyone out the back, I guess. Party's over."

While I was slightly bummed out that I would no longer have access to basically unlimited pizza, I had to admit I was growing tired of the party scene. I kinda just wanted to collapse on the couch, kick out of my now almost too tight sweatpants, and veg out for a while on one of the cartons of ice cream we had snagged from the ice cream shop up the street from our place.

As we walked home- well, waddled and weaved would be more accurate- I was stuffed, and Amy was drunk- we discussed the events of the night.

"You really know how to pick 'em, Ames." I pointed out as I slowly waddled back to our apartment, already huffing and puffing- my gut felt like a rock and I really didn't feel like moving as much as I was forced to.

"I didn't- look, he was cute, right? That's all. Ugh. I'm just... I'm like, done with guys, you know? I mean, seriously..." She plunged her hand into her purse and pulled out- much to my surprise- a can of beer.

"Amy!" I gasped, in mock horror. "That's not very ladylike of you, to imbibe in the men's drink. Why, I have half a mind to report you to the constable!"

"Ugh, shut up. I told you, I just wanted to get drunk and pretend all of... That, never happened. Stupid jackass starting a fight in a party, no wonder he thought he could just grab a handful as soon as we were alone. Blugh." Amy pulled a face before cracking open the beer and chugging it- I watched in awe as she slammed the beer down in a few quick seconds before throwing the empty can off the path and into the woods.

"Wow, littering, stealing, and public intoxication! It's like I don't even know you, Amy!" I jokingly punched her in the arm- the light movement almost sent her off the path- she stumbled a few steps before regaining her balance. Letting out a belch, she pulled out her keycard as we approached our dorm.

"Shut up. It's just been a bad night, okay?"

We made our way to the room, where, once the door shut, Amy immediately began to struggle out of her dress. Watching someone as top-heavy as Amy pull themselves out of a dress was a sight to be seen, let me tell you. Free of the restrictive garment, which she chucked into the corner, I got a few moments of what I assumed every straight man's fantasy was- a topless Amy- before she disappeared into her room, appearing a moment later in a sweatshirt that I distinctly remembered being a lot looser a mere month ago. "Alright, what are we doing? I don't wanna go to bed yet." Unsurprisingly, Amy had procured yet another beer.

"How many of those things did you steal? Damn?"

"My bag was mostly empty." She shrugged, flopping down on the couch next to me. I had kicked out of my sweatpants, and now sat in just my hoodie on the couch- while Amy sat in her own sweatshirt- the epitome of two lazy, fat college women. "I took like five."

"Well... Can I have one?"

Amy looked at me, taking a long sip of her own beer. "Only if you agree to be on ice cream duty tonight..." I groaned.

"Not worth it. Have 'em all, drunky."
111221211211111.title: Like Fight Club, but Shittier

choices: What else can I do? I drag Amy to class with me.
I let her sleep in, but go to my first class. Hey, I've got a GPA to keep!
We skip class, and I teach Amy how to get rid of a hangover Buttercombe style.
1112212112111111.content:
Alright look, I'm not one to be a Judgy Judy.

I live my life the way I want because, hey, I want to, fuck off. I try to extend that respect to everyone else around me. That being said, if I were Amy (no judgement, just a simple matter of fact!) I probably would have stopped after we left that night. And I definitely, probably, wouldn't have drunk all five beers in one sitting.

I mean, hey, don't get mad at me. I hit the sack way before Amy had guzzled her way through most of a six pack. I went to bed about the time she cracked her second beer and continued to drone on and on about what a shitty night that was and how stupid that party had been and blah blah Janus blah blah frat boys blah blah belch. My roomie was pretty fun all around for the most part, but she had been such a downer. I mean, I can't say that I blame her, but still.

Point is, Amy woke up with a monster hangover.

"URR-RRRURP!!"

One that actually sounded like a monster.

I woke up to this window-rattling burp that, normally, would have come from me. But instead it had come from the living room, where I discovered Amy passed out on the couch. In the sun. With a hangover.

"Christ christ fuggin' christ..." Amy squeezed her eyes shut as tight as they would go and threw her arm over her face, "Goddammit who turned the fucking sun on?"

As I toddled my way over to my roommate, still half-dressed and still reeking of alcohol, I couldn't help but laugh. I'd never seen Amy... well, like this. I mean, I'd gotten plenty of time to see in her in her undies, and her cute little tummy rolling into her lap was nothing new either. But I'd never seen my roomie go on a bender like that. Last night was rough and all but... well, at least I got to see a new side to her!

"Hey Ames." I said quietly, "Amy? Amykins?"

"Your footsteps. Are so. Loooooud." Amy moaned as she flopped down on the couch and buried her head in the blanket, "For the love of all things decent and holy, draw the fucking blinds please..."

I took a step forward

"Quietly." she hissed

I took a big girl tiptoe forward. And then another, and another. The bright morning sun was reduced to a little gray hue in my room as I turned the blinds down. Not that it did much good for Amy. She kept her head buried in the blankets like a hungover ostritch. She laid on her belly, and burped loudly into the covers. She quickly threw them off of her.

"Gross." Amy's face twisted in disgust, "Gross in there. Stay out here in the bright."

"Oh God, is that all you can handle?" I did my best to keep my voice low so as not to upset her post-beverage sensibilities, "Back at Buttercombe, we did this every couple weeks. I got in a fight with a girl twice my size and woke up to go to Ms. Holloway's class the next morning."

"Good fer you." Amy snarled, her eyes shut, "Not all of us have all that fat to soak up the alcohol."

"Hey, I was pretty skinny back then." I huffed, offended, "I hadn't even put on my first fifty pounds yet!"

"Don't... don't care. No talk now." Amy grumbled, grabbing the blanket and snuggling up under it, "Skipping class. Staying inside forever."

"Amy come on, it can't be that bad."

"Dead inside."
1112212112111111.title: Huffy and Hungover

choices: We get distracted on the way to Cake Street- probably for the best, honestly.
Cake Street is having some sort of event... Color me intrigued!
11122121121111111.content:
"Alright, Drama Queen Numero Uno- Here you go." Amy grunted beneath her blanket- She had managed to sort of corkscrew the thing around herself since I left, and now looked like a half-woman, half-blanket hybrid- and I was slightly worried that her boobs were going to smother her, since they were currently covering half of her head, which hung lazily off the side of the couch. "C'mon, I didn't smuggle a continental breakfast in my hoodie pocket up here for you to just grunt at it. Rise and shine!" I poked her in the boob, which got her to rise- sort of. She flopped violently off the couch and onto the floor.

"Don't want it." She muttered, face down. "Head hurts."

I couldn't help but sigh. "Look, first off? You're not allowed to go with parties with me anymore if you're just gonna be a hungover brat in the morning. And secondly, breakfast isn't all I brought! Look!" I shook a bottle of Advil loudly. "C'mon, take your medicine, and eat your breakfast. We've got Economics in forty and I'm not going solo."

Long story short, after a bit more coercing I got Amy up and seated, with a nice room-temp coffee, the largest cup of ice water I could wrangle together (Thanks, Avengers movie theater cup! Fifty-four ounces of pure icy hangover cure) and a folded over paper plate from the cafeteria holding as much scrambled eggs and bacon I could manage to smuggle out in my oversized hoodie pouch. With a few Advil in her, plus a rather modest breakfast, Amy was good as new.

Just kidding, she looked like hell.

I let her wear her sunglasses to class, with her hood pulled firmly over her head, because I'm a good roomie, but also because I sucked at Economics and I could count on Amy, hungover or not, to take pretty good notes. Other than a wise-ass comment from our professor when we walked in about Amy partying too hard the previous night, eliciting a grunt from the offended party, class was fairly uneventful. I couldn't help but be thankful that Amy and I had this class together- although Amy was usually the one dragging me to it, not the other way around. And my hangover gambit paid off in spades- I managed to completely zone out fifteen minutes in, but Amy thankfully took somewhat studious notes- in between groaning or stifling belches.

By the time we made our way out of the classroom, Amy was acting more like herself- namely, she was ravenous. "I need like, a hundred cakes. Seriously. I'm starving, why didn't you bring me more breakfast?" I glared at her. "I mean, um..."

"Um, nothing. Your hungover ass could barely scarf down the breakfast I brought you, you ungrateful cow. But I agree, cake sounds good. Maybe not a hundred..."

Amy gawked at me from behind her glasses. "Wow, I never though I'd hear Ms. Carlyle turn down a massive amount of carbs and sugar before!"

"I may be a glutton, but I'm not dumb. That's like... Fifty pounds of food, dude. Be realistic. I could probably eat three cakes, max." I wasn't usually this modest, but honestly, I wasn't feeling 100% after last night either, and the thought of shoveling fifty cakes into my fat face sounded... Not great. Which was very out of character for me, but whatever. Besides, I knew Amy was just talking out of her ass anyways.

"I could eat three cakes in my sleep, Mel! Don't tell me you're getting soft on me- well, you know what I mean." She said, poking my gut. I slapped her hand away.

"Are we seriously doing this? Are you challenging me, of all people, to an eating contest? I think you're still drunk, Amy."

"And I think you're wussing out on me! C'mon, we've got our eating clothes on, let's do this!" I shrugged. I could eat, and she was right- we were both dressed in our stretchiest of sweat pants and loosest hoodies- perfect post party clothing.

"Whatever, fine. This is a dumb idea, but fine. Let's go. If you puke on me because you suddenly feel too hungover to eat halfway through I swear I'm gonna smack your head so hard that all the Advil in the world won't fix it."
11122121121111111.title: Don't Wake the Bear (Except for Class)

choices: "Why don't you ask Amy?  I'm sure she'd go... Any excuse for free drinks."
"I'll go with you dude, no sweat.  In case you forgot, I'm a 'chick'."
111221211211111111.content:
So, I wasn't relishing the walk to Cake Street, but it was pretty much the nicest day ever, so we both slowly waddled our fat asses in the vague direction of our carb-heavy Valhalla- but we had barely been walking for more than five minutes (which was a lot of walking for me, mind you) when I decided we needed to make a detour to get a drink. So, we slowly swerved our significant selves towards one of the half-dozen coffee shops littering the campus.

"I'll have... Uh... Shit, what's that drink with the peppermint, and the chocolate, and the-" Amy said, bouncing on her heels and causing her chest to wobble underneath her shirt- which went completely unnoticed by the bored barista.

"The Pepper-Mocha Melt?" I rolled my eyes. Just call it a fucking hot chocolate with mint and be done with it. Coffee shops had the lamest names for everything.

"Yeah, that! But um, blended like a milkshake?"

"One frozen Pepper-Mocha!" The girl screamed, then looked at me. "You?"

I shrugged. "Um, one of those, I guess." The girl looked ready to strangle me.

"JUST KIDDING, TWO!" She shouted- the other barista stopped, sighed, and started adding ingredients to the blender. "Great, it's gonna be 11.55." My eyes went wide- holy shit, coffee was seriously that expensive? I almost never went into these places- usually someone else bought it for me- case in point, Amy whipped out her wallet and handed over a crisp twenty.

"I owe you for getting me up this morning. Besides, the cakes are coming out of your tab, right?" I shrugged, again. I wasn't really feeling the cake contest anymore- the walk to the coffee shop had taken out my fighting spirit, and I honestly just wanted to go and crash on the couch. I was about to say such to Amy and just deal with her gloating about being able to eat more than me "because I wussed out" or whatever, when I spotted Milo sitting in the corner, looking incredibly upset.

"Hey, it's Milo!" I shouted cheerfully as I walked over to his table, where he sat looking at his phone, a frown etched into his (otherwise admittedly handsome) features. It was funny- he barely fit on his tiny cafe chair because of his muscular stature, whereas I had to scoot two chairs together just to house my titanic ass- and I could feel my cheeks pooling off each side, anyways. "Why you lookin' all upset? You drink too much, like Amy?" I asked cheerfully- Amy let out an indignant grunt from the counter, where she waited for our drinks.

"Uh... No. I got an invite to this thing, but um... I couldn't find anyone to go with me. And it'd look dumb if I showed up solo, you know?" He glanced at his phone as it vibrated, perked up for a moment, read it, and slumped down even further. "Seriously, I've asked every chick I know!" I decided to ignore that- since I hadn't been asked. Milo wasn't the sharpest tool in the shed, but I could tell that he- like most dudes- didn't really feel like showing up with a big, bodacious babe like myself when everyone else had brought a size four or below.

I stared at him, placing a hand on his, which got me a small smile. "Milo, there's no shame in going stag, dude. I've done it plenty of times!" I shot him a grin, but his face remained glum.

"That's different, you're-" I got ready to be pissed off, and pulled my hand back. "-a girl, that's totally allowed!" I faltered. Milo was a blockhead, but he wasn't an asshole. I genuinely felt bad for him... Until I got an idea.

"Well, you haven't asked everyone you know..."
