111221211211111111.title: We're Only Making Plans for Milo

choices: ...all her chub was going to her belly and ass—I turned her into a big fat pear!
...her gut was the biggest thing about her now—and she was PISSED at me!
...that Amy didn't know when to quit—she was getting HUGE!
11122122.content:
Alright, alright, you've probably guessed it by now...

But Amy liked cake.

Like, Amy liked cake so much, you guys. Amy liked cake and cupcakes and muffins and bagels and donuts and that cinnamon raisin bread you buy at the store...And then I introduced her to things like baked potatoes loaded with sour cream and bacon and butter. French fries, potatoes au gratin, the usual. And then I got her well-versed in the art of sandwich making. I didn't really even have to try that hard—I just sort've kept doing what I was doing. Which was a total breeze for me, by the way.

My ability to just kinda go with the flow was probably, in retrospect, why I didn't notice that things were going a little too according to plan...


***


"I don't know Mel, that's a lot..."

"Hey, Amy, listen to me." I placed my arms on her shoulder and turned her forcibly towards me.

"You're thinking with these." I said, stretching out my fingers and digging my palms deep into her tits through her sweater, "You remember these? The things you're trying to counterbalance? Yeah, they don't like this stuff."

Amy just stared at me, wide-eyed, as I took my hands off of her boobs and grabbed her by the tummy. It was pretty grabbable by that point, with a nice little hang over her jeans. There was a distinct pooch, an obvious testament to my training and her newfound affinity for carbohydrates.

"You need to start thinking with this." I gave her belly a good firm shake with both hands, "If you ever want to be able to not have to wear 'my eyes are up here' t-shirts, you'll have to make that change."

"Mel, I don't have a—"

"Oh, what's that Amy?" I cupped my hand to my ear, "I wasn't listening because I was too busy staring at your disproportionately big knockers."

There was a strong silence between the two of us as the rest of Cake Street purred around us. I saw Amy's expression harden from confusion to newfound resolution. I was never more proud of her than when she walked up to the counter and said, all by herself;

"I'll have a whole sheet cake, please."

***


"What gives?!"

"No more of that." I slapped her hand away from her red Solo cup full of Lipton, "If you want to put on the right kind of pounds, we're gonna put you on the good stuff."

Like most college girls, I had an ample supply of beer. You can thank Milo for that—he was more than willing to toss a couple of cans my way after a few good parties. I wasn't what one would call a "heavy drinker" (other than the fact that I was, you know, heavy and also a drinker) but I'd managed to amass quite the little cache of beer cans.

Hey, it needed to be taken care of before dorm inspection anyway, right?

"So what, all I can drink is beer now?" Amy snorted, her double chin accentuated by her position on the couch, "That doesn't sound very practical."

"Well, I mean, not just beer." I plopped down next to my officially tubby trainee, much to the couch's audible disdain, "Lots of bubbles though. Soda, ginger-ale. Shit like that."

I cracked the beer open, and then one for myself, and tossed my head back while Amy looked at me with a confused look on her face.

"I don't know about this, Mel..." she said, scratching her exposed middle as it peeked out from underneath her sweater, "That doesn't sound—"

"Hey, have you ever heard of beer boobies?" I raised an eyebrow, "Shut up, no you haven't. Carbonated drinks stretch your stomach, babe! Known fact. Science 'n shit."

"...Mel, how many of those have you already had?"

"Look, I don't know man." I laughed, my belly wobbling between my legs, "Just... just truss me, okay?"

***


"I love potatoes."

"Uh-huh."

"Like, Mel, I really love potatoes." Amy gushed, taking a big girl swing from her Coke, "I've lived my whole life without knowing that baked potatoes were a thing!"

"Sounds like a life wasted, if you ask me."

"Agreed."

Amy and I had found this little hole in the wall diner near campus. It was the greasiest spoon I'd ever set foot in outside of Patrick's back home. Big greasy cheeseburgers, something called a Super-Sized corn dog, and more condiments than I could shake a tail feather at. The small order of fries came served on wax paper and most "normal" folks might have called it an entree.

But not me.

Or Amy. At least, not by that point.

"Mmm! And these fries! So good!" Amy rolled her eyes into the back of her head dramatically. As she leaned forward to grab a fistful, her belly cut into the table. "I can't tell you the last time I had fries."

"Yesterday." I burped, biting into my burger, "You had fries yesterday."

"Yeah, but like... before all this." Amy corrected dismissively, literally shoving fries into her mouth, "Mmmm! It's like I've died and gone to heaven!"

***


"You can do that?"

Amy just stared at me in awe as I watched, proudly, as my confection was created. We got our sugar fix from this little coffee shop called Mugshots, and somehow she had never once seen me order my usual; a Chocolate Blueberry Cheescake Frappe with almond milk. It wasn't on the menu, but let's just say that me and the barista had an understanding about us...

"Sure can." I nodded affirmatively, my chins flexing, "They put a whole slice in there."

"The world we live in." Amy said, pressing her nose against the glass of the bake case, "I wonder what else they can blend into a frappe...?"

***


I watched in abject horror as Amy did the unthinkable. She had her fries in her chubby little hands, as she was want to do, and I just thought she was gonna eat 'em, you know? But instead... instead she... she...

Dipped them into her milkshake!

She just... she just stuck 'em in there! Got milkshake all over them! At first I thought she was just playing with her food but then she... she ate it! She ate that fucking nasty-ass combination!

"Okay now that's just gross."

I heard Amy chortle thickly—her laugh had changed as she had gotten fatter, to this sort of husky chuckle. Her belly jiggled in apparent amusement at my disgust. She licked her fingers of the salt and dairy and smiled at me.

"What?" she burped, "Everyone does it where I'm from."

"Where's that? Hell?" I gasped, "Seriously Ames, I've eaten some weird shit in my life, but that's fuckin' nasty."

"Your prep school privilege is showing." Amy said with a smile, "Go ahead, give it a shot. I think you'll like it."

"Uh-uh, no way."

"C'mon...umph..." Amy struggled against the swell of her stomach as it folded onto the table in front of her, reaching out with her pillowy arms and dipping (EW!) another three french fries into her milkshake before scarfing them down, "S'really good."

"Too far, Amy!" I took a sip of my own milkshake (LIKE A NORMAL PERSON) and pulled it out of her rapidly dwindling reach, "Too far!"

***



Anyway, I mean, I guess I just having fun. Yeah I wanted to help Amy "even out" her figure so to speak, but I'll admit that it was just fun to have someone to pig out with. How was I supposed to know that Amy would go so far with it?

The only thing was...
11122122.title: Amy the Carb Queen

choices: The apartment across town
The shared house
111221221.content:
The thing I hadn't realized about Amy was what "evening out" was going to mean. Her breasts were SO big that by the time she was "proportional" she was still going to look pretty fat, and she never wasn't going to have big tits (unless she lost weight or something, but what are the chances of that?). The result was that when it came to balancing her out I may have... overshot a little.

Amy's ass was big. I mean, it wasn't just big. I'd seen big asses before at Buttercombe. Hell, I sat on one every day. But this one had appeared so suddenly, and so rapidly outweighed its upstairs counterparts, that it seemed impossibly huge, and always getting huger. It spilled out of the top of the new but already ill-fitting black leggings Amy was wearing, with her ass-shelf, big enough for a full presentation set of the encyclopedia of gluttony, giving it the appearance of a pair of rising bread loaves at a bakery for giants. As she shifted from one plump foot to the other, a ripple travelled through her meaty thighs and reverberated from hip to jiggling hip, testing the seams and elastic of the pants.

"I mean, what do you think?" Apparently Amy had been saying something the whole time. I jerked my head up from her mesmerising butt. "Hmm?"

"Mel," she said, turning around, "did you hear what I said?" This didn't exactly help on the distraction front, because Amy's breasts, as ever packed into an inadequate tank top, were now all that fit in there, and they rested on her bare and utterly outlandish belly, which flopped over the poor pitiable waistband of the leggings in two big rolls, putting her bellybutton at least a foot further forwards than her nipples.

"Um – yeah," I said, dragging my eyes up to her face (guess we didn't solve that problem). "I mean, no. Sorry. What?"

Amy sighed, which sent a ripple through her whole pear-shaped form, and turned around again to look at the corkboard. "Come on, focus up! We're supposed to be finding a place for next year, remember?"

Amy and I had decided to live off-campus for the next year, since our room at the dorm was getting a little crowded for two bodies of our sizes. I wasn't slacking off in the gaining department either – in fact, having a roomie who was so committed to stuffing her face was making me an even bigger glutton than usual and I'd entered a bit of horizontal growth spurt myself. It was getting to the point where we couldn't easily pass each other between the beds and the door. Part the college's fault for packing students in like sardines, sure, but the food we were packing into our guts couldn't be entirely absolved.

It was proving tricky to find somewhere that met our standards, though: no narrow doors or small shower cubicles; within easy waddling distance of food, and lots of it; and NO WALK-UPS. We were determined to find somewhere at ground level or at the very least with a high-capacity elevator, because we weren't just thinking of an apartment for us, but for the Mel and Amy of a year later, and everything indicated that those girls were WHALES.

Nothing we'd looked at so far had been suitable, but some new ads had just been posted on the campus accommodation board. Amy leaned forward to point at one, belly brushing against enough faded flyers selling lightly used musical instruments to stock a secondhand orchestra.

"What about this?" she said. I peered over her chubby shoulder at the flyer, which was indeed advertising a first-floor, two-bedroom apartment in the old warehouse district which was quickly becoming a popular hipster living destination.

"I don't know, I don't really know that part of town, might be kinda far... did you see this one?" I pointed to another: TWO ROOMS AVAILABLE IN SHARED HOUSE, CAMPUS-ADJACENT.

Amy wrinkled her nose. "I don't know, do you really want to share with new people? They could be total weirdos... plus 'house', that kinda says 'stairs' to me."

It was a tough decision, so we decided to do the sensible thing, and eat on it, so we waddled down to Cake Street. A few Deluxe Cupcake Selection Platters and a couple of sheet cakes later, we sat back with a creak of chairs and decided to go look at...
111221221.title: Amy the Pear

choices: The Warehouse is designed for obese tenants—it's a profitable niche market!
Nothing weird—Amy and I still stick out like big fat sore thumbs.
Amy loves it, I hate it—looks like it's back to the drawing board.
1112212211.content:
After Amy and I were sufficiently loaded up with enough calories to think more clearly on the matter, we decided that the apartment was the best choice.

And after Amy and I sat there, packing away cupcake platters for the better part of an hour or two, we were just full enough to make the trip across town.

The old warehouse district was, you guessed it, an older part of the city that used to have lots of warehouses in it. As much as I was against living in a house with two complete strangers in it, the ride over was pretty long. Online classes may or may not have been in my future if we decided to rent a room—there was no way that I was going to be motivated to get up every morning an extra thirty minutes early just to sputter into my classes like an overworked engine. But it seemed like a nice place.

The apartment was actually one of the old warehouses, converted into something of a hotbed for hipsters. Appropriately, it had been renamed something pretentious, but Amy and I had already taken to calling it the Warehouse. All evidence that it used to be anything other than a swanky apartment building in a less-than-swanky part of town had been swept away, and whatever hadn't had been converted into a sort of a modern art theme throughout the complex. I wasn't really much of an artist, but despite Amy's trepidation at even giving this place a fair shot, she was pretty impressed.

"This is so cool." she whistled, chubby hand tracing an immovable support beam.

"I mean, I guess..." I puffed, looking around anxiously for the agent. My feet were getting tired from all this standing around, "If you're a hipster."

"Only the hippiest." Amy said unironically, not catching the joke she'd made at her own wide-bottomed expense, "I was looking at some of the features of this place, y'know? Some pictures online."

"Yeah?" my gut gurgled—god how long was it going to take for this woman to show up?

"Yeah, it looks right up our alley." Amy turned to me, her bare belly swaying with the motion, bouncing slightly once she stopped, "They used to have to move shipping crates and machinery and shit so a lot of the doorways are built pretty wide."

"Well that's a plus." I laughed, may hands resting on my now 500+ poundage, "Already like it better here than I do the dorm."

"And there's a pretty sturdy elevator for the same reason." Amy whipped out her phone and pulled up the page on Lofts.com, "There's only two elevators on either side of the building though."

"Pssh. Why would we even need to go upstairs, Amy?" I rolled my eyes, "I thought we agreed on a first floor apartment."

"Uh, duh—boys?" Amy chuckled at my silence, "Maybe some girls?"

"Alright, alright, point taken."

It was about that time that our agent showed up—I liked to imagine that she rolled her eyes and groaned silently at the thought of having to deal with two overfed underclassmen like ourselves. She must have been pretty sick of dealing with our generation! But for what it's worth, she was very professional in dealing with me and my porky protege.

"There are a lot of kids your age here." she said suddenly, causing the two of us to whip around to the elevator, "I was actually just showing a nice couple an apartment on the third floor."

Our agent was a shorter woman with a rather full figure. Not as full as mine or Amy's but she was a bit plump, probably about thirty I guessed? She had straight black hair and wore black heels to match the stitching on her gray business attire. On the bridge of her nose, she wore red cat-eye glasses.

"I'm Ms. Duvall." she extended a hand professionally towards myself and Amy, "I'll be showing you around today."

"Amy." my puckish partner in crime said with an arm-wobbling handshake

"Mel Carlyle." my whole body shook with our handshake, "Nice to meet you."

To her credit, Ms. Duvall didn't seem put-off at all by our incredible weights. And trust me, as our fat bodies grew and grew, we were hard pressed to find someone who didn't at least look at us funny at first. Not that I minded, but I found it odd. I chalked it up to her just being a good agent.

"So, shall we get started?"
1112212211.title: Whales in the Warehouse

choices: Look for an apartment near some good food
Sign up to be RAs
Someone else stops by with a third option
11122122113.content:
"Well, that was a waste of time," I said when we got back to the dorm, collapsing onto my bed, my ass spreading out beneath me.

"Oh, you never even gave it a chance," Amy grumbled, dropping onto hers with a creak of springs and rummaging under it for her snack cake supply, cleaving bulging against her low-cut top as she reached down under the bed for the large box.

"Ames, it was in the middle of the warehouse district. How would we get food? It was nowhere near any restaurants, diners, bakeries, buffets..."

"I guess you've got a point," said Amy sullenly between twinkies. "Hey, what about the other way round – we could look for places in close proximity to good food?"

"That's not a bad idea..." I said, grabbing a handful of the sweet treats for myself and snacking thoughtfully.

Just then, there was a knock on our open door, and our RA, Emma, put her head round the door. "Hey, just to let you know, applications for RAs are due TODAY, guys, okay?" she said with her usual too-eager smile.

"No thanks, Emma," we chorused out of habit – she was always trying to get us to sign up for this and participate in that, and it seldom involved food.

"Oh, c'mon you two," she wheedled. "We're short on applicants this year, and it's a sweet gig – you get your own room, unlimited meal plan, and all you really have to do is run an orientation session and organise a few group activities. It's SUPER chill." She looked from one double-chinned face to another, and sighed. "Okay, well, think about it, yeah?"

When she'd gone, I said, "You know – that's actually not the world's worst idea."

"Are you serious?" said Amy, her chubby face scrunching up in disgust. "Become the next generation of Emmas? 'Heyyyy, guyyyys!'" she said, imitating the older girl's nasal tone.

"We wouldn't have to actually be like her," I said. "We could be cool RAs. Think about it, maybe we'd get assigned to adjacent floors. We could lead a generation of new freshmen through the perilous world of dorm life, kinda like I did with you," I said, prodding her flabby gut playfully. "Also, you heard the bit about the unlimited meal plan, right?"

"But I thought we were finally going to escape the dorms," Amy muttered.

I munched on another three twinkies pensively. What to do...
11122122113.title: Back to the drawing board

choices: "I'm actually kind of... Excited to be an RA?"
"Look, I don't think I can handle being an RA... But you totally should!"
"So... Do you think I'm gonna get too fat with an unlimited food plan?"
111221221132.content:
Okay, look. I like to shirk responsibility as much as the next gal. Hell, you don't end up as large as me when you actively pursue activity in any way.

THAT being said, I was pretty sure that RA stood for "Rest (our collective) Asses (off)". PLUS: Unlimited food plans? And hell, I would wager to bet that, given the chance, we could just confiscate beer and stuff! I explained this (and whined a bit about how expensive rent was going to be) and eventually...

"Christ, fine Mel! You know, you're quite a manipulator. You should really-"

"Sick so anyways, I have some coupons for the ol' BK, wanna see how many Whoppers we can eat?" I fanned a stack of coupons in front of my tubby BFFs face.

"Seriously? I'm TRYING to be mad at you!" Mel grunted- until she saw the grossly staged photo of a Whopper on the aforementioned coupons. "Fine. But seriously, if my fries are cold, we're turning around!" I giggled at her absurd level of frustration at cold fries. "I'm dead serious Mel! BK fries are the best if they're fresh, and they're LITERALLY the worst if they're cold!"

"Fine, we will turn around. I'm excited to be your RA buddy!" I exclaimed as I punched her arm jokingly. "We are TOTALLY gonna ruin some Freshman's afternoons!"

"Shut up. I need Whoppers. I'm still annoyed that we're going to be in dorms for another year." Amy grunted. "...But free beer sounds good." She finally relented.

"Exactly! Look, we get to boss people around and we can steal their bootlegged beer and we get unlimited meal plans! I know you aren't as big of a professional fat-ass like I am but I am required to remind you of one... big... thing..." I threw my hands up dramatically as Amy glared at me. "Unlimited mac and cheese!" I fluttered my hand in the air in a close approximation of... A dramatic leaf, or something.

"Christ, Mel, I already said yes! Shut up! And also we should hit the kitchen and get some mac and cheese before the Whoppers. Wait, scratch that, let's get Whoppers first, then put mac and cheese on them! Is this a good idea?" My stomach grumbled loudly before I could respond. "Yeah, sounds good. Let's do it."


Only 45 minutes later, we were crashed on the couch, watching Boogie Nights (weird movie choice, I admit) and dipping our Whoppers into mac and cheese when Amy decided to say:
111221221132.title: R U Ready to be an RA?

choices: Donna and Kate weren't exactly expecting girls of our size to show up...
Donna and Kate were more or less "normal" but they made us feel right at home.
Donna and Kate were total fatties!
1112212212.content:
After Amy and I were sufficiently loaded up with enough calories to think more clearly on the matter, we decided that the apartment was the best choice.

And after Amy and I sat there, packing away cupcake platters for the better part of an hour or two, we were just full enough to be motivated to make the drive back to campus.

One of the biggest selling points of this place was that it was near Stuffington U, which meant that there wasn't going to be this long commute to and from school. There were these quaint little houses near the campus that, students and non, found pretty comfortable. I had a couple of classes with a girl named Denise who moved in her freshman year, and she said they were nice enough. That and the fact that all the places I and Amy had grown to love were still very accessible to us, and that was all the recommendation we needed.

The ad had told a sad story about four friends coming to college, being besties, and then splitting up after only a semester together. The lease was for two years, so they needed someone to help even out the rent. It was a four room house, which was good because Amy and I definitely weren't down for sharing close quarters any time soon, and they were pretty generously built. They reminded me a little of the teacher cabins back at Buttercombe Academy that littered the hillside of the campus, albeit a bit bigger.

"Well this is nice." Amy said, almost to herself, as we huffed and puffed our way up the sidewalk

"Fuckin' parking spaces... could be closer..." I wheezed—damn why was it so hot?

Amy wasn't any more active than I was, a side-effect of being put on the Mel Carlyle diet, I suppose. But she was still light enough to gain speed on me. I was given a constant view of her big round mounds of butt blubber bouncing their way out of her leggings, her fat legs quivering with the exertion it took to haul her hugeness around. She tugged at the waistband with sausagey fingers in a futile attempt to keep herself decent from the back but, as I was one to know, it was a futile effort.

"I mean it's... it's pretty, y'know?"

Amy's doubly-chinned face was blotchy and red. Mine was too. No more of this walking shit if we were going to live here! It's cars or nothing!

"So... have you talked to them?" I gasped, "Like, e-mailed them? Texted them? Something?"

"Yeah, they know we're coming over." Amy huffed, stopping to tug at her waistband again, "They said that it's... oh, hey, here we go!"

Our goal in sight, Amy and I moved faster than we had in months. Nothing like getting out of the sun and off of our fat little feet to get us going into high gear. Our bellies wobbling, hearts pounding, and our thighs rubbing against themselves, we made it to our destination. A-2; the second house on the first row.

"Shit... what are their names again?"

"I talked to Donna on the phone." Amy drummed her belly thoughtfully, "Aaaand I wanna say that she mentioned someone named Kate? That's probably our other roommate."

"Other potential roommate." I corrected, "You're the one who doesn't want to live with strangers."

"Whatever, just... I don't know, ring the doorbell."

So I did. I extended one sausagey finger into the soft white button on the side of the wall. Within moments, I knew everything I needed to know about our potential housemates...
1112212212.title: Sharing a House? With My Sheer Size?

choices: Was awestruck- in a good way!  Kate seems pretty stoked!
Doesn't seem happy.  Kate pulls Donna away for a private conversation- Uh oh!
11122122122.content:
We caught our collective breath as we waited for that horrible buzzing noise to come back at us, signalling our entrance. Thankfully, it took a moment- I made a point to say "We gotta get our own keys, they take too long to answer" to Amy before the door flew open... To reveal a stick of a woman!

Okay, that was a bit harsh. Maybe it was because I was staring at Amy's monumental ass too long, but Donna looked... Like, ridiculously thin. If I had to guess... A size... Two? Look, I couldn't remember the last time I had seen a pant size that was below twenty, so that wasn't the most accurate reading- but point was, she was thin. Even by my standards. Donna was a fair skinned lady, with a bit of a potbelly- I couldn't really judge if it was considered small or not, but it defiantly protruded outwards from her frame, pressing against her shirt. The rest of her was pretty average- she had blonde hair, clean skin, and was wearing a white t-shirt with black yoga pants- typical college garb.

"I'm Donna! Hi, welcome to..." She gave Amy and I a look over, paused, and continued as though she hadn't noticed the 800+ pounds of women standing in her doorway. "-Our home! Come in, come in! You must be Amy and Mel!" Her grin faltered a bit, but she kept her pitch going. I had to admit, I was impressed. Unlike Amy, she failed to mention either of our sizes within seconds of meeting her- I guess that was a plus. We staggered our way into the house- both of us were a little bloated from food, and our movements were slow, but Donna kept the pace going all the same. "So, this is kind of the, I dunno, living room?" She gestured outwards- there were two loveseats and a handful of beanbag chairs. "I know beanbag chairs are lame, so... I dunno, don't use them?"

I let out a giggle at that. "I think if either of us sat on those, they'd burst." Donna looked alarmed for a second- clearly, she wasn't used to fat ladies joking about their weight. Eager to close the deal, I attempted to ease the tension. "Don't worry, we'll stick to the loveseats. Nice set-up!" Donna looked relieved.

"Why don't we check out the kitchen?" Amy requested, and Donna's eyes lit up. I started to get excited- no one gets excited about kitchens anymore... Could this place really be what we were looking for?

Turns out, the kitchen was incredible.

"We have gas- it's cheaper, after all, and while I don't cook a lot, Kate absolutely loves to- She INSISTED we find a place with gas stoves, so... Yeah." The kitchen really was incredible- they had an island, a nice two-compartment sink, and a dishwasher! I'd never have to scrub down a sticky bowl of mac & cheese residue again! Also...

"Did you say Kate likes cooking?" Amy blurted out, opening the fridge without asking. She looked impressed, and when I glanced at her, I could see why- the refrigerator was absolutely loaded with food!

"Oh, don't get me started! Look at this gut-" Donna patted her tiny midsection for a minute before her eyes shot wide- her rounder belly was noticeable on her otherwise thin frame, but compared to us she was a stick.

"Look, we know we're fat. You don't have to act so humble. Where is Kate, anyways?" I asked, throwing Donna a rope. Amy had, thankfully, stopped digging around in the fridge.

"Uh, believe it or not, she ran off to get groceries... She said she needed some stuff. Let's, uh, look at your rooms!" Donna said as she began to walk off- Amy and I dutifully followed. "We, uh, have the rooms upstairs already, so you two will be down here." Donna walked down a narrow hallway- I couldn't help but notice that Amy was mere inches away from her hips brushing the walls on either side of her- my thighs dragged against them already, but I knew from the past that my weight mostly went to my gut, so I wasn't worried. She threw open two doors near the end of the hallway. "If you're serious about moving in, you can figure out which rooms you want later. The bathroom is at the end of this hall, and-" Donna stopped as a slam echoed down the hall. "-Annnnd Kate is home, apparently!" I began backing up, as Amy swiveled around and followed, leaving Donna to follow in our fleshy wake. We surged back into the living room, where Donna rushed ahead, leading us towards. the kitchen.

"Hey, Donna, check it out, I got-" A voice rang out from the kitchen, before we emerged. "Oh- Shit, is that today! I completely forgot!" We waddled into the kitchen, and Kate...
11122122122.title: Meeting the Future Housemates

choices: I ask Donna about her old roommates that moved out—there's a story there!
Oh wow, Donna wasn't kidding when she said Kate liked to cook!
Skip to move-in day, where Amy and I celebrate the only way we know how—FOOD!
111221221221.content:
"Oh shit, is that today?" a voice rang out from the kitchen, before we emerged, "Sorry--total brain fart."

We came thundering into the kitchen just in time to see Kate plop a load of groceries on the kitchen counter. Six or seven plastic bags clacked into place as she set them down, the brown material crinkling as their contents settled. Kate turned her head to see us and, much like her roommate had before, responded more or less relatively well to the fact that her kitchen had gained almost a half-ton of weight since she'd last been inside.

Kate was a little shorter than I was, and, I mean... I guess she was skinny? I don't know. Where Donna was about a head or so taller than me and a little lanky, save for her little pot, Kate was shorter and looked a little meatier. And when I say that, don't get excited. She wasn't, like, anywhere close to my size, or Amy's size (not like those comparisons held up for most normal folks though.) She was a couple inches shorter than me, and was a bit bustier than her taller, blonder counterpart. She was cute; long brown hair tied up in one of those lazy buns, a little stud in her nose, jeggings. She carried all those bags pretty easily too. I don't know, she just looked a little dainty somehow. I honestly would have helped her if, you know, I were anyone other than me.

"Hi, I'm Kate." she said with a little wave after she settled the cans and baggies and so forth on the counter, "Are you guys... Meeeel? I wanna say?"

"Yup."

"Aaaand you're... Amy?"

"You got it."

It was always a mixed bag of emotions whenever I interacted with someone less than a third of my size and they didn't react in the way that I expected them to. On one hand, it's always really cool to see who's size-positive and who's not. I'll say this, if Kate had pitched a bitch about my weight, I might have actually sat on her. She reacted even less so than Donna had, so this girl either had a generous worldview on size and my rights as an unabashed fat girl, or she had the best poker face ever. On the other hand... it was always a little nice to get some kind of knee-jerk reaction to just how big I was. I mean, I appreciate it but... you know, I wouldn't have minded a wince.

"Awesome, the sooner I learn your names the better." Kate laughed at her own expense, "I mean, assuming you guys wanna stick around. I know it's kind've a mess."

"You should see our dorm." Amy snorted, scratching her tummy hang as it oozed over her waistband, "We are not tidy housekeepers."

"We're not." I crinkled my nose, mentally picturing Mt. Pizza Box, "I mean, we're not slobs or anything..."

"Ehhh..." Amy teetered her chubby little hand, "60/40."

"But no, this place looks great." I concluded, "I really like this place."

"That's awesome! We're happy to have you." Kate said as she started over, "Do you guys wanna look around a little? I'm sure Donna wouldn't mind giving you a tour?"

"I actually just finished, thank you very much." Donna stuck her tongue out at her friend, reached into a grocery bag, and pulled out a package of Hawaiian King Rolls, "You're not the only roommate who does stuff."

So far, I had to say that I really liked what I saw. The house wasn't too big, but it wasn't so small that I felt like I was gonna pop out of the drywall (yet, anyway.) A fridge full of food and two skinny roommates who were much more willing to get up and hand me stuff than Amy was? Sounded like a dream come true to me! Sure the hallways were a little small, but... you know, that was more of a problem for Future Mel anyway. And maybe Present Amy, if she kept scarfing down Hawaiian rolls like that.

"Cool, uh... well, do you wanna go pick rooms while I get dinner started?" Kate shrugged, "I mean, I didn't plan on cooking for four tonight, but--"

"Of course we'll stay!" my greedy glutton protege said, scraping a poor defenseless chair out from underneath the table and plopping down on it with the great force of her mighty ass, "I mean, it's only polite, right roomie?"

"Jesus Amy, tone it down a little." I scolded her while she practically licked her chops, sopping it up with another Hawaiian roll from Donna's bag, "Donna, you wanna show me the rooms?"

"Hmm?" Donna blinked, probably not expecting such a mobile response or suggestion from me, "Oh sure! I'll just..."

Donna placed the baggie of rolls down on the counter, just out of Amy's reach, and lead me down the hall.

Yeah, I could see myself living here. Donna was nice enough and Kate could cook. Neither of them seemed into making me or Amy feel bad about ourselves or our weight. Things just seemed pretty chill there! I mean, it wouldn't be a forever home or anything, what with my rising weight, but it would do for now...

It couldn't be any worse than those friggin' dorms!
111221221221.title: Kate's Great!

choices: Dinner goes very well- We sign our lease the next day and start our move-in!
While we're eating and drinking, one of Kate and Donna's acquaintances shows up!
1112212212212.content:
So, we shuffled our way into one of the bedrooms. It was nice! Honestly, living in a dorm with Amy made me miss my old bedroom- a feeling I didn't think I'd ever, well, feel- but at least at Buttercombe they pretended to try and care if you felt like you were at home. Stuffington? Fahgeddaboutit. Plain white walls, semi-strict decoration rules (I mean, we still hung shit up anyways, but they tended to frown about it), no real kitchen... No roommate that wanted to cook? Okay, that wasn't really on Stuffington, but still! It just felt... Lacking. And this place didn't! Also, Donna said how much we'd owe a month, and like, I assumed she meant each of us would owe it, but she meant all together! I wasn't exactly rolling in dough- nor was Amy- but with that big of a difference in payments? Hell, we could eat like Queens- not to say we didn't already.

Also, I hate to be that girl, but the internet in the dorms sucked, whereas Donna casually threw out the fact that they paid for the nice, local internet companies business- which meant we had blazing download speeds! No more Netflix buffering every five seconds because some asshole down the hall decided to torrent all of Game of Thrones or whatever... I stood and talked to Donna for longer than I thought, because it had gotten kinda dark out- the bright blue sky had given way to a purplish-orange hue, and I noticed the breeze coming through the cracked windows was slightly cooler.

"I'm sure Kate's almost done with dinner, why don't we head back out? I'm really glad that you and Amy are okay with this place! Honestly, we had quite a few people come through already, but they were all... Well, creepy. I mean, they were mostly dudes, so that explains that part of it, but..." Donna waved her hand in the air. "Whatever, it's all in the past. Seriously though, I think I speak for both myself and Kate when I say we'd love to have you here." We began our slow return to the kitchen- Donna happily walking in front while I awkwardly shuffled down the hallway... Only for both of us to pause when a massive belch echoed through the house.

"I'm guessing that was my half, not yours." I sighed... If Amy blew this deal out of the water because she couldn't keep her gluttony in check for a few hours, I'd... Well, strangling her sounded like too much effort. Maybe I'd just give her a charlie horse or something. However, we emerged into a kitchen that held two very happy women- One slightly sweaty Kate, who seemed to be using all four burners on the stove and making an absolute mess of the counter, and a clearly already stuffed Amy, who was reclining back on her stool- I was thankful that the back seemed to be holding up, since if Amy took a tumble to the floor, I doubted she'd be able to get back up. Her shirt and her leggings had parted ways due to her bloated gut, letting a sliver of pale, pudgy skin peek outwards, and she currently was holding a pint glass of beer.

"MEL!" She shouted, taking a long pull from her glass. "Not only is Kate an amazing cook, she's like- super good at combining beers!" I shot Donna a 'Oh God I'm so sorry' look, but she was already walking up to Kate.

"Oh, wow- You already started? Sheesh, leave me and poor Mel to knock out the nitty-gritty of the place while you and Amy have all the fun! I see how it is..." Kate finished up stirring whatever she was working on and spun on her heel.

"Like I didn't already pour you and Mel some? Don't even trip, girl! I just- I was happy to have such an eager student, is all! You're always talking about 'not drinking so much beer', or whatever- Amy was all for it! Weren't ya, Amy?" She shot Amy a thumbs up, which was happily returned. "I've got you covered too, Mel!" She pointed to a pint glass that I hadn't even noticed among the various groceries that were splayed all over the counter.

Donna had already come back towards me. "I told you Kate likes to cook, right? I hope that won't be an issue..." She shot a glance at Amy, who was scarfing down some nachos that Kate had apparently made for her. "She seriously buys so much beer... She's trying to figure out the perfect pairing for every dish, apparently. She's a culinary student here..." My eyes went wide.

"Tell me I'm not dreaming, Amy." I held an arm out for her to pinch, but she was too busy chowing down.
1112212212212.title: Cookin' Kate Convinces Amy

choices: Colleen, exercise science major—don't worry ladies, she's cool."
Wanda, one of my classmates—I kinda forgot we had a project to do tonight..."
Haley, our (and your!) neighbor—she's really cool.
11122122122122.content:
Look, I'm not one to complain about a foodie roommate. For God's sake, I'd been living with Amy for two semesters now.

I'll admit that it was a little different to have a roommate that wasn't quite into food the same way that I was. Kate was closer in line to "chick who really likes the taste of food" and "culinary student looking to justify her degree", rather than "fat chick who knows food is the prime instigator of weight gain." I hadn't ever really given any thought to the folks that outright enjoyed mixing and matching other flavors and seeing how they paired in my five year sprint towards the big five-double-goose egg, but if they were anything like Kate, I had been missing out.

"An' this one's just a little lighter. A little wheatier, less barley, you know?" Kate monologued as she poured a glass of heady yellow bear into my glass, "Should go great with your burgers..."

Let me just say this--I, for one, loved Kate already. That moment, that then and that there. Unlike just about everyone else I had ever met with an obsession with food, she was all about me eating it and giving her feedback. I could knock back burgers, fries, chips and hot dogs of all kinds of various flavors and makes while chugging back drafts from dark to light. And Kate was always spot-on, recommending that I try that beer with this, this beer with that. Who knew that I had such a refined palette?"

"Okay, so I'm getting that you like this kind, right?" Kate had asked me, her face flush with inebriation, "You like the wheaty stuff?"

"I do." I burped deeply, "I really do."

"Me too." Donna burped from her seat next to me, slouched back in her chair as she surrendered to the calorie onslaught of Kate's cooking, "It's really bubbly and the taste isn't, like... it isn't too strong, you know?"

"Doesn't overpower the burger." I added constructively, "Or the barbecue sauce."

"Exactly!" Kate laughed a little as she topped off her roommate, "I've trained you so well, Donna~"

We all threw our heads back and chugged the beer in our glasses. I was already toasted, and that wasn't an easy feat with me. Amy, next to me, had long succumbed to her buzz. And whenever we were drunk, my porky pal and I tended to indulge just a bit more than usual. We'd been hawking back burgers and fries for the better part of an hour, but Amy had been choking them down with such a speed that even I was impressed. Inebriated, but impressed.

"I think m'gonna like livin' here..." Amy burbled poetically into her fistful of sour cream and onion chip before tossing them into her mouth, "All the cookin' I can eat an' the drinkin' I can drink... Why didn't we move out, like... forever ago?"

"Because you were still skinny enough to fit into the dorms." I laughed, my jowls quivering and my belly shaking jovially as I reached across the table to give Amy's belly a good bounce, "Porky."

If Kate and Donna were upset at all by Amy and I openly groping and fondling each other's voluptuous figures, they didn't really show it. Either that, or they were too drunk to care. Donna, by this point, was much more interested in filling up her hollow leg with booze than watching Amy's belly jiggle, and Kate was too busy tapping herself off with a particularly heady, frothy dark draft that she seemed fond of. I could have called Amy all the kinky fatty names in the book and I'm pretty sure neither one of them would have bat an eye.

"Coming from you." Amy burbled drunkenly as she lifted up my shirt, allowing all of my cuddle-fluff to eek out into the world, "You were... the reason that we all had to take the stairs. Remember? 'Cuz you jumped up and down in the elevator."

She gave my belly a few playful pats, and we both watched as it wobbled and shimmied between my legs.

"I prolly burned, like a bajillion calories 'cuza your Melly Belly."

"Stop..." I huffed, begrudgingly hot and bothered from all this tummy talk, "Amy you're being weird."

Much to my surprise (and relief, considering!) Kate and Donna were way too preoccupied to notice our little dip out of heteronormativity there. In fact, I think Donna may have been way too drunk to be leaning back in her chair like that. But before Amy or I could cop another feel, the doorbell rang. Apparently, that was enough to rouse either one of them from their stupor, but not Amy and I squeezing each other by the guts.

"Ooh, I'll get it!" Kate laughed stupidly, stumbling up to her feet

"Yeah, you get it." Donna slurred, "Gonna just get me summore beer here..."

Anyway, Kate got up, leaving us without a make believe bartender or waitress for a solid minute or so. I had actually only just realized the ramifications of my empty glass and plate when I heard her coming back into the room.

"Hey, great timing!" Kate said, trying to sound more sober than I knew (and I'm pretty sure everyone knew) her to be, "Amy, Mel, I just wanted to introduce you to..."
11122122122122.title: Feeding, Fondling, Getting Friendly...

choices: It's time to move in- Amy and I come to terms with how out of shape we've gotten
Move in day- thankfully, Colleen is there to help our fat asses move our stuff
111221221221221.content:
"Hi!" I said happily, wiping my hand briefly on my shirt as I tugged back down over my gut and extending it outwards, which Colleen took happily. "I'm Mel!" She nodded and smiled. "That's my other half, Amy. The lighter half." I pointed with my free hand towards my roomie, who still had her tubby tummy peeking outwards for all to see- apparently she didn't feel like being polite. "She's uh... A little over her limit, y'know? Try not to judge her too hard." Colleen shot me a wink.

"Wouldn't dream of it. Hi Amy!" She waved, which caused Amy to snap out of her stupor. "I'm Colleen, in case you missed that part."

Amy attempted to appear sober, which made Kate's act, by comparison, look impeccable. "I'm Amy-" She slurred, standing up, belching, and stumbling all in one smooth motion, which caused her entire form to quiver wildly as she grabbed the counter to stabilize herself. "Uh... Look, your buddy Kate gave me too much to drink, I'm basically without fall... Without fa- fffffffault here." She struggled back onto her stool as Kate loaded her plate back up with food, which immediately dmanded her attention again. "Nice t' meet ya, though." She managed to get out before going back for fifthsies or seventh-sies or whatever number she was on.

"Sooooo Colleen, tell me about yourself." I offered, limiting myself to eating my fries one at a time instead of chowing down like my cohort. I mean, I could have absolutely destroyed the plate in a matter of moments, but I felt like at least one of us should probably be polite.

"Well..." She said, stealing Donna's chair, who had snuck off to the bathroom. "I'm an Kinesiology major." My face went blank, because the word she said honestly sounded... Well, like anything but English. I tried to save face.

"So, like, uh... Kinetic motion?" Her expression didn't change. "Uh... Kins... Like... Families? Look, I've honestly never heard that word before. I'm sorry." Colleen laughed- she had this quiet, dignified laugh, which was a sharp contrast from Amy's boisterous guffaws.

"No, not even close. I just use that word to sound fancy and make my parents think I'm not wasting my life. It's an Exercise Science degree... Basically human health in relation to exercise." I tried to look interested, but I guess I didn't do a great job because Colleen immediately placed a hand on my knee. "No need to look so worried, Mel! Look, I'm no health nut... I mean, look at me!" I did. She looked like a health nut. She was the skinniest woman in the room by far, wearing leggings and one of those form-fitting workout t-shirts. She wasn't like, ripped or anything, but she definitely took care of herself. "I just... It's always been interesting to me, y'know?"

Now, I wasn't one to feel self conscious- but I also had... Maybe five conversations with someone who was fitness-minded in my whole life. And my Mother counted for 2 of them. So I wasn't quite sure what to say. So, I said the default answer when I didn't know what to say. "Oh, that's really cool!"

Colleen shrugged. "It's a living, I guess. Trust me, I won't be a dick about it... I'll have to talk to you about it sometime!" She turned away from me as Kate slid a plate in front of her. "Oh, shit yes! You showing off for Mel and Amy?"

Kate rolled her eyes. "Yeah, right. They're basically putty in our hands already, right Mel?" She winked at me and I shot her a thumbs up. "I just actually have an audience who actually appreciates my food."

Donna rushed into the room, sliding slightly on the wooden floor in her socks. "Hey! I appreciate your food!" She shouted. "Aw, Colleen took my chair!" Colleen shot her the finger as she started eating her fries. "Wow... So much for my favorite neighbor..." Donna grumbled, before Kate pointed her towards the sink.

"You know the rules- I cook, you clean. And I meant to say that they're an audience who appreciates my food and can handle more than one serving." Kate clarified, before plopping a brand new pint glass in front of Colleen, snagging my glass along with Amy's and refilling them from a brown glass jug. "I filled this growler up the road- It's just an IPA, I'm too exhausted from all this cooking to pair anymore. Just drink it and pretend the hops accent the flavor or whatever."

"I just have to train in the morning, you know this! I eat my fair share..." She poked me in the arm. "Mel, trust me, I eat my fair share, honestly."

I threw my hands up. "I'm didn't say anything!" She shot me a thumbs up. "And I'll be more than happy to eat whatever is left over, as will Amy, if you hadn't noticed..." My roomie was already done with her plate, and was chugging her beer, oblivious to the conversation around her. "Amy! You gotta cool it with the beer, we still have to head home!"
111221221221221.title: Colleen, Cool but Inquisitive

choices: After we get settled, we have our first house party—beer, pizza, and lots of it!
I get Donna or Kate to help me unpack my room, and get to know them better
Not long after, classes begin again at Stuffington...UGGGGHHH.
1112212212212212.content:
So Amy and I really liked the apartment. Donna and Kate seemed cool, they had at least one fun neighbor, and it was a lot cheaper than taking out a small fortune to live in an increasingly "snug" dorm room for another year. Splitting the rent not just two ways but four was reason enough to move out, and combined with the fact that we'd have at least one roommate who knew her way around the kitchen meant I'd finally be able to save a bit. Even if Kate only cooked us one meal a day, that's still one less meal that I didn't have to pay for.

We spent the rest of the week packing up our things. There was an entire day dedicated to figuring out which clothes were still good and which ones we'd outgrown. It was like one giant fat girl fashion montage—First Amy, then I would waddle out of our bedrooms into the living room, our bellies hanging out or our ass muffin-topping out from various waistbands. There was pizza, lots of soda, some beer... it was nice! We rolled up our posters, boxed up our furnishings, and got Milo to help us with the move. Donating/throwing out our outsized clothes made a lot of room, which meant less work for us in the long run, I guess.

I mean, you'd think it would have anyway..

"Gaaawd..." Amy whined as she threw one pale pillar of leg in front of the other, "Moving's so hard..."

It was almost surreal to think that just a year ago, Amy was one of the thinnest girls I'd met since graduating from Buttercombe. The only challenge she would ever shy away from when I had first met her was a flight of stairs (because seriously, fuck stairs, right?). But after just two semesters of me and our little quest of evening her out (and getting her hooked on carbs!), Amy was almost a completely different person; one who indulged with increasing frequency and regularity, who got winded going up escalators, and moved only when necessary. I'd turned Amy into a regular porker just by merit of being there, and it wasn't always noticeable until we started doing something physical.

Something physical like moving.

We had pulled up in Milo's truck, Amy filling up the passenger side while I was poured into the back, and we were both already sweating. It was a hot day out, and we were both already well insulated. Amy, with her giant tits and fat ass, wasn't any better equipped for lugging heavy boxes than I was (with my giant-er tits and even fatter ass) and it showed. She was red-faced before she even picked up her first box; she bent over, giving everyone a good idea of just how wide her butt was, and heaved up a box marked MEL's JUNK that couldn't have been much heavier than a couple of choice items from my room. You'd have thought I'd had her move one of those old fat-back TV's by herself, with the way she huffed and puffed. Her chubby cheeks blew outwards as an unsteady stream of air escaped her.

"Where do you want this one?" she huffed

"Uh, just take it to my room."

I repeat, Donna and Kate were pretty much the best ever. We were moving into a two-story house, and none of us were the kind of moderately wealthy college girl where we could get an elevator installed. Their old roommates, Kelsey and Haley, lived upstairs before they moved out. Forseeing that Amy and I might have some problems with this arrangement, Donna and Kate were taking this opportunity to move into the second floor so that the more easily accessible rooms would be available for the two of us.

So good news: I wouldn't have to climb any stairs ever!

Bad news: that meant Donna and Kate were busy with their own moving, and that Amy and I were kinda on our own.

"Fffffiiiiiinnneeee." Amy blustered before she teetered herself towards the door, her gigantic cheeks swaying from side to side as she waddled towards the door.

I took a look in the bed of Milo's truck, wiping the accrued sweat from my forehead with one doughy arm. There were about fifteen boxes, minus the one that Amy was waddling into the house. I knew for a fact that a couple of them were what remained of our fashion expose, and therefore wouldn't be quite so heavy. But even still, I wasn't exactly in the best shape of my life. Amy, who was about two hundred pounds lighter than me, was having trouble. What chance did I have in the Summer sun, throwing boxes around?

"Hey there, neighbor!"

And then, as if she had been sent from above, who else but Colleen came bounding down the sidewalk—our new Exercise Science Major neighbor!

"Colleen!" I threw my hands up in the air, taking two jiggling steps towards my new favorite person, "Collie, Col, Colleenikins... would you mind, uh... giving us a hand here?"

I could tell that Colleen had partly expected the invitation. Something about the way she cut her eyes at the truck, then at me with my lowest belly roll hanging out of my leggings, then back to the truck, then back to me as I sweat profusely in the hot sun. She just sort've smiled and her pace slowed down until she was standing mere inches away from my belly. She wasn't as sweaty as I was, and she'd been jogging. Even I thought that was kinda pathetic.

"Sure thing." Colleen said with a little laugh as she unplugged her earbuds and tapped on her phone, "I was about to head in anyway."

Let me just say, watching Colleen manhandle those boxes made me realize how lucky I was. Just standing out here on the lawn was making me tired. Watching Colleen was almost exhausting. As she wriggled one of the boxes from the pile we'd thrown into the bed and carried it like a pro, I knew she was a godsend.

"Where do you want me to put this?" Colleen asked, no worse for wear, as she jostled a box labelled AMY'S SHIT...

Oh fuck, I knew what that was. That box had those big ass scrubs in there that I'd been bugging Amy about. That girl's butt was almost as big around as mine was, and they had that long drawstring.

"Uh, put it in my room." I said, turning her around, "Yeah, the one on the left."

Colleen was in and out in half the time it took Amy. They actually came back out onto the lawn about the same time—Amy squeezing her wide hips through the doorway with Colleen flitting easily behind her.

"You got another box?" Colleen asked me

"Uh..."

I looked behind me. There was no way I was going to be able to get in there. I weighed five hundred pounds. I'd break the damn thing. Jumping up like Colleen did was an impossibility for me, and even if it wasn't, I had a sinking feeling that the sudden shift in weight would wreck the suspension even on Milo's burly compensation-mobile. So I lowered the lid, waddled to the side, and walked a box over to the edge of the bed, and hefted it up.

"Sure thing!" I puffed, tossing it to Amy, "I'll, uh... I'll just get the boxes from the truck. You guys can carry them in. Sound fair?"

"Unf—no." Amy winced as her flabby arms quivered in exertion, "How come you get to be the box elf?"

"Uh, because I called it?"

Amy groaned.

"This is dumb. I'm gonna go take a break." she puffed, tottering back inside.

That left just me and Colleen outside. I'll admit, I wasn't really comfortable around her. I mean, she was nice and seemed pretty chill. But I hadn't had the best experience with Exercise Science-adjacent folks, especially since my days as a little porker in Buttercombe. My Mom had always been a real bitch about my weight, and that alone made me just a little uncomfortable just being around someone who felt like she could break out into fat-shaming me at any moment.

Call it irrational, but I'd been bitched at enough for one lifetime. I liked Colleen, but I still couldn't wrap my head around the idea that she wasn't gonna do that every other breath she took.

"Soooo... box elf?" I offered weakly

"You're still gonna help me, right?" Colleen raised a knowing eyebrow, "I mean, that's a lot of boxes."

I bit my lower lip in anticipation. Of getting health-freaked out on, of scaring her off and having to do all this myself, of literally collapsing from exertion. I was a big girl! A really big girl. I wasn't built for this kind of manual labor!

"Yo, Mel!"

And, for the second time that day, the Gods of Displacing Labor answered my prayers. Headed out the door was Milo, my hunky ex-neighbor from across the hall back at the dorms. He was in a fraternity, had the still-chiseled body of a student athlete, and wasn't all that bad to have around. A little dumb, but pretty. Good for some conversations, a couple drinks, and (most importantly) when you needed something moved, he was there to help.

"I just finished helping your friends upstairs—you guys need any help down here?"

"Yes." I said quickly, whipping around and grabbing a box, thrusting it into his arms, "Take this to my room, please?"

"Sure thing, dude."

Milo reached past me, grabbed another box and plopped it on top of the one I gave him (He grabbed one of Amy's by mistake, but in his defense, the label was on the other side) and hauled them both inside. As he walked away, I could see Colleen practically drooling over him. Or... wait, maybe literally drooling a little there.

"I will do literally anything you need me to with those boxes." Colleen said breathily, fanning herself for effect, "If you hook a bitch up with that big piece of man cake."

"Lady, you've got yourself a deal" I puffed in appreciation, waddling towards the door, "My boxes go to the left, Amy's to the right. Have fun with your... uh... man cake."
1112212212212212.title: Displacing Hard Work Unto Others

choices: "No real reason, I guess—they just transferred to a school in Abercrombie."
"Nicole and I sort've had a... fling... I guess—It got weird, they moved out."
"Just drama—Brooke started getting fat, blamed Kate, it was just ugly."
11122122122122122.content:
So if I thought that moving boxes in and out of Milo's truck was difficult, moving the contents of those boxes around my room in a way that I felt moderately comfortable with was another animal entirely. Lots of bending over, lots of standing, waddling around my room. While I was happy that I wasn't crammed into one of those teeny-tiny sardine cans that they called dorm rooms back at Stuffington, that was a double edged sword. There was a lot of room for me to wobble around in, but I could no longer decorate everything by sitting down on my bed.

"Thanks for helping me, Donna."

Thus, I recruited Donna.

"Hey, no sweat." the taller blonde said, putting her shoulder-length hair up in a messy bun, "I figured you'd need some help. And this used to be my room anyway."

Like I said earlier, Donna and Kate had been really cool about moving letting me and Amy move in. They both roomed on the ground floor of the house and, rather than let Amy and I exasperate ourselves every time we wanted to go to our rooms by climbing up a whole flight of stairs (like animals!) we swapped. Amy got Kate's old room and I got Donna's.

Let me tell you, this girl was a godsend. I mean, I wasn't exactly doing nothing, but in the time that it took for me to decide where I wanted something, Donna had already unpacked an entire box. We threw everything onto my bed as an incentive for me getting this done in as timely a manner as possible. She'd hold something up, I'd say "over there" or "no, put it over here". She helped me hang up clothes, arrange my knick-knacks, the works.

God bless my new roommate. God bless her.

"Woah!" Donna said out loud as she held up a pair of my favorite scrubs (the ones that I had stolen from Amy!), "These things're—"

She held them out the length of her arms, stretching them to their fullest width. They were pretty big! Just big enough to cover my fat ass. Amy still had a lot of room on that draw-string when she wore them, but I had no doubt at the rate she was going that she'd grow to fit them in no time. I, on the other hand, was much harder to dress, and therefore deserve all the clothes that I could find. I'd tried them on before. My belly hung so deliciously over the waistband, and I filled those scrubs out. My big beautiful booty was just big enough so you could see the fold beneath my cheeks, but still look loose and comfy. Plus, I could always untuck my tummy if I needed more room. I could make those things last a while. That must have been one big nurse who donated those...

"Sorry." Donna said sheepishly as she withdrew her wingspan, the scrubs folding with her arms, "I, uh..."

"Nah it's cool." I snorted, "No offense taken."

You would have thought that I'd have told her it was okay to make cancer jokes. As cool as my new social circle was, I knew it would take some time for them to get used to being around a girl as big as I was with just as thick of skin. Personally, I loved making folks feel not-so-but-kinda uncomfortable with the way I embraced my weight. Sometimes literally.

"Hey, you wanna hand me those?" I held out an arm. Donna tossed them my way and I caught them, folded them up, and opened one of what used to be Donna's drawers, "I can't tell you how long it's been since I've had a friggin' drawer that could hold all my clothes—now I won't have to hold the Hunger Games every time I get a new pair of leggings."

"God those dorms must've really sucked." Donna made a face, "How little were they?"

"So little." I rolled my eyes and stuffed Amy's my scrubs in the drawer, "Like, not just for me and Amy. You'd probably feel pretty cramped."

"I am pretty tall." Donna snorted, rummaging through another one of my boxes, "You like the doorways 'cuz they're wide, I like 'em because I don't have to hear "oh hey Donna, keep growin' an you're gonna have to duck to get in here, huhuhuh!"

"I... get something similar." I laughed, my big belly rippling, "Hey, any other lazy clothes in there?"

"Uh, just..." Donna rummaged a little more, "These. And these. And these and... wow, you have a lot of leggings."

"They're a fat girl's best friend." I grabbed a three pairs of leggings and two once-flowy t-shirts and started folding them, shifting my weight on my poor fat feet, "You'd think food is, but no."

Donna giggled at that. I liked Donna. As cool as Kate was, Donna seemed really chill. Kate was kind've all over the place, darting around the kitchen and serving up food. I hadn't really had time to actually sit down with Kate, you know? But that's because I didn't think Kate ever sat down. Don't get me wrong, even then I appreciated the hell out of her dedication to playing chef and waitress. Donna was just cooler to me, I guess. Maybe because she was tall? I don't know.

As I was organizing all my lazy clothes into one drawer (or doing my best to--it's hard organizing all your flop clothes into one drawer when you flop as much as I do!) I came across something that Donna had missed. When she was clearing out her drawers, she left a picture laying face down against the bottom. I saw it because, you know, it was white and I was looking, and I took it out.

"Hey, you missed something." I said, looking at the photograph.

I recognized Donna, despite the sunglasses and the distinctive lack of her pot-belly, and I recognized Kate, pre-stud and with black hair instead of brown. I didn't recognize the other two girls in the photo though. One blonde, one brunette, on either side of Donna with Kate in the middle, down in front. The blonde on the right was about my height, I guess. Her hair was long and up, and she had this friendly, round face. On the left was the brunette, who looked somehow more manufactured than everyone else. Lots of makeup, immaculate hair even though it was clearly windy that day. Something of a tan, probably natural.

"Oh!" Donna put her hand over her chest dramatically, "How could I have missed this? Oh this is my favorite picture of us!"

"Us?" I asked, taking this opportunity to get off my poor aching feet and sit down next to my roommate on (what was free of) the bed, "You and your other roommates?"

"Yeah yeah, these are the girls we told you guys about." Donna said, pointing to the other blonde in the photo, "On the right there, that's Nicole. And the girl on the left is Brooke. Uuuugh we were like best friends here..."

"Huh." I puffed, trying to catch my breath, "So you, like... you never told me why they decided to move out?"

"Oh, that." Donna made a face, "Well..."
11122122122122122.title: Getting to Know You, Getting to Know All About You

choices: "Nicole was the one who really ballooned... It was almost scary."
"Kate would never forgive them.  I wouldn't bring it up around her."
111221221221221223.content:
I paused, as did Donna. Suddenly, I felt awkward- Great, I was the girl who brought up the ex-best friend. Cool first day in the house, Mel! Honestly, I would've preferred that all my clothes burst off my bodacious bod than have made that faux-pas, but Donna let out a small giggle, which broke the tension, even when it rolled up into a gut-buster of a laugh that caused her to double over, her "belly" pooching over itself in a cute way that reminded me of Amy's earlier days on the chub-train.

"Man... I haven't thought about that day in a while, honestly. Since you and Amy decided to become our new bunker buddies I haven't even thought about them at all! Gawd... I mean... That was a ridiculous night." She wiped away a tear from laughing so hard- although to me, it didn't seem that she was all that giddy. In fact, her tone had sobered up quite a bit since the laugh attack. "It still seems stupid, honestly."

I made a big show of folding up my clothes so Donna could wipe away the extra tears that had begun rolling down her face. A few sniffles later, she started talking again.

"We lived here since day one- pretty cool, right? A bunch of cool chicks living in a house together on campus. But... Well, you've obviously met Kate. And- if it isn't obvious from that photo- Kate, myself and Nicole, we never really were super serious about our looks, I guess. But Brooke? She was- well, she was the kind of girl who learned how to eat BBQ ribs without getting any on her face or fingers. You know, that kind of girl."

I rolled my eyes- she sounded like my Mother. "Yes, I know the type all too well, trust me."

Donna continued. "Yeah. So we'd all fool around, like, 'Oh, Kate, you keep cooking like this, we'll all be 300 pounds!', y'know, stuff like that... Uh..."

"Donna, dear?" I gently slapped her cheek. "Amy and I, believe it or not, don't mind being fat. You don't have to act like you're being insensitive when you mention weight-related societal views."

Donna blushed, but continued. "...Anyways, we all joked about it but Brooke. She'd get- Well, bitchy about it. 'It's not a joke, you guys.' She'd say- and on any night where Kate went a little nuts with dinner, Brooke would end up going to the gym the next day for like, way too long- she'd come home dripping in sweat and could barely move the next few days. But we all chalked it up to Brooke, well, being Brooke!"

I nodded. Again, I knew people like that- too afraid of gaining a pound to enjoy even one meal. I could respect someone who exhibited self restraint- I couldn't respect someone that hellbent on keeping a figure as to not enjoy any food... Ever.

"Anyways... It was all for naught, because one day Kate made like, the best brisket ever- seriously, I'm gonna ask her to make it again soon, so you know I'm not lying- and like, we all were drinking wine, chatting, and eating too much, and all of a sudden Brooke goes bright red, and goes silent in the middle of a sentence. And we're all confused, and she stands up, and her size, I dunno, negative two jeans that she insisted on cramming herself into had popped open, and the button had come off. And... Well, Kate, being Kate, and also kinda drunk, is like 'I call that a successful meal!' And Brooke FLIPS OUT. Seriously, she was screaming about how Kate was 'purposefully trying to ruin her image' and stuff like that, and Kate started crying and started shouting about how she wanted to be a chef, and that Brooke was being crazy- because she was- and it was this big thing, and the next day Brooke had packed up all her shit and said she was leaving!"

"Wow. Uh... Sorry to have brought up painful memories. If it's any consolation, Amy and I probably won't leave if we gain any more weight... Y'know." I grabbed my gut. "It's not like we would really notice anyways if we gained a pound or two." That got a small smile out of Donna.

"Trust me, you'll gain weight. Again, look at me. I try to stay in shape Mel, I really do. Anyways, Brooke was super dramatic about, piled all her bags in the hall and was crying and had mascara running down her face and Nicole was hugging her and crying... Ugh. It was a mess. So Brooke told me and Nicole that if we didn't want to end up flabby balls of lard, we should leave with her, and I may have lost my temper and called her a conniving bitch and I think that kinda freaked Nicole out and made her side with her. So they broke lease, paid up the 400$ a piece for doing so, and moved out!"

I was starting to feel a little guilty about the whole thing, honestly. Sounded like we were moving in with two emotionally vulnerable roomies who just lost two of their closest friends. "I don't know what to say..." Donna sadly shook her head, folded up the photo, and tucked it inside her bra.

"Eh, don't worry about it. Honestly, Brooke has done this before. I mean, they're not moving back in anytime soon, obviously, but I'm sure I'll hear from them sooner or later. Don't tell Kate, but Nicole actually texted me a few times to apologize. She's always been the more... Sensitive one. Of course..."
111221221221221223.title: Broken Brooke Blames Everyone But Brooke

We met our other neighbors: They. Were. The. Worst.
Classes started again at Stuffington, and I wasn't happy about it.
1112212212212212232.content:
"Kate would never forgive them." Donna winced, sucking air between her teeth before quietly, gently, adding, "I wouldn't bring it up around her."

"Was it that big of a deal?" I asked, genuinely concerned/confused, "I mean, you guys were all such great friends. Could it have really been that bad?"

"Well, I mean, that alone wasn't bad." Donna readjusted her seat on my bed, holding out her hands to better illustrate the falling out, "But like, you know, it wasn't just that. The four of us, we were all great friends in high school. I guess because we didn't have to live together. But living under the same roof, all the time... things can start rubbing people the wrong way, y'know? It wasn't that Brooke wasn't always obsessed with how she looked, or that Kate wasn't super effin' crazy about her cooking. They just couldn't... I don't know, what's the word? Coexist? Like, it wasn't as bad until they started buttin' heads. You get it?"

"Got it." I nodded, "Don't mention your old roomies. Always say thanks for the food. Make lots of fat jokes. Got it."

"Mel... you're a wreck." Donna snorted, "C'mon, let's finish up. Kate should have somethin' cooked up pretty soon..."

***


"Pizza?"

It was so weird for me to be standing in a dining room that could be qualified as something more than just "designated corner of dorm where you stuff your face more than normal." Like, sure it was part of the kitchen, but it wasn't just a little fold-out table and some bent plastic chairs. It was homey and there was a big picture of some generic fruit in a bowl. The table was scooted out just enough so as to allow us more generously proportioned roommates some wiggle room between the chairs and the wall.

And on the little table, stacked up high, was a sight that I was quite accustomed with. Boxes of Little Caesars', one on top of the other, with two liters and paper plates. Well, Amy and I tended to forgo the plates, but still. Point made; I was already feeling at home. And hungry. So yeah, pretty at home.

"Hey! I have spent all day helping everyone swap rooms." Kate said, more than a little sensitive at the lack of culinary flare of our first "real" meal in our new home, "I cook for you like, every night, Donna. You can suck it up and eat pizza."

"I'm not complaining." Amy purred as she lowered her enormous ass into two poor, unsuspecting chairs, "Mel and I used to eat out all the time. Right, Mel?"

"Totally." I added confidently as I joined my ravenous, redheaded roommate as she popped the top on some cheesy, greasy pepperoni, "Suck it up Donna, eat some pizza."

"Or I will!" Amy added giddly as a stretch of string roped between her mouth and her first slice

Look, I'll be the first to admit it, moving made me hungry. Like, in general, but this too. I had burned so many calories that it was stupid for me not to be eating something, even if I hadn't weighed a quarter ton by myself. I grabbed a box for myself and went to town. My great gut gurgled in appreciation of finally getting a good old fashioned takeout meal. We had been coming over and eating with Kate and Donna so often, I hadn't had an honest-to-god pizza dinner in... forever!

So, you know, when Kate pulled up a 12-pack and cracked open a cold one, sat down, and got herself some pizza, there wasn't much more for Donna to do but to sit down beside her. We must have been quite a sight, the four of us. Two huge heifers, eating with two girls half their size (at least, horizontally in Donna's case—Twofold in Kate's!) straight out of the box. I was a wreck. I was so hungry, I didn't even care that this was my first "official" meal with my new roommates. I was rolling up slices into little burritos, making pizza sandwiches, and Amy was right there beside me! We were two fat chicks and we'd worked our proverbial asses off moving out of those dorms.

We were entitled to a little reward.

And our reward was pizza! And getting drunk for, like, the second night in a row. I mean, buzzed I guess is a more accurate term It's not easy for a girl my size to get more than a little toasted. Kate and Donna on the other hand, I mean... let's just say they were fun. Loud, but fun.

And meanwhile Amy and I just ate, ate, ate our way through Little Caesar's Mountain. Stuffing slice after slice into our growing, growling gullets. We turned on some music, did some awkward dancing (Kate and Donna had a lovely routine to Sugarhill Gang Apache worked out) and we just sorta... had fun.

It had been a long time since I'd partied. And I don't know if you'd call that partying but... it was nice! We had a great time. Kate and Donna got drunk, Amy and I got fed, and we all woke up and cleaned up the house like good roommates should...

Eventually we did, anyway.

The thing is, and you probably saw this coming, the fun couldn't last. I mean, everything was going great, don't get me wrong. It was just...
1112212212212212232.title: Humongous House Party
