11122122122122122321.content:
So everything was peachy in our new digs. Classes didn't start for a little while (thankfully) so we just sort of felt out each other's vibes and started all meshing together in a happy roommate mashup that would've made the cast of Friends jealous.

Donna was hilarious. I mean, she had this perfect comedic timing that would send me into hysterics, and more than once I had laughed so hard that I had fallen off the loveseat. On top of that, she had really good taste in shows and movies- she'd pull out some film that was subtitled, which prompted a "I don't watch movies to read!" from Amy, but five minutes in and we were absolutely hooked.

On top of that, Kate- who's culinary prowess was already well known- was a serious bro. Well, bro-ette, I guess. In fact... She had actually (gasp) convinced me to help her cook! As in, I actually did something that could be considered minimal physical labor. I know! I chopped some stuff with a real knife and everything, it was bonkers.

Of course... While I was ever so slowly increasing the scope of "things I might do in my free time besides stuff my fat face" -even though one of them was conducive to that exact thing- Amy was... Well, not doing that.

The thing was, Kate & Donna's house- well, I guess our house- was definitely a college house. Which meant we had a cabinet devoted to nothing but bottles of booze that cost less than 15$ a piece, and a constant flow of beer- Kate apparently was buddies with some dude from the liquor store who occasionally "forgot" a box of beer out back.

So while I was staying juuuuust busy enough to not gain like, a dozen pounds a week from the calorific onslaught that was Kate's cooking and non-stop beer, Amy was becoming a bit of a recluse. I mean, she wasn't like, locking herself in her room all day or anything- she was more than happy to eat with us at any rate. However, outside of that, the only time we saw her was when she waddled out to go to the bathroom, or steal a few bottles of beer from the kitchen, or snag her fifteenth plate of leftovers for the day. And it was starting to show... And Kate was the first to say something.

"Is Amy okay?" She asked one day, after Amy had stumbled off to bed for the day, hiccuping all the way down the hall after devouring about three pounds of hamburger casserole and half a dozen beers. "I mean... Is she always quite so... reclusive? She didn't really act that way when you guys first moved in."

I thought about that for a second. I was used to Amy acting this way, honestly- but that was when we lived in a dorm together. We actually had people to hang out with now, and while I was embracing it, it seemed Amy had just reverted back to her old, sloth-like ways. "I mean... Yeah? When we lived in a tiny dorm together, she didn't really have anywhere to go. I guess she just likes having her own room?" We all winced as a massive belch echoed throughout the house. "She's a bit of a loner, I guess."

Donna nodded. "Nothing wrong with that! I just was worried we offended her or something. She'd tell you if that happened, right?" I, too, nodded, feeling my chins fold into themselves.

"Yeah. No, that's just how she is. Is it a problem? I mean, she's not like, freaking you guys out or anything, right?" Kate rolled her eyes.

"Nope! Honestly, as long as it stays drama-free around here, I could care less! Oh, and I guess as long as the trash doesn't pile up. Speaking of, who's gonna help me clean up?"

Feeling slightly guilty, I actually managed to shift my bulk off my stool and grabbed my plate. Donna immediately clapped a hand dramatically over her mouth.

"Say it ain't so! Are the stars in alignment? Is Jupiter in retrograde or whatever? Did radioactive dishsoap leak into Mel's room?"

I lobbed a lofty punch at her arm. "Shove it, Donna. Fat people can actually do things besides eat- I know your boney ass wouldn't understand, but..." That earned me a retaliatory punch.

"I'll have you know my ass is far from bony- speaking of, Kate, do you wanna go shopping this weekend? I... Uh... Need new clothes for the semester."

I placed my plate in the sink and threw my hands in the air, milking the situation. "Oh, Donna, I forgot, fat girls and skinny girls can't go shopping together! Oh, my stars and garters, what would society think if a beluga like me was seen with a stick like yourself? The stocks in JC Penny would plummet!" She glared at me.

"Fine, you can come too!" Donna snapped jokingly.

I faltered. "I... I buy my clothes online, thank you very much." I grumbled, throwing my hands up in defeat- Kate had clearly called my bluff.

However, even as I started putting away dishes, I couldn't help but feel a little twinge of guilt. Honestly, I was a little worried about Amy too. I mean, don't get me wrong- she learned laziness from the best of the best. However, even at my laziest point, I wasn't so much of a recluse as to completely shun human interaction in any form- and Amy is/was one of the most social people I knew.

And if I was being completely honest with myself, Amy was looking a little rough lately. As Amy ballooned over the past year, I taught her the importance of keeping up appearances- Y'know, buying new clothes (stretchiest size that still stays on your body, loose fitting shirts, stuff like that) and not just bulging out of pants that should've been replaced two months ago. Amy... Wasn't really doing that anymore. Her outfit tonight was a pair of elastic booty shorts that had evolved into a borderline-thong and a shirt that several inches of her gut, splashed with stretchmarks, hung out of, wobbling wildly.

I mean, Donna and Kate were cool, but at this rate, Amy would be waddling around naked. I think that was involved in our lease somewhere: If tenants get too fat for their own clothes and walk around naked, they have ten(10) days to leave the building, without their security deposit.

That being said, I decided...
11122122122122122321.title: Aimless Amy's Adipose Amazes

111221221221221223212.content:
That being said, I decided to just let her be.

Amy was a big girl (a rather big girl at that!) and she could make her own decisions. I wasn't going to tell anyone how to live her life, even if I was a little worried about her. Sure she'd sequester herself in her room for literally a majority of the day, but it wasn't like she was bothering anybody. Maybe it was just the shift from dorm life to apartment life? I wouldn't know. I'd like to think that I was just as social now as I was before, but hey, people react differently to things. And that's okay.

More extra-special roommate bonding time for me.

So, we still had a few weeks before we all had to go back to school. No one was exactly happy about it but, hey, it had to be done. So I decided that I was gonna go out and do at least one fun thing every couple of days until classes started up again. As you can probably guess, Amy wasn't exactly down for a lot of it—she was much more interested in completing her transition into full-on Hermit mode—but everyone else was pretty cool with the idea. Sometimes I'd go with Donna, sometimes Kate, one time I got lucky and Colleen showed up. That was fun. But I guess the point is this: I hate college, I really liked having roommates that were into stuff, and as it turned out even I could get bored of Netflix and snacks.

I mean, I wasn't exactly not snacking. But it was fun to get out and do things sometimes.

Also, Donna and Kate were real lightweights and it was fun to make them skinny-girl nervous when I ordered half the menu at any given restaurant.

Because of course I was still going out and getting myself kicked out of this place and that. Just because I didn't have my saddlebagged sidekick to totter behind me didn't mean that I suddenly developed self control or anything. Gosh. As it turned out, I couldn't have asked for better, less judgmental roommates. It took me a good two weeks of going out with them to realize that none of my new friends really cared about how much I could eat, negatively or positively. They were content to let me eat my fill and talk or tap on their phones or whatever. Kate would chat me up about what I was eating, what it was made of or where it came from. Donna would tell me jokes or fun stories about her and her old roommates, and I had a great report with Colleen where I'd tease her about fat-shaming me. As long as I paid my own tabs and my quarter of the rent, I was good to go.

Anyway, you don't care about that. Or maybe you do, you weirdo. I was doing stuff, you get it.

It was actually on one of these post-move-in, pre-sophomore excursions that...

1112212212212212232122.content:
So I was attempting to educate Kate on take-out pizza.

Look, Little Caesars? It's pizza. And they have one job, and it's to feed college kids for cheap. Seriously, that's like... Their entire niche. Look it up, or don't, I don't care. But the thing was, after living with Kate for a short while, it was obvious that she viewed all pizza chains as being the exact same, so- in her own words- "Why would I pay an extra few bucks for a pizza that's exactly the same?" And I'll tell you something: I almost cried. Seriously, I was sniffling, needed to excuse myself for a tissue, it was horrible.

Don't get me wrong- this girl made a pizza and I just about died. Well, three pizzas- one for each rack of the oven. And they were perfection! She made her own damn garlic butter for the crust! From scratch! I didn't even know you could do that, I always assumed garlic butter was just pure chemical magic made in a factory somewhere. In hindsight, adding minced garlic to butter in a pan and then mixing in some parmesan made perfect sense and seemed pretty easy, but whatever. Not the point!

So we were walking along in the local mall. The kid hadn't even had an Orange Julius! So we each got one, which sent Kate off on a tangent about how she could make a better one, which I welcomed her to try, as long as I got most of it, and then we went into a candy story, and she had never heard of chocolate covered potato chips, and then she started talking about how SHE could make chocolate covered ANYTHING, and then I started telling her-

Look, we spent almost forty minutes in a candy store. That's all really needs to be said.

Anyways, after getting past the point of no return on sweet treats, I decided I needed something a little salty to balance out the day, so I suggested we go to Sbarro- partially so I could hopefully prove that all pizza was not created equal, and sometimes you need to spend a little more on it.

So we're sitting, because this Sbarro honest to goodness had tables, which was crazy in its own right, and also lent me several minutes to wonder if more of my ass was hanging off a chair, and in fact I was just about to scoot another one of their chairs over (look, they were small, okay?) and try to counter-balance my rear when Kate went white as a sheet.

"Shit. Mel? Do me a solid?" I was busy drumming on the table with some of the straws I had plucked out of the dispenser- look, sugar and me have a weird relationship, okay? But I stopped when I saw how serious she looked.

"I'm all ears, Katiekins." She winced. Bad nickname. "Er... Kate...Plus Eight? Hey, remember that show? I-"

"Mel! Seriously!" She was dropped low to the table, her brown hair trailing perilously close to the small puddle of Pepsi I had spilled earlier. "Look, uh, things might get a little weird, because-"

Whatever Kate was going on about, I would never hear, because at that moment the loudest set of heels I've ever heard in my entire fucking life clacked up behind us. Seriously, it sounded like someone glued tap dancing taps to the bottom of these fucking things, and they echoed loudly on Sbarro's weird linoleum/marble hybrid floor. "Kate?!" a high-pitch voice rang out, and Kate immediately sat up straight.

"Ohmygo-Nicole?" Kate stood up, shot me a weird look that I couldn't quite parse, and ran off. However, at that moment, our garlic breadsticks showed up, and I kinda zoned out for a minute as the two girls talked. However, after I had shoveled down half the order, I wiped down my face with a napkin and turned to see who I assumed was Nicole. She was... Well, she looked exactly like her picture, other than a set of cute little glasses that rested on her face. She seemed uncomfortable, and I soon realized why. Standing next to her was Brooke- the girl who presumably broke up the party of four into two parties of... Well, two. She looked even faker than before- her hair, still brown, had these weird streaks of blonde highlights, and was done up in a way that seemed way too fancy for a simple trip to a mid-sized mall that mostly consisted of fast food joints.

Nicole and Kate were, thankfully, deep in conversation, ignoring Brooke who was busily tapping away at her phone- and I mean literally tapping, because this girl had nails that looked like talons. They were long and painted this horribly gaudy shade of red that managed to hurt my eyes a little bit- of course, they matched her long-ass heels, which added at least three inches to her height. I decided to be polite- at least to one of them, anyways, and waddled over.

"Hey, I'm Mel." I announced when they stopped chatting as my bigger form approached them. I held a hand out, which Nicole took gently, shaking it happily a few times.

"I'm Nicole! Kate and I are best- Er... Well... I used to..."

"She's my old roommate." Kate said, shooting a glance at Brooke, who was (thankfully) still ignoring everyone. "And one of my friends..."

Nicole lit up- I don't think she was expecting to be called a friend. Of course, I had a part to play, and I dutifully played it, not wanting to betray Donna's confession to me about her ex-roomies. "Well, it's nice to meet you! Yeah, I just moved in with them, it's... It's pretty great! I can't believe how great of a cook Kate is!" Kate turned a nice shade of red, so I decided to continue. "No, seriously. Like, me and my roommate lived on campus-"

"The worst!" Nicole giggled.

"-That's right, the worst! So I hadn't cooked, in like... Forever, and, well, Kate is actually kind of teaching me! I actually-" I leaned in low for dramatic effect, and so did Nicole, clearly buying into the hype. "-I actually chopped up a jalepeno! All by myself! It was nuts!"

Kate laughed at this. "I had to give you gloves, Mel. But yes, she's a fine sous chef."

Nicole, however, was wide-eyed. "Do you still make those stuffed jalepeno chicken bites? Oh man, I miss those so much!" I was nodding happily.

"We had jalepeno chicken bites, jalepeno poppers... Oh man, what was that salsa you made?" I asked. I liked Nicole, she seemed very eager to be everyone's friend. It's no wonder she chose the Alpha-bitch over Kate- much easier to win Kate and Donna back then lose Nicole, this much was apparent.

"Oh, that poblano corn salsa recipe, I think you gave it to me, Nicole!" Kate said happily.

"That was yours? Oh maaaan, I must've eaten like, a pound of that salsa! You gotta stop by sometime!" I honestly blurted that out without thinking, and Nicole's eyes went wide, as we both comically turned in unison to face Kate, then Brooke...

The tension was broken slightly by our server returning with like, three pizzas for our table. I coughed awkwardly as he took way too long to set them up, before asking us if we needed anything, which earned a quick head shake from the two of us.

As he walked away, Kate finally spoke. "I'd... Really like it if you swung by again, Nicole."

I almost teared up, I swear. It was such a beautiful moment.

Of course...
1112212212212212232122.title: Showdown at Sbarro

choices: Nicole actually did hang out with us a few days later, which was nice!
My confrontation with Brooke has some unintended consequences! Whaaat?
Laying around on my big beautiful butt all day wasn't paying rent—I got a job!
11122122122122122321222.content:
So, like, there was this pause and everything right? And everything was going really well—I swear I hadn't seen an honest-to-God expression of emotion like that in years. Kate, in her teeny tinny voice, tells her long-lost best friend Nicole how she'd really like it if they could hang out, and Nicole just sort've looks at her, all doe-eyed and pink faced like someone had just told her she'd be going to college for free and was also getting a speedboat.

There was that, a pause...

And then Brooke decided that she was just gonna put her big ol' Bitch Stick in the mix and stir the pot.

"Um, Nicki? Sweetie? Are you almost done here?"

Seriously, I don't know how I knew that she sounded like this before she opened her stupid mouth, but I did. You know the voice. Nasal and a little screechy. Kind've like a harpy, I would imagine. She put down her phone and sort've snarled at the three of us, probably more at Kate than either Nicole or me. But she just had this face. Like, she was not well to do for any manner of social interaction with either of us, and Nicole was clearly just slowing her down from raining on everyone else's parade.

"Uh... yeah, I was just... you know..." Nicole stiffened up a little, her shoulders resting high like she was trying to hide in her shell, "Talking to Kate..."

So have you ever, like, seen someone look like they were about to explode? I mean, like really actually explode? The pressure from the sheer rage they were feeling inside of them was building up and they were going to go nuclear, blow up like a balloon before bursting and spreading pain and fire all over the place?

That was Kate.

Much to my surprise, she actually handled it pretty well.

"Hi Brooke." Kate hissed like a squeezed balloon-knot, "You look well."

"Uh, yeah, because I moved away from you." tanned tyrant gave me a quick up and down, "Unlike Tiny here. What have you been feeding this one, you weird little kitchen elf?"

"Hey—!!" Kate took a step twice her size towards her ex-best friend and looked like she was about to pop, her little finger poised and ready for some (assuredly) grade-A chest poking and a piece of her little mind, but I took care of it.

"Gawd... pretty much everything." I said suddenly, cupping a roll of my belly and giving it a good little bounce, "Taquitos, we had enchiladas, taco night... lots of Mexican food, I guess, is what I'm saying."

I gave the skinny little bitch a quick up and down for good measure. I know she saw me do it, too. She wasn't a bad looking girl just... I could practically see the Alpha Bitch radiate off of her like gas fumes. From her dye-job to her expensive looking nails to her Basic Bitch fashion sense. Ugh. Nice girls though—I had to give her that.

"I mean, you were Kate's roommate." I said with a sly little smile and a chins-wobbling chuckle, "You know what I'm talking about."

Her attention momentarily distracted from ruining Nicole's reunion with her old friend, Brooke flashed the fakest fucking smile she could manage and actually turned towards me. Like, girl, I didn't even know her. This bitch and I just met five fucking seconds ago, and she was going to devote an entire motion of her body to putting me in my lowly, fat girl place. What. A. Cunt.

"I do, I really do." she said with a pseudo sincerity that wouldn't have fooled Marlee Matlin, "And my best advice for you, sweetie? Is to get another roommate. Before Kate makes you into an even bigger fatass than you already are."

Ooh. That was cold. Again, five seconds I've known this bitch. And Kate's mad and Nicole's embarrassed as hell and they're making their way towards our confrontation. I'm really proud of myself for not just punching her in the face, because honestly this bitch would have had it coming if I did. But instead I smiled, that same kind of fake smile that she gave me, and I kept my cool.

"Yeah, I guess I have put on some weight since I moved in with her and Donna." I curled my nose, my hands travelling to rest on either side of my gut as I fiddled with the hem of my top, "Kate's cooking is just sooo good—how did you do it?"

"Uh, by not being a fatass?" Brooke snorted

"No, I mean... how did you lose those first ten pounds?" I smiled again, a little longer and a little more poignantly, "They're always the hardest."

"Um, excuse me sweetie." Brooke scoffed again, looking to Nicole as if to ask 'did this bitch just ask me that?' before turning back to me, "Did you say the first ten pounds?"

"Well yeah, I mean, you look good, don't get me wrong. I know living with Kate can be a little fattening." I pat my tummy appreciatively as I watched Brooke bubble and boil beneath her makeup, "Kate said you'd put on some weight after you moved in but... I mean, it's not that noticeable."

"Excuse me?" she parroted her eyes wide with the fiery passion of an upper-middle class white girl

"I mean, hey, if you can do it, so can I." I said proudly, placing my hands on my hips and arching my back, my belly surging forwards and brushing Brooke against the hip, "You're only what, ten, twenty pounds from your goal weight?"

So have you ever, like, seen someone look like they were about to explode? I mean, like really actually explode? The pressure from the sheer rage they were feeling inside of them was building up and they were going to go nuclear, blow up like a balloon before bursting and spreading pain and fire all over the place?

Yeah, that was Brooke.

She inhaled really sharply, her chest swelling like she was some kind of nasty little frog, and she whipped around and grabbed Nicole by the arm. Then she started storming off in the opposite direction yelling at Kate that she had a "nice fuckin' roommate" and that she should have a nice life.

There was this pause, this long sort've awkward pause, between Kate and I before she finally started to smile. And then laugh.

"That was fucking great!" Kate howled as she wrapped her little arms around the outermost crest of my belly blubber, "Mel you're my hero!"

"Aw shucks." I snort, making Kate bounce on my belly like a ship in the ocean, "It was nothing."

Honesty, I would have done it just to see the look on that bitch's face when someone my size bucked back. I got the feeling that Nicole wasn't exactly the type to go challenging Brooke's authority, and Kate would have just gone apeshit and started throwing things. I mean, yeah, I hadn't exactly made a good first impression with Nicole but... it was worth it. So totally worth it.

"C'mon, our food's getting cold." Kate said as she walked me back to the table, "Free refills on me."

"You shouldn't have." I rolled my eyes, "Honestly, I don't know how you used to live with her. She seems like such a bitch."

"Yeah she is." Kate settled down across from me and claimed a slice for herself, before sighing, "She's just so... ugh. You know? I'm glad she's out of my life."

"Same." I claimed several many pieces for myself before pausing, "Nicole seemed cool."

"Yeah, no, she's cool. I mean, I guess." Kate said flatly, "But, you know, not as cool as you."

"As cool as Amy?"

"Maybe as cool as Amy." Kate held up her fingers in a little pinch, "On a good day."

And... yeah, that's the story (one of the many stories) I have about making a skinny bitch lose her cool. This one was in public, and Kate was there. So that was fun. Honestly, this was the first time I can remember actually bonding with Kate. Our mutual dislike of Brooke actually pushed us a lot farther in friendship than we probably would have been otherwise. Which was totally cool with me. The better I knew my roommate, and the more I got to dish about that bony bitch, the better.

"I still can't taste the difference between this and Little Caesar's."

"You lying fucking bitch."

And so we ate our pizza, we laughed, had a good time...

111221221221221223212223.content:
So as you may have noticed, I didn't exactly have a day job.

For a long time now, I've been floating by on scholarship money and hand-outs from my parents. When I lived in the dorms, I wasn't exactly paying rent—the more money that could be spent on cheap pizza and booze for me and Amy, the better! My Dad was great and he sent me a little care package each month, and even my Mom wasn't content on letting me starve... even if it was only because I hadn't told her about what my Dad sent me.

Point was, I was living the college kid dream; all I had to do was keep my grades up and I'd keep the money coming in.

What I didn't factor in for was rent.

Between the four of us, the house was pretty affordable! Kate working at the bar and Donna doing some on-campus paperwork, they'd done their best to keep the roof over their heads before Amy and I waddled in. But now that the two of us were there, we were... sorta kinda expensive to feed. And to house. And clothe and entertain... Amy and I didn't come cheap! Which was why we inevitably had to get jobs. And trust me when I say that I wasn't happy about it.

"UUUGH." Amy moaned, even fatter and more out of shape than when we moved in, "How am I supposed to find a job? Like, nobody's hiring."

"Have you even looked?" I rolled my eyes, "Like, for real, have you even looked?"

"I mean, no but... aren't we still in a recession?"

Even though some of my roommates weren't exactly what you'd call "industrious" (at least, not after two hundred pounds of fat ass found its way into her pants) I hadn't been so easily defeated. Just because I was a big fat blimp didn't mean that I couldn't put my mind to something and do it! How do you think I got so big in the first place?

"Well have you gotten a job yet?" Amy asked snottily from the couch, cracking open a beer

"I'll have you know, blubber butt, that I've got an interview in an hour." I raised my nose and carried myself out in faux indignation, "So yeah. Probably."

I had gotten all dressed up for the occasion. I know it was counterproductive, but interview clothes weren't exactly on the top of my "make sure you can fit into this" list, so I had to go out and buy a new outfit. And trust me, clothes my size don't come cheap. I had to break out my non-pizza, non-boredom emergency fund that I kept stashed away in my dresser. But trust me when I say it was worth it—I looked big and bangin'.

I bought a half-sleeve white top just the right size. It hugged my shape and size tightly, but it wasn't constrictive. You could see the various rolls and folds of my body as it struggled against the stretchy white material, and the outline of my tummy tiers were clear as day, you could even see them bounce when I walked. The frills around the low collar helped tone down the "over-prominence" of my girls, so hopefully I wouldn't scare my (hopefully!) future boss off with a perceived sluttiness or whatever. Down below, I'd squeezed my ass into some black flowy dress pants and crammed my fat little feet into the cutest shoes. I'd gotten my nails done, broke out every Youtube makeup tutorial—I'd contoured the hell out of my face.

Just a few finishing touches to my luscious blonde locks, and I was out the door!

"At least pick up dinner!" I heard Amy holler, "Kate's not gonna be in tonight!"

"Kay!" I hollered back rolling my eyes and shaking my head

I tried not to pay Amy any attention. She'd get a job. She'd have to. Right now the biggest concern, aside from wondering if I'd even fit in my Uber driver's teeny-tiny car, was my interview at...
111221221221221223212223.title: Get a Job, Wideload!

choices: "You've got yourself a job, Mel."

1112212212212212232122231.content:
I don't know if you guys like coffee.

I do.

Like, yeah, I like the kind you put in your cup in the morning. Folgers, Chock Full 'o' Whatever. But I really like the frilly, froufrou drinks popularized by Starbucks. You know the ones—the fancy Italian names, the ones pumped full of various syrups. The big sizes, the high sugar, the payload of calories just in one Venti cup? I was all about some coffee. You can blame Hannah Hammond for that, back at Buttercombe.

So when Colleen and I were in town one day I saw that Bean Machine (our local coffee shop, which was much more affordable than Starbucks) I mentally filed it away for future knowledge. I mean, I could see myself working back there. Couldn't you? I mean, people tell me all the time that they could see me working in food service. I'm pretty sure it's because I weigh about five hundred pounds, but I take it as a compliment. That means I'm friendly, cheerful, and cute enough to get tips. So fuck yeah, I'll work in food service.

I'd do it for the discount alone!

So, arriving promptly at two in the afternoon, right after lunch (well, that's what she said—I could personally have gone for another one) my Uber pulled up in the parking lot. Donna was gonna be off at about four, so that meant I had two hours to wow my interviewer and then stylishly waddle out, squish myself into Donna's car, and make a celebratory Wendy's run.

Bean Machine was this cute little shop in one of those outdoor centers. It was tucked away next to the GNC and some kind of computer repair shop. It wasn't exactly big—the seating area was packed enough for me to consider it a hazard for a girl of my size. Surely once I started working here I could make some adjustments...

So I walked up to the counter, told the barista that I was here to see Mo, and took a seat in the corner. A short woman, I would say late thirties, in a black t-shirt and a brown apron came to greet me. She sat me down, we talked, and got on with the interview.

"I'll be blunt." the woman, Mo, said with a wry cock of her eyebrow, "We don't exactly have aspiring baristas banging on our door. It requires a lot of footwork."

She paused, looking directly at my gut as it pooled onto the table in front of me. Honestly, I must have looked huge. The tables were so small and Mo wasn't exactly a giant. I was pouring out of both sides, and I had to resist the instinctive urge to grab two chairs for comfort. I tried not to move, or the poor metal seat beneath me would creak and groan. I really wanted this job, and I didn't want my size (of all things!) to be the reason I didn't get it.

"Do you think you'll be able to..." she flicked her eyes back up at me, "...handle that?"

"Sure!" I hoped I sounded convincing, "I, uh... I'm pretty light on my feet!"

"Uh-huh..." Mo nodded, her lips pursed contemplatively...

And so the interview went on like that. She'd ask me a question, most of the time hinting that at my size I probably wasn't the best candidate, I'd lie my big fat ass off or at least stretch the truth a little, and she'd make that face. I did my best to not look like I was nervous, but I'm sure she could tell. I was shiny with sweat by the end of it all.

"Well, everything seems to be in order here." Mo finally said with a click of her pen as she wrote something down in her notes, "I think..."
1112212212212212232122231.title: Big Girl at Bean Machine

11122122122122122321222311.content:
"Really?" I blinked stupidly, "You're... you're sure?"

"Well, like I said, we don't have applicants busting down our door." Mo said with a little point to the glass door, "You're the first potential hire I've gotten in weeks that didn't have a criminal record or 'just need to get back on their feet'. Whatever that means. You seem like you've got your head on straight."

"Aww!" I cooed, "Thank you!"

"No, thank you." Mo shook my hand, my arms wobbling right out of my sleeves, "Come back Wednesday—wear black pants and a black shirt, we'll get you sized up for a uniform. Do you want a drink before you head out?"

***


So, suffice it to say, yes I wanted a drink before I headed out. But I had long moved past the basic menu offered to me. There was a bakery in there, and I had what Kate had often called "shit taste". And my taste was shit enough to have experimented frequently in the past with the boundaries that baristas were comfortable performing. Turns out, there's not a lot of boundaries to be crossed—they're really terminally bored people.

I got the barista—my fellow barista now, bitches!—to do me a solid and make me one of my old favorites. It's, like, one fifth of a vanilla bean frappuccino with white mocha as the base. Then you throw in a blueberry muffin. I know, hear me out. You pour in the milk, the vanilla powder, the cream syrup, and like triple blend that shit. It's amazing.

"Mmm!" Donna said with a slurp of her straw, "Mel what is this? Is this a new drink? Can they come up with new drinks by themselves? I thought they just ripped off Starbucks?"

"That's a Mel Carlyle original right there." I clinked our cups together (Mo made me pay for the second one. Even with her discount it was expensive!) "I call it the Blueberry Blast."

"Is this the thing with the blueberry muffin in it?" Donna made a face at the cup

"It sure is, Donna." I said with a happy little slurp as I slid my sunglasses over my fat face, "It sure is."

There was a pause.

"Huh." Donna started slurping on her straw again, "Not bad."

"I'm glad you liked it." I sucked an inch of my blue not-coffee down in one gulp, "Now onward! A celebratory Wendy's run, in honor of my newfound employment!"

***


And so yeah, it happened just like that. Donna and I sucked down our glorified smoothies, got a couple burgers, headed home, and ordered Chinese. Everyone was super excited for me and honestly, I was excited too! I'd never had a job before, and I was actually looking forward to performing a service and getting paid for it for the first time in my life. I couldn't ride those Buttercombe coattails forever, now could I?

And then, you know, since we had the next day off, Kate wanted to throw me a celebration in her own particular way, but I was pretty adamant about not going in on my first day with a hangover.

All in all, everything was great! There was just... one thing...
11122122122122122321222311.title: Enormous and Employed!

choices: With some of these crazy drinks, I can definitely see how someone got fat here.
I made the mistake of bringing Amy home a drink- She's instantly hooked!  Uh oh.
111221221221221223212223113.content:
So, this gig? Pretty rad. You know on those old 90's shows, aimed at teenagers, where they'd always go to the local coffee shop, and it'd be this big, massive place that only had like, three patrons at any given time- presumably so drama could happen without a crowd of 30 people all being like, "what the hell"? This place was kinda like that. Kinda.

Like, it wasn't massive. It was small. BUT-

We didn't get a lot of customers. The lunch rush? Like five people. But, as Mo instructed me diligently in my "first day of work tour" tour, the building was owned by some dude who owned like fifty other businesses and he didn't really care as long as we at least broke even because he liked to help out the people of the town and blah blah blugh it just went ON like that.

Which was fine, because I was super duper peppy and I liked Mo and I did as I was told! Also, I had like five plain coffees with a ton of cream and sugar so I was a little wired, just a tinsy-tiny bit. So, it went pretty great. Until a certain someone burst in...

By the name of Colleen.

"Colleen! Oh man, Mo just taught me how to use the latte foaming wand! Wanna watch? It's super loud!" I pointed eagerly to the machine- Mo, who I was pretty sure either loved me or hated me, because my fat ass kept knocking things down and forcing her to pick them up out of the kindness of her heart, shot a weird look at me that was either a coy acknowledgement or silent hatred.

"Oh, God, it's true." Now it was my turn to give ambiguous looks. I wasn't quite sure if that was a happy exclamation or an upset one, and clearly, neither was Mo.

"What, that someone else is working here? I know, Ms. Triple Shot Red Eye, it must suck to know that your drink might not be made to your standards! Oh, the horror!" I still think I liked Mo. That was a pretty good diss- now that I actually knew what a Red Eye even was. I giggled, but Colleen rolled here eyes.

"Fine, Mel. Make me what she said. Sixteen ounce."

I stood there awkwardly. "Um... Room for-"

"Mel. Do you think I want room for cream or sugar?" She gestured to her outfit- which I suddenly realized was what normal people would consider "workout gear". She clearly was either on her way to or coming home from the gym.

"Oh!" I exclaimed. "Right. Well, three shots of ex-spresso-" Mo coughed angrily from the her spot. "Ugh. ESSSSSSSSSS-spresso!! Coming right up!" I went for the espresso machine, paused, started to go for it, paused again, then side-stepped sheepishly as Mo stormed over and began pouring the shots.

"I'm only doing this today, Mel. You can't stay afraid of this thing, it's pretty important to know how it works." Mo grumbled. "Go grab more cups from the back."

So anyways, I hustled and bustled and did my job, which was honestly pretty easy. While it DID require a lot of foot-work, it also, as I previously mentioned, wasn't exactly the busiest location on the planet, which meant a lot of down time. There were these nice metal stools against the standing bar, and while they were a far cry from comfortable, they actually held my weight- for now- and let me rest my normally unburdened feet for periods of time. Colleen even left a five dollar tip, and Mo- who I was now pretty sure liked me- let me keep all the tips for the day, presumably because she was technically the manager and probably got paid more than minimum wage.

Which is why my good mood felt so bizarre when I walked into the house that night. Colleen, Donna and Kate were all sitting around the kitchen, looking like they cut into the booze a little too early and didn't feel like cleaning up for me.

"Guess who's home from their first day of work and already made 18 dollll-aaaaars!" I sang, waving my fat stacks like I was some hotshot- but the three girls drinking whiskey just shot me odd looks. Colleen looked annoyed, Kate looked embarrassed, and Donna looked sheepish- she was the only one to immediately grab the bottle of whiskey and fill up her glass a tad more.

"So. Mel. We gotta talk." Colleen said. My face fell. I thought this was gonna be the 'First day of employment' party, not the 'Totally bummer house party' party.

"Uh. Did I not make your drink right?" Colleen sighed.

"Mel, you can't really fuck up my drink. Look, the problem is that... Is that..."

"That place has a tendency of girls gaining serious weight while they work there." Donna interjected.

I blinked in amazement. "Uh. Have my fifteen jokes a day about being super fat and perfecly fine with it not made any sort of impact in this household? Do I need to up my quota?" Colleen rolled here eyes, but laughed anyways, as did everyone else.

"Ugh, no, it's just- Look, like, this one girl worked there and gained like, twenty pounds in a month. It was the craziest thing ever, seriously! And it wasn't the first time this happened to someone who worked there. Look, just- Ugh, I knew this was dumb to even bring up." Kate moaned, punching Colleen in the arm. "I told you Mel didn't care!"

Colleen rubbed her arm. "Fuck! Fine, you were right, and I'm a dummy who worries about your new roommate gaining like a hundred pounds before the year is over- no offense, Mel. I just wanted to say something, it didn't feel right if I didn't. Goes against my code, or whatever, with the whole degree about doing the opposite of whatever the hell happens in that place."

"No offense taken. Seriously, you guys are acting like someone died! Give me some of that damn whiskey and a can of Coke and lets forget the whole thing, okay?" Donna dutifully did so, and I scooted up to the group to sit down.

"Just... Try not to bring too many of those drinks around here, okay?" Kate asked, half kidding.

"I doubt that'll be a problem." I grinned.
111221221221221223212223113.title: Reputation of Turning Baristas Totally Tubby

choices: Well, I was drinking thousands of calories a day—I was getting HUGE, already!
I hadn't exactly kept my promise—I was bringing my work home with me a LOT.
It wasn't all sunshine and rainbows—I HATED this one regular customer...
1112212212212212232122231131.content:
Show of hands—how many of you guys go to your local coffee shops?

If you do, you'll notice that there are all kinds of different recipes and drinks that all follow a simple, basic pattern. The ingredients might change, but there's always milk (either almond, coconut, or soy, at your leisure!) and some kind of flavoring... lots of sugar. I mean, it's kind've inevitable. Be they blended, brewed, stirred or steamed, there's usually a certain science to it. But that's just the basic drinks.

The thing that set Bean Machine apart was that, unlike Starbucks, we had a rotating cast of "special" drinks that we kept on the menu, and were otherwise more or less always available. Certain days, the Seven Layer Frappe was the drink of the day so you could get a Superior drink for the price of a Supreme cup. Others it was the Marble Mint, the Yosemite Sam Frappe, or even (once I showed Mo the recipe) my Blueberry Blast Frappe. We tried to keep things interesting because, hey, we were a little more expensive and we didn't have as big of a name as certain other chain coffee bars. We had a small but loyal sect of customers who kept coming back because of the "atmosphere" or whatever; "support local businesses", "big corporations are evil", yadda yadda. I didn't really care, so long as there wasn't too big of a rush. Y'know?

My point is, things were steady. I got a half-off discount on just about everything I could my little heart could palpitate for. I liked it there, and my coworkers were pretty cool.

But damn if I couldn't see how a couple girls put on more than a couple pounds working for Mo.

I mean honestly, other than the morning rush and the lunch rush (there was a fabled after work rush, but I was still on Summer hours and had yet to experience such a mystical time) there really wasn't all that much to do. There was usually one, two customers in the store at any given time, and it was me and another employee. There really, really wasn't a lot to do other than experiment with coffee flavors and sit on our butts.

I mean, I'll be honest, I was slowly getting hooked on these drinks. The caffeine, the sugar, all those sweet delicious flavors whirling around in the blender or frothing in the milk... and that wasn't even counting all those tasty calories that I was soaking up like a sponge. Seriously, I think I gained ten pounds after my first two weeks there. I was definitely doing my part in fulfilling Colleen's prophecy and thensome. Even if I hadn't been trying to gain weight, I don't think I could have helped it—if I wasn't behind the bar, I always seemed to be sucking down something from the blender.

Mo honestly didn't seem to mind. I paid for it all, of course, and I was always coming up with new drinks ideas. Kate may have had the perfect beer-to-meal whatever, but sometimes it felt like I could throw anything into a blender and make a mean frappuccino out of it. Brownies? Done it. Rice Krispies? Done it. Cheesecake? Overdone it. I was a drink mixing machine, and the results were incredible!

"Wow, I've never seen that before!" said a particularly pudgy-tummied teen as she pressed her budding pot against the glass, "Do you like, really make it with cheesecake? No wonder it's so good!"

"Um, I don't know if it's possible sweetie, but can you make one of those low-cal?" said one of three plumping office drones, her hands cupped over her mouth to one side, "They're a little rich for my taste."

"Mm!" a jogger smiled as her lips parted, belly bulging over the waistband of her spanx, "This Blueberry thingy gives me just enough energy to make it home. Thanks a bunch, Mel!"

I mean, yeah, that too.

We were making a lot of money. Once Mo advertised that we were adding new drinks to the menu, our social media followers went up by, like, twenty. You had our regulars giving us good press, my awesome drinks giving them something to gab about... it was nice! There was money in my pocket and my new boss really liked me!

"I don't know where you've been all my life, Mel." Mo said with a slurp of her Black and White, "But don't you ever fucking leave or I'll hunt you down and bury you in espresso beans."

Seriously, everything was going great. I never imagined that working was so much... fun!

But, uh...
1112212212212212232122231131.title: Making Fat Stacks

choices: I need to take a step back—I want to gain yeah, but I've gotta control myself!
What makes this food so addictive, anyway?—I'm not the only one who's hooked...
Eh, who cares?—I head back to the house after my shift
11122122122122122321222311311.content:
Well, I mean, I was drinking an excess of a couple thousand calories a day, guys. With my employee discount, any and every drink that I could ever want was half off. And I wanted a lot of drinks. Not just because it was hot (it was actually starting to cool down outside—time to switch to hot drinks!) but because it was pretty exhausting lugging more than a quarter-ton of me around even the tiny coffee shop. Seriously, between squeezing myself behind the counter, parting the tables with my hips, even just trying to tie my custom-ordered apron around my gut was enough to make me crave one of those sweet, thirst-quenching, dripping-with-calories panaceas that I pumped (blended and served) out almost every hour...

Which had the totally forseeable side-effect of making it even harder to do those things. A couple of my barista buddies could go for a coffee around their break. Maybe before they came in, or after they left if they didn't have to close. But me? I was drinking frappes like it was going out of style. On my breaks I'd order two, sometimes three or four, just so I could put them in the fridge in the back so I could help keep myself hydrated. I regularly made coffee runs for my friends, emptying out entire batches of blueberry muffins for my self-designed Blueberry Blitz Frappes. Whole halves of cheesecake went into me inbetween my already pretty regular indulgences on some days.

I had certainly created a monster—and that monster was me!

***


It was another day, and that meant (yes) another dollar, but it also meant that I'd just ordered enough lunch to make even Amy think twice. My orders had been getting increasingly complex since I started working at Bean Machine, but they'd also grown in size now that I could afford to indulge thanks to my discount. I had two trays of entrees; one in my left hand and the other nestled between my fluffy upper and forearm fat so I could carry my backup Blueberry Blitz. The one that I was drinking was nestled on top of my stomach, and I balanced it with the straw in my mouth. And yes, I may have been drinking it too. What's it to you?

The walk into the back and playing balancing act with all my food had left me beat. Like, sweating beat. I was getting fatter than ever, but the modest amount of standing and walking I did was enough to taper the weight gain slightly. No doubt at this caloric intake, if I moved as much as, say, Amy, I'd be a goddamn whale.

Not that that would have been a bad thing. I'd thought about throwing in my hat with Amy or Donna and getting a desk job. That way I could just sit on my ass all day, squishing chairs and not burning precious calories. But then I wouldn't get to have all this—

Two sandwiches, Turkey and Brie, two bowls of chili, two croissants, a red velvet cupcake and a slice of cheesecake for dessert. And two Blueberry Blitz frappes? Um, I think the discount that I got working here was way better than whatever perks Amy and Donna got—which was none.

I'd gained almost thirty pounds since I'd started working there, middling me out at just over 550. I was huge. So big that I might have actually had to cut back a little if I wanted to keep my job... the thought alone made my breathing quicken. I was really starting to get hooked on all this. I'll admit it.

But at least I wasn't the only one.

"Hey Mel?" Mo said with a slurp of her own sugary drink, "Think you pull a shift for Lena this Monday? I'll make sure your Saturday's covered."

My boss was leaning in the break room doorway, one of my frappuccino calorie bombs in a venti cup nestled firmly in her hand. She was sucking down one of my newer recipes, a Cheesecake Factory Sampler. It was basically like, a little bit of all our cheescakes blended in with white mocha and frappe base. Plus there was like these almond nuts and syrup. Mo'd made them do a caramel wall along the rim of the cup. Mm, that actually looked pretty good...

When I'd started working there, Mo was a short woman with an average build. She was short, with box-dyed red hair, and in her mid thirties. But since I'd started bringing in so much money to the place and filling our recipe book with drinks of my own design (read: enough calories to send most girls back to the tailor) she'd been filling out. A lot of my fellow employees had, but Mo's gain was more obvious because of her height. Her belly rounded out in front of her, and pressed tightly against her black polo. Even beneath her apron, I could see where the waistband of her jeans cut into her gut, and it had started folding over. Add into that a modest set of hips and a noticeably flabby bust, and my boss was definitely getting bigger. I'd say she might have put on almost as much weight as I had!

"Ooh... Saturday off?" I panted, "That sounds great. What time do you want me in?"

"Can you do three?" Mo said with another slurp, "You'll be with me, and you're the only one I trust to get these drinks right."

"Then three it is." I smiled, chubby cheeks bunching, "You got it boss."

"Awesome." Mo finished off her frappe and chucked the cup into the trash, "By the way, you've got like... fifteen minutes left on your lunch. So eat fast."

And as my boss walked out into the larger store, her cheeks flaring out behind her and bouncing in her slacks, I looked back to all of this food I had spread out in front of me and actually thought, unironically

"That shouldn't be a problem"

Before I started to dig in, I had a moment of clarity. I really had a problem. Like, I was seriously addicted to the food here. All the drinks and the sandwiches, soups, and sweets... I was completely hooked!
11122122122122122321222311311.title: the Biggest Barista

choices: I plop down on the couch with Amy—not that there's much room...
I head up to my bedroom—there's a Colleen in my bed!
Donna and I plop down in the kitchen—Kate comes along to serve us!
111221221221221223212223113113.content:
After several hours of standing on my feet, interspersed with sucking down sugary coffee drinks to keep me going, Donna pulled up in the parking lot and waited patiently for my shift to end.

I pressed the double doors open with my gut, pale flab pressing against the glass as I waddled out slowly. God I was getting huge. My arms swung from side to side as I tried desperately to keep a momentum going. My whole body ached, like it seemed to after every shift. Being my size was great and all until I actually had to get up and do anything. I was managing, barely, at the Bean Machine but only with the innovation of abusing my discount to extreme levels. But as I got fatter and fatter, I was going to have to make some adjustments soon...

The straps of my purse cut deeply into my fluffy elbow as it bounced against one pillowy hip. I had a drink container in one hand—as much as they liked to bitch, I had done a pretty spectacular job of making regulars out of my roommates—plus an extra special treat for Donna for picking me up. It was a hazelnut frappe with a caramel wall and marshmallow whipped cream; totally custom, and made to her exact specifications.

"Jesus Christ you are so slow." Donna teased as my added weight tilted the car to one side, "You got my drink?"

"Yeah, I got your drink." I said, handing over the extra cup

"Mm!" Donna took a sip immediately

"All better?" I panted, exhausted from my little stroll through the parking lot

"Better." Donna sat the drink in her cupholder and extended her seatbelt over a budding pot belly, "Next time, do you think you could score me some of that dark caramel sauce? That shit was good..."

So anyway, we made our way home (I may have convinced Donna to stop for Wendy's—just maybe) and we piled our way through the back door. I had been skinny enough to use the front door for maybe like, a month? But after that one time I got stuck, I just resigned myself to using the glass sliding doors around back. It was a little more effort to get to, but at least I could go into the house. Also, it wasn't too much effort if I had whoever drive me halfway there...

Donna balled up the Wendy's bags and tossed them in the bin outside (Kate would kill us if she knew we spoiled our appetites!) and sucked heartily from her frappe, half-gone. I waddled inside and placed the drink carrier on the counter.

"DRINKS ARE HERE!" I panted, exhausted.

I needed to sit down...
111221221221221223212223113113.title: Big Barista Barging In

choices: ...I didn't see her, and I sort've sat on her... like, really hard...
...thankfully I heard her sleep-talking. She was having a dream...
...saw her and snuggled up next to her. I'm the best cuddler.
1112212212212212232122231131132.content:
Looking for a place to get off my fat feet for a moment, I headed towards my bedroom.

My fluffy flanks officially brushed against the sides of the hallway now. The sides of my gut, with the occasional catch at my lovehandles and the swell where my belly folded over, slid against the plaster. I didn't know how much longer I'd be able to walk through my own apartment at the rate I was going. And I'm not going to lie to you, I thought it was pretty great. A bit more irritating than I would have imagined fulfilling my fantasies to be, considering that I was getting too fat and tired to do anything and too wide to fit through most things like hallways or doors, but all in all pretty great.

My footsteps boomed as I lumbered down the hall, towards my bedroom. Thankfully the doors inside were wider than the ones outside, but not by much. Well, almost zero fault.

I was bustling around behind the counter, trying to figure out a good way to incorporate a bagel into a drink. I was on the verge of pouring a drink on top of a bagel and eating it soggy, just for scientific sake, when Colleen busted in. Unlike her usual athletic wear, she was just wearing shorts and a nice blouse, and looked pretty down in the dumps. I paused momentarily from playing Goddess of the Lattes to talk to her. I had really come into my own at this place, and Mo trusted me enough to run the shop while she did the books in the back- along with the promise of "Steaming a Latte on my face if I mess anything up."

Man, I loved that lady.

Anyways, Colleen slumps in looking all morose, and I swear I could hear that sad piano music from Peanuts playing in the background. "Woah, Debbie Depressed, what's eating you?" I asked, slumping over the counter and forcing my titanic tummy to ooze over the top.

"Fine, fine, semantics. What's wrong?" I asked, buttering up the bagel and making a mental note to not dump drinks on top of baked goods, ever.

"You ever... Well, I'm guessing not, but you ever had a workout buddy?" I coughed awkwardly. "Right. No, you haven't. Anyways, there was this cute guy who I had been working out with every now and then, from my classes. And I asked him out to lunch, y'know, like... Well, I thought I was being clever and flirty or whatever. And this dude brought his girlfriend! Which, he's like, never even mentioned before. And I guess they've been together for like two years! Who the fuck even does that?"

I shrugged my shoulders awkwardly, because my 'cool relaxed barista' pose made it kinda hard to do that. "Sounds like a jerk, Colleen."

"Yeah, that's just it. He's not. Just dumb. Boys are dumb." Suddenly, I was struck with an idea. See, I had been making this list of drinks in my head for every one of my friends, and Kate and Donna and Amy were all super easy- especially Amy, who's drink was more syrup than milk or coffee or espresso.

But Colleen had been a harder nut to crack. I tried to analyze her choices at meals, and in her taste in beer, but I had really been struggling. Until now. "That's true, boys are dumb. But this drink sure isn't!" I said happily, running around behind the counter for a moment and the sliding the drink out.

"Mel, I don't- I don't drink this stuff, you know that." I rolled my eyes.

"Look, just try it, and if you hate it, I'll make your usual drink. For free. Seriously. But you gotta be honest!"

"Mel, this is dumb, but fine." She grabbed the cup- I only made a 12 oz., because honestly I was half convinced she WOULD hate it. But, to my delight, she took a long sip, then another, and then finally put the cup down, more than half empty. "I... Hate it? Make my drink for free now? Please?" Colleen said, the burst out laughing. "Ugh, fine, you win. It's okay. What's in it?"

I winked at her. "I'll never tell." It was dark chocolate and hazelnut. Simple, but effective.

"Ugh, but how am I gonna order it if you're not here?" This caught me by surprise.

"You're gonna order it... Again?" She gave me a weird look.

"I've been drinking the same drink since this place opened. I'm allowed to switch it up every now and then."

"Fair enough! You want one to go?" Colleen downed the rest of the cup and threw it on the counter. "I'll take that as a yes! You gotta pay for this one, though. And I'll tell Mo about your new drink." Colleen nodded appreciatively as she dug through her bag for some cash.

So, I guess you could maybe make an argument that I kicked this whole thing off. But honestly, I was just being a good friend for Colleen! She was all sad about a boy, I did something nice.

I came home to the house to find...

I came home to the house to find that Amy was half in the bag, and all the way out of control—uh oh was right.

I should have known that something was up when I smelled takeout food. The general rule in the house was that, as long as Kate wasn't cooking, we could order whatever we wanted. I mean, we were grown/growing women so we could order whatever we wanted anyway, it was just a courtesy thing. So, since Kate would be covering her friend's shift at the bar, I should have probably guessed that I'd walk into some kind of good old-fashioned feasting fiesta. Neither myself, Amy, or Donna were exactly whiz kids in the kitchen.

The thing was that I knew something was up from the minute I walked through the door. The smell of greasy takeaway food was overpowering—I could smell the beer from our porch, and the air inside was thick and heavy. Was that...

"Oh for the love of..." I puffed, shuffling my fat feet inside and hurrying the door shut, "Amy! Donna!"

Heavy pungent smoke loomed overhead, and I took an instinctive and appreciative inhale. Kate had this dealer friend at the bar (Kate seemed to know everybody!) and he tended to "thank" her for covering his shifts by sliding her a sample here or there. Like her cooking, Kate had never been stingy with her pot. Donna, Amy, and I were more than welcome to help ourselves at any point ("It's not like he's not going to sell to me." Kate had said thickly one night as smoke poured out of her mouth), but there was an unspoken rule that we... you know... we at least liked to offer each other a seat in the circle. It was just... rude!

"Amy? Donna? Where the hell are you guys? " I puffed, my fat feet aching after a long day of work. I dragged them through the living room and into the kitchen, "I know you're not upstairs..."

But they weren't in the kitchen either. Which is weird because, as far as my experience with Amy as a roommate went, she could usually be found in the same breeding ground as food when she was high. Especially when she was high. But her fat ass nor Donna could be found at the table, which was especially strange. They couldn't have been upstairs, at least not Amy. Being drunk off her ass (her great, big, disproportionately large ass) would have been enough to dissuade her from climbing stairs if Amy's natural inclination against stair climbing hadn't been enough. And Donna was a real lazy high—I couldn't exactly see her lumbering upstairs after smoking a bowl of Keith's loud.

Suddenly I heard a sound; it was far off, and muffled, but I could recognize it anywhere.

Someone just opened up a bag of chips.

"Amy?" I called out again, tottering around until I was facing the hallway, "Are you in my room?"

The muffled giggling I heard carry down the hall, and the soft crackling of chip bag confirmed it. I had heard all that I needed to hear—those two were in my room, and by the sound of it they were...

"No." I said softly, my eyes wide with terror, "No no no no!"

I probably moved faster then than I had in months. My fat feet carried me with the speed of someone half my size. No longer did my cumbersome corpulence slow me down, rather that it aided me in my assault on my room. It was no longer a belly, it was a battering ram. I pressed my gut against the door so hard and so fast that I heard it creak, I thrust my flabby arm towards the knob and started to twist.

"Amy you fucking bitch I swear to God I'm gonna cut you!" I shouted, genuinely unnerved, "You better not, you hear me? You better fucking not!"

I twisted the door handle and barged my way inside. My gut fell back into place, rolling over my thighs as I lugged one heavy leg in front of the other. My footsteps boomed and my knicknacks shook as I made my entrance known. You'd think that, being my size, that wouldn't be much of an issue. But when you have two roommates, one nearing my size, giggling on your bed like a bunch of overfed teenagers, you'll find yourself hard pressed to get anything clear into their foggy brains.

"Heeeeey Mellllll." Donna said with a little wave, her fingers coated in orange dust, "We, ummm... we don't know what you're talking about."

"Yeah!" Amy managed through a mouthful of ho-ho, while also unwrapping another package, "No idea!"

I had never had this kind of trouble with my own sister growing up. Alice had always been super sweet and respectful of my personal space. Plus I went to a private high school for four years, and that probably helped. But the point was, I'd never had anyone come into my room without my permission. Not even my bitch mom, if only because she probably thought "fat" was contagious. I wasn't quite sure how to deal with someone (two someones!) barging into my room, plopping down on my bed and—

"Are you eating my snacks?" I demanded with a stomp of my foot that made my blobby body quake, "What the shit, guys?!"

—ohhh my God I was beyond words!

You see, I do my best to keep my voluptuous, incredibly round and jiggly figure through ample snacking. For convenience, or when I'm having a particularly stressful day (or when I'm just bored) I bought one of those bed-under things that you slip clothes into. Except instead of filling it with clothes, I filled it with all my favorite junk food. I had crammed Doritos of every flavor, just about every Little Debbie variation known to man, a couple boxes of mini muffins, some cupcakes... everything a fat girl could ask for, and crammed it into a container about the size of a twin mattress that nestled quite comfortably underneath my queen sized one. I had thought that it was safe from prying fingers and greedy gullets (other than my own!) but I should have known that if anyone would have found out about it, it would have been Amy...

"Hey, don't be mad." Donna slurred in a slightly stronger southern accent as she sucked the cheesy dust off of her fingers, "Like we weerrrrreeee gonna do it in Amy's room but her fat ass broke the bed."

I turned in shock, and some horror, as I caught sight of the bedframe buckling beneath Amy's superior posterior. I knew that she had only gotten bigger since we made the move (so had I!) but had she really gotten so fat that she was breaking furniture? Like, furniture that we got when we moved in?

I looked at her face—it was definitely rounder and chubbier. Her chin was set pretty deeply into a plunging, swaddling second that had stopped bunching into a third one when she spoke. Her arms were all wobbly and they shook even while she calmed down from her laughing fit. Amy's gut sat heavily between her enormous thighs as her ass pooled and spread out behind her. Her long red hair was free, draping over her meaty melons as she choked down snack cakes and potato chips like a true champ.

"Don't....RRRAAAPP!" Amy belched deeply, "Don't listen to her, Mel. Like, it didn't break until she started jumping up and down."

"Yeah but it broke where you were sitting. Donna punched Amy in her fat arm wing, "That's what she gets for hogging all the pizza."

"What? It's not like... RURRRP..." Amy gasped, "It's not like Katie isn't gonna cook when she gets home."

"She's working late tonight, you dumb heifer!" Donna laughed, her full belly shaking out from underneath her top as it quivered with mirth, "Ohhh... you are so high."

"Am not." Amy snorted, snack food tucked away in her cheeks like a squirrel

"Yes you are."

They'd already eaten all the pizza? Like, all those boxes out there? And then they had emptied out my snack drawer and... and probably the freezer too at this rate!

Was Amy really getting so out of control that she'd eat us all out of house and home?

I mean sure, I knew she was getting fat. We were both huge, but I wasn't about to go hog wild and suck down everything edible within a fwo-floor radius of myself. At least, not yet anyway. I was all for getting fat, but...

Amy was just getting so big... so fast!

I mean, I know it was partially my fault. I introduced her to the way of the weight, and she took to it like a fish took to water. She'd been piling on the pounds like crazy since we started living together on campus, and once we moved in with Donna and Kate she'd only just gotten fatter and fatter... Amy was still my friend, and I wasn't exactly one to tell her to stop fucking eating, but I was starting to get worried!

When Donna started getting fat—and I mean really started packing it on, I started to get a little worried about her!

It wasn’t that much longer after that whole snack stash fiasco, about a week or two, that I came home to find Amy and Donna vegging out on the couch like the spuds that they had so quickly become. Honestly, I’d started seeing them camping out in the living room more often than not—it was the room in closest proximity to the kitchen which meant that all of their basic primal fat girl needs were just a few labored steps away. Food, beer, soda, snacks; everything was just a few awkward toddles to the right, and they could still get the most out of our Amazon Fire stick.

You should have seen the two of them. Happy as pigs in mud, and just as fat.

Amy I wasn’t so concerned about. She’d been filling out ever since day one with me, even if she had gone a little overboard. Her pale pillowy cheeks spread across the couch like an avalanche of freckled ginger blubber, but what else was new, right?

“Oh hey, Mel’s home!” Amy extended a lazy, expectant arm, “Hey, mind tossing those Ho-Hos my way?”

“Get ‘em yourself, wide load.” I snickered as I put my purse down, “I just got off work.”

“UUUUGH.” Amy threw herself onto the arm of the couch, “Donna?”

“Fiiiiiine.” The tall blonde rolled her eyes, “But one of these days I’m going to get you to get up and get something.”

And it was then that I saw it.

That tell-tale grunt as she rocked off the couch should have been enough for me to realize what had occurred, but I couldn’t look away! Pressed against my roommate’s snugly-fitting pink Southern Couture tee were two thick meaty lovehandles! Handfuls of tanned plush pudge pulling at the fabric from either side, leaving little to no room for that belly she’d been growing. I could already see where it threatened to fold over itself.

That was no belly, it was a full-fledged tummy! On my once tall, lanky roommate!

As she walked over, belly swaying from side to side with every swish of her thick hips, my mouth dropped. How long had this been happening? Since when was Donna our third fattest housemate?

Far be it from me to judge but… damn Donna got fat!

“Oh shoot.” Donna made a face as she dropped the Ho-Ho package, “I dropped it.”

“Pick it up, five second rule.” Amy waved her hand dismissively as she rubbed the summit of her own mountainous rolls and folds

Donna bent over and… and…

RRRRRIP!

Those chubby buns of hers had definitely been growing too! They were just big and round enough to split her jeans right down the middle!

“Double shoot!” Donna frowned, “I just bought these…”

Jesus Christ, what was happening here? Was I just contagious? Was I so fat that I just… made everyone around me fat? That… was kind’ve hot. But no, Donna! What had gotten into her?

“I’ve got an old pair of sweats in my room, if you want.” Amy offered helpfully from the couch, catching the package that Donna tossed at her and deftly unwrapping it.

“Thanks.” Donna huffed as she cupped her meaty cheeks so as to blind us from her carnivorous crack, “You’re a peach, Amy.”

“Any time.” Amy managed through a mouthful of snack cake.

I mean, do you see what I mean? This kind of stuff didn’t just happen. First Amy, and now Donna? Something didn’t add up. Was Donna okay? Maybe I should go talk to her…
