I let out an aggressive sigh. "Yeah, you know what, that's a pretty good analogy, or allegory, or whatever- Look, I didn't almost flunk out of English for no reason- but I'm being serious! I'm not getting in on this weird plan to fatten up our housemate, and I'm definitely not going to support it, but I guess... I mean, your arguments were okay, and... Ugh. Whatever. Look, just don't bring it up again? It's weird to hear about someone else doing this as a result of me- WILLINGLY AND KNOWINGLY, BY THE WAY- doing it to them. Cool?"

Amy nodded, her chins multiplying and dividing before my eyes. "You shouldn't feel too guilty, anyways." I stared her down. "I mean, yeah, it is totally your fault that I'm this big-" I snorted so hard that I actually shocked her. "FINE. It's KIND of your fault that I'm this big- but I mean, I didn't really have to do much 'persuading' to get Donna to plump up. In fact, she took to the kind of gluttony that I thought only you and I possessed pretty quickly once we started hanging out more."

I eyeballed her suspiciously while she offered me a bag of Ruffles. I, of course, immediately accepted them.

"I mean, look- Like, I'm not gonna be eating healthy anytime soon, but you aren't here a lot- and Kate is. I mean, here more than you. And I swear, ever since we moved into this house, she's like... Quadrupled the amount of culinary magic she pulls! Every time Donna and I are crashing on the couch, in swoops Kate with some insane five course meal, paired with like, fifteen beers. She literally texts us forms to fill out through some Google nonsense or whatever! And I mean... It's never like a salad with a side of some healthy shit! It's always like, Pasta topped with cheese, topped with more pasta, topped with some deep fried food, and then there's a side of some milkshake that's supposed to be made with some fancy Creamy De Mint?"

"Crème de menthe." I responded almost immediately- Look, one of my cousins was French, alright?

"Sure, whatever! All I'm saying, is, well... Maybe I'm cool with her getting hella fat like us, but Kate is definitely the enabler. Like, more enabler than me, because I happen to have limited funds for junk food, whereas Kate is willing to force feed us several meals a day to get some culinary experience or whatever..."

"Or maybe she just found two willing gluttons for taste-testers. Don't act like you're so innocent in this." I said, but I couldn't help but giggle. For some reason, the idea of Kate "forcing" meals on Amy- and now Donna- was kind of hilarious to me. It also made me a little jealous... But I also really liked getting out of the house every now and then.

"Fine!" Amy threw her hands up as Donna stepped back into the room, finally. We had been talking for a while. Donna let out a modest belch.

"Hey, Amy- Saw that last Crispin Pear Cider in your room- You know, that one you said we were all out of? Drank it. Screw you. But thanks for the sweats." She grumbled as she flopped down the couch opposite of us.

Oh. I was starting to see Amy's side of this... Maybe I should leave well enough alone?
11122122122122122321222311312323332.title: Understanding Enabler

choices: I noticed that Amy was actively working to make Donna eat more and more!
Donna got SUPER into this—what had Amy unlocked within her?!
It became clear that Kate was well on her way to Chubsville Station herself!
111221221221221223212223113123233321.content:
However Amy got her kicks, I wasn’t really in any room to judge. If Donna didn’t seem too upset by her rapidly expanding figure, I didn’t exactly have any reason to complain, so I didn’t. And yeah, that might make me a bad friend too, but judging people because the people around them seem to get fat—How hypocritical would I have to be to pull that off?

So, like a lot of stunts that Amy pulled, I let it slide.

Besides, it wasn’t even like Amy or I were doing the most damage to Donna’s girlish figure.

“Laaaaydeeeeees!” came the high pitched voice of our teeniest roommate, “Soup’s on!”

As Kate entered the living room with (I shit you not) an old dish cart from the bar that she’d repurposed to carry the triplicate servings required to feed three lovely ladies of our spectacular appetites, I already got the sense that I had been forgotten. As large as I was, I didn’t really lose control around food the way that Amy did. But her big green eyes may as well have glazed over as the plump ivory sausages that she called fingers began to wriggle in delight. She leaned forward into the sea of stomach that held her pinned to the couch as Kate unfolded a TV tray and placed it on top of Amy’s belly. Then mine, and then Donna’s on the other couch.

“Thanks Kate.” Donna said breathily, her voice husky as her eyes lingered on the spread set out in front of her, “You’re the best.”

“Anything for my two favorite customers.” Kate’s little nose wrinkled in delight as she laughed, “You too Mel.”

“Ha ha—sue me for having irregular work hours.” I huffed, though I was a little itchy myself to get to work on Kate’s newest burger/pasta confection.

She was the only woman I knew who would think of something like a Ravioli burger. I have no idea how she did it, and honestly, I was a little afraid to ask. But she’d somehow managed to get ahold of giant ravioli, stuff them with beef and cheese, dress them with garnish and ranch. Viola—serve with a side of fries and marinara sauce and you’ve got a first course in this house.

Jesus, no wonder we were all getting so fat.

Forgetting the pudgy plight of our newest inductee into the fat life, I allowed myself to get a little carried away in the first few bites. I leaned forward so as not to ruin the last good black polo that fit me (I had work tomorrow!) and bit deep into the cheesy, beefy, glorious concoction. Ranch dribbled down my chins as a familiar euphoria overwhelmed me—damn that was good.

“I’ve got a great IPA to pair this with.” Kate swelled proudly as all three of us enjoyed our burgers, “It’s a microbrewery that isn’t far from here and I managed to score some from the bar. Here, let me get it…”

Another night of booze and dinner was upon us, alright. I could really see why Donna fell so fast to Amy’s trickery. She wasn’t nearly as big a girl as Amy and I were (at least, not yet!) so she probably spent most of her time at home buzzed and hungry. Knowing that there was definitely more to where this came from—the oven was still sizzling in the kitchen, after all!—I got pretty excited myself.

However, as dinner progressed…
111221221221221223212223113123233321.title: What the Hell is a Ravioli Burger?

choices: Make a fuss!  I'm supposed to be the resident fat-ass, dammit!
Politely ask for seconds.  It's pretty clear that I'm going to be outdone...
Okay, time to get Amy AND Donna to talk.  Kate wasn't THAT much of an enabler.
1112212212212212232122231131232333212.content:
Like I said before, I was proud of my work with Amy. Donna turning into a "Tonna" flabby fun through Amy's nebulous machinations was something else. That being said, Amy kinda had a point. Kate's culinary crimes had only ramped up, and the fact that I tended to be MIA meant they were directed at the other two members of the house- and it showed.

These "Ravioli Burgers" were literally a calorific onslaught in more ways than one. First of all, I was pretty sure the burger patty itself was a half pound of meat. The "ravioli" portion of it was basically a nightmare of ricotta and spinach (so we were about 1/5 healthy foods, hip-hip hooray), and the red sauce... Was really only red because of the tomato. I'm pretty sure it was actually just melted butter with a hint of tomato mixed in for appearances.

So look- I'm a glutton. I munched down on two of these bad boys, and had several IPA's on the side. But Donna was literally glutting herself. I had learned to appreciate food. Look, I was a fatass, but the college life had made me more sophisticated, and as such, I could actually appreciate flavor- and Kate definitely appreciated my input as I gave fair, logical feedback.

Donna was basically a vacuum permanently set on "suck". You ever see someone actually inhale food? I'm pretty sure I've done it more than once, but I swear to God that Donna opened her mouth, inhaled, and the burger disappeared. And I thought AMY was quite the glutton. But Donna was literally devouring everything in sight, and Kate seemed to love it. Even when I tried to distract her with some bullshit compliments, she gravitated towards Donna and Amy, making sure both over-gorged girls got more than they truly needed.

A weird thought hit me, just then: I was being out-eaten by my formerly scrawny roomie and a formerly apathetic taste-tester. Mel Carlyle was being outdone by two... Amateurs!

Clearing my throat, I knew there was only one way to handle this...
1112212212212212232122231131232333212.title: Donna Dissolves Any Doubts

choices: Donna and Amy started getting really big...
I start making waves at work—I go out with some of my coworkers for a night!
We hear from Colleen for the first time, since, forever—what's she been up to?
11122122122122122321222311312323332122.content:
I know. You’re probably thinking “WOAH, am I reading a story about Mel Carlyle, the Big Fat Feedee, or am I reading a story about Mel Carlyle the big fat wuss?!” But just… let me explain, okay?

I knew that I wasn’t going to be able to keep up with Amy and Donna. And, sure, at one point in time, that would have driven me crazy. Like, here I am a good three times the size of Amy’s little pet project, and she was lapping over me like I was some kind of amateur! But ever since I got my job and started living on my own (well, with my roommates) I’d like to think that I’d matured a bit. I wasn’t exactly ready to go for immobility yet. It was already a struggle just to get around at my size, and I wasn’t exactly going to win “Best Barista of the Month” if I was too fat to leave the house. Or, you know, make enough money to pay my part of the rent.

I was only twenty-one, and I still had a lot of shit to do. Get a non-entry-level position, make enough money to support an incredibly hedonistic lifestyle, meet that special someone who wouldn’t mind waiting on me hand and foot for the rest of my life… that, or marry someone rich enough to afford me all of those things. Which I wasn’t going to be able to do if I couldn’t get out of bed. So either way, instead of binging on Kate’s calorie-bomb burgers (which were amazing and delicious) I decided to do the responsible thing and stop at seconds.

Which, admittedly, still would have blown you out of the water. These things were amazing.

I let the little ones have their fun (little ones being Donna and Amy—not quite so little anymore!) and bowed out somewhere around my third burger.

But not those two.

I was admittedly a little pleased with how well Amy had coaxed Donna into the fat life. From that day forward, I was much more aware of the changes going on with my tallest roommate.

Amy talked her into trying just about everything under the sun.

Every meal had an “and”—nothing like burgers and pizza. Milkshakes and fries. Lasagna and gnocchi.

Why go out when there was an internet right there in the palm of your hand?

Don’t freak out about outgrowing anything—between Amy and I, we could keep Donna clothed for quite a while with just our hand-me-downs!

I could go on.

Anyway, time passed as it usually does...
11122122122122122321222311312323332122.title: A Mature Response to Stuffing

choices: I decide to talk to Kate alone. See if she's okay.
I talk to Amy. Because now I wouldn't put something like this past her.
What else? My roommates pork out—everyone in our house gets FAT!
1112212212212212232122231131232333213.content:
“Can I cook, or can’t I?”

“You stole that from Star Trek.”

“Like… no I didn’t.” Kate chuckled stupidly, “I stole it from me. I mean, like, Shatner stole it from me.”

“Captain Kirk didn’t say that.” Amy interjected, “It was—”

“Okay, like, whatever. I make the burgers so I make the rules.” Kate turned the glass up over her head and finished yet another beer, “Plus, I don’t think Shatner can cook nearly as well as I do, so… you know. That’s two for Katie.”

As our horizontally-challenged roommate high fived herself, I couldn’t help but giggle. Her tolerance was through the roof—she must have outdrank all three of us if she was this fucking buzzed. I’d believe it too. That little leprechaun could drink the three of us and just about everyone else in the apartment complex under the table. It came with the territory of her obsession with pairing everything with alcohol, I suppose.

“Oh man this is so good.” She mumbled drunkenly as she bit into her burger, “Can I cook or can’t I?”

“You already said that.”

“SO YOU ADMIT THAT I SAID IT FIRST.”

Kate was, like, 5’ flat. Most beer mugs were about the size of her head. She was teensy. If she were half a foot taller, at her weight, she’d get blown away by the wind. Her hands were so small that she simply couldn’t hold her ravioli burger one handed. She had to hold it into the back and catapult herself into it, only occasionally coming up for air.

Sauce was all over her face. I don’t know if it was because she had just let out a nasty beer burp or if she was full, but Kate’s breathing was ragged. It was clearly a struggle for her to keep up with us.

“Aww, is little Katie-Kate gonna need a box?” Donna teased from her couch, scarfing down her third burger with ease, “You’re so widdle and cute!”

“I can… I can do it.” Kate burped, “I just…”

“RRRRURAAAAP!!”

“There.” Kate smiled stupidly, “Had to make some room.”

I guess it was because I hadn’t been home as often as I should have been. Ever since I’d gotten my job, I’d been out at odd hours and I hadn’t really gotten the chance to see Kate lately. And… was it just my imagination or was she getting kinda fat?

Like, okay, yeah, she wasn’t exactly a stick before. It was kind’ve hard to keep weight off when you were three apples high like a Smurf. But she just looked heavier. Like, maybe ten pounds. Nothing like Donna’s impressive gain at the hands of Amy, but enough for me—a trained professional of pudge—to notice.

“THERE!” Kate stood from her chair in the living room, her belly knocking over the tv tray, “I FUCKING TOLD YOU!”

I’d never seen anyone so proud of finishing two burgers in my whole life.

“Jesus Kate, you’re loud.” Amy whined, “Why do you always get so competitive when you drink?”

“And loud.” Donna chided

“You said I couldn’t do it!” Kate bawked, “But I did!”

There was a loud gurgle of pain as Kat’s gut churned in agony. Her face—flush with booze—drained of its color as her eyes widened.

“And now I’m gonna lay down.” She announced shakily as she struggled up the stairs of our flat.

With that, it just left Amy Donna and I in the living room. I had an early shift the next day, so I was about ready to turn in. But I couldn’t help shake the feeling that maybe Amy’s campaign to turn Donna tubby had left some unseemly side-effects on our teensiest, weensiest roommate.

“Alright, I’m just gonna say it.” Donna burped as she plunged her hands in a bag of chips, “Is it me, or is Kate getting fat?”

Amy and I looked at each other and shrugged.
1112212212212212232122231131232333213.title: Binge Drinking & Burgers

choices: Gone?  Oh, shit... I might have pissed her off...
Staring hungrily at my greasy feast.  "You gonna share?"
Looking slightly uncomfortable-  seems she may not be too happy about her weight
11122122122122122321222311312323332131.content:
So, it's kind of a known quantity that fat people are less affected by alcohol, right? So by that logic, fat people are less susceptible to hangovers.

False, and false.

I woke up feeling like shit. I mean, drinking a lot in our household was definitely a thing, but after Kate trudged off to bed, and Amy and Donna cleaned and smoked a fresh bowl, shit got real- real fast.

So at some point we wanted to build a castle out of beer cans. Except we only had about 15 empty cans. So, through some witchcraft (IE sending Amy across the street to that frat house that happened to be run by a dude who totally was into fat chicks whenever he had more than two beers), we ended up with two 24-pack boxes of some generic beer brand that I can't be bothered remembering.

And then, at some point, Donna found the following items in her room:

-A beer helmet that held four beers (graciously given to me)

-A beer bong

-More beer

... So anyways long story short we stayed up until like 6 AM and I think at some point that frat dude showed up and... Well, I don't wanna know what him and Amy hypothetically did, since I might have been shitfaced by 1 AM and- look, it doesn't matter.

Wait, maybe I take back that first point about it taking more booze to get fat people drunk, because I'm not sure slamming approximately 10 beers before you feel buzzed is normal. But I digress. The point is, I woke up feeling like hot shit. Judging by the uncomfortable sounding belches by my longest-know friend in the house, emanating from her own room, I was going to go ahead and say I wasn't the only one. Although, oddly enough, I didn't feel the need to let out an alarmingly loud belch every several seconds. I glanced at my phone- it was well beyond noon, which meant I hadn't really gotten what most people would call a "proper" amount of sleep, but I was awake and my head was pounding, so it was as good of a time as any to stagger out of bed. I glanced down and noticed I had fallen asleep in my clothes, which seemed appropriate, given the debauchery that happened the night prior. That being said, my shirt reeked of cheap beer, and I quickly disrobed and re-robed into more appropriate attire, IE more sweatpants and another "loose" top that only let a few inches of my fat gut peek out.

I waited for the more aggressive hiccup-belches to stop before gently tiptoeing into Amy's room. "Rise and shine, sweet-stacks!" I said in my cheeriest voice, yet somehow still managed to sound like hot death.

"Fuggin... I... Ugh...." Amy grumbled. "No words now." I noted with some amount of satisfaction, a pair of boxers on the floor. One point to my drunken mental abilities, I guess?

"Okay, no words now, Amy. But Mel needs fatty foods. Will you pitch in if I order some?" Amy stuck out her thumb horizontally. "I was just gonna get like, fifty bucks worth of McDonalds." The thumb shot vertically. "Great. Pay me back later, if you aren't dead by six." The thumb flipped downwards as another bur rattled out from beneath the duvet. "Wonderful."

I struggled toward's Donna's room, before stopping. Donna was solely responsible for this hangover, I decided. She was the one who brought out those foul torture devices designed only to heighten hangovers, not to mention the extra beer. Fuck her, she can smell the McGriddles and suffer in peace. Look, I'm not normally that vindictive but my head felt like approximately ten-thousand bees lived in it. I went back to my room, fuzzily fumbled with my phone for about ten minutes- I swear to God at one point the GrubHub app actually said "Seriously? You want all this?" But I chalked it up to still being kinda drunk on top of being so hungover that I was hallucinating things. Finally, I managed to get my order in. Next on the list: water. I wasn't normally a water lady, but ice water somehow sounded even better than the fifteen thousand calories of McDonalds I had just ordered.

I staggered into the kitchen, only to spy a plate holding a small mountain of bacon, a half drank beer, and a very chipper looking Kate. "Sup? You guys sounded like you were having fun last night... Especially Amy!"

I staggered over to the kitchen and set about getting a glass of ice water. "Kate, I'm gonna need you to take it down about... Oh, ninety-five percent, okay? Also are you seriously drinking already?" I grumbled, making sure to sit far enough away from her to not smell the beer.

"It's like, almost five. Did you seriously just get up?" She giggled, chomping down on a crispy strip of fried pig.

"Did you not see our monument?" I grumbled, sipping my ice water. "The Castle de La Calories?" I gestured towards the other table, only to see it empty.

"Do you mean the fuck-ton of beer cans that I had to pick up this morning? That were scattered around like Easter eggs, only not as fun because instead of candy, they just had shitty, tiny bits of backwashed beer? Because yeah, Mel, that was a real monument to perfection, or whatever." She was grinning, which I took as a good sign. "Seriously, you guys got real rowdy last night, though. If I wasn't too stuffed to move, I would've come and yelled at you or something. But instead, I just turned on my white noise and passed out, so, I mean, you're welcome."

I glanced at her, and winced as she chugged the rest of her beer. She was wearing a tank-top and some running shorts, both of which definitely weren't new. Her tummy pushed the hem of her tanktop up, and her tanned pooch pushed outwards. The shorts were too tight on her as well, giving her both a muffin top and accentuating that her thighs had been hit with some calories as well. Now look, I'm pretty blunt normally. When I'm hungover/still drunk, apparently I'm super blunt and also not very good at being impartial with my questions.

"So, uh, you been eating well?" I asked. "I mean, I, uh... Just mean-" Kate grabbed for the final strips of bacon. Wait, she seriously ate all that bacon already?

"Look, I'm not oblivious, okay? I know I've gained a bit. It's kinda hard not to, with Donna and Amy constantly demanding 10k calories per meal. But, I-"

"Kate. I'm sorry, that was a bad way of phrasing that. I just- I mean, Donna's really... Blimped up. And I wasn't sure if-"

Kate threw her hand up. "Mel, I-" She began, but paused as our doorbell rang.

"Oh, shit! I forgot I ordered some food. Um... Hold on, and we'll get right back to this, okay?" I stumbled off my chair and wobbled my way towards the door. After a really awkward exchange with the dude, who I'm assuming assumed that I was going to eat all of this, I made my way back to the kitchen, only to find Kate...
11122122122122122321222311312323332131.title: A Solo Still-Drunk Serious Kate Talk

choices: Why not? Amy has Donna—I decide to "adopt" Kate as my own little fatty!
What? No, that'd be weird. Moving on...
111221221221221223212223113123233321312.content:
“Hey…” I caught the small panting smile that she gave me as she looked my grub up and down, “You gonna share?”

Oh god. Had I done it again? Like, seriously, what was it about me that just seemed to bring out everyone’s inner glutton. Kate was supposed to be the enabler—not the enablee. But the way that her cute little brown eyes zeroed on all that fast food, her face hungry and lusting after all that sweet greasy meat, I could hardly stay mad at her.

“Yeah, sure.” I sighed, “I mean, even I shouldn’t have too much grease on my stomach after last night.”

“True.” Kate wasn’t even listening as she went ahead and pawed a quarter pounder from my cache of calories, “Mmm… I mean, it’s bad for your hangover, right?”

Even if it were late in the afternoon, it was clear that Kate hadn’t been any more productive than the rest of us. Standing there in her tank top and her yoga pants, I knew that she hadn’t so much as been out of the house all day. Must have called out sick so she could take care of our drunk asses when we inevidably woke up. With the way that she dug into her burger, I would have thought she hadn’t eaten since last night… but I knew better than to assume that.

She was getting a little heavy. I looked her up and down (when I could stand the light) for good measure. She was a little softer in the belly, but that’s about it. At her small stature, I couldn’t have placed her at more than maybe ten pounds heavier. But that’s a slippery slope, especially when I’m involved.

As I watched my ittiest-bittiest roommate eat stuff burger down her throat, I idly pictured her a bit bigger. It was something that I (don’t like to admit) that I do sometimes. I tried picturing her in fifty pounds, with a round belly and full chest. Her face curving into a cute little double chin and her cheeks all dimpled. Then I added another fifty, and another. Her double chin got deeper, her arms got all flabby. Her gut hung lower and lower out of her pants, forming into good ol’ fashioned fat girl rolls…

I could definitely see it.

Kate would make a great fatty.

I mean, don’t get me wrong, lots of people would look good with a few extra pounds. But some of us (like me!) looked better the bigger we got…

I wonder what my boozehound of a flatmate would look like as a cute little landwhale…?
111221221221221223212223113123233321312.title: Contemplating Kate's Weight

choices: Colleen has just such a scale! And boy is the number surprising!
No scale can handle this much Mel. We have to get creative.
What if we monitor Amy instead?
11122122122122123.content:
When I looked out at the lecture hall, I knew I was in hell. This class was at 8 in the morning. It was only available at 8 in the morning...every...goddamn...semester. But I had to take it. I had to take THIS class. Because to graduate, I needed to take a physical education class. And all of them required exercise...except this one: Introduction to Exercise and Dietary Science.

I had a grumbling suspicion they only offered this class at 8 in the morning because they were trying to get me to exercise. My doubts only grew when I realized the building it was in was built in the 60s. The chairs were all the little crappy wooden foldy ones with the armrests you can't move on the sides. I had no where to sit, and I was going to be surrounded by people enthusiastic about losing weight. I was in fat girl hell. I was lost adrift in a sea of uncomfortable wooden chairs that wouldn't fit my fat ass, and then someone threw me a life saver.

Colleen was here, and she was waving at me. That was unexpected. As I lumbered down the steps, she stood up and grabbed her shit and dashed up to meet me half way.

"Funny seeing me here, am I right?" I teased. I knew I was the fat girl in the diet class. I wasn't going to ignore it. Especially since it excited me a little. I found my thoughts drifting to maybe I should take my breakfast here and pig out during class, and it was a little hard to pay attention to what Collen was saying.

"Yeah. We seem to be bumping into each other a lot, neighbor." She teased back. "You...probably need help with seating here, right?"

"Uh...yeah, how did you know?" I asked, caught off guard.

"I mean, come on Mel--" She said, gesturing at my, I guess you could call it my bulk. She had a point, but most people didn't bother thinking about the needs of a girl my size "It's kind of obvious. But they're required to provide you with seating to accommodate you."

My eyes went wide. This was amazing. I mean, sometimes at Buttercombe they'd let me sit at the teacher's desk if the teacher was nice (and wasn't fatter than me, like that bitch Ms. Knight), but I didn't know they were like, legally required to. This was a fat girl trick not even I knew! "They are? How did you know that."

"It uh, actually came up in one of my courses on weight loss. I'm kind of enthusiastic about my major, so I actually skipped intro until now and just dove right into some of the more advanced course."

"Sweet. That means you can help me figure all this stuff out, real easy, right?" I smiled.

"Yeah, sure. And maybe a few other things." She said. Her meaning was opaque, but she quickly explained my rights to the professor when he finally came in, and she even sat next to me right at the front of class.

Once it got started, it wasn't too bad. There wasn't a lecture about the dangers of eating too much, and the fire and brimstone that would befall on any of us sinners who gave in to the evils of obesity. In fact, looking around, I didn't seem to be the only fatty who was eager to get out of a gym class. The whole class looked portlier than most, it almost reminded me of my Buttercombe days.

Once we went over the syllabus, the content of the first lecture was nicely abstract. Going over calories, and proteins, and what vitamins are. It was like Cellular Biology but way, WAY easier.

Then, at the end of class, the professor revealed the catch. This was a lab science class. There as a 'hands on' portion.

"This semester, you'll be splitting up into pairs as lab partners." He began. "Together, you're going to monitor the diet and excercise of someone, every day, every single day for the rest of the semester, starting next week. So it should probably be one of you, just to make it simple. Whenever we learn a new metric of diet and fitness in this class, that will be added to what you have to monitor. You have to start next monday, so you have until then to pick out partners. You'll have to measure the subjects weight and body mass at the start of the week, and daily caloric intake every day."

Colleen reached over and poked me in the shoulder. "Mel!" She whispered loudly. "We should totally be lab partners!"

Immediately I was on the defensive again. Here it came. Colleen was going to use this class to put me on a diet, and make me lose weight. "I'm not really interested in trying to diet, Colleen." I said, firmly, and simply. I didn't owe her any reasons.

"The prof didn't say anything about diet, Mel! He just said monitoring. And since we're neighbors it will be way easier to meet up and for me to come over and keep track of what you're doing! You wouldn't have to even do any of the work! I could just come over and keep track of your day!" She was trying to sell this idea really, REALLY hard.

"Why are you so excited for this?"

"Too uh...can I be totally honest?"

"Please."

"It's really hard to get accurate data on the habits of girls your size. They're usually really shy about it. And measuring someone more...usual in their habits it's way beneath me, I can do that in my sleep. But you, you're...interesting?" She said. She was uh...really, really enthusiastic about this. When I heard "exercise science major" I pictured, you know, a jock. But this girl was really more like a nerd for food.

We caught our collective breath as we waited for that horrible buzzing noise to come back at us, signalling our entrance.

And sure enough, as soon as she said that, the door flung wide open to reveal quite the sight for sore eyes—at least one of my new roommates was a total blimp!

Staring us right in the face, as soon as she opened the door, was her big belly. She was struggling to pull something over herself, like she had been naked when we rung the doorbell and had scattered to find something to make herself look decent. Even after she covered up her belly and (what I assumed was) her bra, I could still see every curve of her figure. More specifically, I could see the distinctive crease where her top tummy folded over the waistband of her sweats, and bulged out underneath. You'd think that the next thing that I noticed would have been her smiling, chubby face as she battled with her double chin. But no, it was her giant chest. Those massive mams of hers plopped to either side of her billowing gut from beneath her tie-dye t-shirt, hastily thrown on prior to our entry. Her hair was up and her cheeks were red. She must have been coming down those steps pretty fast—she was sweating!

"Hi! I'm Donna! Hi, welcome to... phew..." she puffed, breathing visibly labored as she greeted us in a majority of the doorway, "Come on... in! You must be,uh... Amy and Mel!" Her grin faltered a bit, but she kept her pitch going.

Look, far be it from me to say anything about another girl's weight, but damn if my prospective new roomie wasn't fat. Like, we're talking she could have been a Buttercombe alum and I would have gone along with it. It wasn't often that I found girls my size around campus (most girls my size tended to do online college!) but I'll be dipped if there wasn't three... (I don't know, she looked pretty tall...) four hundred pounds of woman standing in the doorway, popping out of her top! And as she led us inside, I was given a marvelous view of her big bubble butt, bobbing behind her. Between her and Amy, I was really starting to question just how straight I thought I was. I couldn't stop staring!

"So, this is kind of the, I dunno, living room?" Donna spread her wobbling wingspan, exhibiting a well-worn couch and a nice-ish tv set, as well as empty but stained styrofoam plates suggesting that we may have interrupted a little meal time, "I mean, it's kinda the dining room too I guess. Kate and I eat in here a lot."

"So you eat a lot." I said with a little chuckle, nudging Amy in her fatty flank, "I think Amy and I can handle that. Don't you think so Amy?"

"Oh for sure." Amy touched her tummy with her fingertips, "In fact, I think I might be a little peckish right now..."

Donna clearly wasn't used to this level of body positivity from two girls who had so much body to be positive over. I didn't know if she was just shy or we were offputting (probably both) but she just sort've gave us this look. Like this, what the fuck are you doing, look. Like she was trying to discern whether or not the 800+ pounds of woman in her kitchen were calling her out for her weight. But once she saw that we were earnest enough, and we weren't picking on her, she lightened up.

"Well if that's the case." Donna said with a wicked smile as she lead us by the bellies, "Why don't we check out the kitchen?"

As it turned out, the kitchen was incredible.

"We don't exactly have a lot—the rest of our house is kinda crap—but I think we've got the biggest fridge that doesn't have to, like, be built into the wall." Donna said with no small amount of pride, "Of course, with the way me and Kate eat, it doesn't stay very full for long!"

Aside from the fuck-huge fridge Donna showed us a gas range oven, one of those big kitchen sinks, a garbage disposal... they even had a dishwasher! I eagerly awaited the day that I no longer had to scrub my plates like some kind of animal!

"Well you better stock up." Amy blurted out, "Cause if we move in, it's only gonna get even emptier even faster. I can promise you that..."

Amy opened the fridge (without asking!) and popped her head inside. She looked impressed, and when I glanced at her, I could see why—the refrigerator was absolutely filled with beers, sodas, snacks, and more!

"That's probably good." Donna snorted, her double chin flexing and her chest bouncing, "Because with the way Kate and I keep this place stocked up, I don't think y'all will have to ever worry about going hungry."

“Cool?” Kim repeated as if I’d just blasphemed, “Mel, this isn’t just cool—didn’t you hear me? We can eat here for free, any time we want!”

“Like, any any time?” I asked curiously, trying to give this scrappy little cafetorium a fighting chance against my alma mater, “Because that, dear Kimmy, would be cool.”

“Well no, not any time.” She said rather reluctantly, her hands back on her gigantic hips as we took up a large portion of the lobby area outside the cafeteria, “But most times. 5 am til 11 pm—I guarantee now that you’re in college those’ll be your prime eating hours between classes.” She said with a pat of her own belly

“Gotta go down a lot of hills to get here though.”

“Oh goddammit Mel, just come inside.” Kim threw her hands in the air and grabbed me by the arm, tugging me behind her like two parade floats caught by the ropes, “You’ll see what I mean.”

***


I kinda sorta saw what she meant.

It was chique and modern and stuff, yeah. Plus the tables were really big and looked like they could hold me, Kim and a couple friends if we amassed a little gaggle of vapid college girls. The food smelled good—a healthy mix of prepackaged stuff that was cheap and college-kid approved and the good stuff that they made with the ovens back there. While I’ll admit that I wasn’t exactly overwhelmed, I was definitely whelmed. It had exceeded my expectations.

“See?” Kim nudged my arm with her doughy elbow, “Totally palatable to your tastes, right?”

“I guess.” I rolled my eyes as Kim pouted, “We’ll see how the place fares against my experience with places like these.”

I grabbed my belly by the handles and shook it up and down, almost knocked off-kilter by the reverberation that my increasingly vast gut shimmied and swayed with, even as I stopped. Kim snorted and slapped my gut, which had unfurled my sweater slightly in all its jiggling.

“Yeah yeah, well most fat girls aren’t so choosy.” She said with a pat on her own immodest obese tummy, “Let’s eat.”

1122112.content:
I will give it this—the Stuffington University culinary fare was not a bad one. At least, not as bad as I’d thought it was. Modest selection with decent quality food was well enough for me so long as I could get however much I wanted, but the fact that it was free really did make a difference. Once Kim showed me where the serving trays were, I may as well have just checked out. I grabbed three plates and loaded them full of excess carbs and empty calories. Pizza (lots of it), a six-inch grinder, some fries, two little slider burgers, some more fries, and something that I guessed was some sort of burrito? Either way, it smelled good, so I grabbed a few of them and waddled over to the drink fountain.

“Oh-ho, not so picky now, are we chubs?” Kim gestured towards my plate with her chins, a smile dimpling her cheeks as she held her own tray, “You seem to be getting along pretty well in a place that’s so okay.”

“It’s okay.” I snorted, filling my styrofoam cup up with soda, “Like, it’s… there’s a lot of it, I guess.”

“You guess.” Kim rolled her eyes as she filled in my space at the fountain, “Well just wait ‘til you try some. Trust me—I don’t keep up my girlish figure by not stuffing my face here.”

We rounded the corner and stepped back into the main seating section of the cafeteria, two enormous fat girls with more food than sense. I couldn’t help but look out into the crowd to see if anyone was staring at me yet, hoping to get a nice little jolt off of their reaction to my size. I wasn’t turning too many heads, but I figured that it would just be a matter of time. I was already daydreaming lustily about causing café-quakes with my footsteps when Kim’s voice cried out and ripped me back to my (still pretty fucking huge) reality.

“Oh hey, my crew’s here!” she said happily, turning to me with an open-mouth grin, “You feel up to meeting a few new people?”

“Uh Kim, I don’t know if you know this yet, but you’re not supposed to talk with your mouth full.” I puffed playfully, “And since my mouth is always full, I don’t think socializing is up my alley.”

“Whatever fat girl.” Kim nudged me in my spare tire, “Come on, let’s go sit with them.”

Kim led me to the very center of the cafeteria where two girls had already struck their claim. They were all smiles and laughs and I just plopped myself down next to Kim.

“Britney, Robyn, this is my new roommate Mel.” Kim said expertly, readying her first of assuredly many slice of pizza to dip in ranch, “Mel, these are my friends Britney and Robyn.”

Much to my surprise, Kim’s friends were pretty skinny. I say that because, in my experience as a girl of certain enormous proportions, people my size tended to attract girls of similar interests and hobbies—and suffice it to say that girls who shared my hobbies and interests were far from skinny. Or maybe that was because I went to the fattest Prep school in America…

Point being, Kim’s friends were some twiggy chicks.

The one on the right (Robyn) was this short, angular looking girl. Long brown hair, tannish skin, and a t-shirt straight from the Juniors’ section. Meanwhile the one on the left (Britney) was this cute little Asian petite, swimming in a stylish sweater/polo combo while she munched complacently on fries and played on her phone. Their friendship with Kim—I took a shot in the dark at this point and guessed that she was the group’s resident fat girl—must have numbed them to the sight of people that had reached my super-sized proportions because they barely batted an eyelash between the two of them as I plopped down. They were friendly, don’t get me wrong. It just wasn’t… I kinda wanted their eyes to get all wide with surprise, y’know?

“Hey.” I smiled through my disappointment, comforted by the juicy sliders waiting for me on the plate closest to my belly, “I’m Mel.”

“Hi, I’m Robyn.” The itty-bitty brunette said with a more genuine smile, “Nice to meet you.”

“Britney.” Said the sweater girl on the left said tersely as she tapped on her phone, “Same.”

I hadn’t seen girls so skinny in person, like, since I’d left for Buttercombe way back in Middle School. The poor things had no idea what they were missing out on, being so little. How could they? It was a shame, really—I blame the media.

“Assuming we manage to get along as well as we have been, I forsee you having to put up with her a lot.” Kim gave a belly-laugh that made her gut quiver, “So play nice.”

And that was pretty much it, I guess. It’s always awkward when there’s an elephant in the room—especially when you’re the elephant in the room—but we managed to get along without too many awkward pauses. I guess I could bore you with everything we talked about, but the truth was that it was just that boring getting to know you shit. Robyn was an Education Major, Britney was an Athletics Major, blah blah blah, they lived on the floor below us, wah wah wah, they all met at Orientation. There, you’re officially all caught up to speed.

If you want the truth, I just sort of auto-piloted my way through the whole conversation thing. Not that I wasn’t happy to have made some potential acquaintances, but the food just seemed far more interesting to me. I managed to scarf down more than a few entrees just floating in and out of the conversation, picking up just enough to convince Robyn that yes, I really was listening to her talk about all the cool stuff on campus that I had already been informed of about a billion times.

I didn’t really start to pay attention until...

So, like all good things, my first course came to an end. All of the food I had was actually pretty good; it didn't taste the same as Buttercombe fare, but I could easily see myself subsisting on this stuff for a few years. I was feeling sated, but not full. So, I prepared myself to heave my bulk up and said, "I'm getting seconds. I'll be right back."

A moment after I spoke, Robyn jumped up. "I was planning on getting some seconds myself, Mel. I'll get some more food for you. Anything in particular you want?" she asked.

I was a little surprised, but decided not to look a gift horse in the mouth. I knew from personal experience that having someone else get your food for you was one of the best things ever. So, I responded, "Uh, thanks. I'll have a little bit of everything." Kim snorted in the middle of taking a sip of her drink, spraying soda out of her nose. After making sure that she was okay, Robyn headed off to the buffet table with both of our trays. She returned a few minutes later with only one tray, overflowing with all of the good stuff I had sampled. She'd somehow managed to pack it with more food than I had managed, an impressive feat. I spent a few seconds staring at it.

"Um..." I turned to look at Robyn, who was looking nervous. "I didn't get too much, did I?"

Now I snorted, and flashed her a grin. "The answer to that question is always going to be no." Robyn smiled back at me, and took a seat. I briefly wondered why she hadn't gone back to get her own tray, since she claimed she'd been going to get seconds herself. But, then I started digging in and I use all of my brainpower to focus on my feast. I like to pay attention to the nuances of flavor as I eat; if you're trying to discern the motives of someone you just met, then you're not devoting all of your brainpower to experiencing your food.

Robyn got up one more time in the middle of my eating to get some seconds for Kim. She really could put away about as much as I could. I filed away the idea of challenging Kim to an eating contest later, then returned to stuffing my face. Finally, I'd cleared away everything on my tray and Kim had done the same on hers. I was painfully full, massaging my gut and trying to relieve some of the pressure I was feeling inside it. It was glorious. It looked like Kim was doing the same. Meanwhile, Robyn was looking at the two of us while Britney continued to tap away on her phone.

"Can I get you gals anything else?" Robyn asked. I had to think about it for a moment.

Okay, look, I don’t want to sound like a mean person. Because I’m really not. But these girls… I just really didn’t know them that well. They were Kim’s friends, not mine. And that was cool and everything, but they started talking about stuff that I didn’t really know about and… I sort of phased out of the conversation. Like, completely. I just started eating. And once I start eating, there isn’t really any chance of bringing me back into the fold of anything that wasn’t edible. These girls seemed nice, but my relationship with them wasn’t nearly as close and intimate as my relationship with food was. I love food—how could I ever have picked two strangers over my dear, sweet food?

“Okay, see you guys tomorrow—I’ll text you about classes tonight, Kim!” Robyn seemed to say rather suddenly as I blinked myself back into the civilized world, “It was nice meeting you Mel!”

“Send me the syllabus for Art?” Britney tacked on rather poignantly as she turned towards me, “Thanks a bunch.”

And with that, they were off. Had I really just zoned out of that entire conversation? Was I really that obsessed with keeping my face stuffed? By the look on Kim’s face, it didn’t look like I had offended anybody. So either I was super-fucking charming when I was faking my way through conversation, or nobody really noticed that I was about 10% there and 90% in my own stomach.

I did notice, though, that somebody (me) had eaten almost everything on my plate. Is it sad that I remembered the sliders better than anything that those girls had told me?

“So…?” Kim said searchingly as she poked me in the arm, “What do you think?”

“They’re…” I bit back any urge that I had to blurt my guts and confess to zombieing through that whole getting-to-know-you crap and decided to lie, “Nice. Really nice.”

“Aren’t they though?” Kim said with a smile, settling back into her seat—I now saw that I wasn’t the only one who had pigged out a little during all that, she was probably just better at controlling herself than I as.

“More importantly though…” she said with a wicked twinkle behind her glasses…

“Now that they’re gone we can finally cut loose.” Kim said with relief in her voice as she hunched over her tray, “As much as I love those girls, damn if they can’t talk.”

“Right?” I thought I did an excellent job of making it look like I’d been mentally present the whole time, “I mean, you can’t just go full fat girl in front of two twigs like that and it be okay.”

***


The food was so much better without some skinny girls yakking on and on about shit I really couldn’t care less about. And knowing that I didn’t have to worry about offending anyone’s stupid sensibilities, I just ate to my little heart’s content without so much as a thought about what two skinny twigs might have thought about me. All their chattering was just distracting—now that I was alone with the sound of my own gluttony, I could really focus on getting a good meal.

I stuffed sliders down my throat. I deep throated burritos. I smashed sandwiches into my face, making piggishly erotic noises the entire time as I felt the familiar weight of food in my stomach. At some point my pants button popped off, and I didn’t even notice. God this food was good!

“Having fun there?” Kim asked me teasingly in the midst of my trance, going to town on a grinder that was easily the size of her forearm in both length and width

“Fuck yes I am.” I burbled, practically palming my plate of french fries and picking up one hill of potatoes at a time, “Gawd it feels so good to just eat!”

Kim seemed almost impressed with how much I could put away. I had gotten up a grand total of four times after her friends had left, putting me at my sixth-platter point. Each time I rose it was with more exertion and strain as my belly grew bigger and rounder with the amount of food I was cramming into myself.

Not that she was slacking off or anything—that girl could eat too. She wasn’t that far behind me in the number of trays she’d been scarfing down, and her big butt was just as eager to hop up for another plate as mine was.

“These portion sizes are—HIC—shit though.” I burped, smacking my lips, “How do they expect me to keep my figure—URP—living on crumbs?”

“I think the argument could be made that you’re just too big.” Kim looked up from her plate, her chubby cheeks coated in a thick layer of salt and condiments, “Not every college girl eats their weight in junk food.”

“Just us, right?” I panted, smiling greedily at my morsel as I bit into its cheesy, beefy center, “Don’t—HIC—know what they’re missing out on.”

Kim and I could have probably gone on like that for hours—we’d already been in the cafeteria stuffing ourselves for the better part of an hour and a half since Britney and Robyn left. It was nice to have someone who got me; like really got me, y’know? Another big fat chick who didn’t mind that I was probably the worst influence ever, and was completely content to do nothing but eat all day. I was just a pig who could do nothing but eat, eat, eat and get fatter and fatter and fatter.

"We met in highschool when I was a tiny 200 pound freshman...a couple dinners later and four years of highschool and suddenly I was having to have my family help me stand up my 600 pound ass to waddle up to get my diploma...I know because he weighed me on the way there.."

"He did all THIS??" I asked. I was shocked. Sure, Hannah had done some things back at Buttercombe like this, but over 300 pounds? And willing? At least I think she was willing.

"Yeah," she chuckled, her three chins jiggling and shaking. "He was pretty relentless..Gain shakes, funnels and everything. He met me every lunch at school and stuffed me till I was about to pop. Weekends were....rough."

"Wow....just...wow.."

"I know right? Part of the reason I decided to move off for school was just so I could spend some time away from him. Don't get me wrong! I really love him but...I don't want to be 1000 pounds just yet. ya know?"

Slumping down, I twiddled my fat thumbs. To be honest, that DID sound nice. Ever since I was young I wanted to be fatter and fatter. And here was someone who was clearly fatter than me, with the means to continue AND a loving partner? It seemed to unfair. "Yeah..I guess...." I mumbled. I couldn't help but stare at the beached whale across from me and be envious..

"Is something wrong?"

12.content:
Okay seriously, let me say this now: I love my little sister to death.

We've basically been best friends since she was born. When me and Alice were kids, I always looked out for her and we did almost everything together. Even after I went to private school, she waited up for me every Christmas break and every Summer. So yeah, we're pretty close. It really helps that she's probably the only one besides Dad who's never hassled me about my weight.

Ever since I got home though, we've been pretty much inseperable. I parked my fat ass on the couch on Night One and ordered four large pizzas for myself it's been nothing but Netflix marathons and a steady diet of your standard Millenial hiked up to about a billion with my favorite little sister, and it's pretty much been the best week of my life. You could call it making up for lost time, but the truth is that I'm lazy and deep down I know that Alice is too.

Mom might not like how much time she spends with me—something about me being a "bad influence"—but that didn't stop us from knocking out Dexter in a week.

But, as you can probably guess, a week of nothing but pizza and flash-frozen food products does an awful lot in the ways of a girls' waistline. Especially when it's in abundance. I'm wearing my fat pajamas, which I was pretty much exclusively wearing before I got home anyway since they were the only things that fit me comfortably starting two weeks ago.

My belly is warm and full as it sits lazily on top of my fat, bloated thighs. It's full of leftovers from last night, and breakfast from this morning. Dad made a run to Krispy Kreme for his two favorite girls, and I may or may not have taken the lion's share of the donuts. I burp, rubbing the flanks of my distended stomach with round, chubby hands in an attempt to ease the digestion of my sizeable snack.

I must look like a mess; half-dressed with my gut hanging out, no bra, too-tight pajama pants and my hair looking like a mop.

But hey, it's Summer, right?

"Hey Mel?" came the sweet voice of my little sister from the kitchen, "Did you eat all the donuts that Daddy brought us?"

"No." I burp unconvincingly into my hand, my cheeks inflating with the distinct scent of pepperoni and apple fritter, "Did you look in the box?"

Alice, my little sister, comes into the room holding the empty box. Her own jammies are looking pretty snug around that little potbelly she's been growing since Christmas. I guess maybe the poor thing does spend too much time around me. I know this might sound terrible, but ever since Alice started putting on weight we've never been closer. It kind of helps that she's been a total slug lately.

"Uh-huh." she hooked her eyebrow playfully and put her hand on her hip in a stealthy impression of Mom, "Forgive me if I don't exactly believe you."

"You're forgiven." we both laugh as she heads back into the kitchen...
12.title: Couch Crushing with Sister

121.content:
Suddenly, my phone starts belting out Beethoven's Fifth, and all of our good times are lost.

There, on the arm of the loveseat, sat my phone as it wore my mother's fake-smile profile picture. The ominous melody was only slightly indicative of the sheer amount of dread I felt when talking to that woman. She was a controlling, manipulative, ego-centric bitch who couldn't see anything about me other than as an extension of herself, and how much of a disappointment I was. And that was before I got fat.

"Hello Mother." I say flatly into the phone

"Oh good, I didn't interrupt you eating. For once." she snarked back, "If it's not too much trouble for you, Melanie, would you do me a favor and pick up a gallon of milk? We all drink it you know, it wouldn't kill you to leave a little for your mother in the morning."

Ugh.

"You know, the same Mother who works so hard to provide you with the opportunities you've so expertly wasted, and all the food you so unappreciatively choke down.."

Double ugh.

"Yeah Mom, me and Alice will go pick up some milk right now." I roll my eyes, "I'll get her some breakfast on the way back."

"Do not get her any breakfast on the way back!" she hollered, "You'll order way too much for her and you know she'll eat it all! That girl is on a diet the minute I get home, do you understand me?!"

Blah blah blah, blah blah...

"Yeah Mom, sure." I exhale, "Don't feed the sister. Got it. Love you too."

I hung up and threw the phone down beside me before throwing my head back and letting out a loud groan of immense displeasure.

"What was that about?" Alice asked from the kitchen, "Did you and Mother get into another fight?"

"No." I grumble, "Hey, put on your slippers, we've gotta go get... milk or something. I wasn't really paying attention."
121.title: My Mother Ruins My Morning

I pull into the gas station parking lot because fuck my mom. If she wanted to bitch at me, then I was going to use her debit card to buy over-priced gas station milk.

Alice stayed in the car, munching on her third bacon egg and cheese biscuit from McDonalds and taking sips off of my Coke. Because seriously, fuck my mom. She didn't have any right to tell me not to feed my sister because she would get fat. I seriously, seriously hate that woman.

"Mmm?" The cashier responded. "These came in earlier this week, made by some company's European branch, they're really pushin' the stuff..." The worker concluded wearily.

I only noticed the bars when I brought the over-priced gallon of milk to the counter. They were in a cardboard display decorated in a bright, almost garish orange wrapper, which is when I noticed it's name.

'Amplair?' Well it sure sounded like your average pretentious European name. Also on the cardboard display it supported a cheesy slogan printed on it. No mention of the company who made it though. Not on the packaging or display, all it said on the package was a guarantee about gaining as much bulk as a product like this could in the least amount of time.

It sounded 𝘌𝘹𝘵𝘳𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘭𝘺 suspicious, but I would be lying if I said it didn't peak my curiosity by a bit. I certainly knew several folks online who were gainers who used protein bars and shakes as a supplement to pack on flab rather than muscle, besides if all else fails it's not me who's paying for it!

"What the hell?." I stated while scratching my exposed lower-belly. "I'll take one."

The woman serving me, who never broke her mundane expression offered me the choice between two flavors: Dark chocolate and nuts or dark chocolate and sea salt, of course, being me, I went for both.

And on top of that, I got a bag of Skittles for Alice. Not only to get something for my little Sis but also just for one last fuck you to my Mom.

So I handed the cashier the debit card, packing my items in a carrier bag. Once she was done, I waddled my way back to the car, the jiggling from my gut garnering more than a few stares from other patrons stopping by for gas.

When I squeezed myself behind the wheel as Alice was polishing off the last of her breakfast, I pulled out my protein bar from the bag.

12133.content:
What the hell, right? I couldn't exactly blow all of Mom's money, but maybe ten bucks for a lottery ticket plus a few snacks would be enough to whet my appetite for revenge. I was already making her pay dealer mark-up on milk. I'm pretty sure if I went any higher, she'd kick me out.

"This and the most expensive lottery ticket you have." I said confidently to the cashier, "Here's my ID."

The Mel in the photo was a good seventy pounds lighter than me, but that was alright. I really, really don't think she actually checked to make sure my fat ass was nineteen anyway. I grabbed my treasure trove of goodies (and milk) and waddled out to the car, where I saw Alice expertly and appreciatively chowing down on the extra hashbrown I'd ordered for her.

"Did you get milk?" Alice asked with her mouth full

"A lot more than that." I grunted as I plopped down, my poor car's suspension groaning in agony, "I scored us a few snacks too."

"Won't Mother be mad?" Alice wiped her mouth of all the crumbs she'd accumulated throughout the course of her breakfast, wiping it on her shirt as it rose with the drastic swell of her chunky pot, "I thought that card was only supposed to be used in an emergency...?"

"Yeah, but she's always mad at me." I tossed my chubby sister a bag of Cheeto's Puffs, "Besides, I'm just comfort shopping. She knows I'll pay her back."

I think Alice expected me to crank the car and get home, but I was too focused on my Slim Jim to really care about getting back to the place where I was constantly nagged at for my eating habits. And for influencing Alice's eating habits. And for being alive, basically. The more I thought about it, the more I ate. I swallowed my Slim Jim in half a minute, flat, and moved on to the EL Fudge cookies I'd also purchased. And then to the mini bag of sour cream and onion chips.

She made me so mad. Just, constantly, all the time. I was really glad she finally got a job when Dad left, because that meant she'd be out of the house for at least a few hours every day of the week and I wouldn't have to put up with her bitching at me at literally every hour of the day to lose weight.

Stop eating! Munch. You're such a pig! Chomp. You're such a brat! Chew.

As I felt around for the last bit of snack food I'd bought (a double-pack of donut sticks, which I didn't realize Alice was already going to town on) I felt something else in the bag. Something I'd forgotten about...

I felt something else in the bag, something I'd almost forgotten about as my feelings got the better of me. The lottery ticket I'd bought had been crammed down between all the snacks, and now that they were gone, I could see the cheesy black and yellow graphic on the scratch off.

"Huh..." I pick it up out of the bag, "Hey squirt, do you still have the change from breakfast?"

"Hm?" Alice's cheeks were inflated with donut stick, and her lips were dotted with glazing, "Yeah, shure..."

She dropped all of thirty seven cents into my chubby hand. I picked out a penny and let the rest fall into my console. I placed the lottery ticket on the steering wheel and leaned in...

BEEEEEEEEEP!

Alice nearly jumped out of her seat, and she dropped her wrapping paper into the passenger side floorboard of my car. My gut was so big that I couldn't actually lean any further in than I already was, or I'd honk the horn with the my upper belly. Which was, admittedly, a pretty big turn on. Just the thought of me not fitting into this old car anymore was enough to get me a little... distracted.

"What are you doing?!" Alice yelped, breaking me from my trance

"You got a lottery ticket?" Alice asked, seemingly amazed by the mere prospect of it, "Won't... won't Mom be mad? You know how she feels about..." she gulped, "Gambling..."

"Yeah, but like I said, she's always mad at me."

I had to put the ticket on the middle console beside me, leaning over and folding my side-fat into three distinct tiers of flabby rolls. I wasn't used to such feats of athleticism, and the position was incredibly uncomfortable. But I managed to scratch off all the little squares on my ticket.

"So how do you know if you've won?" Alice asked innocently, wiping off her mouth, "All I see are a bunch of numbers."

"Well, I got three 7's, so I know we won something!" I said proudly, "So now we see what three 7's gets you..."

121332311.content:
"And, um...a-anything else, ma'am?"

"You bet! Alright, so you know everything I've ordered already? Get me another of ALL of it."

The waitress visibly swayed and her knees almost buckled, but she recovered admirably.

"OF COURSE, ma'am." she murmured, in a voice so chipper and with a smile so bright you could hardly even notice that her eye was twitching.

As she staggered off, I started to drum my already wonderfully full belly expectantly, eager to find out what my limits were, and see just how far I could stretch those limits in the span of a single meal...but not just any meal! This was my celebratory FEAST!

See, I've never been the girliest of girls, never dreamed of being a PRINCESS or anything in the usual fancy or romantic sense, but as far as my most decadent and unrealistic fattening fantasies that I;ll indulge in with daydreams (and...OTHER kinds of dreams) go, I'll admit I have sometimes pictured myself as a pampered, spoiled, big fat rich lady, obese royalty, never having to lift a finger or fret about WHERE all the excessive food would come from, paying others to spoil her even more rotten, the intriguing contrast of an aristocratic pig, all her wealth just funding her own appetite and luxurious weight gain. It was a fun mental image for me, alright? But I'm realistic, and even by 'erotic fantasy' standards, I knew that one was never gonna happen. I never doubted my ability to get fat as hell, but I also knew it would probably be a pretty glamor-free BLUE-COLLAR fatass life for me. I'd accepted that.

But NOW? I was RICH! Literally (barely, but LITERALLY) a millionaire! Suddenly, my pampered fat princess dream was lookin' downright ATTAINABLE! So I saw no reason to hold off on treating myself right.

Alas, I finally noticed that my dining companion for this feast was looking a little less enthusiastic.

"Alice? You okay? Oh! Shit, sorry, did YOU want more food, too?"

"What? NO! I'm stuffed! Although...well, that one appetizer WAS pretty good--but no! No, I'm just...this seems like A LOT of food, even for you. Even the waitress seems shocked."

"I'm used to alarmed wait staff, believe me. Maybe not quite as EXHAUSTED as this lady's getting, but...don't worry, I'll give her a REALLY good tip, okay?"

"That's the other thing, the food here is EXPENSIVE!"

"Because it's DELICIOUS! And they don't WANT you to know how high-calorie it all is, but TRUST ME--"

"But yes, expensive! Especially in the amounts that you're eating it! I just...look, I KNOW you're excited to finally be able to eat as much as you want with NO concern for being able to to pay the bill, or finding somebody else willing to pay the bill, or whatever. I understand. And a million dollars is a ton of money, but it's not INFINITE. I just don't want you to end up being one of those lottery winners who blows all their money and ends up in debt. I don't want you to waste it and have nothing to show for it."

"First off Alice, I guarantee I will have PLENTY to show for it..." I paused to jiggle my belly for emphasis, but realizing that it was already too full to jiggle properly, I just drummed on it meaningfully "...and as long as it adds PLENTY to my waist, it won't have been a WASTE. Get it? And besides, I'm not ALWAYS going to eat like this!"

"You mean, you're going to tone it down after tonight?"

"Of course! Like, not AMOUNT-wise, of course, but there's plenty of cheap jun and fast food to gorge on that's plenty yummy and plenty fattening, and just picture how much of THAT I'll be able to afford! I'm picturing it RIGHT NOW..."

Alice, resting her chin on one of her hands, stared hard at my belly.

"You are going to get just SO FAT now, aren't you?" she said in a resigned, but ultimately accepting, tone.

"I KNOW, RIGHT!? Hah!"

121332313.content:
Alright, before you judge me, I want you to realize that I had literally just won a million dollars. I was a little punch-drunk with all the possibilities that having all that money to myself entailed. Between getting my own place, getting ready to move out on my own, trying to find maybe a few investments to play around in, and keeping my fat face fed, I had a lot on my plate—literally and figuratively.

So I thought to myself, I shouldn’t just blow this money like I would anything else. Winning that lotto ticket was a once in a lifetime opportunity, which I then used to beget another once in a lifetime opportunity…

Hillary Heart tickets.

Oh my God, right?! I was so excited when I saw that she had started touring again—it had been so long since I picked up her first (and only) album. Heartbreaker was unstoppable back when I was in middle school. For real, I played that CD so much that I actually wore it out. I took it to Buttercombe with me and blared it through four years, pretty much making it my unofficial soundtrack, along with the sounds of my incessant eating and various furniture creaking beneath me. Her songs were—are!—so beautiful, and they inspired me to be true to myself. I firmly believe that, if it weren’t for Hillary Heart telling me that she wanted me to Be All I Could Be, I wouldn’t be the great big wonderful whale I eventually turned into.

So, long story short, I was just lounging around in my jammies (like all us massive millionaires are wont to do) when Alice looked over at her new laptop (courtesy of yours truly, since Mom raised the poor girl as a Luddite) and saw an ad on one of those trashy gossip sites that the HilHeart was coming back to the States after more than, like, half a decade. I flipped my shit, rolled off the couch, and bought two tickets right then and there.

Can you blame me? My childhood idol comes within, like, an hour of my hometown and I had enough money to buy out the whole stadium if I wanted to? I’m honestly surprised I just stopped at 2 tickets.

And backstage passes.

What? Hillary Heart was in town! Come on, you know you’d have done the same!

So, anyway, the night of the concert…
121332313.title: Concert Tickets & Immediate Gratification

1213323131.content:
So, anyway, on the night of the concert Alice and I arrived in style. Seriously, I was still in that “obvious” form of lotto-winnery, and I’m pretty sure that everybody knew it. On top of the rented stretch Hummer, I had probably already packed on another twenty pounds just from eating out as much as I wanted, as often as I wanted. Which made it super hard to fit into the concert clothes that I had bought a few weeks in advance of the event—making this probably the only time in my life that I was upset to outgrow clothing.

I stepped out of the car, causing the whole thing to tilt slightly to my side with all my weight gathered in one place. When I managed to heave my fat ass out of the seats, it actually groaned in relief. My body wouldn’t stop wobbling as I poured myself onto the pavement, shaking and jostling itself free of the tight Hot Topic tee that had begun to fail in covering me. It wrapped all the way around me, sure. But it was so constricting, and it cut into my tummy really noticeably around the waist. The shirt was made for girls about my size, and who happened to be Hillary Heart fans, but it didn’t seem to be up to the challenge of covering up my big fat tits and my big fat gut. The pink heart logo was stretched and distorted with all my titflesh, the outline of my bra very visible due to the pressure I put it under. The collar felt so tight around my neck and chins that I constantly kept adjusting it, which meant that I caused the hem to ride up on either one of my lovehandles. I’d tucked my gut into the waistband of my reinforced, custom-ordered jeans, but I doubted they would really last the night. One good meal in those, and I just knew that the button would give out…

Alice came tumbling out after me, dressed surprisingly casual for the first time in, like, ever. She was wearing one of my old tees from like Sophomore year at Buttercombe, the one she and Mom got me for Christmas. Naturally, I had outgrown it by the time Christmas rolled around, but it looked to fit Alice pretty well. Her long blonde hair curled over the shoulders, and the sleeves cut a little into her soft arms. Actually, it looked a little tight. Hanging out with me, and all my money, had already started to make my poor little sister a little chunky. But she looked good, dressed like a skinny mini-me—I almost believed she was a normal teenager.

As we jiggled our way onto the sidewalk up to the convention center, the stretch pulled out behind us and went to park—it’d be back by the time the show was over. It’s not like I was planning on going anywhere; I wasn’t going to miss a minute of my time with my teenaged girl crush.

“So… um… where do we go from here?” Alice whimpered, unaccustomed to life after dark like I was, “What do the tickets say?”

“Well squirt, we go up there, flash our tickets, and then we go get our front-row seats!” I said excitedly, my tummy gurgling in agreement, “Scratch that—go up there, flash tickets, grab some snacks and then we get our seats.”

I reached into my purse—I’d broken out my old pink-and-black bedazzled one from eighth grade just for the occasion—and whipped out our tickets. I gave them to Alice, considering that in all likelihood she’d be the first one to reach the hub area, and started puttering forward.

Let me just say that it should have been really obvious how much I was looking forward to this show by the fact that I was walking. Like, up steps and everything. My slow, pathetic waddle was only slower and pathetic-ier by the fact that I hadn’t done shit in about a month. I’d spent the past few weeks lounging around being big and beautiful, stuffing my face with anything I could get my hands on or pay people to get my hands on for me, pretty much making me as slow and useless as could be. I would have been embarrassed if I weren’t so into that. And it would have made me horny if it didn’t also make me incredibly tired.

Alice pretty much just walked at a modest pace (her little lovehandles making her own top ride up in the back) and did exactly like I told her. She went up to the guy, showed him we had tickets—probably with lots of stutterings and ums because, y’know, it’s Alice—and then walked right back to me before I was even halfway between where we’d been dropped off and the ticket house.

“He says we’re clear to go through.” Alice said brightly, “We just need to get some wristbands.”

“Cool.” I puffed, “You… You ‘xcited?”

“Y-Yeah! I am!” Alice smiled, “It’s my first concert, and Mother’s even letting me go without getting mad at me. How could I not be?”

“And yer… phew…” I wheezed, my entire body from my chins down rippling as I struggled to heave myself around, “You’re with yer… super cool… big sister… right, Al?”

“Right.” Alice said sweetly as she wrapped her arm around one of my skinny-girl’s-waist-thick upper arms, probably getting a little damp in the process, “You’re the best big sister ever.”

“You… know it.” I puffed, plodding along.

So the two of us waddled along, passing through the archway and actually getting inside the stadium…
1213323131.title: The Biggest Hillary Heart Fan Ever
