12133231311.content:
When I realized something.

Okay, I didn’t realize it immediately because I was sort of preoccupied with lugging all my largeness around. I was too out of breath to really think straight for the long (long long long) walk that I hadn’t entirely been expecting to seem uncharacteristically quiet. In fact, it wasn’t until I made it all the way to the little metal gate where the security guard stood to check my ticket and wristband that I realized we had gotten in entirely too easily.

After I’d caught my breath, I looked out into the seating area. It was this ocean of hard, uncomfortable looking plastic green seats that stared lifelessly back at me, twinged silver by the trim and armrests that shone slightly in the vibrant blue lighting. Even the mosh pit, where you had to (ugh) stand the whole time was empty. Nobody had shown up to the concert except for me and Alice, and I’d waddled away the minutes until it was just ten minutes til showtime.

“Um… Mel?” Alice whispered, as if not to offend the guard, “Where are all the people?”

How could this be?! Hillary Heart was like… was like… the Madonna of my generation. I mean, she only had ten songs out, but they were so good! Who cared if it took her seven years to come out with a new one? They were worth every year and change! At least they were to me, anyway.

“I… I don’t know.” I puffed, “Ughh… come on, let’s go get our seats…”

So the two of us got our wristbands (mine was tight enough to cut into my fat every time I bent my wrist) and started shimmying through the empty seats, looking for our designated spots in the empty auditorium. My underbelly, tucked beneath my jeans, brushed against the back of the chairs as it oozed over into what would have been someone’s personal space. My ass was so fat that I could feel the chairs behind me scraping against it. Seriously, if I wasn’t so confused, this would have been a perfect time for some immodest abuse of my generous size. But, since I was so distraught, I decided to just get to my seat and plop down.

A-24 was near enough to the center of the row that I didn’t care to bitch. But I actually wound up taking up both of A-24 and A-25, with some room to spare. My ass had been growing non-stop lately, and it didn’t look like the disinterested security guard was going to say anything about me taking up somebody else’s seat.

Seriously, where was everyone? I know I didn’t accidentally spent half my million buying out the auditorium like I’d joked about doing. Why was it just me and Alice?

As we sat there for a minute, both a little huffy and puffy from all the walking we weren’t used to, Alice and I quietly speculated the suspicious lack of spectators amongst ourselves.

“Maybe they’re all together?” Alice whispered behind her hand, “Like some kind of fan club?”

“I would have known if there was a fan club.” I whispered back, “And they would have been here hours ago—it’s almost showtime, why are we still the only ones here?”

We waited. And we waited. And we waited. I had never been so anxious to share something like this with a screaming crowd before in my life, and nobody was showing up. Which was weird because, when she went on her hiatus, Hillary Heart had a pretty decent sized following back here in the States. I mean, just because my old friends from middle school weren’t as obsessive as I was didn’t mean her music wasn’t good. So what could have warranted my fat ass being the only one to buy tickets?

After a few more minutes of waiting…
12133231311.title: Mel and Alice and the Empty Auditorium

choices: She went edgy and modern—Ew! No wonder no one else came, she scared them away!
Poor Hillary Heart, looking absolute crushed staring at all those empty seats...
Apparently I wasn't the only one who packed on a ton of weight in seven years!
121332313111.content:
After a few more minutes of waiting, despite the empty auditorium, the whole room dimmed as the bright blue spotlights swiveled. The familiar Hillary Heart logo stretched across the black banner was encircled with the light, which slowly shifted to a pinkish hue as the familiar beat to All You Can Be began to thump in the background. My belly quivered, catching the sound like a glass of water and rippling with the effect. I had literally never been sad to hear this song before, but I was getting the sinking feeling that I was about to watch my favorite musician have a record-shattering breakdown.

Alice and I exchanged nervous glances as the music continued, the curtains drawing to cover the stage in hopes of building a dramatic reveal for the audience of two tubby teens.

Hello loves—it’s been far, far too long! a familiar voice came over the P.A. system, just above the thumping bass, But I’m back babies, ready to rock the States once more, and ready to groove just for you; my loyal fans.

“Do you think she—“ Alice whispered, I shushed her.

And now, the moment you’ve waited seven long years for… I couldn’t tell if the voice in the roof was overwhelmingly loud or the room was just that empty, The return of the one... the only… HILLARY HEAAAAAART!!

Alice and I covered our ears at the sudden announcement, taken by surprise of the incredible volume. I winced as the curtains drew back once more, and I was shocked to see...
121332313111.title: Our Own Private Recital?

choices: We go backstage and try to cheer Hillary up.
We go backstage, but we're stopped by security along the way.
We go backstage, but she's already left!
1213323131112.content:
I was shocked to see how crushed and absolutely broken Hillary Heart—my teenaged idol—looked as the curtain rose. The completely silent auditorium echoed with the booming announcement of her triumphant return, and yet only Alice and I were there to cheer for her.

But the real kicker was that not only could I see her down on the stage, I could make out every second of heartbreak in Hi-Def on the big screens that hung above the railings. Her perfect, freckled face fell miles to the floor as her brown eyes watered pitifully. She just looked around, confused at first but eventually she just sort of settled into an intense sort of visible sadness. Her eyes glistened in the lighting—I could swear she was about to cry.

But that didn’t stop me and Alice from giving her the greeting she deserved. I used more energy cheering her on—waving my fat arms and shaking my enormous tits—than I had in months. Our voices carried through the bleachers, replacing the dying echo of Hillary’s booming voice. We cheered for probably a minute straight before I finally got tired, nestling back into the tight confines of my seat(s), panting and wheezing up a storm.

It didn’t look to have done much.

“Are you…” the British pop (former) idol’s voice cracked audibly as she spoke into the microphone, storming up to the edge of the stage as if to get a better look at her biggest fans, “Are you the only ones who showed up?”

“U-Um…no?” Alice hollered down, “They’re, uh… in the… um…”

“You are!” Hillary’s face curled up, her lips stretching into the biggest frown I’d ever seen in person as tears rolled down her cheeks, “Wh…Why didn’t anyone show up?!”

I really didn’t figure that to be a rhetorical question, but it may as well have been. She bolted off the stage, sobbing so loud that she didn’t need the microphone for us to hear her bawling all the way back to her trailer. Alice and I just sort of sat there, exchanging awkward glances of equal parts pity and sadness over the fate of my fallen idol.

“Should we… should we do something?” Alice finally spoke up, her chubby cheeks flush with embarrassment, “I feel pretty bad for her.”

“Me too…” I said, still a little winded from flailing my fat limbs around, “I mean, I didn’t think we’d be the only ones to show up…”

Alice and I debated silently on whether or not to get involved. I could tell by her worried looks and fidgeting form that she would have very much liked to help my idol feel better, but couldn’t exactly think of what we could have done. I, on the other hand, was far more tenacious and creative when it came to going outside my comfort zone.

“Hey Squirt, help me up.” I said rather suddenly

“Wh-What are we gonna do?” she asked, her muffin top quivering as she rose to her feet

"Go backstage, duh." I whipped out tickets out from between my tits, "We've got VIP passes."
1213323131112.title: Fretting over our Fallen Idol

choices: Alice and I take Hillary out on the town for some comfort food—American style!
We head back to my new apartment for a night in! Snacks included.
We stay backstage—Hillary scored some alcohol...
12133231311121.content:
There isn’t really much more to say after that. Alice helped me up and helped me waddle my fat ass down the stage and back up a small flight of stairs until we were in the backstage area. The security guy—a Steve Wilkos lookalike with all the charisma of Steve Wilkos authentic—tried to give me and my little sister the business before I flashed him our backstage passes.

“Hey, come on ladies, don’t be those fans.” He said with a flash of compassion in his beady Steve Wilkos eyes, “Ms. Heart’s obviously not in the mood for any visitors.”

“It’s fine, Frank.” came a familiar voice from behind the dressing room door, ”Let ‘em in…”

I would have been offended at the flippancy in Hillary’s tone if 1) she hadn’t just embarrassed herself in front of the only two people who cared enough to show up to the first stop on her revival tour and 2) I wasn’t about to meet my hero from ages 14 ‘til death.

Frank let out a deep sigh and turned his muscle mass to the side, having to step back a few times to allow my superior bulk room to wiggle through. With Alice tagging along behind me, apologizing to Not-Steve quietly, I stepped up to the door so closely that I could have used my belly as a battering ram if I needed to. I rose one flabby arm and knocked as gingerly as I could on the crappy hollow door. I felt footsteps on the other side, and soon the door opened to reveal my favorite pop superstar, her outfit already disheveled and her mascara running so much I would have counted it as exercise.

“What do you want?” she asked to me—the super-sized superfan currently eclipsing her doorway, “I’m not really in the mood to give autographs right now, ladies.”

“O-Oh no, nothing like that!” I stammered, trashing the idea of her signing my tits, “It’s just… well… y’know, we wanted to… check up on you. You looked pretty down.”

“We? I don’t see a—” Hillary raised a red eyebrow as here Alice waved her arms behind me, “—oh, there she is.”

“My sister and I, we’re just such huge fans.” I did my best to not seem like I was gushing, but I don’t think that I was doing a very good job of not crossing into ‘crazy-450-pound-fan’ territory, “I-I know, at least with me, that your music has helped me a lot. So my sister and I, we… wanted to come cheer you up.”

Here Hillary huffed and leaned against the doorway, sniffling down snot as she wiped her eyes with the back of a thoroughly mascara soaked hand. She crossed her arms defensively against us, lowering her head down slightly as she stood there, battling my belly for space.

“Well I don’t rightfully see how that’s possible…” she harrumphed, “But that is awfully sweet… and, let’s be honest, I’ve got about four hours to kill, don’t I?”

I tried my very best not to smile at that—it would have made me seem like a terrible, awful human being—but I couldn’t exactly help it. Here we (mostly I!) were talking to a celebrity. Personally. I was torn between feeling terrible about this whole thing happening and feeling great that nobody else showed up!

Hillary looked down, sighed, and then looked back up at me again—her eyes looking much drier.

“Well, what did you have in mind?”
12133231311121.title: Super-Sized Super Fans to the Rescue!

choices: Hillary ordered some greasy, fatty, all-american comfort food!
Hillary got up and went to the bathroom to bawl her eyes out some more
Hillary ordered a water, and proceeded to make fun of me and Alice
121332313111211.content:
I ask you, is there anything that can lift one’s spirits like a good old fashioned binge at Waffle House?

I mean, it was probably a little beneath Hillary (she said so multiple times) but it wasn’t like she had anything better to do. There was one right off the interstate we had to take to get home, so it seemed like a natural choice. Me, Alice, and Hillary friggin’ Heart piled into the back of my rent-a-limo and sputtered off towards the Awful Waffle—singing her songs from Heartbreaker along the way to help cheer her up. So fucking cool.

Another so fucking cool moment? I got to roll up to Waffle House in a stretch Hummer limo. Seriously, try it sometime.

Anyway, so we went inside and scored ourselves a table by the window (I had long known that this particular chain of restaurants’ booths were not Mel-Friendly) and went right to work. It was a pretty dead night—just a few interchangeable rednecks spitter-spattered here and there, but it wasn’t late enough for the weirdos to start showing up—so we were seen pretty quickly.

“I’ll have three All-Star Breakfasts.” I said confidently to our waitress, “One with bacon, one with sausage, and one with ham. All scrambled, and can you put a little cheese in my eggs? I’ll pay extra. Oh! And can I get two waffles with each? I’m kinda hungry.”

With that, I gave a superior pat to my gut as it beached itself on the table in front of me. Our server’s eyes looked like they were going to pop out of her head as I smirked proudly at my massive order. When I asked for a Diet Coke at the end, I thought she was going to lose it!

“I’ll just have the Texas Chicken Melt… no onions please?” Chubby little Alice said softly, “And, um… c-can I also get a waffle with that? I kind’ve want a waffle now…”

All eyes turned to Hillary, who seemed hardly phased by my ridiculous order. In fact, she seemed to be off in her own little world. I couldn’t tell if she was staring at the menu trying to figure out what to get, silently judging my sister and I for being such fatties, or if she was still getting over her no-show of an audience.

I got my answer when…
121332313111211.title: Hillary Heart at the Waffle House

She had gotten huge! She was my size!
She was MASSIVE! I barely recognized her!
12133231313.content:
So the two of us waddled along, passing through the archway and actually getting inside the stadium…

And...wow. It kind of both hit us at once. There were a lot of fat people here. A Lot. Everything from chubby bunnies to massive whales, all shuffling about carrying piles of vendor trash food for which....there were also a lot.

Rows upon rows of the most fattening greasy sugary country fair bumpkin fast food lined the stadium walls. This place was HEAVEN. Or Hell for mother. But all the same to me.

"Is this...normal?" Alice paused, scratching her neck as we both waddled through a throng of swollen concert goers.

"Not that I remember..Might just be the place.." I puffed. God everything looked so good. And everyone looked like they were enjoying it! Multiple chins jiggled and chewed, lines of fatties wobbled as they waited their turn for funnel cakes. There were multiple people leaning against pillars and walls rubbing overstuffed guts, already having their fill before the music even started. If this was what Heart concerts were going to be like from now on I just might have to follow her entire tour! "Come on...let's stock up.."

With time to spare, Alice and I went to work. Corn dogs, pizza slices, fried ores, funnel cakes, you name it. My sister and I piled it high. Waddling with a leaning tower of fattening foods we eventually met back in the middle where we admired each others respective haul. Obviously mine was bigger, Alice had held back as usual. But I was determined to make a fatty out of her yet.

"Come on, let's go find out seats." Alice beckoned, her arms stuffed with food and drink as we made our way with the crowd. Step, by step, by step. This was exhausting! My desire for front row seats was suddenly being tempered by the knowledge that I had to WALK there, carrying about 20 pounds of food, being tugged along by my sister a quarter of my size. After what seemed like an eternity of endless walking I suddenly felt Alice elbow me in the gut. "Mel...check out these seats."

Uuuuuggghhh...I had a feeling what I was supposed to be looking at. For a long time now my ass had been inflating like a hot air balloon. And seating had become a...challenge. Sometimes I needed two chairs, sometimes I needed a bench, and suddenly I was realizing that I probably should have bought three tickets. One for my sister, and one for each of my cheeks.

Yet...to my shock and surprise...they were massive. At least for concert seats. Easily enough to seat me with some space, Alice was rolling around in space and comfort in the massive chair. So much so we sat all the food between us in the space she left.

So, THAT problem solved, we both started munching as the show rolled on eager to finally see the main attraction.. As the lights dimmed a voice rang over the loudspeakers.

Hello loves—it’s been far, far too long! a familiar voice came over the P.A. system. Though it seemed..huskier than I remember, But I’m back babies, ready to rock the States once more, and ready to groove just for you; my loyal fans.'

“Do you think she—“ Alice whispered, I shushed her.

And now, the moment you’ve waited seven long years for…The return of the one... the only… HILLARY HEAAAAAART!!

Alice and I covered our ears at the sudden announcement, taken by surprise of the incredible volume. I winced as the curtains drew back once more, and I was shocked to see...
12133231313.title: A Big Crowd

choices: Yes! There's been a HUGE size acceptance movement, with Hillary at the helm!
Nope! Hillary Heart just got fat—and I loved it!
121332313132.content:
When I was in middle school, before I packed up and moved to Buttercombe, I had this poster of Hillary Heart on my wall.

It was bright pink and I got it specially ordered over the internet, all the way from England. It was a present from my Dad and I loved it and I'll never forgive that bitch Rachel Elvers for getting mustard all over it. It was a picture of Hillary Heart, circa my seventh grade year, laying sensually on top of two neon H's, enclosed in a bright pink neon heart. She was all decked out in her best Euro-punk gear, with her long beautiful red hair and her freckles all photo-shopped and prominent. I remember she had on a tie and it dangled over the little x between the H's. She was what a lot of people would have considered beautiful—and the reason I bugged my Mom for two years straight to let me dye my hair red.

The woman on the stage, slowly being unveiled by the collapsing curtains, was decidedly not the same girl that I remembered from my bedroom or dorm. In fact, she may have been three...four times the woman that I remembered from my first concert experience!

The bright lights outlined her shape spectacularly, her mighty weight eclipsing her from the crowd. She was big—maybe bigger than I was. She was vaguely spherical in shape, with the distinction of two definitive bulges on either side of her, just below her head, that were no doubt her legendary breasts. Surely enough as the lights dimmed and more of her could be looked at directly, Hillary Heart's heaving hooters of her youth had absolutely exploded into two massive milky mams, speckled with freckles and resting on either side of an impressively immense gut. It rested against her pillowy thighs and folded into two very distinct tiers as it sagged under its incredible weight. She took a slow, thundering step forward and it caught against her knee, wobbling and rippling with the impact. Her legs alone may have been as wide around as Alice was... or rather, Alice had been before I got a hold of her.

I was so confused! I looked into the multiply-chinned face of my enormous idol as she smiled and waved at the crowd, her armwings rippling and wobbling with the motion.

That couldn't have been...

Surely it wasn't...

But it was!

"I don't, um..." Alice bit her bottom lip, "I don't remember her looking like that on your poster."

"Sh-She didn't!" I blinked, staring my big beautiful idol up and down, up and down over and over in hopes of registering what had happened, "I guess I wasn't the only one who went and got fat after seven years, huh?"

In retrospect, that really did a bit to explain the sudden surge of fatass fans in the crowd. Myself excluded, we were a rather large group, and I couldn't quite place why. When I was in middle school, everyone liked Hillary Heart. I mean, some of us did. My friends and I did. But we weren't all fat (at least, I wasn't. Not then, anyway).

And it wasn't like I was upset or anything. Seriously, no, go Hillary! But how had something like this slipped through my fingers?

Had I missed something?
121332313132.title: Heart Breaker, Earth Quaker

choices: I, predictably, make a pretty sizeable hog out of myself
Woah, hey, Alice is trying to bogart all our food!
Someone at BK recognizes me, it's an old friend from middle school!
122.content:
"Yeah, I'll have ten bacon double cheeseburgers, four orders of chicken nuggets, four spicy Chicken Jrs, two orders of large fries, a large Coke and... hey, Alice, what do you want to drink?"

"Sprite."

"And a large Sprite."

We had a sudden hankering for a change of scenery in addition to our hankering for greasy fast food. Mom was always telling us to get out more anyway. I don't see how she could have any problem with us taking a nice Monday morning drive down to Burger King. We were even eating off the value menu. That's economical, right there.

It took, like, fifteen minutes for all of our food to be ready. Plenty of time for my feet to get tired. So while Alice waited, I went ahead and scored us a booth by the window. We fixed ourselves up a little so we didn't look like total slobs, but I hadn't bothered to change out of my pajamas, so my too-tight tank top was still riding up to very immodest levels. It squished against the cold glass of the window as I sandwiched myself into the booth, waiting for Alice to return with our greasy brunch.

"Order up." Alice said excitedly as she placed the tray down on the table...
122.title: Breakfast with the King

choices: "I'm trying to... maybe... gain weight...too?"
"Sorry, I don't know what came over me... I guess I'm just hungry is all."
"Wow, I guess Mother's right--you ARE rubbing off on me!"
1222.content:
I'd been craving this all morning. Bacon, beef, cheese, empty carbs and grease-- the five major food groups of every fat girl's breakfast all sandwiched into a burger the size of my chubby fist. I've basically been living like this ever since I got home from Buttercombe, and it's been great. They had really nice, fancy food for every meal. But you can't beat an old-fashioned American burger straight from the King himself. But as much as I love me a good cheeseburger, I love my sister more.

Until said sister encroaches on said cheeseburger. Then things get a little complicated.

Look, I'm not anyone to criticize anyone's eating habits. Mine are atrocious. But then again, I'm actively trying to put on as much weigh as possible by cramming food into my stomach in an efficient time so I can get back to eating sooner. I've gone whole hog many a time in public places. There are times (more than I'd like to admit) that I've lost myself in gluttony, eyes glazed over and everything while I ate just about anything within line of sight. And that's totally cool because it's (usually) my food that I'm eating.

But when my sixteen year old sister is doing it, it looks a little strange.

Granted, my eating habits may have rubbed off on Alice just a little bit since about Christmas or so. And yeah, she might have put on a little weight since then. But I'd been home for about a week, and I'd never seen Alice just... stuff food into her mouth like that. Her little pink lips separated and she just started shoving food into her mouth like a regular pro, never really stopping and picking up momentum on the way! Pretty soon she was halfway done with her own rations..

...and that's when she tried to make a grab at my bacon double cheeseburger.

"Hey squirt, mind your manners!" I snapped, smacking her hand away from my sloppily wrapped grease burger, "Jeezus Al, what's gotten into you?"

"Sorry." she whimpered, rubbing the back of her little hand, moving quietly back to grazing on the mountain of fries we had whittled down into a hill.

"It's cool, just... ask first, you know?" I take a big, greedy bite, "I mean, you probably won't get any. But asking helps. What's gotten into you, anyway? You never eat this much. At least, not in such a small stretch of time. Usually you kind of graze instead of stuffing it all in your face at once."

Alice turned to me and answered...
1222.title: Sister Stuffing

choices: help me? I've been trying for months, and all I have is a pot-belly..."
not tell Mother?" She'd get really mad at me and put me on a diet..."
maybe buy me seconds? I'm starving..."
12221.content:
"I'm just trying to...gain weight...too?" Alice squeaked, "Maybe?"

I was so surprised by Alice's answer that I nearly choked on my burger. The little bit that was left got lodged in my windpipe, and I spent a solid two minutes as a big fat coughing mess.

Alice was trying to get... fat?

"I know, I know, it sounds so...weird. I-I mean, not to you but..." Alice scrunched up her face, but I could see a little smile between her cheeks as they started to redden, "I mean, I started off just wanting to stuff myself because it felt good. But then when I started to put on weight, a-and I saw how big and round my belly was getting I felt... I felt..." she looked back up at me, her face all mischevious and small, "sexy... is that weird?"

"N-No!" I stammered, still adjusting to the shock, "Not at all just... I mean... so you... you want to get fat? Like... as fat as me?"

"I don't... I don't know." I could tell how uncomfortable my sister was telling me all this, "I-I mean, I've never been... bigger... before. I've pictured it in my head... being as, um... as big as you, and it um..." she laughed nervously as her face turned a darker shade of crimson, "I'd really... really like to be."

All I could do was stare at my sister, my mouth hung open and my fries untouched.

"B-But I don't know. I-It's stupid, just forget I said anything." she shook her head and crumpled up her trash, "L-Let's just go home."

"Hey Al, calm down." I said to my tearful sister, touching the back of her hand softly, "It's okay. I of all the people you could have talked to about this totally understand where you're coming from."

"Y-Yeah..." she sniffled, "You're right..."

I remember when I came out to my sister, about my fetish. It was last Summer, right before my Senior year at Buttercombe. I came back a good seventy pounds bigger than I had been at Christmas, and I was so fucking fat that I broke a chair in the dining room with my massive ass. My Mom bitched at me and sent me to my room, and Alice came in to check on me and I told her everything. About Buttercombe, about getting fat, and about how much I loved it.

I just... I had no idea that one day we'd be having the same conversation, just flipped around.

"Hey Mel?" Alice squeaked, sniffling up nervous tears, "D-Do you think you could...
12221.title: Alice the Wannabe Fattie

choices: I agreed and took Alice under my wing, setting her on the tracks to fat-girlness
I refused, sparking a long feud between us as Alice set out to be the Fat Sister
I needed a day to think about this...
122211.content:
"You want me to help you?" I repeated dumbly.

Seriously, where was all of this coming from? For as long as I could remember, Alice had been this quiet, mousy girl who could barely raise her voice if she tried. I mean yeah, she'd been a lot more confident lately, but this seemed like a hugely out of character moment for her at the time.

"Well yeah, I mean... you're the only person I know who wouldn't think I was a..." Alice shrunk into her shoulder, "...a freak. You know?"

I did know. I remember when I told my roommate back at Buttercombe Academy about my epiphane about my weight, and she just laughed at me (didn't stop that preppy bitch from gaining another fifty pounds that year, though.). I knew I couldn't exactly run around and tell everyone that I got off on being fat, but I distinctly remembered being able to trust Alice. She didn't tell Mom or Dad, and she never brought it up unless I did. She covered for me when I snuck snacks out of the fridge, and always played lookout when I was hiding from Mom.

So why did all of this feel so... weird?

I mean, I wanted to be fat. I wanted to be so big that I couldn't get out of bed. In fact, the very thought of being pinned down under my own blubber, stuffing myself while someone else took care of me was enough to make me physically aroused. But I didn't know if I wanted that for Alice, my sweet little sixteen year old sister.

"Look, Alice..." I started, crumpling up my wrapping paper, "This isn't something to be taken lightly... obviously."

I rolled up my t-shirt over my belly and untucked it from my pajama pants, letting it flop out into the empty space provided by my tree-trunk thighs. It gurgled and churned as it processed my greasy, fast-food breakfast, rounded and a little firmer than it had been this morning. I caressed it with both hands, jostling it in place.

"This? All of this? It's a huge commitment." I said softly, "I'm fat. Really fat. And I'm only gonna get fatter. And I'm okay with it, even knowing that there are all kinds of nasty side-effects. I just don't want you to gain fifty pounds and realize that you hate it."

"I won't." Alice blinked her big blue eyes at me, a familiar fire burning bright behind them, "It's just... I've been trying so hard for so long, and all I have is this little pot-belly."

Alice rolled up her own shirt and showed me the damage. She'd been lugging around this round, swollen belly ever since I got home. It was soft and pale and jiggly. There were other areas of gain too--I noticed Alice wasn't wearing the new jeans she got for Christmas at all. Her hips had put some on too, and I noticed her picking at her bra strap a lot. But more or less, she was right. Alice was definitely belly-heavy.

"You see? All I have is a tummy..." Alice said dejectedly, a hint of desperation in her voice, before she looked back up at me, "You're the best gainer I know... and I'd really appreciate your help."
122211.title: Alice's Quest in Acquiring Mass

choices: First lesson: Keep yourself stuffed between meals
First lesson: Midnight snacking
1222111.content:
"W-What? My help?" I stuttered. "What the hell are you expecting me to do, anyways?"

"Anything you can, Mel" Alice moved her hands to her belly. "Just look at this thing, I've been feeding it for months now and it has not barely grown at all!" "Hey Al? Your um... your tits are on the pizza." I poked my not-so-little sister in the flabby arm, "You might wanna take care of that."

Over the past few weeks, against my own better judgement, I'd been helping my sister pack on weight. And I was proud to say (in a weird way) that by following everything I told her to do, Alice had eaten herself into quite the little chubster. Forty pounds in two months--on top of the twenty-ish or so she'd put on while I finished out my last year at prep school. That meant that, with my help, Alice was a whole sixty pounds heavier than she had been this time last year.

Not a bad gain for a girl with almost no head start, right?

"Mmm... this pizza's good." Alice said thickly, scarfing down the greasy slice of empty calories and grease, "Maybe my boobs should be toppings."

"Don't be weird, Al." I nudged her in the arm, using my superior fat girl strength to make her rock slightly in her seat, "And don't hog all the pizza either. I paid for it."

All Summer, I'd had Alice doing as I did. Eating what I ate, when I ate, and matching me bite for bite. She'd been laying out on the couch with me for hours on end, vegging out in front of Netflix while she grazed on some of my high-cal snacks. Basically, Alice had been playing monkey-see monkey-do with me, and all it had done was turn her into a lazy chubster.

Her face had become round and puffy, and it got red at even the slightest amount of exertion. Her little double chin had sprouted and then bloomed into a full-on jowl that wobbled whenever she spoke. Alice's arms had become useless and soft, and her ass had become fat and wide. Her chest, as you've probably already guessed by now, had fucking ballooned though; and I didn't quite get that. We Carlyle women tended to be pretty bottom-heavy (citing myself, my Aunt Rhonda, and my Mom's pregnancy photos as sources) but Alice broke the mold with her big fat tits. Sure, her gut was getting pretty big too. She was up to wearing some of Dad's old clothes. But her breasts were just... well, big enough to fall into some pizza and her not know it.

I'd turned my sister into a bonafide fat girl, alright. And judging by the way she happily ate her boob pizza (and the fact that she had started locking her doors after big meals) I could only guess that she was only just beginning.

The thing was, my own gain had more or less halted. I was so used to stuffing my face at Buttercombe's expense that there was no way my (Mom's) wallet could keep up with me. I'd only put on about five pounds this Summer, thanks to my Single White Female mom only having one source of income. Ugh.

"Hey." Alice said as she stared unblinkingly at the television screen, "You want to grab me some Cheezits?"

"Sure." I burped, palming the box with my hand, "Save some for me, okay?"

"Pff." Alice snorted, "No way. These are my favorite."

"Look, Alice..." I did my best to let her down gently, "I don't know what to tell you. If you want to get fat, that's fine. But I really would rather not be a part of it."

It was at that point that Alice's eyes got wider than I'd ever seen them in my entire life. I don't know if it was shock or anger or she was holding back a psychotic rage manifested from all the years of Mom telling her what to do or what, but I just remember her being more than a little scary at the moment. Of course, it didn't register to me at the time, and she wasn't saying anything, and I really really hate awkward silences.

"It's just... y'know, I don't think you're really doing this because you want to." I continued, "I think you're trying to gain weight... to be like me."

"What?" she asked flatly, her little voice shaking "Why would you even say that?"

"Well, like... you always do what I do." I said matter-of-factly, "I get it, I'm your big sister and you love me, but you can't just do... this on a whim."

I shook my stomach for emphasis, upsetting the natural balance of food in my belly and causing me to burp very loudly. Alice didn't look any less pissed at me.

"It's not a whim!" she said little louder than she probably would have liked, "And I do not do everything because you do it! I... I... I just want to be fat, okay?!"

"Jeez squirt, calm down." I looked around, and we were attracting some stares, "Look, I didn't say you couldn't gain weight on your own. But if Mom ever found out that I was plumping you up? She'd kick me out on my big fat ass!"

"So you're not going to do it because Mother wouldn't approve?" Alice snarled back at me, uncharacteristically angry with me, "Since when has that ever stopped you before?"

"Look, it's just... I said no, okay?" I stood my ground (figuratively) and cross my arms beneath my huge tits, "I love you a lot, Alice. I missed you while I was away, and I've had a lot of fun this week. But I'm not going to help you get fat. I'll still lay around on the couch with you, and I'll still front the bill for pizza, but that's it."

"B-But... but Mel!" Alice whined, tears welling up in her eyes, "I just..."

"No." I restated, "I'm not going to help you."

There was a long, awkward pause between the two of us. Which was weird, because we'd always been super close. I wasn't quite capable of fathoming that Alice might have developed some kind of problem with me after that, because she'd always been my little sister who followed me around and did whatever I did.

Let me say it again, what I did was out of love. I didn't want my sister turning eighteen at three hundred pounds like I did, not because I wasn't a bomb-ass bitch, but because that's my sister. I got lots of stares, yeah, but most of them weren't positive. I mean, people acknowledging how fat I was, positively or negatively, was basically my #3 turn on (behind food and belly-rubs) but Alice was a real sweetheart. She freaked out when someone told her she had big feet, and she was talking about being bigger than I was. All those nasty catcalls would have killed her. Plus, if anything ever happened to her because of her weight, I'd never forgive myself...

"Hey..." I ended the silence after everyone in Burger King had gone back to not staring at the four hundred pound white whale and her chubby little sister, "We cool, Squirt?"

"Yeah." Alice spat, "We're cool."

I had no idea that after that day, my relationship with Alice would never be the same again.

I went to go after her, and get some answers out of her, (you put your +400 lbs in front of a doorway and see if you don’t get some answers,) but she’d already slammed the door closed, heading out the back door of the house all together.

My mind reeled! Alice hadn’t given up on gaining like me! In fact she was doing a damn good job of it! It took a second, to realize how she'd done it, I’ll be the first to admit it’s a lot harder to gain at home under the strict watch of Mom but it wasn’t impossible, but to do so and keep it from me, who practically never left the house unless it was to go eat out, it was a shock! I thought things had been cool between us, but I suppose my sister is nothing if not strong-minded and she’d obviously found a way…

It only took a few seconds for me to figure it out. My sneaky sister must eating all the while she said she was exercising! That was just…just SO wrong on SO many levels! Like mixing dark matter, and anti-matter or something, two forces of the universe are the opposite side of the scale (literally!) So I knew when she was sneaking away to go stuff herself, but HOW could she get so big in such a short of time?

I figured there was either one of a few ways she was doing it...

1222112321.content:
Undoubtedly the person, who’d arrived just on time to pick up Alice, and from what I could tell, been sneaking Alice out on her new sustenance splurges HAD to be Hannah Hammond.

I mean, I could recognize Hannah Hamond’s figure from even a mile away too. She was sort of my roomie my Senior year in Buttercombe…And while It took me a bit to realize Hannah Hammond, is a notorious obesophile—she absolutely loves anything and everything about people getting fat. So the two of us, we were a match made in heaven! The thing was though, she didn’t live anywhere near where Alice and I lived, but now she was here, hanging out with my sister and something was up, well other than my sister’s weight.

As the car pulled away I immediately hurried back home, ready to punch up her contact info as soon as my fat fingers got to my phone…I wouldn’t have too though as it Hannah was already calling me…

“Hannah!” I began, trying to remember why in fact I’d gone zero contact with her….”What are you doing with my sister!?”

“Oh, Mel…Four months and not a single call? Mel, I’m hurt!” said Hannah from the other end, her tone speaking of feigned sorrow.

“Look Hannah I know things between us didn’t end so well…” I began vaguely recalling some unfriendly memories towards right around graduation time...

“I MADE YOU!” she wailed unexpectedly, her voice going from controlled and cool, to piercing and scratchy. “I did everything for you for a whole school year, made you into the beautiful hunk of lard you are today, and what’s the thanks I get come graduation? “I didn’t say you could grope my butt Hanna, I’m not your plaything Hannah, let’s just be friends Hannah …” she said her voice growing more mocking with every imitation she did of me, in the background I could hear faint chewing noises, assumedly Alice was already eating in the back of Hannah’s limo.

Oh. Right. Her controlling psycho bitch side…that was why. [*Editor’s Note: At least for this storylines sake it is TRUE BELIEVERS]

“*Sniff* But it’s fine now really.” She continued her voice now back to its cool and usual lovey dovey tone. “Cause I’ve got something-uh- someone even better now….From what she’s told me your sister Alice has got a bit of a grudge against you~…”

I gasped everything clicking in my head, and I had a sinking feeling in the bottom most part of my stomach…

“Hmm, and I’m just the woman to feed her needs. I’ve got a whole wonderful new Carlyle to stuff to my heart’s content. I mean imagine my surprise, when I happened to get a poke online, and then a note from Mel Carlyle’s sister. Of course I had to give her MY number, and well my family does have a hotel chain in just about every tri-state-area so of course it was not trouble to drop on by for a few weeks I mean I just had to…” her flirty voice oozing over her own heinous plot.

“…Hannah you’re crazy.” I spat, jolted by my jilted roomies plot.

“No Mel, you’re just jealous! Your sister and I are going to have a nice long summer studying abroad, and I do mean studying a broad, a certain classy broad all right, along with every restaurant in Paris. Hmm~ And by the time she heads back home for school she’ll be broad in all the right places…"

-Wait what do you mean France?”

“Oh she didn’t tell you? You are good at keeping a secret Alice!” I heard a muffled giggle in the background and a high five.

“Well you SHE obviously didn’t tell YOU there’s no way in HELL our Mom would ever give Alice the okay on something like that.”

“Oh, well off course not,…But say if I paid for it, and she mentioned something or other about studying the latest designs of the fashion of Paris for some school scholarship project or whatever, we’re betting your Mom will be very excited by the idea!”

Flabbergasted I could only remain silent…Alice had been planning this for a long time obviously and this sudden reveal of her devilish side had me floored.
“We’ll see…” was all I could think of having being put so suddenly into checkmate.

“Yes. We will. Au revoir sweetie. Here Alice have another milkshake before it gets warm-" *click.*

Breathlessly, I collapsed back onto the couch, letting my phone fall down uselessly to the side, collecting my still scattered thoughts. I mean it’s totally not because I was jealous or anything, even the slightest bit. I mean the idea of Alice getting spoiled rotten and eating whatever she wanted while in France while I was stuck doing double the chores here on the ever watching eye of mother…Nope I pushed the thought from my mind…No there was no way would Mom let her do something like that! No Way!

And it wasn’t like it was because Alice was getting fat; I mean she was just better at sneaking it then I was, and, come on, if I did squeal to Mom that would make me some sort of big fat hypocrite…

But on the other hand Hannah was in the nicest of words; downright crazy town banana pants, and was also very good at hiding it. I didn’t want Alice getting mixed up with her AT ALL. I took a deep breath and decided that night I would do everything I could to make sure Alice did not go on that “Educational Trip” to Paris…

That night Mom says…

12221123211.content:
That night, my mom says yes.

Seriously, right?

I have to live like a freaking second class citizen because of my weight, despite the fact that I made excellent fucking grades in school and am more or less a responsible adult who is very in touch with what makes me truly happy—something that bitch probably can’t stand—where Alice, sweet little Alice who’s been lying to me for months, gets to go off and gallivant around France or wherethefuckever with Hannah Hammond—the craziest bitch I’ve ever known. Present company excluded, of course.

So she took us out to Patricks’ Diner, Alice favorite place, to celebrate and they just spent hours gushing about how much fun France was going to be. How much it would broaden her horizons, how much she would learn about fashion. Just every fucking thing. Mom didn’t even speak to me until I had the audacity to order another plate of onion rings—which she confiscated, by the way! Threw them in the fucking trash! Seriously!

And this entire time, Alice is giving me these really snotty looks. It was so unlike her to act this way, I had no idea what had gotten into her… other than maybe a few dozen cupcakes. She was always the sweetest girl, and Mom never seemed to pick up on it either.

Was she taunting me?

Was she gloating?

Was she basically going ‘nyeh nyeh, I’m gonna get fatter than yoooooou’ with every little bitchy face she’d make?

Probably, yeah. Which was why, for the next week before departure, Alice and I barely spoke a word. I stayed in my room, stuffing my face and fondling myself, and Alice probably did the exact same thing in her room.

It felt so weird to know that beneath the sister I’d always known and loved was this… jerk! I still couldn’t believe that they were the same person. All I’d done was say that I wouldn’t help her get fat (which, yeah, kinda hypocritical, but you know my reasons!) and she just flies off the handle and recruits one of the most dangerous feeders I’d ever had the displeasure of meeting.

Anyway, so a week later we were at the airport. Hannah, disguised as the chaperone for whatever illustrious bullshit school she’d made up, shook my mother’s hand (who wept a single dramatic tear from her eye as she watched her little girl go) and did the same thing to me—making incredibly uncomfortable eye contact with me all the while.

“Take care of my sister, Hannah.” I said flatly

“Oh don’t worry sweetie.” Hannah’s face twisted into an evil grin, “I will.”

And just like that, they were off. Mom gave Alice a last little hug, an emergency cell phone, and told her to be good and to learn a lot about fashion. And that was just sort of it. My Mom was really upset by it all, I could tell. She actually let me stop and get Burger King on the way home, which was fun. But that should tell you how depressed she was.

Not like she was that sad when I left for school, but whatever.
12221123211.title: Au Revoir, Alice!

122211232111.content:
(Originally written by wowee (77) )

So, yeah after all that no surprise that Summer was well…sucky. Mom had me under her thumb at home, but I wasn’t off course without tricks of my own. Having to get an …ugh...job at Patricks’ Diner wasn’t the highest on my summer to do list. But it wasn’t all bad if you didn’t mind coming home smelling like grease (trust me not as appetizing as it sounds.) I could eat all the food I could after hours and I was able to get away from mom, as well as make some money. I did wince every single time I had a customer order a basket of “French” fries though….

All in all I did end up still putting on 20lbs over three months, which wasn’t exactly losing weight, but this was me we’re talking about, that was practically pitiful! What could I do though; I wasn’t exactly ready to move out (Though I was on my way! Slowly but surely!) So I had to settle for scarfing at work whole getting scraps at home. All the while in my head I could just see my little sister, who was literally on the other side of the world, doing who knew what with notorious obeseophile: Hannah Hammond. We didn’t exchange a single text, although Alice would call mom every so often and I’d be forced to exchange niceties such as the usual “Oh, how are you?” which Alice would always answer with something boastful like “Good. Very good.”

It really was a Dickensian best of time, worst of time situation here. Eventually the summer had to end, and Alice was set to arrive home. Mom had instructed me to come with to the airport, AND of course had me be the one to actually pick up Alice when she arrived at the gate, while Mom sat with the car in the parking lot.

So begrudgingly and in a huff, I headed off into the airport and Gate24-Air France. While wondering what I’d say to my sister when she returned home, (and wondering why everywhere didn’t have these moving walkways they’re awesome!) I worked my way to where I’d have to wait for her.

However down the walkway first, strutting picturesque as if it were a catwalk was Hannah Hammond, a smile a mile wide on her face, towing two large cases of luggage behind her.

“Bonjour, Mel. Comme ca va?” she asked, malicious intent behind the kind words.

“Wait, let me guess, that's French for "I'm done brainwashing you sister?” I said my tone cold and stodgy, "Or is it French for "I'm a stupid skinny bitch who learned how to say this one thing while I was over in Paris."?"

“Oh no, we both had a très grande time in France. Emphasis on grande. You know me I just love love love making people happy and your sister loved every second of it.”

“Har-de-har-har, that’s new Hannah… fat puns. Seriously do you ever get bored of those?”

“No.” she said flatly seeing I wasn’t entertaining the idea of chatting with her at all. “Here’s her luggage by the way.” She said handing me the handle to one of the two rolling suitcases.

“Why are you carrying her luggage?” I asked, never knowing Hannah to lift a finger she didn’t have to or wasn’t in some way foodie related.

“Please, the gorgeous thing she is now, I wouldn’t make her carry her own luggage…Oh look her she comes.” Boasted Hannah, as we both turned our attention to the gate.

I looked around through the exiting crowd and didn’t see my sister….Wait…Was that…

To be fair I should have been more prepared, three months’ vacation with Hannah Hammond at her size would do wonders to anyone’s waistline, but even with what I had imagined, Alice had gone and exceeded my imagination/worst fears! This blubber ball was not so much walking as bouncing with every step off the plane, she was my once sweet little sister ALICE!?

Wearing makeup, and donned in a luxuriously looking large French top that would have been classified beyond merely plus size, Alice was gigantic planetoid in the sea of tiny stars that were the other plane passengers. I could still see Alice’s body fat was mostly front loaded. Her gut had grown surging outwards and forwards dominating her midsection. Just below her top, but just above her jeans, (only Hannah would go to such lengths to bother to find them in such as size) her belly so big and obvious now it would bounce against her thighs with stretchmarks accompanying her muffin top of flab telling of the sudden swiftness of her huge gains. If I had to roughly guess, she weighed maybe less than 100lbs less than I did at this very moment. I was shocked to see my sister in such a new look for her, I was angry at Hannah for being such a jilted former devotee of mine she’d gone through my sister in a way to get back at me, but above all else…I was awestruck.

I swear Hannah licked her lips while reveling in the shocked look at my face.

“Hmm, well Alice and I already said our ‘personal goodbyes’ …for now. I’ll let you two catch up… Au Revoir, Alice darling!” shouted Hannah as she blew a kiss to Alice who mimicked catching it, and rather than return the act, instead mimed eating it in saccharine manner. “That’s our thing.” Said Hannah cutely as she turned on the ball of her foot, and disappeared into a crowd, the grin never leaving her face the entire time.

Slowly the pudgy person worked her way up to me, already bit winded.

“Bonjour ma soeur!” she greeted as if nothing had incredibly changed. I knew she was baiting me to bring up her weight, but I was still so dumbfounded I still ended up uttering.

“Alice…you’re…”

“Yeah, I know great isn’t it? You know I never knew Hannah was such a giving person, not a stuck up brat like you made her out to be, I mean she really gets me. Shame you two couldn’t work things out.” I sighed and started automatically heading for the car, Alice’s suitcase in tow just to get away from my sister, knowing that this bragging was only beginning.

“Eiffle tower…blah blah blah…French bread and duck fat for breakfeast, blah blah blah, Chocolate Milkshakes there are so much better than milkshakes over here…” that sort of went on for a good two minutes until she ended it with a phrase that always perked my ears…”You hungry?”

Now let’s get this straight. I’m 99.9% of the time always hungry but, this was the rarest of rare occasions where I had something I’d rather do than eat. I just wanted to get home and get as far away from Alice as I could.

“Alice, Mom’s waiting for us.” I insisted to my sister.

There was just this change in attitude about her as a whole, no longer shy and sweet, she was sour and…just the way she acting now it was…I searched for the word…

“No, I’m hungry now!” said Alice with an actual stamp of her foot. “I’m going to get something to eat.”

“Alice!” I started sternly, but she’d already taken off to the airport’s Burger King. Brat was the word I was looking for. Hannah had spoiled Alice to her hearts content and now she was a full-figured, full-blown brat.

I made it to B.K and now that I knew what she looked like it easy to pick out her fatty frame at the counter.

“A number four and a number six.” She stated, casually picking a $20 bill (hey this was an AIRPORT Burger King) from her wallet…woah! Hannah had obviously given her a good-bye present of cash to make sure Alice stayed well fed.

Well if anything, I figured I could at least sneak in a bite to eat before getting back into the car with Mom, (notice I said quick not small there’s a difference.) I reached for my wallet…only to remember I left it in the car. FUUUUCCCK!

Angrily I was forced to sit down, empty handed and watch my sister enjoy her first meal back here in the states. Her new poundage had also brought along new appetite as she tore into the four burgers and fries with such ferocity we only sat for what couldn’t have been more than 5 minutes. Alice was not intent to share a single crumb it seemed, I was her sister, her best friend! Her eyes seemed much to focused on the greasy feast in front of her, she didn’t eat so much as inhale the food. How could this have happened? Then I remembered it wasn’t how…it was who.

“So, I’m guessing Hannah didn’t exactly stay laissez faire during the trip.” I snipped feeling pretty put off by Alice’s new attitude.

Alice looked like she swallowed a rock and then shot me a dirty glare after guzzling what was coming near to a gallon of soda fountain pop.

“Hannah and I have a professional friendly relationship. And I had NO problem if she wanted to get a little…grabby.” She said crushing her last burger wrapper and giving a small belch.

“Jezebel.” I shot at her,

“Jealous!” she shot back.

Now that SHE was good and full, finally finally! We made our way back out to the parking garage. Holy shit. I’d been so concerned with my sister I hadn’t given my mother’s reaction a passing thought. Oh man, Mom was going to flip. I was almost salivating getting ready to watch the scene play out…
122211232111.title: Alice Returns Rotund and Ravenous

1222112321112.content:
"My sweet baby!" my mother yelled, her arms thrown up in the air, "You look so... healthy!"

Alice dropped her bags like it was this big important moment in her life, finally reunited with our mother dearest, and waddled full speed ahead until they collided in this big fleshy hug. My Mom's skinny little arms could barely wrap around her sweet, super sized baby as she tipped the scales at... god... three hundred pounds. My little sister weighed three hundred pounds. She was bigger than I was at sixteen! She was bigger than I was this time last year! And my mom... she was okay with it!

Like, this was the same woman who had scolded me just that morning for sucking the frosting off my fingers. The same woman who never let me live down an extra portion or another slice. The same woman who had been fat shaming me and criticizing me (and in doing so, inadvertantly fueled a very satisfying fetish for me, but that was beside the point) for the past four years of my life.

And now Alice comes home, twice the size I was when I was her age, and all my Mom has to call her is "healthy"?

What. The. Fuck.

"I missed you so much, Mommy!" Alice's voice did a quick flip back to pre-Hannah tones, expertly harkening back to the times when she was genuinely so sweet and demure, "Hannah and I had such a good time!"

"I... can see that!" for what it's worth, it wasn't like my Mom was blind or anything. She could clearly see that Alice had packed on some serious poundage while she was away, "Oh, come here sweetie. I missed you so much while you were away..."

Here my mother turned to me, expectantly, and urged me silently to come in for a hug. Or to say something. It was pretty hard to tell with her sometimes; especially when her eyes were wide with confusion over the sudden expansion of the "good" daughter. But with my overall size and her overall size, and the fact that I didn't exactly feel like hugging the big bloated brat that she'd turned into while she was away, I figured that phoning in a generic comment or two was my best way at playing things.

"Yeah, it's real good to have you back." I said dryly, "Sis."

Alice's only response was to sway her butt tauntingly in my direction. Her massive ass swung playfully from side to side for a moment, jiggling for a few moments after. I could just picture the shit-eating grin on her face while she did it. Waving it in front of me that she wasn't in trouble, or that no one suspected a thing. Slowly but surely, Alice unwrapped herself around our mother and took a few steps backwards, her enormous stomach sinking lower over her lap.

"I-I really hate to ask, but you think we could get something to eat on the way home?" Alice asked in that pathetic little voice, "The plane food was really gross..."

"O-Of course we can, sweetheart!" my Mother was all to pleased to dote over the prodigal daughter as she broke out into a sweet little smiled that belayed her newfound manipulative side. She turned to me expectantly, "Mel, get your sisters bags."

I took a short, curt look at my sister, who took the same opportunity to look at me. She laid her hands on the flanks of her belly as it billowed out in front of her, folding distinctively beneath her tight European clothes. It growled at me, menacingly, to while Alice placated it with some quiet little pats on the top of her tummy. She looked back at me with a nasty grin and pressed oh-so-much deeper into the sides of her stomach. Her fat yielded to her touch as her chubby fingers sank into the sweater by just a little bit further.

And then she gave me this shit-eating grin.

"Mel!" my mother urged, snapping me out of our staring contest (and making me lose), "The bags?"

Rolling my eyes, I struggled to bend my knees ever so slightly the small angle required for me to grab all of my sister's luggage. I didn't understand it. I had a hundred pounds on that girl, and I was the one who was forced to exert herself because Alice had had a long trip. Unbelievable. Simply unbelievable.

***


Surprise surprise, Alice's time in France had done little to expand her culinary pallet.

We had gotten in the car, driven a little ways down the road, when my Mom noticed the extra hungry, extra longing looks that Alice had been giving a McDonalds. She longed for good old fashioned American fast food (not that I could blame her) and, for the first time in forever, my Mother relented.

But boy oh boy would she regret it.

Alice racked up quite the bill at the golden arches, and she did it in such a way that even I had to be a little proud. She ordered almost exclusively off the dollar menu. Rookie mistake to think that bigger prices meant more calories. Three double cheeseburgers were more calories than one double quarter pounder, and at about the same price. A large fry, a few apple pies, and one refillable large drink to go with it made for a pretty solid meal!

But then, that was my order. (which I had to pay for out of my waitressing money, thank you very much!)

Alice may as well have bought the dollar menu. Mom loaded her up! A welcome home present consisting of burgers, chicken sandwiches, nuggets, fries, drinks and pies. Anything Alice wanted, my mother saw fit to give her! And boy oh boy, Hannah had left her wanting...

Which was why Alice saw fit to say, between her noisy, foodgasmic bites...

12221123211121.content:
"Mommy, I don't want to go all the way to Buttercombe in August..."

To say that this came as something of a shock to my already poor, overloaded (and unfortunately for me, sympathetically confused) mother was a bit of an understatement. Ever since I had enrolled, all Alice had wanted to do was go where her big sister went. They were a top-knotch academy, and had plenty of opportunities for a higher education better than anything in our little cow town. My Mom nearly spit out her burger (which she was pretty close to doing anyway) when she heard what Alice had to say!

"Why not, sweetie?!" my mother choked, "I-I thought you wanted to go to Buttercombe?"

Ugh. All this sweetie talk was killing me. Ever since the divorce Mom had tried to mellow out. Just a year ago, she might have tried to literally choke my sister if she said something like that. But now that she was "nurturing" and "caring" (at least to one of her daughters) she was a lot more leniant. And apparently, blind. If I had tried to pull this shit, she would have seen through it in an instant.

But then again, I suppose, we hated each other.

"I-I know, but... I don't think I could spend that much time away from you!" Alice's big blue eyes got all watery, "This Summer was really hard on me. I don't know how Mel did it for four years!"

My mother shot me this nasty look. Like 'see? it's just you. nobody else wants to get away from me.' Fuggin' little bitch.

"Oh Alice, come here..."

My mom actually got up, out of our side of the booth, and walked over to give her youngest daughter a side-hug from outside the booth. Her youngest daughter that, might I remind you, barely stopped herself from eating during the entire duration of the hug. Alice might have been able to fool my mom, but she couldn't fool me.

"So you want to enroll back into public school?" my Mom did her best not to look too terribly pleased, "Because I can arrange that for you if that's what you want."

And here, for just a minute, Alice's facade faltered. Her smile went from this grateful, chubby little princess to this greedy little glutton who had just gotten her way. Little did I know that I would be seeing that smile a lot more in just as early as the coming weeks. Her cheeks creasing and her second chin bulging. That evil little twinkle in her big blue eyes.

"Actually..." Alice began, regaining herself, "That girl I was with? Hannah? She studied at Buttercombe. And she's a certified home schooler, and--"

"Alice, I don't know."

"Pleeeeease?!"

Alice clasped her chubby little hands together, inadvertantly causing this ripple effect to flow throughout her entire body. Everything from her tits to her belly to her chubby little double chin wobbled suddenly. She was breathing heavily, no doubt from the furious rate at which she'd been wolfing down burgers, and her cheeks were all rosy. She was so big now that her belly folded onto the table in front of her. Alice was so fat now, I barely even recognized her! And here she was trying to get even more time with the woman who had spoiled her rotten and turned her into this big, bitchy brat! Surely my Mom would see the connection. Surely there was reason in the world?

"Well..."

GODDAMMIT MOM.

"I suppose... since she took such good care of you over the Summer..."

"Mom you cannot be serious." I bawked

"Now Mel, just because you went to a private school doesn't mean that Alice has to." my mom did her best to expertly mediate between her own conflicted feelings and Alice's wants, "Maybe it'll be good for her. A big school like that. You know how timid she is."

"Yeah Mel." Alice bit into a burger, her jowls jiggling, "I'm timid."

Unbelievable. Unbelievable! My Mom was actually considering this! She was falling right into Hannah's trap--I'd seen it more than enough times at Buttercombe. And this time it was all to get back at me. I wouldn't be her fatty fuck toy, so now she was going to do it to Alice! Private tutor--pssh! That was the lamest excuse I'd ever heard in my entire life! And this was coming from a woman made of lame excuses.

Whatever Hannah was doing, I wasn't okay with it. Her influence on Alice was... terrible! Horrifiying! She'd turned my sweet, quiet little sister into this manipulative brat who was just out to get her gut filled!

"I suppose, if you're sure her credentials are good..."

"Oh they are, Mommy they are!" Alice jiggled excitedly in her seat, the supports creaking as she bounced, "I'll give her your information. Oh this is going to be so much fun! Thank you thank you thank you!"

122211232112.content:
I'm going to come right out and say that I was not looking forward to spending the rest of my time alone.

I had pretty much spent the last few weeks going throughseperation anxiety as I realized that my sweet little sister was a) a lot more like me than I thought b) getting herself involved with one of the most dangerously fattening women I knew and c) physically capable of actually lying. To me of all people!

Let's just say that I was more than prepared for this Summer to be the shittiest time of my life, and that was without factoring in the fact that my mom and I were now stuck, alone, in a house with someone that we both couldn't fucking stand.

So for the first week, I just went about my business as normal. I ate, I watched TV, and when Mom got home from work, I either went into my room or went out on the town--where I usually ate some more--before going to sleep and doing it all over again.It wasn't the best routine, but it worked.

You can imagine my shock, one day, when my Mom out of the blue asks me:

"Mel, would you like to go shopping with me this weekend?"

No, seriously.

I was just sitting there, scarfing down donuts like the good little whale I was. I hadn't spoken to the woman all morning; she was getting ready for work, I was gearing up for another day of being a useless sack of lard, we just never really crossed paths. So when she spoke to me--in the form of an invitation rather than an insult, no less-- I almost choked.

"What?" I asked stupidly, my eyes wide with terror and wonder, "Like... with you?"

"Well... yeah." she said to me flatly, no detectable sarcasm or snarkiness beneath her make-up, "I mean, you've been wearing the same outfits for a while now, and they're looking pretty tight...."

I fully expected that to go into another anti-fat, weight-shaming tyrade that my mother was so keen on doling out whenever she felt that I was a little too in love with myself (which, let's face it, was always).

But it didn't.

"Uh... sure?" I swallowed my donut dumbly, "Is, um... is this Saturday good?"

"Of course." my mother said with a little smile, "We'll make a day out of it. You can't just spend all Summer laying around in your pajamas."

She was right. My big double-belly had already outgrown the Buttercombe Athletics t-shirt that I had brought with me back from the Academy. The gray material wrapped tightly around my lower roll of belly blubber and cut deeply into my sides, giving me an extra muffin top as I sat squeezed into my shorts. The straps on my bra were so tight that I had honestly just started to go without, letting my big round girls hang freely and fabulously. Even the neck was tight. And my shorts were hanging on by mere threads; one good arch of my back and those things would be goners.

"S-Sure..." I stammered awkwardly as my Mother hung in the doorway, "Yeah."

I was in awe. Dumbstruck. My mother and I hadn't spent any quality time together since my first Holiday Break home, when I had put on my first forty pounds and ate the entire Thanksgiving Turkey by myself. The fact that we had spent years at each other's throats after that certainly hadn't helped matters any. I'll be the first to admit that I suspected foul play, but I decided to give my mother the benefit of the doubt.

So, all throughout that week, my Mom didn't stop with this whole "treating me like a human being" thing she'd picked up after Alice left. And it was really starting to freak me out.

Whenever she got home from work, she called me. It started out as just telling me that she was on her way home, but it had evolved in the past few days. 125.content:
We had the TV turned on, all ready for the latest installment of our summer-long binge watching marathon. But before we queued up Netflix, Alice and I were getting into a long philosophical discussion about just what was going to be for breakfast considering that I ate all of the breakfast. And it was during that little argument that a commercial (one of those offputtingly loud, crappy local broadcast kind) for a new Greek/Italian restaurant in town popped up with just enough obnoxious loudness and tempting pictures of food to distract us both.

So as soon as I had convinced my stick-in-the-mud sister that maybe we could play food critic for the day (which was getting a lot easier to do, btw) and check this new place out, we got dressed and piled into my car.

It wasn't too far, but that didn't mean I wasn't still starving by the time we made it there. I practically ran-waddled my way up to the entrance, with poor Alice straggling behind me because I was so hungry I forgot to shut my freaking door. It was a rinky-dink little place. I didn't really notice it because I had tunnel vision at the time, but we were pretty much the only other car in the parking lot. I waited up for my sister, and we went inside.

We were greeted by this old guy, probably the owner. He was swarthy, short and stocky with a mustache straight out of the seventies, and he just happened to be near the front door. I saw his eyes widen in terror as my great big body wriggled into his itty-bitty restaurant, shimmying and shaking my way slowly out of my tank top.

"Welcome to the Acropolis, ladies!" he did his best to hide that fear and channel it into customer service, "H-How many today? Two?"

"Just little ol' us." I said cheekily.

He laughed nervously, probably wondering how I managed to fit "little" into a sentence describing myself.

"Right right, would you like a table or booth?"

***


"Booths are kinda small..." I grumbled as I pushed against the table for the millionth time, barely managing to get any leeway for my largeness, "Gawd... have you even seen our waitress?"

"Oh stop complaining, they just opened." Alice dunked a breadstick in a tiny dish of olive oil, "Besides, they were nice enough to give us each a basket of these breadsticks while we waited."

"Well they should have brought three." I huffed, my stomach gurgling longingly as the smell of Greek meats wafted through the restaurant and into my nostrils, "If we don't get into second gear here, I swear to God we'll go to that Jack-in-the-Box we passed on our way over."

Okay, so we might still do that even if I get great service, just on the way home. I was pretty sure that they brought the double order of breadsticks in hopes of sating my ginormous appetite while they got their slow asses moving, but they didn't count on Alice being able to pack it away too. My basket was long gone, and so was the buttery residue left on my chubby little fingertips, and Alice was almost done with hers. Seriously, what was the hold up?

Finally I see someone in the distance. A plump Greek woman about my Mom's age in a yellow dress and an apron. She's got a notepad and a dumbfounded look on her face as she comes closer to me, so I can only guess that she's our waitress.

"Good morning ladies." her accent was about as thick as her figure, and I could tell that she was doing her best not to stare at me, "What can I start you off with this morning?"

"Hmm... How big is the Turkey Gyro pizza?" I asked, holding out my doughy arms about two feet apart, "Like, this big? Because that's how big it looks on the menu."

It took my waitress a second to register what I was talking about.

"Oh, no, it's only... one foot." she struggled with the imperial measurement, "Personal size."

"Okay, I'll have three of those." I said nonchalantly, "And an order of baked spaghetti."

"For both of you?" she looked at Alice and back to me, "Okay, and to drink?"

"Oh no, that's all for me." I said proudly pointing to myself, "And I'll have a Coke. Refills are free, right?"

Our waitress' eyes widened in astonishment of how huge my order (and my appetite) was. I saw her scribble it down on the notepad, looking back up at me in-between every other word. God I loved to freak people out like that. To order so much. It made people so nervous for some reason.

"And, um... I'll have the Greek Yogurt pancakes." Alice finished pleasantly, "And I'll get a Sprite."

"Hey, do you think we could get some more breadsticks over here too?" I tack on, "We're starving over here."

There were a lot of places to choose from, almost none of which I would have disagreed to. Big chain restaurants like Longhorns or Olive Garden, some smaller stuff like Waffle House or maybe Corona's, I wouldn't even have been adverse to a night at Taco Bell or McDonalds honestly. I am fully aware that I eat a lot--a very lot--and sometimes that doesn't agree with people's wallets.

Which was why it surprised me when, out of every place in town, Alexis chose Patrick's.

I mean, don't get me wrong, I love Patrick's. My dad used to take me and Alice there when Mom wasn't watching and let us get all the unhealthy crap we wanted, a tradition he continued to do even after the divorce. Seriously, whenever he wanted to spite mom, he spoiled us. Which was, in a word, fantastic. And this was his idea of spoiling me; the greasiest spoon in town with prices that reflected the quality of the food with which you put into your body. I hadn't been here since I moved out, and honestly my mouth was already watering at the prospect of stuffing my face with those gi-fucking-gantic onion rings.

It was just kind of weird that out of all the places she chose to go to, she had to pick the one where me and my Dad used to go.

Soo... half a point for her on the good date scale?

"Well well, if it ain't Mel!" came the familiar voice of the owner, Patrick, as he came out to walk us to a table, "I haven't seen you in a minute, girl!"

"Hey Mr. Hines." I smiled warmly, a little weirded out that he was seeing me here on a date. With a girl. "Can we get a booth for two?"

"Well sure you can, sweetie, lemme just go wipe one down for ya." he smiled, grabbing two menus and heading off into the dining area, leaving Alexis and I alone.

"You know the owner?" Alexis sounded so pleased with the fact that me, a fat girl of extraordinary calibur, was on such good terms with the owner of a restaurant, "Is that how you got so... mmm...?"

"Maybe just a little." I winked, patting the side of my gut playfully as it wobbled beneath my top. Alexis squirmed a little, her smile getting wider...

What? So I was a flirt. Big deal, it was a date. Kind of. Maybe.

"Alright ladies, right this way!" Patrick called out, escorting us to a booth with enough wiggle room for a girl my size, "I'll be right back to take your order."
