One of my favorite things about Patrick (well, along with the greasy menu) was that the booths didn't have stationary tables. I assumed it was for larger parties, so they could snag a table or two for longer setups, but seeing as I had never seen a party larger than 3 (albeit usually weighing enough for a party of 4 or 5- Patrick's didn't attract the healthiest crowd), I had never seen them moved out of a booth. Still, when wiggling my way in, I apologized briefly as I scooted the table towards Alexis and squeezed myself in.

"Oh, no, it's... it's kinda hot." Welp, that cemented it. This girl clearly didn't hold reservations in regards to subtlety. I barely refrained from rolling my eyes- I hope this night didn't turn into nothing but throaty whispers about how large I was.

"So, anyways, what made you pick this place?" I said nonchalantly as I pondered over what flavor of malt to get- I already knew what I was getting off the menu, especially if Alexis was paying.

Alexis blushed a tiny bit, clearly staring at my gut which was pressed lightly into the table. "I, uh, read a review about it being really good?" I had my doubts. As far as I knew, there were only two Yelp reviews, and my Mom had written it after a particularly belt-busting day, leading to a large fight between her and Dad. As far as I recalled, the term "Despicable, unhealthy, and frankly, grotesque" was her tagline, followed by her rambling about how many calories the menu probably had. Frankly, I thought it was a bit of a low blow, even for her. The other review was very positive, but went on to say that they ate 2 servings of fries, and a triple cheeseburger- my guess is the person was probably slightly smaller than me, so it stood to reason they'd dig the place. I only had to guess which one she read.

"Well, the review was right, whatever it was. This place is pretty damn good." I said with a smile. No point in being bitchy about her transparent love for my body- hell, I loved my body too. Just hoped she wouldn't be too aggressive. "Anyways, you haven't even looked at the menu, aren't you gonna check it out?" I asked, noticing she hadn't touched it. She awkwardly stared at it for a minute, before picking it up gently. I almost felt bad, this girl clearly was in over her head. I mean, I had made it pretty clear that I was a big girl, but she seemed shell-shocked a bit. So, when Patrick strode over, I decided to put on a little show for her.

"Heya, Mel!" He said with his usual gusto. "Whatcha thinkin' for starters?" The man knew me well.

"I think, since I can't pick, I'm going to get a chocolate malt AND a strawberry shake, along with an order of onion rings, and a double side of honey mustard, if ya please, shugah." I threw on a terrible Southern drawl on the end, which got a chuckle out of Patrick and a giggle out of Alexis- although I couldn't tell if hers was from my stupid attempt at humor or at the fact that I just ordered 1200 calories worth of food before the main course. "Oh, Alexis, you want anything?" I asked innocently, just to drive the point home that I wasn't sharing.

"Uh. Just a water, thanks." She said quietly, and Patrick gave a quick affirmative before whisking off behind the counter. "Holy shit, that's a lot of food. Do you really think you'll still-" She said quietly, eyes wide over the top of her menu, but I cut her off.

"Alexis, I don't know if you've noticed, but I'm kinda... Fat. And I need a lot of food. So yes, I'm pretty sure I can finish it all, and still get a burger." I gave her a wink, which sent her hiding under her menu again. Damn, for a girl that apparently lived in a veritable mansion, who owned fucking horses, and drove a brand new car that probably could pay off our house mortgage, this girl wasn't exactly too keen on conversation. Still, she was footing the bill, I guess I could give her a bit of a show.

By the time the appetizer round came out, along with our drinks, Alexis had set her menu down, so Patrick took our orders. I let Alexis go first so I could slam down one of my drinks, because my stomach was rumbling something fierce by now and I couldn't quite concentrate. She ordered a chicken salad- of course, with her skinny figure, I'm sure she didn't realize that it was covered in chicken tenders and absolutely drenched in ranch dressing, but I'm sure she would be too busy staring at me to notice, since when Patrick got to me, I was down one malt but still starving, and so I said- "I need a triple cheeseburger deluxe, with fries, of course, an adult grilled cheese, with bacon, of course, and, oh, I dunno, why don't I get a side- no, scratch that, an order- of the mac and cheese. And a Coke, I guess."

Alexis had turned bright red. Damn, this girl was really transparent about her preferences. Patrick, of course, didn't miss a beat. "Just like the old days, girl." He said with a grin as he scooped off the menus and made his way to the back. Alexis had slouched slightly and her mouth was open. Shit, was I the first girl she ever saw do this? I almost felt a little bad, and so, with all of my social grace, I asked-

"Shit, have you never been with someone who eats like this?" Her face got even redder, if such a thing was possible. She awkwardly stuttered for a bit, and then said:

"No, actually. You, uh... I mean, that is to say, I don't really, leave the house much." I could tell. "I mean, if we're being honest about it, I, um..."

I cut her off, I could only take a guess at what she was going to say. "Look, Alexis, let's just take this one thing at a time. Tell me a bit about yourself, yeah? I mean, I'm still gonna pig out, because that's just what I do, but don't think this is a thing- not yet, anyways. I barely know you!" I felt a little bad, but put it the best way I could. She didn't seem too defeated by the comment, which was good. I mean, I may come across a little bombastic, but that doesn't mean I'm gonna rush into something with someone I don't know. Anyways, we got to talking, and-

14.content:
Alright, so my Mom and I got in a huge fight.

I get home from school, I get all my stuff unpacked, and my Mom waits until just then to tell me that she has a problem with my unhealthy lifestyle. I said some things, she said some things, Dad said some things, and long story short, I decided to take my residence elsewhere. How could I be expected to live in a house with that woman constantly nagging me to eat right and exercise when I made it abundantly clear by how freakin' fat I was that I would be having absolutely none of that? I had my pride, after all!

...okay, she kicked me out.

In her defense, I guess I kind of am hard to live with. I mean, I weigh four hundred pounds. Like it or not, shit is going to get knocked over by my ridiculous badonkadonk. Or get crushed underneath it. Whatever.

But hey, silver linings, right? I was given a week to get out and find a place to stay on my own when, in a moment of the most pure unadulterated kindness that my fat ass had ever been shown, my Aunt Rhonda offered me a place to stay.

It started out as your standard auntie-niece phone call. Seriously, she called me to tell me congratulations on graduating and it eventually led into what a bitch my mom was being. Except, you know, I couldn't use the b-word because that was kind of her sister. So, long story short, she told me that if I didn't have a place to go by the end of the week, she'd pay for the trip down to her house and that would be the end of it. And since all of my friends were kind of scattered across the country or taking residence in boarding school, I wasn't going to be able to move in with them any time soon.

And that's how Aunt Rhonda became my favorite aunt.

I mean, we were pretty close before. As close as two people could be being on different sides of the East Coast. She lived down in South Carolina, which meant that our bonding had been somewhat stilted before all this happened. But since she was fronting the bill and a month's rent at her house, how could I say no?

Mom didn't like it, but what did she care? It was my car, my decision, and my life. And she made that abundantly clear when she bitched me out for crushing the couch.

...shit, did I forget to mention I did that?

Anyway, Aunt Rhonda never really got to see anyone on this side of the coast, so it was a really rare treat that any of us ever got to see her on the off chance that we actually got to spend any time with her. She and my mother always had some kind of beef between them. Probably because my mom was a controlling pathologically manipulative bitch. She had that effect on people.

So, after a long drive down south and what probably amounted to at least two hundred cumulative dollars in impromptu drive-thru binges, I finally made my way to my new home...

Enter my Aunt Rhonda—

141.content:
Enter my Aunt Rhonda—your stereotypical southern housewife.

Seriously, I don’t know what world she crawled out of, but living in the South for so long had definitely changed my Aunt over the years. I mean, to me she was always my Aunt Rhonda. I didn’t really see her enough to register similarities, let alone differences. But even I had to admit that my Aunt had picked up a lot more than an accent over the years.

“Mel!” my Aunt squealed as she wrapped her arms around me as best she could, “C’mere sweetheart!”

I felt the shape of my supremely svelter aunt press deeply into the folds of my gut, which gurgled and churned approvingly as if to say ‘hello’.

From my understanding, my Aunt looked more like Grandpa than Grandma. Whereas me, my mom, my sister, and all my cousins were all short-to-average height, blonde and pie-faced, Aunt Rhonda had a much more statuesque appearance. She was tall, and had her thick black hair cut in this retro 50’s ‘do that I thought did her angular face a lot of justice.

I squeezed her back, wrapping around her waist and enveloping her motherly frame with my doughy arms. She let out this happy little noise of approval, almost like a little giggle, and gave me one last squeeze before I let her go.

“Now don’t say another word; yes, I can tell yer just starvin’ ain’tcha?” my Aunt said with a not-so-subtle glance at my gut, incompletely covered by my increasingly lack-luster t-shirt, ”Now you go right on inside—don’t worry about these bags or nothin’.”

She gave me an affectionate little kiss on the cheek and pat my shoulder pitiably

“Poor thing. You’ve just been through so much, haven’t you?”

“I so have.” I pouted, sticking out my lower lip as I leaned into her hand as it cupped my fat cheek, “Thank you so much again for letting me stay with you, Auntie.”

My Aunt shut the car door behind me with one expert kick, and stood proudly with her hands on her wide birthing hips.

“P’sshaw. Your mama can talk about how “backwards” and “anti-progressivist” we are down here, but at least we know how to take care of our own.” My Aunt said with a definitive huff, “Now c’mon inside; you’ve got great timin’, dinner’s almost done!”

So I trudged my fat ass up the concrete walkway to their impressive ranch-style home. It was a lot nicer than I’d expected. I mean, not that I was expecting anything bad but, and this might have been my Mother talking, South Carolina didn’t exactly inspire images of picturesque typical suburban homes like this one. White picket fence, porch with rocking chairs on it, USC flags flapping in the warm summer night air...

Of course, I wasn’t exactly paying attention to any of that crap.

No, my mind went straight to food as soon as I stepped out of the car. My Auntie hadn’t been lying about dinner being almost ready—my expertly trained nose could smell an old-fashioned country dinner from outside the house! I lumbered greedily towards the front door as soon as I was given the clear, feeling the frame brush lightly against my ample side-fat. My gut entered my new home first, already roaring and commanding to be fed. A few more steps and I was inside, smacking my lips and breathing heavily in a mixture of anxiety and exhaustion.

After I was safely inside and following blindly the smell of freshly-made biscuits, my Aunt Rhonda tumbled in after me:

“Sweetheart, Mel’s here!” she hollered up the stairwell (ugh. Stairs. I knew that was going to be a problem.) “C’mon down and grab some dinner before me an’ her eat it all!”

After a few seconds, I heard some very audible footsteps coming down the stairs. It was…

I only continued to gorge myself on warm cornbread, hot ham, and biscuits covered in gravy by the ladleful! Truly I was the jealous one, why had her mom been the great chef?

I was working through my plate of thirds of everything, when Krystal, gave a flick of her long dirty-blonde hair and got up from the table. “Mom I’m headin’ ta Lindsey’s. I’m probally’ gonna’ stay the night. So…”
“Ohh, sweetie ya don’t want to at least be here for yall’ Cousin Mel’s first night?”

Krystal shot a mean look to her own mother and gave a small equivalent of a shrug, as if to say, “Why are you even arguing with me about this?”

In an instant I could tell who was used to having their way around here as her mother quickly backed off the issue. “Ok, well…at least text me when you get there Krystal.”

Krystal gave a minor nod at this show of power, seeing things weren’t going to change all of a sudden just because her nearly four-hundred pound cousin had crashed into their place like a fleshy wayward meteorite.
“See ya cuz” I cut in as she got up from the table. We locked eyes, and I quickly grabbed the brick of cornbread on my plate and wedged as much as I could into my waiting gob as I eyed her back, in a way affirming that; Yes, this was how much I ate as a regular meal, and that, No, I would not be stopping or changing my fattening ways any time soon. Krystal’s mouth opened reflexively out of shock at the sight. Mel 2 – Krystal 0 as far as I was concerned, she managed to eke out a dim “Bye.” before turning in disgust and heading out the front door happily away from what she saw as her embarrassment of a cousin.

Fortunately for me, Krystal’s mother didn’t happen to catch sight of my little stunt, before she turned back around to face me again, (I’d had managed to chug down my second glass of milk to avoid choking.)
More time passed, and my aunt and I caught up some more, and let me tell my stomach felt perfect. Not completely “Omg so full I can’t stand, my gut is at maximum capacity” but I was happily content, in fact maybe a bit too content as I let a tiny burp slip, (okay it was a belch, let’s be honest I was beyond tiny anything anymore.)

“Sorry, I uh” I said my face immediately reddening, after I literally burped in the face of such hospitality.

“Aw, nothin’ to worry about Mel, I’m just glad you liked it. Heck’ ya ate so much I don’t even gotta worry about takin’ care of the leftovers!” My aunt gave a short laugh, and then seemed to catch up on what she just said, her face now reddening a bit. “Oh, I mean, uh, it’s not a bad thing-

“I know what you mean” I assured her, giving her my patented winning grin, and insisting that keeping the kitchen left-over free would be my pleasure.

“Now seriously Mel, about earlier…Don’t pay any mind to what your cousin Krystal said. She’s still a teenager, well, I mean, not like you aren’t either…She’s just been stressed out lately, now that she’s gotta take an online math course over the summer for school or she’ll get held back as a Senior, and there’s boy troubles…Course I can only find out what I can in bits and pieces, she’s over at our neighbor Lindsey’s so much Krystal and I barely have a chance to have heart-to-heart like this now a days. Keep this hush between you an’ me but I think that Lindsey girl is a bit of a bad influence on he. I remember when Krystal would love to…Oh that reminds me! I got something special for dessert!”

My heartbeat quickened and my eyes lit up, Aunt Rhonda clearly knew how to treat her guest’s right, as I’d almost forgot about dessert after that monstrously sized meal. Then my heart sank as I recalled what my aunt had considered a dessert from the few family get-togethers we’d had.

Jello! Jello! It was almost as bad as nothing! No, it WAS as bad. I mean the stuff is like literally water and bones; sure it was as wobbly as I was but that’s where my empathy ended. Don’t get me started on people who try to hide it by calling it knocks blocks or *ugh* stuff it with vegetables, or *gag* buy it in sugar free variety! Just by pudding and call it day.

“I bought ice cream!” sang my savior Aunt Sally, pulling out a brick sized carton of double chocolate chunk. I gave a sigh of relief. “Krystal’s not one for sweets anymore, but I thought it be the perfect treat for the hot summer nights ahead.” She set the carton on the table and returned armed with two spoons in hand. Holy-ee Shit! She was going to eat right out of the carton with me! Oh, I wanted to whip out my phone and send my mom a text right then and there soooo bad. But I didn’t and instead I enjoyed the first of what would hopefully be many a night of just hanging out with my awesome Aunt.
141211.title: Curt Cousin Krystal

141212.content:
"Oh my god Mel! It's been forever!" my cousin squealed, before bounding across the room to give me a hug. Her arms, naturally, didn't reach all the way around me, but she didn't seem to care. I heard her murmur "Mm... soft..." as she squished up against me.

Damn right I'm soft! I give the best hugs in the world. One of the perks of being me.

Eventually she broke off the hug, but she looked at me with sparkling eyes. I suddenly remembered that we had had some good times together during family reunions and such. It had just been, as Krystal had said, forever since we had seen each other (and unfortunately, that had been during those dark days where social media hadn't really been a thing). "You were going to that fancy bee school, right Melly? You gotta tell me all about it!" she said.

I laughed, causing my everything to jiggle. The two of us sat down on a nearby sofa, and I regaled my cousin Krystal about my time at Buttercombe Academy. I mentioned the friends, the hardships, the unending struggle of keeping one's uniform updated. And, of course, I talked about the food. Krystal giggled when I talked about that. "Well, that explains this," she said, poking me in the belly. She said it in a teasing, but not hateful, way.

"This," I responded, patting my belly, "Was going to happen regardless of where I was. Buttercombe just made it easy for me. Anyway, how are you doing, Krissy?" My old nickname for her slipped out without me thinking about it. Damn, it was good to see Krystal again! She talked about her school and her friends, and was in the middle of a tale involving a boy who had tried to impress one of her friends when the both of us heard the front door of the house open and close.

I heard Aunt Rhonda say "Evenin', Hon," to someone who obviously had to be my Uncle Ted. Krystal quickly sprang up and ran off to give her Dad a hug. It took me a moment to lift my considerably bigger ass off of the sofa. I'd forgotten how flighty my cousin could be. Still, there were worse people I was related to. I headed into the dining room myself, and said hello to the man. Uncle Ted was a husky man with muscled arms and a paunchy stomach; he was obviously the kind of guy who worked hard and partied hard.

After that, it was time for dinner. Which was, needless to say, excellent. My Aunt Rhonda could have outcooked any of chefs back at Buttercombe, and I say that with only a slight bias. There were biscuits, fried chicken, potatoes, and I even got to try grits for the first time. I liked 'em! There was no conversation over dinner as everyone ate with a gusto that I had only before seen in fellow Buttercombe students. Even Krystal wasn't holding back, which made me wonder how the hell she stayed so thin. She must have had one of those super metabolisms that I was glad I didn't possess.

Dinner ended with hearty belches from everyone around the table. I was feeling very happy and very stuffed. These were my kind of people!

"Delicious as usual, Darlin'," Uncle Ted said.

"That was good, Mama," Krystal said, patting a stomach that I could swear was still as flat as a board. Where did it all go?

"That was wonderful Aunt Rhonda. Thanks!" I said.

"Aw, that weren't nothin'" Aunt Rhonda replied with a modesty that had to be false.

"So, Mel, got any plans yet?" Uncle Ted asked me, reclining in his chair.

"I was plannin' on taking Melly with me to the mall tomorrow!" Krystal said brightly. She hadn't run the plan by me yet, but what the hell? It wasn't like I'd had tomorrow figured out anyway.

The next morning, Krystal and I set out in the hybrid car that Uncle Ted and Aunt Rhonda had splurged on for Krystal's 18th birthday. I wasn't jealous at all that my cousin's awesome parents had bought her a car and my hard-ass mom had gotten me a diet book. Yup, no envy here. Anyway, Krystal explained the plan on our way over to the mall.

14123.content:
Okay, so normally I wasn’t on the other side of this sort of thing.

But I’ll be damned if my eyes didn’t get as wide as one of my ass-cheeks when I saw Krystal come down those stairs.

I had sort of expected her to be this bratty teenaged twig, given the tone in her voice. But I realized very quickly that she was just winded doing from one end of the hall down to the next. As she came down the stairs, it became very clear to me that Krystal was anything but twiggy.

I mean, I knew it had been a while since I’d seen her and all, but I just didn’t expect Krystal to be so… to be so fat!

Seriously, she was huge! And this was coming from a girl who had spent four years getting huge and being around girls of similar sizes! Krystal was about my height, with a belly that blocked the stairwell and tits that blinded her from the neck down. The bottom of her belly rolls were outlined by the thin grey leggings she’d heroically managed to put on, and cute little dress’ pattern had been completely distorted by the rampant growth of her rolls. Her face was round and swaddled in a thick double chin, her cheeks overly appled and creasing along the corners of her mouth. Her saddlebags brushed against the stairwell, slapping thickly against the little columns between the railings as she huffed and puffed herself down the stairs.

“I’m… I’m comin’…” she puffed pathetically, “Mama...Don't start... without me...”

I was, in all honesty, fucking flabbergasted.

I mean, I always remembered Krystal being a little spoiled when we were kids. A little whinier, and a little chubbier than everyone else at the time. But I never imagined that she might have grown up to be (almost!) my size. Seriously, I had spent so long being one of the biggest bitches in Buttercombe Academy, I downright forgot what it was like to see someone that close to four hundred pounds. Maybe this was what it felt like to be my Mom, watching me get fatter and fatter every time she saw me… except, y’know, all at once.

“I wouldn’t dream of it, baby.” My Aunt Rhonda said with an affectionate kiss on Krystal's puffy cheek, “But while I finish up in the kitchen, why don’t you get a little better acquainted with your cousin Mel?”
14123.title: My Cousin's HUGE...

choices: “That was just a special meal, to welcome you here.”

141231.content:
Krystal turned to take me in, her shock at my size little different from my own.

“Mel? Well look at you. Guess I'm not the only girl in the family with an appetite. Never would have figured your mom for much of a cook. No offense.”

“None taken.” I fought back the ire that came from thoughts of my mother. “But she wasn't responsible for all this. If she had her way, I'd be a size 0. No, I got this at school.”

And I told her about my time at Buttercombe; about my gains, my friends, my growing pride in my growing body.

“But really, it was just a lot of eating,” I concluded.

“Same here,” Krystal said, patting her belly. “Mama's always been a great cook, but for a while now she's been real into trying out new recipes and then improving them, giving 'em a personal touch. I'm like her personal taste-tester, which suits me fine. I'd be stuffing my face all day anyway, but I love that Mama's finding new things for me to try. Though she can be a little pushy.”

“What do you mean?” I asked, but the answer was made clear shortly.

“Dinnertime!” Aunt Rhonda called, and I followed Krystal into the dining room (more than a little proud that she didn't have the magnificent ass that I did). The dining room table, a long, rectangular piece, was filled with dishes and bowls. I counted at least three entrees (catfish, fried chicken and pork chops) and several sides.

“Is it just the three of us?” I asked, looking at the settings.

“Ted is away on a business trip,” Rhonda explained, referring to her husband and Krystal's father, “So it's just us ladies.”

“You really went all out,” I said. Looking closer at each dish, I couldn't tell which looked more delicious. They were all so tantalizing, as if they had been made specially for a magazine shoot.

“This is normal for her,” Krystal replied. “If she'd outdone herself there would be more waiting on the kitchen counters.”

“Actually,” Rhonda said, “I have a ham still in the oven, but you two have enough time to clear some of these plates and make room for it. So dig in.”

Following Krystal's lead, I started loading my plate with as much food as I could get. From the first bite (creamy mashed potatoes with butter and sausage gravy) I was in hog heaven. Everything tasted as good as it looked, Krystal's comment about her mother refining the recipes proven to be more than talk.

I watched my cousin for a couple minutes to gauge just how... unabashedly voracious I could be. There had been times when I would be eating and I would get into the zone, scarfing down my food as fast as I could, not caring about whatever sounds of eating or moans of pleasure I was making. This being my first meal in my new home, I wanted to make a good impression.

But when I saw how greedily Krystal was eating, and how Aunt Rhonda was not the least bit bothered, I started to loosen up. I began taking bigger bites, or pushing more food into my mouth before I was done chewing what was already there. When I loaded up my plates with seconds, thirds, fourths, I took bigger portions, going less for variety and more for quantity.

Aunt Rhonda finished well before either of us, and she just sat there smiling contently as the two fat girls before her kept chowing down. Her attempts at small talk were either yes-no questions to us (that we could answer without pausing in our eating) or her talking at length about something. She mostly talked about her cooking, about the changes to each recipe she made, and about Krystal's favorite dishes.

“I'll have to make them all for you. Get your thoughts on them as well.”

Around the eighth course I was starting to get full, and after the drive down I was feeling sleepy.

“That was amazing,” I said, pushing my plate away. I leaned back, hitching my t-shirt up and rolling the waistband of my pants down.

“You can't be done yet,” Aunt Rhonda said, shocked and a little bit offended. “You've barely tried the fried eggplant.”

I wasn't at max capacity yet, so I took some more and kept going, albeit a little slower now.

“And I suppose Krystal didn't explain to you,” Aunt Rhonda continued, “that we have a special rule in this house: we don't do leftovers. I know it's probably different from at your house, but down here we don't take food for granted. A lot of love goes into these meals, and I like to know it's appreciated.”

Talk about a guilt trip. After I was done with the eggplant I moved onto the sweetbread. I saw most of the table had been cleared, Krystal and I doing a number on the small feast already, so the thought of finishing what was left wasn't terrible. It's not like I was against the idea of eating more, but being pressured into it and going beyond what I wanted to naturally... that was a little weird. Still, first impressions.

When we were done Krystal and I were both slouching in our chairs, our bellies rock-solid and jutting forward. We were having trouble breathing, our eyes glazed over.

“Wonderful!” Aunt Rhonda clapped her hands. “I feel almost blessed to now have two hungry girls under my roof. I'm going to have so much fun feeding you gals.”

She started cleaning up the table, while Krystal and I sat there immobilized by our packed guts.

“Dessert will be ready in about an hour, so don't go far.”

When the table was cleared Aunt Rhonda sequestered herself in the kitchen, Krystal and I slowly reclaiming mobility.

“I'll show you... to your... room,” Krystal huffed. As we shuffled to the stairs, ponderously mounting each step, I said

“Quite a... meal. I haven't... eaten like that... since... Buttercombe.”

“Told you... Mama... loves to cook.”

“If I ate like that... all the time... whew... I'd be twice as big... within a month.”

1412312.content:
We reached the top of the stairs, stopping to catch our breath, as Krystal said

“That's normal for us. Hope you packed stretchy pants, because your ass is going to get a lot bigger.”

I wasn't sure if Krystal was teasing or not, having fun with me as the newcomer unfamiliar with the family's customs. Could Aunt Rhonda really be cooking that much at every meal?

Oh yes, she could. Dessert that night was pecan pie, Krystal and I each getting an entire one of our own, with whipped cream and doughnuts fried in lard on the side. Just a couple doughnuts, but the next morning at breakfast we each had a full dozen sitting at our places, along with the bacon, eggs, waffles, sausage, biscuits in gravy and hashbrowns filling the table.

Then lunch was a parade of cold cut subs and chili, simpler fare which, it turned out, gave Aunt Rhonda more time to concentrate on dinner, another gut-busting avalanche of dishes that left Krystal and I stupefyingly stuck in our chairs.

And that was the tone for every day I was with Aunt Rhonda. It took more than two weeks for Krystal to show me around the town because we were expected to take every meal of every day at home, leaving us only a few hours in each day to venture out.

Not that there was much to do in town. There was a pretty large mall, built just a few years before and still shiny and new, and a movie theater. Plus some stuff that didn't interest me, like a hunting lodge and paintball course. No, once I knew my way around town I found little reason to leave the house.

Made it easier for Aunt Rhonda, definitely. In addition to breakfast, lunch and dinner she was pushing a bevy of snacks on us. Most parents would lament their children spending all summer indoors, binge-watching Netflix, but Aunt Rhonda welcomed the chance to keep us glutted on goodies in the convenience of her living room.

And don't go thinking I was an unwitting victim in this. I was still the fat-obsessed, gluttonous girl I had been when I got here, without a single qualm about taking advantage of Aunt Rhonda's generosity. I accepted every tray of snacks or plate of food happily, devouring it and eager for more. And Krystal was just as bad. She was more familiar than I how enabling her mother was, so she had even less reservations about spending all day either at the dining table or the couch in the living room, vacuuming up whatever food was in reach.

As comfortable with the set-up as she was, my cousin didn't have quite the same knack for eating or gaining that I did. My first month at Aunt Rhonda's passed with her swelling up fatter, reaching the size I had been when I first arrived at her house, but I had already left that number on the scale behind before then. My body had adapted to the abundance of food at Aunt Rhonda's by becoming even more demanding and even more frightened that a great famine was on the way. My stomach cried out for more and more food, and my body stored ever more fat all over itself.

My ass was the main recipient; it wouldn't be much longer before Krystal and I together would be too big for the couch, and I had already outgrown the recliner next to it. Soon I'd have the couch to myself, my hips and thighs spreading across the cushions and, one day, reaching both armrests. Whether I was sitting or standing you could see a shelf of fat rolling out behind me, joining with my hips to create a crescent of fat surrounding three-quarters of me.

My belly was getting stretched out every day, yet it still claimed some of the new poundage for itself. Completely empty (something you would only see when I had just woken up and without my breakfast yet) it sagged over my sex and halfway down my thighs. Full, it could exceed the reach of my arms. My breasts looked like small potatoes next to my belly and ass, but they were more like small pumpkins.

Up a little higher I had grown a fourth chin, even more of my neck now obscured by the cascading fat-falls of my face. Unless I raised my head it looked like I was sinking into a sea of fat; a wonderful image, and one I would work to bring closer to reality every day.

At the end of my first month I had gained close to a hundred pounds, the milestone of weighing a quarter of a ton within my chubby-fingered grasp. This was more than I could have hoped for, but it was just the beginning. Aunt Rhonda was hooked on feeding me, and I was hooked on eating. Give it time, and I could be the fattest woman on Earth.

You know they make us girls down here a little thicker than they do up north." Krystal chuckled, sending waves through her engorged chins and heaving her chest up and down. "What did they feed you at that school?"

"Well yes you'd be correct, it was the food at the prep school I went to that helped me acquire this body. But enough about me, tell me what have you been getting into?" I had to change the conversation. I liked talking about my weight, but not like this.

"Oh not much. Mama likes to make sure I get three full meals a day, so I some times go to the mall, but usually I've been sticking around here. Mama has been practicing her cooking so she makes she I try a little bit of all her dishes, I'm kinda like her personal taste tester."

"Oh that explains it." I voiced my thoughts out loud about how my cousin could have gotten so big. But it still didn't explain why she was so naive about her size.

"Mama loves to make sure she cooks my favorites, so don't go taking my fair share,ok?" Was this twirp telling me what I can't eat? Ok now that wasn't going to fly. A big girl like me can't be held responsible for the food that goes into her mouth. If it's on the table it's up for grabs.

Before I could tell my cousin other wise we were interrupted. "Girls, dinners ready!"

a plump, jolly woman who'd always been more than a little heavy.
a big busty blimp, who'd put on a LOT of weight since being married to my Aunt.
1413.content:
I knew that it had to be my Aunt Sally.

I was never really sure, but I think one of the main reasons that my Mom and my Aunt Rhonda never really got along was the fact that my aunt was gay. She never said anything outright, but I knew enough about my mother to know that she just didn’t really like anyone who was different than her. Add into the fact that she never really called Sally my Aunt Rhonda’s wife—things more along the lines of “partner”, “special friend”, and “roommate”— while bashing their home life at every opportunity, and it became pretty clear early on that I could add “homophobe” on the list of things that I didn’t like about my mother.

Despite that, they were always super cool with me and the rest of my family. My aunts always gave the best gifts at Christmas time, sent us care packages from time to time, and (let’s be honest) were letting me live with them because my Mom was such a bitch. I think because they could never really have kids of their own, my aunts sort of looked at me, my sister, and all my cousins like their own kids—except they only saw them once a year sometimes and didn’t have to deal with them when they were bad. Which probably explains why Aunt Sally was so cool with me moving in with them and imposing my immensity on both of them, and the fact that I probably hadn’t seen either one since I was shipped off to Buttercombe Academy.

As I understood it, my aunts had met on the internet when I was little. They dated for a while before taking the plunge, where my Aunt Rhonda moved down south and my Aunt Sally became my Aunt Sally. While my Aunt Sally worked a white collar job at some vehicle manufactoring company, my Aunt Rhonda got to stay home and play housewife while doing odd jobs here and there. I guess, between the two of them, they could support me. So I guess I didn't feel too bad about imposing myself. Certainly not when I was being welcomed with such open arms.

“Sweetie?” my Aunt called up the stairs again, “Yer comin’ down sometime tonight, right?”

“Yeah Rhonda, I’m comin’!” came the distinctively deep purr of my other aunt from up the stairs, “Don’t you dare start without me again!”

As she descended down the stairs, I got a good look at my dear Aunt Sally…
1413.title: Please Excuse my Dear Aunt Sally

choices: I could see how Sally got so fat—Aunt Rhonda was an AMAZING cook!
After dinner, my Aunt Rhonda helps me get settled in.
Something else happened later that day...
14133.content:
As she descended down the stairs, slowly and with great exertion, I got a good look at my Aunt Sally for the first time in years…

Now, I remembered her as something of an amazon. Tall, long red hair, and looks that could kill. She always wore these three-piece ensembles with tight little skirts. Big breasts, a strong but not overly masculine jawline, a contender for a real life Wonder Woman. The fact that she towered over the rest of us, even the adults in the family, certainly helped my then little mind build up that image.

The woman who came down the stairs, however, wasn’t really what most would consider Amazonian material. She was just as tall and her hair was just as red; it was literally almost everything else that had changed. Namely that her features, once strong and proud, hadn’t so much softened as much as they had inflated. My Aunt Sally had been voluptuous all my life, no doubt, but never quite so dangerously so.

“Is that Mel I hear?” she huffed and puffed as she came down the stairs, gripping the guardrail with one hand as she gingerly lowered herself down one step at a time, “Hold on sweetie, lemme… lemme get down there first… phew…”

As she slowly descended the stairs, my attention actually managed to shift to something other than the heavenly smells filling the house. She was even bigger up close—something that, at least, had stayed the same. At such a huge height to begin with, I had no idea how much my aunt could have possibly weighed. She was at least a head or so taller than I was, and we looked to be almost the same amount of fatass. Her belly strained the buttons on her blouse and her fupa pressed tightly against her tentish skirt, managing to hold such a gut perfectly still as she lumbered down the stairs with all the grace of a Buttercombe graduate. Her features—high cheekbones, strong chin, firm jawline—had all been buried under pound upon pound of facial fat, framed by a Daytime-TV-Perfect hairdo of orange brown. Her chins touched the swell of her chest, leaving her no neck to speak of as she wrestled two ripened melons that even now threatened to pop the buttons on her blouse right at my face.

She took a second to catch her breath, gripping the column at the end of the stairwell tightly, before waddling closer towards me and wrapping me in this big, flabby, titteriffic hug.

“It’s so good to see you!” my Aunt Sally wheezed breathlessly, “Oh you got so big!”

“Yeah… you too?” I answered a little flabbergasted before I attempted to hug back, “Thanks for letting me stay with you guys.”

“Oh don’t mention it, sweetie. We’re family.” Aunt Sally said as she broke away—I could see that the climb down the stairs had left her damp with sweat—and gave me another look at just how closely this family was beginning to resemble me, “We’d do it for ya anytime.”

Even standing a few feet apart, our guts were still getting acquainted. They brushed up against each other as Aunt Sally fidgeted in place, sniffing around like I’d been for the past few minutes before I got so seriously distracted. Somehow, Sally had been fattened up into a prize-winning porker—and judging by the overpowering aroma of home-cooked kitchenry, I could only begin to guess the culprit…

“Mmm… smells good Rhonda.” She turned her attention to my other aunt, “Is that…” her voice fell as she let out a familiar noise of guttural satisfaction

“Sure is, sweetie!” Aunt Rhonda said with a pinch of Sally’s overly appled cheek, “Your favorite—meatloaf, fried chicken, and spaghetti casserole served with mashed potatoes, green beans, creamed corn and lots of macaroni pie!”

I practically started drooling right there as my suspicions were confirmed. My Aunt Sally held no such reservations and actually started smacking her lips before waddling towards the kitchen, a hungry glimmer in her eyes as she inadvertently gave me a great view of her ass that was easily the size of the broad side of a barn.

If my Aunt Sally was anything to go by, moving in with Aunt Rhonda was definitely the right decision if I wanted to fatten myself up.
14133.title: Super-Sized Aunt Sally

My Aunt Sally and I got to talking.
141331.content:
Let me put it this way: if Aunt Rhonda was this good of a cook, I could very easily see myself becoming a permanent fixture in this non-traditional family.

My Aunt Rhonda guided me to the head of the dinner table where a smorgasbord of country cooking awaited me—and I knew in that instant that I was home. She ushered me into the room, pulled a chair that was just big enough to support someone of my size and weight (or, rather I should say my Aunt Sally’s size, since they were probably made with her in mind), and gave me a little napkin to put in my lap while she went to work on plopping a little bit of everything onto my plate.

Two pieces of country-fried chicken, a fat thigh and a juicy leg respectively, a mountain of mashed potatoes with a lake of gravy inside, three slates of meatloaf doused in ketchup to make a meaty slab of the stuff next to a serving of spaghetti casserole with so much meat and cheese I had trouble picking it apart from the equally enormous helping of macaroni pie were all plopped onto my plate with the tender love and care of a southern hostess, all served to me on what couldn’t have been anything smaller than a platter. She set it down in front of me, gave me my silverware, and told me to dig in…

So dig in I did.

I mean, I just fucking dove into my plate. Face-first, probably; my excitement sort of blurred my memory. But what I do know is that that was some of the best fucking food I’d ever had in my entire life. The potatoes were buttery and flakey, the casserole was meaty and just the right amount of saucy, and the meatloaf was so fucking perfect that I only regret I couldn’t have made a sandwich out of it. Seriously, my Aunt Rhonda had every lunchlady back at Buttercombe beat by a wide mile when it came to cooking up fat-girl feed.

But that was just the first plate.

As I continued to stuff—no, gorge myself on all of my aunt’s dinner delicacies, my mind started to get fuzzy. This food was so good, so delicious, I honestly don’t think that I would have stopped eating it if I didn’t have to. Even as my gut grew round and firm, its malleable massiveness growing hard in the middle as a food baby slowly expanded it outwards, all I could think was that I needed more.

About halfway through, I fussed with the button on my last pair of jeans; undoing them so as to allow my great big belly to seize forward and unzip them for me, and all bets were off. My stomach completely unencumbered, I ate and ate and ate and ate.

Looking back on it now, I probably gave a really shitty first impression. I mean, here my aunts were giving me a place to live for free, and then I go and eat the fuck out of most of their food. It was probably good that I gave them a good idea of what to expect from me now that I was squatting there—ie; eating the fuck out of most of their food—but I guess I sort of feel bad about it now.

I ate for hours. Dinner lasted until dark in my aunts’ home, something that I hadn’t done in a while. Not since Thanksgiving at Buttercombe Academy, actually, when my roommate had to get a trio of other girls to drag me back to our room.

I sat at the head of the table, the guest of honor in this little celebration, panting and wheezing up a storm. My face was beet red, and I was sweating so much that I must have been shiny. My poor belly was so big that I’d had to scoot back from the table about an hour beforehand, and it still wasn’t enough. My eyes were just barely focused, but I could very clearly see that between Aunt Sally and I, we’d pretty much decimated the dinner table.

As if to illustrate to my aunts how completely stuffed I was, I let slip the biggest, angriest burp I’d ever given—releasing some of the PSI in my dangerously overfilled gut.

“Well Ah’ll take that as a win for me!” Aunt Rhonda said with a proud smile as she started to clear the table, “How’d ya like yer first meal in yer new home, Mel?”

“S’good.” I burbled stupidly, “S’real good…”

“Good to hear.” Aunt Rhonda said with a pinch of my cheeks and a pat on my shoulder, “Also happy to see that this whole thing with mah sister hasn’t put a damper on yer appetite because, if ya couldn’t tell before, I like to cook.”

I laughed weakly, the action hurting my belly so badly that I honestly thought that I was going to barf.

I looked over to the panting, sputtering whale seated at the other end of the table—my Aunt Sally looked to be in a similar state as I was. At some point she’d popped a breast button on her blouse and I could see the crest of her valley of cleavage—as well as the skimpy black holder she’d shoved those boulders into. If I had to guess, my poor aunt got a little too excited herself at seeing all her favorites spread out before her… I know I had.

I mean seriously, fat girl gastronomies aside, I had really overdone it. I had been subsisting almost entirely on junk food since I’d graduated from prep school. My tummy was in no way ready to deal with the heavy onslaught of calories that my Aunt Rhonda had prepared for me. Don’t get me wrong, I loved a good meal as much (probably more) than the next fat chick, but I was seriously considering retirement.

After we sat there for a while, Aunt Rhonda cleaning up while Sally and I digested…

1413311.content:
I had almost fallen asleep in my chair when the smell of various pies woke me up. “Wake up Mel, Sweetie ah cooked y'all some desserts.”

I opened my eyes to see a massive spread of pies, at least eight different kinds, along with at least two tubs of ice cream, one chocolate and one vanilla. I looked over to Aunt Sally, who had clearly done what she could to make room, but most of that was adjusting her posture and unbuttoning most of her blouse to let her gut hang over her skirt, which it did, making Sally look a hell of a lot fatter than she did when her belly was tucked in. It was then I realized I had already done all I could to make room during the meal proper, let alone have room for dessert.

“Uhmm, Rhonda?” I asked sheepishly, “You don't happen to have any tums would you?”

She looked up from the pie she as cutting, a gorgeous smelling blueberry, and said, “of course darling give me a minute to serve these up and I'll see what I can do.

As so after a few seconds of plating half a pie with two scoops of ice cream each to both me and Sally, she apparently would not be having any, she rummaged through her purse and tossed me a container of brand X antacid to hopefully release pressure on my poor bloated tummy. I popped a few in my mouth and let the bubbles do their magic.

After a minute I had let out the biggest burp I head ever heard, and I'd had some pretty intense soda chugging experience in Buttercombe. But despite it making room for quite a bit more food it still wasn't enough to fit the platter she had spread in front of me. I had gotten through most of the pies she had given me, and we were on our second to last plate when I finally gave in. I was stuffed. I could eat no more. It had been a while since I'd been able to say that. But now I had to admit it. And on top of that I'd have to admit defeat while so stuffed I could barely breathe.

“Ah-Aunt *huff puff* Aunt Rhonda?” I said pushing my chair back to give me room to breathe

“Yes Mel?” She said turning to look at me from staring at her wife

“Could I, uhh..” I put my pudgy hand behind my neck and looked around the room.

“Could you?”

“Could I put the rest of this pie up for later, I'm stuffed to the brim.” I finally let out.

“Now Mel, I'm gonna tell you this once, this is not a leftover house. I expect those who I cook for to eat what I make for them.” she said in a shockingly stern tone.

“I'm not trying to sound ungrateful here, It's just that I'm as stuffed as a turkey on thanksgiving here Auntie, I'm about to pop.” I explained, doing my best to not sound like a whining child

“Well just try a bit more and we'll see about how you feel. Alright?”

I pushed around the pie for a few seconds, before shoving a few bites of ice cream in my already tight belly. I managed to get the rest of the plate I had into me before she finally decided to have mercy on my poor fat tummy. I looked over to Sally for the first time since I started dessert, and she was stuffing her face like a pig, I'd not seen anyone eat like that. I made a mental note to ask her how she eats like she does later. But for now I just had to figure out how I was gonna get to my room.

I pushed myself up out of the chair, something that was normally a mild struggle turned into the most physical exertion if had to do all year. I huffed and puffed my way to where Sally has sat on the couch to ask where my room was, and she led me back through the kitchen into the guest room, my new room, and showed me around bringing in my stuff for me. As I lay on the bed I didn't know if I wanted this to be the norm, on the one hand if I ate like that every day I'd be immobile before the end of the summer, but on the other hand, if she cooks like that every day I'd die of a burst stomach before I got through lunch.

I rubbed my poor bloated tummy, letting out small little burps as I slowly fell to sleep.

I woke up to...

Aunt Rhonda wakes me up in the middle of the night—midnight snack, anyone?
1413312.content:
After a suitable amount of time had passed, and I managed to digest at least some of the monster meal that I’d happily endeavored, I figured that it was about time that I got to bed. We were getting on into the wee hours of the night, and honestly after a meal like that I figured that I may as well throw in the towel and call it a day. With no small amount of exertion, my Aunt Rhonda helped heave me up to my feet. I said my goodnights to Aunt Sally—the embrace forgone on both parts due to the sheer exhaustion of wrapping our arms around one another—and I was ushered out of the kitchen.

Thankfully, my room was to be on the bottom floor. Apparently the only rooms in use upstairs were Aunt Sally’s office and another bathroom; most of our time would be spent downstairs, which didn’t surprise me one bit. I couldn’t imagine my fat ass climbing stairs every day just to flop down on my bed, and that probably meant that Sally faced a similar predicament. With Aunt Rhonda leading the way, I trotted heavily behind her as we came to a pause in the surprisingly spacious hallway.

“This’ll be yer room, sweetheart.” My aunt gestured to the door, smiling that perfect housewife/surrogate mother sort of smile as she twisted the knob, “Feel free to make it your own.”

Puffing appreciatively, I waddled beyond her and through the doorway into my new room. It was nice enough; nice curtains, a desk with a woefully undersupported chair (I’d get my aunts to replace that later) and a closet that looked up to the task of holding my backlog of outgrown ensembles. The most important and appealing part of it though, was definitely the bed. After an entire afternoon spent at the dinner table, stuffing my fat face until I could barely see straight, nothing sounded better to me than crawling under the covers and falling into a nice little food coma.

“Thanks Auntie.” I smiled weakly, “This is great.”

“I’m happy it meets your approval.” My Aunt’s voice was much more firm than mine, a consequence of having gotten the scraps between the two hottest hogs in the house, “How was dinner—did you like it?”

“That was also great.” I said with a little more fire in my belly, subconsciously coming to rest my hands on the flanks of my gut, “Best dinner ever.”

“Glad to hear it, Mel.” My Aunt pat my tummy approvingly as it gurgled in ecstatic agony, “Now get your rest. You’ve had a long day drivin’ yourself up here and I want you to sleep at least ‘til noon. Y’hear me?”

“Yes ma’am!” I agreed all to eagerly, receiving another placating belly pat as my aunt walked out the door.

Once I was alone, I stripped down as quickly as my sluggish enormity would allow. It was an awful lot of work getting naked at my size—especially when I was over encumbered by more than a few heaping helpings of southern home cooking. My belly was so bloated that I could bend over even less than I normally could, which meant lots of pulling and wriggling to get my jeans off. I plopped my fat ass on the bed, making it groan and squeak as I burdened it with what was likely the biggest butt it had ever met. When I was down, I kicked my flabby legs sporadically in an attempt to coerce the skin-tight denim past my saddlebag thighs; eventually settling on just coaxing them down the old fashioned way and kicking them off the rest of the way.

“Oh damn.” I whistled, noticing the busted zipper and the fraying strings around the button, “These things’ll be done by tomorrow if I keep eating like this…”

The thought… excited me.

I came to rest my hand on my fupa as it bulged out against my lap, cupping my big belly roll with two chubby hands ill-equipped for anything other than feeding myself and fondling myself. I pressed slightly into the surface of my great gut, eliciting a sharp wincing pain and another hot burp as I relieved some pressure on the inner contents of my gut.

I fell backwards onto the bed, my legs dangling off as I tested the springs’ integrity in the poor mattress. My belly stuck high into the air, a towering monument to my commitment to indulge myself and reaffirmed by a night’s worth of hoggish indulgence that surpassed even my usual feats of fatgirlery. As I continued to grope myself, my breathing growing husky and terse, I felt my food baby churn and bubble beneath the skin of my fat, kicking me as I rubbed and poked and prodded.

That first night was… a good one.

Let’s just leave it at that.
1413312.title: Big Girl Breaks in the Bed

choices: As my aunts kept spoiling me, the food kept coming! I'm in hog heaven!
The next morning, I woke up to an empty house and a note on the fridge...
So I stumbled upon something interesting while making myself at home...
14133123.content:
After I’d gathered the strength to turn off the lights, crawl under the covers, and thoroughly masturbate myself to sleep, I was awoken just a few hours later.

This was particularly jarring because one, I hadn’t even begun to acclimate to my new surroundings (except in one rather intimate way), so when I woke up I was already taken off guard. Two, I was having my recurring dream about the cast of Supernatural pamper me and feed me until I couldn’t move, and I didn’t exactly ever get to finish the part where Dean ventures between my legs and underneath my belly. Three, the lamp just fucking turned on right in front of my face.

While I groaned in agony, whining because it couldn’t possibly have been morning yet and I had a lot of fat girl sleep to catch up on, my Aunt Rhonda perched herself merrily on the sliver of bed edge that wasn’t taken up by one of my flabby limbs or my acre of belly. She had changed into a pair of pajamas not unlike what I liked to wear; a cute little tank top that hugged her full chest and waist, and a pair of pink plaid sleep pants that were incredibly cute and I totally would have stolen if I had any hopes of fitting into them.

In her hand, a platter of brownies.

Like, a goddamn platter of brownies.

“Aunt Rhonda?” I managed sleepily, rubbing my eyes with one chubby hand, “W’time izzit?”

“Just a little past midnight.” She said in a matter-of-fact sort of way, “Ah was making brownies and Ah figured that you’d like to have some.”

She lowered the platter in front of me and, of fucking course, I accepted them readily. Eagerly, even. My immediate response to any type of food these days was to cram it into my mouth—especially brownies and especially if they surprise brownies. I was sure that I had to be dreaming, but when Sam didn’t come in shirtless with the chocolate syrup, I begrudgingly accepted that this must be reality. My sweet, chocolatey reality.

“Mmmrm… they’re good.” I smacked my lips as I took another brownie off the platter, “But… mmph… midnight brownies, Aunt Rhonda? Seriously, do you have the munchies or something?”

My aunt placed the platter down on the table beside my bed, well within my reach (and I continued to reach for them even as she spoke, slowly dwindling my stack of chocolate squares one or two at a time) and sat back down.

“Oh, your Aunt Sally likes to have a little midnight snack every once in a while.” My aunt said with a smile, “Ah figured what the hell and made another batch just for you.”

“Aww.” I said with a mouthful of mush before swallowing, “Love you too, auntie.”

My aunt’s smile grew wider as she pat my cheek, tussling my long blonde hair as she reached over to the other side of the bedside table and moved a glass of milk within my reach. I grabbed for it immediately and slurped it down; relishing every sip of its cool, creamy texture.

“Betcha never got midnight room service at that school a’yours, didja?” she added wryly, “And you certainly didn’t get it at home.”

“You know, I never did.” I wiped a pretend tear from my eye (it may have been a brownie crumb), “I’ve been so deprived.”

My aunt chuckled at the thought, probably amused by the notion that anyone could have called her four-hundred pound heifer of a niece ‘deprived’.

“Well Ah’ve gotta get back to your Aunt Sally.” She said to me as I continued to scarf down sweets, “She gets a little grumpy when she’s hungry. G’night, Melly. Sweet dreams.”

“Good night Auntie!” I said as she shut the door, still battling the invading army of brownies with a dwindling reserve of milk.

Soon enough, I was back to bed; the brownies defeated, my tummy topped off, and back to my dreamworld where the Winchester brothers worked to keep me satisfied, armed with nothing but bricks of brownies, gallons of milk, and their own lack of shirts…
14133123.title: Midnight Snacks with Auntie

choices: I spent all day being stuffed & spoiled by Aunt Rhonda—I barely left the kitchen
I go clothes shopping with Aunt Sally—who treats me to a new wardrobe and lunch!
I head out by myself, ready to explore my new hometown...
141331231.content:
Despite the fact that I had actually woken up not hungry for the first time in probably a few months, I managed to eat all of the breakfast that my Aunt placed in front of me. I didn’t exactly live up to my promise of sleeping until noon, but only because the sweet smell of pancakes filled the whole house and got me all excited. That being said, I had no idea what I was waddling into; led by the nose via the intoxicating aroma of blueberry flapjacks, bacon, and eggs…

And, I would come to find out, more. I wasn’t sure if this was some kind of welcoming breakfast to go along with the feast that had been my welcoming dinner or if I’d actually died and gone to fat girl heaven; I could have checked either box and not known the difference.

My aunts were right where I’d left them last night, Rhonda at the oven doting over Sally at the head of the table. And, just like last night, there was so much food on the table that I doubt that I could have made out a single grain of wood. There were stacks of pancakes on a platter, a super-sized serving dish of scrambled eggs, a brush of bacon, thick pink slabs of ham open for grabs, practically a whole fucking loaf of toast… I had to stop myself from throwing myself onto the dinner table!

“Oh good, you’re up.” My Aunt Sally said in her deeper voice, chowing down on some bacon from her fat grip, “Just in time for breakfast!”

“Yeah!” I said excitedly, ignoring the protests of my still taxed tummy as I waddled towards my seat, Aunt Rhonda pulling it out for me as I plopped myself down, “Do you guys do this every morning?”

“Every morning; bet you’re not used to that, huh? Normally Ah try not to spoil your Aunt Sally’s appetite so much, but we both figured that your bein' here was calls to cut loose a little.” Aunt Rhonda gave a wry little crinkle of her prominent nose towards her breasty behemoth of a wife, who let out a sultry laugh as a sign of approval, “Now eat up—I don’t want those flapjacks getting cold.”

I vowed not to let that happen.

Beginning a breakfast-meat remix of last night, I found myself drawn to Aunt Rhonda’s exquisite cooking. It didn’t matter that I still hadn’t managed to digest last night’s dinner or the brownies she brought me; my complex relationship with food and my desire to see myself grow even bigger and fatter than I already was aside, I probably still would have kept eating. Her food was that good, no lie.

While I was obviously still sluggish from waking up and having a half-digested food baby in my belly, I was surprisingly quick for being Morning Mel. I managed to hold my own against Aunt Sally at least, who seemed hardly bothered by all that she’d eaten the night before. Must be how fucking tall she was.

Three plates of pancakes, more strips of bacon than I probably should have taken, and a mountain of eggs later, and I was about ready to throw in the towel. My gut was still so round and fat from last night, I wasn’t sure that I’d be able to get up after refilling it up; even if I did have my aunts’ help. At least this time I was in my jammies, which meant that I didn’t run the risk of sending a button across the room.

“That was… so good…” I panted, clutching my gut at both sides, “I can’t… eat another bite…”

Seriously, what was wrong with me? I mean, I always loved to stuff my face. Always. And for a four hundred pound heifer like me, “stuffed” didn’t come easy. But I’d just been bottomed out by Aunt Rhonda’s all-star cuisine twice in a row now. It was like some sort of switch flipped on in my head and I had to eat it. I might have been worried, if I could have thought straight.

“Mm-hmm, glad to hear it.” My aunt pat my cheek approvingly as she cleared the scores of vanquished plates from my sight, “Now that you’ll be stayin’ with us Mel, I ought to get used to cooking a little extra.”

I heard a thick noise of approval escape my Aunt Sally, who was picking her teeth decadently on the other side of the table.

“I could get behind that.” She purred, “Couldn’t you, Mel?”

“Hff… yeah…” I wheezed, smiling weakly, “Totes…”
141331231.title: The Biggest Breakfast

1413312311.content:
I wasn’t sure what my Aunt Sally did for a living, but it was certainly enough to allow my Aunt Rhonda time to fritter away in the kitchen.

I had just barely escaped from breakfast, Aunt Sally’s widening frame having left the doorway, and plopped myself on my aunts’ super-reinforced couch for a little morning television. I didn’t know any of the channels, so I was happy to flip through them until something familiar came along to distract me from the ache in my ample inches. I hadn’t quite figured out their cable box (seriously, switch to satellite.) but the welcome tones of the Friends cast and the cute little candy dish by my side were enough to keep me company as I dozed off, sprawled out on the couch…

***


I woke up later, how much later I didn’t know, to the familiar smell of sizzling meat. It must have filled the whole house; the strong and undeniable scent of cooking pork products meant that I woke up with my lips smacking. I had been drooling in my sleep, and now I knew the reason why.

I slowly rocked myself to a seated position, my size and current level of fullness governing my speed at heaving myself up even with incentive, to get a better picture of what was cooking. I now smelled potatoes, with an undertone of something bready, as well as maybe… maybe something sweet? I don’t know. But my mind was racing. I grappled the armrest of the couch and struggled to push myself up, my unused muscles quivering and shaking in strain as I eventually poured myself into a standing position.

I followed my nose to the kitchen, where I was greeted with the welcome sight of the dinner table—filled yet again with a smorgasbord of down-home delights.

“Hey Auntie.” I burbled confusedly as I scratched my tummy, “Dinnertime already?”

“Dinner?” my Aunt turned from her covered countertop, “Mel, sweetie, it’s just about time for lunch. Y’aint been sleepin’ that long.”

I… hadn’t been? Sure felt like I had. But I guess she was right; my stomach wasn’t nearly as empty as it would have been if it were dinnertime. Even still, the sight of all that food on the table, those delicious smells wafting over me in the air… I could afford to make some room, right?

“Now c’mon and sit down.” My aunt said in a matronly manner as she went back to her cooking, “It’s a good thing you woke up—I don’t think Ah woulda had the heart to do it. You were so cute, layin’ there on the couch.”

“Yeah, yeah.” Ugh. She already did Mom-stuff. Like, normal people mom-stuff, not my mom’s mom-stuff. I scooted back one of the massive Sally-sized chairs and plopped down in it, seemingly making the whole kitchen quake a little, “Thanks for letting me crash on the couch like that, Auntie. I don’t think I would have made it back to my room after breakfast.”

“Think nothin’ of it at all, Melly.” My Aunt turned around and smiled, armed with a pan of… cornbread? Yeah, cornbread. “In all honesty, Ah should be thankin’ you—it gets a l’il lonely around here without mah Sally, an’ if yer Mama doesn’t want you around then Ah do.”

My Aunt set me up with a mountain of this… mixture. Corn beef hash is what she called it. It didn’t look really appealing (my city-girl instincts were showing, as my Aunts would later put it). Sizzled brown meat littered with chunks of potatoes thrown into the mix…

Okay, maybe it was a little appetizing. But not the point.

I started out with no less than a quarter of the pan of that stuff, plus a little building-block set of cornbread, a harvest of green beans, flaky buttery biscuits, and two cobs of corn that had been loaded with salt and butter to top me off. I appreciated the enthusiasm, but I would be lying if I said I wasn’t worried about not being able to finish my plate. Let alone the mini-Thanksgiving that my Aunt Rhonda had prepared for lunch.

Never the less, I started shoveling it down.

“That’s what Ah like t’see—a girl with an appetite.” My aunt said pleasantly as she pat me on the padded shoulder, “Now you eat as much as you want Mel; Ah made plenty.”

“Mmphm…” I swallowed nearly choking on my hash and Aunt Rhonda’s encouragement, “What about Aunt Sally? Shouldn’t we save some for her?”

“What? Oh no, sweetie, Sally doesn’t come home from work ‘til five!” my Aunt laughed, “She eats lunch with the girls’n her office.”

That… was worrying. Even for me. Because, as I’m sure I’ve said to you before, there was a lot of fucking food set out in front of me. I wasn’t even sure that I had completely digested last night’s dinner, let alone breakfast. I was all for pigging out—it was kind of my whole schtick—but Aunt Rhonda couldn’t have honestly expected me to eat all of this, could she?

14133123111.content:
“Yup, this is all for you sweetie.” My Aunt said with a happy face, “So you just go right ahead and dig in.”

I gulped, overwhelmed by the task in front of me. How could she honestly expect me—expect anyone, even someone my size—to have room after not one, but two of her super meals? I mean, I was a fat girl through and through, but this seemed downright impossible. I had stuffed myself to more than four hundred pounds over the past four years, but I had never had to eat so much. I could only wonder how I could have possibly been expected to eat all of this, fearing that I might actually explode if I managed to do it if not before.

But if I wanted to get fatter, eating a shit-ton of food was going to be my best route of doing it. I did my best to bear through it, scarfing through my pile of corn-beef hash (which was very good, btw) and taking little bites of cornbread as I whittled it away. Soon they, the corn, and the greenbeans were all gone. I was munching on my last biscuit, breathing heavily as the cracks in my solid stomach were filled with my top-off, when my aunt began to refill my platter. My eyes widened in surprise and, honestly, fear as she just happily piled more and more onto my plate.

“Auntie…” I gasped, “I don’t… I don’t think I can eat all that.”

“Now sweetie, Ah made all this for you.” my Aunt Rhonda said in the most stern tone that I’d heard since I moved in, hands on her hips and everything, “You’ve done eaten some of it, there ain’t much more to go. I don’t know how they did it at that Academy, but we don’t do leftovers in yer Aunt Rhonda’s house.”

She walked back over to the counter, hopefully fixing herself something so I wouldn’t have to eat literally all of it, and left me to my own devices. And since the devices were the fork and knife she gave me, I decided to at least put them to good use.

Against my better judgement, I continued to let my Aunt Rhonda guilt me into eating. After every plate—it seemed like after every bite—she would give me that same look that told me I wasn’t done. Don’t get me wrong, I was happy to eat my weight in food, but I preferred to limit such feats of gastronomy to maybe one meal a day, with several “normal” sized meals to keep me full. Aunt Rhonda, apparently, didn’t see it that way.

After maybe two hours of stumbling through my epic lunch, I had almost come to its conclusion. I was so full that I was shaking, like a bomb trembling before it exploded. I had bypassed the “I’m so full/horny” stage and moved right into “oh my god this woman is trying to kill me” one. Seriously, I had never been forced to eat before. It was exciting at first, but it quickly lost its appeal once I realized that leaving the dinnertable was right up there with blasphemy in my Aunt Rhonda’s house. Fetish be damned, this was the first time I hadn’t enjoyed eating in a long time!

“Done.” I said thickly, my voice heavy and slow as I struggled to keep consciousness, “M’done…”

My Aunt Rhonda smiled at me from across the table and looked over at my plate—like she was inspecting to see if I’d actually finished. Once she saw that there were merely crumbs left on my plate, she looked up at me.

“Good girl—clean plate!” she said in a motherly tone, “You wanna go take another nap?”

I leaned back into my chair, flailing my arms out behind me as my gut surged out in front of me. It was so stuffed, so fucking full that I could barely see straight. It was hot to the touch and tight as a drum, aching and throbbing with my heartbeat. I didn’t want to touch it—I couldn’t touch it, for fear that I would literally break apart into a billion little pieces.

“K-Kay….” I stammered, unable to lift myself, “C-Can’t… can’t…”

My aunt came over to shush me, stroking my back lovingly while I sat there, pinned down into the chair by my own overindulgence. I was sweaty and damp, sputtering like a steam engine as I struggled to discern what was going on around me. But my Aunt’s hands on my back felt good. She rubbed my tense muscles in a circular motion. It didn’t make the pain go away, but it lessened it slightly.

“Shh… it’s alright sweetheart. You just sit there for a minute and rest.” She said in a comforting, hushed voice, “I’m gonna start on dinner—you just sit there and look pretty, m’kay?”

I nodded stupidly as she left my side, huffing and puffing and wheezing as I struggled with consciousness. I was so full—so fat. I didn’t want to do anything other than just sit there and hope that there wasn’t any more food on the way. Just like Aunt Rhonda said—sit there and look pretty…

Wait, did she say “dinner?”

141331231111.content:
“Aunt Rhonda?” I cried, panting a little. I had just chugged a two-liter of cola, and before I caught my breath I was calling to the kitchen.

“What is it, honey?”

“M'out of soda! And ice cream!”

I wasn't out of ice cream yet, but the way I was scooping the creamy peanut butter treat to my mouth with an oversized spoon it was only a matter of time. It was my last carton from second breakfast.

“Just a sec. I gotta finish frying this chicken,” Aunt Rhonda called back. My stomach, already containing several plates and bowls of food, grumbled eagerly at the thought of fried chicken. The skin crackling and shiny with grease, the meat so juicy and succulent, tearing apart in my mouth.

I ate the ice cream faster, looking forward to the chicken. It would be just another course in the almost endless stream of them, my days now nothing but eating and sleeping, but Aunt Rhonda's cooking was so good, and she knew so many recipes, that even if I didn't love eating for the sake of eating I wouldn't want to do anything else.

And I hadn't, not for almost five months. Through the summer and into the fall now I had spent most of my days at home, gobbling up anything and everything Aunt Rhonda made for me. It might sound selfish, but my aunts were all too happy to spoil me. Aunt Rhonda loved having someone to cook for all day long, and Aunt Sally loved having a food buddy to binge with.

Me? I was happy to be spoiled. When I left my old house I wanted to seize my dream of being the fattest girl around, and when it was handed to me on a silver platter like this? Damn right I took it.

How was I doing, you ask? How does 800 pounds sound?

Yep. I had doubled my weight. I was 800 pounds of pear-shaped, couch-filling beauty. I had four chins, a 60-inch belly, 100-inch hips and my arms and legs were rolls of fat, one piled atop another.

That was why I wasn't in the dining room. Waddling all the way from my bedroom to the dinner table was too much, so in the morning I would get up and make my way to living room, settling on the couch (my ass had already made a permanent indentation in the cushions) and spending the day having Aunt Rhonda bring me carts of food.

I didn't go out, I didn't travel into town, I just sat and ate. I would have the TV on as I kept my belly filled – Aunt Sally had replaced their old 35-inch with a 55-inch smart TV and set me up a Netflix account back in August – but really I was concentrating on my food. From those early days of being overwhelmed by how much food I was being given, I was now a bottomless pit, always ready for more.


Aunt Rhonda came into the room, wheeling a cart filled with chicken, biscuits soaked in gravy, bottles of soda and tubs of ice cream.

“Ready for more?” she asked. Her tone was eager; far from exhausting her hospitality with my unremitting gluttony, she had continued to step up her game, always ready to feed me more.

“You bet,” I said, leaning back and shaking my belly. “This thing won't fill itself.”

“It's not too warm in here, is it?” she asked, pushing the cart closer to me and handing me a tub of ice cream. “I can't remember the last time we had an Indian summer last like this.”

“I'm fine.”

“You sure? You don't need another fan, do you?”

“Mmmf.” I swallowed my ice cream. I had one fan with me, sitting on the floor and pointed at my belly's underhang. Plus, I was mostly naked, wearing only a spaghetti strap bra. “Nope. But if you make any more shakes, that's be great.”

“Sure thing. Mocha or strawberry?”

“Can I have both?” I asked sweetly.

“Of course,” Aunt Rhonda almost practically cooed. “You can have anything you want, just ask.”

Yeah. Life with Aunt Rhonda was nothing like life back with my mom.

It was only at dinner that I would get up – needing help from Aunt Rhonda at this point, her pulling me forward so I could lift my boulder-sized butt off the couch and get standing upright – and go to the dining room. Aunt Rhonda insisted we eat dinner as a family, but as long as there was enough food I was fine with anything.

Tonight was seafood night, Aunt Rhonda filling the table with fried catfish, butterfly shrimp and jambalaya, plus several sides. Hours passed as I ate, cleaning all the plates and bowls after Aunts Rhonda and Sally had their fill. I didn't waste any time with filling a plate; I just grabbed a dish and shoveled the food directly into my mouth.

After dinner was dessert, entire pies and more cartons of ice cream finally filling my belly to full capacity for the first time today. I leaned back, content, drifting into a half-dreamy fugue.

“Did you get enough, sweetheart?” Aunt Rhonda asked. I didn't doubt that if I asked for more she would be able to produce something.

“Enough and then some, Aunt Rhonda.”

“You really packed it away today,” Aunt Sally said, impressed. “I thought I was a big eater, but you've put me to shame.”

“I love to eat,” I shrugged. “And I love being fat.”

“I know. In fact, there's something I want to talk to you about...”
