141331231112.content:
Five weeks. That's how long I was living with Aunts Rhonda and Sally before I actually left the house and explored my new hometown (and with how quickly and deeply I had fallen into the way of life with them, it wasn't hard to think of this as my new home). For over a month I would do little besides eat and sleep, and I'm not exaggerating to sound lazy. I would literally wake up, go to the dining room, stuff myself on my aunt's irresistible cooking, waddle to the living room and pass out on the couch, wake up for lunch, sleep most of the afternoon, glut myself at dinner, and retire to my bedroom for the night. And then I would be woken up around midnight by Aunt Rhonda, with a tray of some treat or another.

I mean, I was a big eater before all this, a dedicated glutton who wanted to stuff her face more than anything. But there was something about Aunt Rhonda – her cooking, her eager attitude, her refusal to let me leave the table when I was less than completely full – that made every meal for me a full-blown production. Snacking was becoming a memory; if I ate, I ate to the limit, not passively while doing something else.

The first few days I expected this to ease up. Once I was acclimated and they were used to my presence my aunts wouldn't feel so compelled to spoil me. The opposite happened; the more she learned about my capacity, the more Aunt Rhonda wanted to push it. Aunt Sally said it was her joy at having another mouth to feed, implying not-so-subtly that she was a born mother who never got the chance to express her nurturing nature. I don't know if it was really that simple, but the cause wasn't as important as the effects.

Even though Aunt Sally was enjoying herself more fully at mealtime, gaining a few pounds herself if her straining three-piece suits were an indication, I was showing the most growth. Small wonder; I was effectively housebound, present for three meals and a midnight snack every day. And it showed. In a little over a month I had jumped to over 475 pounds. I would have liked to have charted my growth as it happened, but it wasn't until a couple days ago that I thought to even ask if they had a scale.

I loved the look of the new weight on me. My butt looked the best, all bubbly and jutting out behind me, and when I sat down you could see it and my hips forming a ring around me. It's more obvious today, of course, but when I was taking some selfies to send to my friends from Buttercombe it was a new experience for me.

My boobs and belly were also bigger, and my upper arms jiggled and shook at the slightest jostle. My neck wasn't completely obscured yet, but my second chin was thicker and would form a third any day now. Even my cheeks were plumper; they looked like I was eating all the time, even those rare times when I wasn't.

There was one downside to hog heaven: clothing. I had packed what I could before coming down to Carolina, lucking out with a wardrobe that provided me enough cover and breathing room that I was decent, but that was at an end. For weeks my collection of clothes that fit me shrank two or three pieces at a time, and now I was getting desperate.

Aunt Sally came to some rescue, as her clothing was tailored to her much taller height, which balanced out with my now wider body. But she and I had different tastes in fashion, and I wanted less things that flowed over me and more that showed off all my well-earned curves.

Couple that with the monotony of bedroom-dining room-living room, and I was in need of a trip to town. At the start of the summer the shock from the change in temperature (good lord, how hot did Southern summers get?) was as much an incentive as anything for me to stay indoors, but it was the middle of July by now, and I felt I was as comfortable with the heat as I was ever going to get. And as comfortable with the daily stuffings. I hadn't let on yet, but my belly's capacity had grown pretty quickly under the flood of food Aunt Rhonda was forcing on me, and I was at the point now when one of her breakfasts wouldn't put me right back to sleep.

I picked one of Aunt Sally's few dresses, lifting the hem and keeping it up with safety pins; it was sleeveless and roomy, breathing well in the heat. With Aunt Rhonda's gift of some money (and the promise I would be back in time for lunch) I went out to the bus stop, hoping to hit the mall, get some new leggings and shirts, and maybe see a little of this place.

Even under the shade the air was stagnant and humid, and I was flushed by the time the bus pulled up. Sweet, sweet air conditioning.

I heaved myself up the three steps, paid the fare, and took one of the open benches near the front. My ass spread across two of the seats, making me even hotter than I already was.

The bus was almost empty, it being after rush hour, and it wasn't until I got to the mall that I made my first real impression on the local population.

There were a couple parties in the entrance of the mall; a mother and her baby, a pair of senior citizens mall-walking, and a trio of preteen girls. When I waddled through the doors (I pushed the automatic doors, not trying to squeeze through one of them) they all noticed me, some glancing up and others looking right at me, but they all had the same reaction: bland indifference.

OK, I was a little disappointed, I admit. It's not that I wanted taunts and sneers, but I always love when people see me coming and forget what they were doing.

The same thing happened as I walked across half the mall to the Torrid shop, passing people who noticed me but not my size. What was up with this? There were some other fat people, quite a few of them younger people, but it's not like this was Buttercombe and someone my size (or near my size; I had left the school one of the biggest girls around) was considered 'average.'

I would have loved to chat up the salesgirl, get to know something about the town and what there was to do, but I was already feeling my stomach start to empty, and I didn't want to spend too much time away from home. I found some clothes that were stylish and sized right, paid for them, and headed home.

I got home just in time for lunch, and the sight and smell of all that food pushed from my mind any thoughts about the people's reactions to me. But later that night, when Aunt Sally asked me how I liked the mall, it came back to me.

“There was one thing I thought was weird,” I said. “A lot of people noticed me, but nobody seemed to react to how big I am. It's like they see people as big as me all the time.”

Aunts Sally and Rhonda exchanged a quick glance.

“Actually...” Aunt Sally started, “They kind of do.”

“There's quite a lot of... big eaters in this town. It's one of the reasons we love this place. People don't look askance at Aunt Sally for her size, and the grocery stores are the best-stocked I've ever seen.”

“Really?” I asked, wondering why they hadn't told me this before. “What's the deal?”

“You remember that celebrity chef, Linda Roselli?”

I wracked my brain. The name sounded familiar, but I couldn't pin it down.

“She was big several years ago,” Aunt Rhonda explained. “Had a talk show, a couple bestsellers. Then it all imploded. Nutritionists and dieticians pounced upon her, saying her cooking was unhealthy, too fattening. She tried to fight back, said fat wasn't unhealthy, but it didn't matter. Her show was dropped, her publisher found a new young face, and she moved out here.

“The locals loved having a celebrity in town, and welcomed her with open arms. She originally didn't want to much except be alone and work on her recipes, but the town took to her so well she opened a restaurant. Italian menu. It was such a hit she opened another one, Southern cuisine, and then she started teaching classes at the learning annex.

“Pretty soon half the houses in town had Roselli's recipes cooking in their kitchen, including this one.”

“Your cooking was already fabulous,” Aunt Sally said, making mushy eyes at Aunt Rhonda. Aunt Rhonda did an 'Oh, go on,' hand thing.

“But yeah, her recipes aren't exactly health food, but they're so good nobody cares. Not everyone has gotten fat, but enough have that everyone has just taken it in stride.”

“You're pretty big even for this town,” Aunt Sally said, “but I know there's some people as big as you.”

As big as me, I thought. I had to meet these people; my pride as a fatty wouldn't let me be anything less than the fattest.

“Do you know any of them?” I asked.

141331231112221.content:
“I know a few.” Rhonda said after a certain silence that caused both my Aunt Sally and my own head to turn towards her, “I mean, not that I stare but…”

“Uh-huh.” My other aunt said with a roll of her eyes, picking at a scrap on her plate, “Sure you don’t.”

“Oh Sally, don’t be that way.” My Aunt Rhonda pshaww’d the bigger between them and turned back to me, though I noticed she was not without some trepidation as she spoke on the topic, “Most of the bigger people I’ve met—er, seen—around town are closer to your me and your Aunt Sally in age, but some of the biggest folk around here are actually about as old as you are.”

My eyes widened in surprise, an anxiousness bubbling beneath my ribs and all my blubber as the realization hit me. Not only was I not the fattest girl in town (or if I was, it wasn’t by enough) but the people who were my direct competition for Queen of Fatties were my age! That was way too close for comfort—if I let myself slack, I could be just another regular old fatty while some Carolina bitch soaked up all the calories! I had to know more about them. I had to go find these people!

“Tell me about them?” I demanded, my voice low and serious, “Please?”

“O-Oh! Well, uh…” my Aunt Rhonda’s face turned pink as she looked to Aunt Sally, who looked to be more than a little peeved at her expertise on the subject, “I-I, uh… I don’t really… um… I-I mean, I don’t know these people, sweetie! I’ve just… y’know, seen them around town.”

“Well how about Maddie from the firm, Rhonda?” My Aunt Sally said in a snippy tone as she took a sip from her post-binge coffee, “You seem pretty eager to talk to her during our office parties—and she’s around Mel’s age.”

“Oh, uh… right.” Aunt Rhonda said abashedly, “There’s a, um… girl who works with your Aunt Sally who’s… pretty heavy, I guess…”

“Mm-hmm.” My Aunt Sally punctuated her opinion with a bite of butter-bathed biscuit, shooting my Aunt Rhonda one last dagger before turning her attention back to me, all sweet and regular-sounding, “There’s also the local eating contest champion. Ken’s a pretty big guy; maybe even a little bit heavier than you. You can usually find him at buffets around town, amazing and astounding people who’ve never seen a guy like him eat before.”

“Oh, you know who Mel might like to meet?” My Aunt Rhonda said a little shakily, wary of upsetting her weight-conscious wife again, “The Mathises. You know they own that bakery downtown—that whole family is big. I know their daughter Brooke was about your size the last time I was in. I haven’t seen their son in a while, but I can’t imagine he’s any smaller than his sister since all he does is play those video games all day.”

Okay. Lots of options.

I wasn’t sure if that was good or bad.

But now I knew where to start. If I wanted to scope out the competition, to really get to know my enemy (and, y’know, maybe pick up a few tricks along the way) I knew I had to start with…

1413312311122213.content:
I waited until the next morning to follow up on Aunt Rhonda's suggestion about checking out the Mathis family bakery, asking where it was as if I had just remembered the conversation at dinner.

“Oh yes, we'd talked about them,” she said. “It would be nice for you to meet people your own age, and I'm sure a trip to a bakery doesn't sound too bad, does it?”

She playfully poked me in the belly, and I laughed it off as a jest. My aunt loved to serve food to anyone who would eat it, but I don't think she knew how much I loved being fat and getting fatter.

“Come on,” she grabbed her purse and car keys, “I'll drive you over there. Your aunt Sally will love some treats for dessert tonight.”

The Mathis bakery was in a two-story building trapped between two other businesses. The windows on the second floor led me to assume the family lived above their business; lucky break for Brooke if she was my size, having all those sugary treats in the same building as you.

I followed aunt Rhonda inside. The dining area was pretty small, just a few tables, but it looked like most of the menu (displayed on a chalkboard suspended over behind the counter) was full-sized desserts. There was a selection of coffees, espressos and the like, plus snack-sized portions, so there was some diversity.

“Hi! Just give me a second.”

Standing on a stepladder, writing on the chalkboard menu, was the widest ass I had ever seen. OK, there was a person attached to the ass, but that was all I saw at first because the woman had her back to me and she was standing a few feet off the ground. Those twin boulders of fat were directly in the path of my eyeline, how could I not stare?

After a moment the woman slowly made her way to the ground, folded the stepladder, and turned around.

This must have been Brooke. She looked to be my age, with blonde hair, three chins, and that aforementioned booty. It was her defining feature. Her belly and boobs were large, and her upper arms squeezed against her chest when her arms were at rest, but her hips and butt swelled out almost twice as wide as her torso. A definite pear, and a definite fatty. I couldn't tell for certain, but she weighed about as much as I did.

“What can I get you two, today?” she asked. She was wearing a button-down shirt and vest, and a pair of black leggings that couldn't do anything to make her look slimmer.

“Do you have any of the turtle pies available?” my aunt asked.

Brook frowned apologetically.

“We don't at the moment, but if you'd like to place an order we can have one ready later today.”

“That sounds fine.” Aunt Rhonda turned to me. “I've got some errands to run in the meantime. Would you like to grab a snack and come with?”

“Actually...” I wanted to chat up Brooke, find out her story. “I'm having a hard time deciding. Can I stay here and just hang around until you come back?”

Aunt Rhonda placed her order and left, leaving me and Brooke alone in the shop.

“So what would you like?” she asked, smiling.

“I don't know. What would you say is the best thing here?” I had to be cautious. Brooke could be cool with her fat, or maybe she was self-conscious about it. Maybe she loved to eat and was open about it, or maybe she blamed working in a bakery for ruining her figure.

“Everything we make is awesome,” she said. “Maybe I'm biased, but look at me. I know what I'm talking about.”

OK, yeah. This girl was a proud fatty. But just to make sure...

“You sold me. I'll have one of the chocolate banana nut muffins, one slice of red velvet, one slice of salted caramel cheesecake, half a dozen of those peppermint bonbons, two apple fritters and what's left of that plate of lemon bars.”

I had just ordered as much food as most people would eat for dinner, all of it sugary junk food, but Brooke didn't bat an eye. She just asked

“Would you like it for here?”

“Sure, I'll eat it here. And can I get some hot chocolate?”

I paid, she slid the tray of food across the counter, and I found a seat at the table closest to the register. I positioned myself so I could see her and she could see me, and I dug in.

Mmmmmmmm... It was all so good. Brooke wasn't lying about that. As I ate she pretended to wipe the counter and arrange the display case, but she always had one eye on me. Was she watching to see if I ate everything? She must have been.

When I finished I returned the tray, looking over the display case and considering a second go-round.

“How was it?” she asked.

“You weren't kidding. Those were some of the best treats I've ever had. I could probably go for some more.”

“Don't let my mom hear you say that,” she laughed, “or she'd be filling a bag for you to take home.”

“Is she the kind of woman that's always pushing food on people?”

“Definitely...
1413312311122213.title: the Mathises—my Aunt Rhonda takes me to their...

choices: …he was bigger than me. I need to step up my game.
…he was bigger than big! I'd never seen someone so huge!
14133123111222132.content:
“Definitely,” Brooke nodded vigorously. “If you think I'm big, you should see my brother, Michael. He's gotten the worst of her attention.”

“Is he even fatter than you?” I asked, both intrigued and frustrated there was indeed someone bigger than me in town.

“Much. 'Mommy's little piggy,' she calls him. Officially he's the bakery's taste tester, but that's really just my mom's excuse for keeping him stuffed with treats all the time.”

“You sound a little jealous,” I said. Or maybe that was my own reaction I was reading in her.

“It's fine. Between you and me, I'm more like her than anyone. I want to find someone I can fatten up and take care of.” Suddenly, her eyes went wide and she jerked back. “Oh my god! I can't believe I just told a stranger that.”

“No, it's OK. I'm no stranger to the fat life.”

“I can see that, the way you went to town on those desserts just now.” Brooke relaxed again. “I've known some other big girls, but none of them had the... zest you seem to have. Tell you what: any time you want to come by, I'll give you a discount on anything. 25%.”

“Really? You sure?”

“Sure I'm sure. Aside from the morning rush, when everyone is getting coffee and pastries, it's dull as hell around here. I'd love someone to talk to, especially one who can keep up with me while eating. Speaking of,” she motioned to the display case, “what else would you like?”

For the next hour we ate and gabbed; well, I did most of the eating, as Brooke needed to make the pie for Aunt Rhonda. But once that was in the oven and she was sitting across the table from me, she tried to make up for lost time, catching up with me dessert for dessert. I took the competition a little too seriously, and before long we were both cramming Danishes and slices of pie into our mouths.

“Oooooh,” Brooke moaned at the end of our impromptu gorge. Both of our bellies were pretty swollen, and I was waiting for one of the buttons on her shirt to give up the ghost. “I haven't stuffed myself like that in a long time.”

“That's pretty normal for me,” I said. “You'll regret offering me that discount before too long.”

“Nah, it's fine. I like the thought of having a food buddy. All my friends have other stuff going on during the summer, and my brother's always playing his video games.”

I wanted to learn more about her elusive brother, except Aunt Rhonda chose then to come back.

But I had a standing offer to return, and I now knew where the bakery was, so the next day after breakfast I lumbered my way back.

“That didn't take long,” Brooke said as I came in.

“Breakfast is over, so now I'm ready for some dessert,” I said.

“You have dessert after every meal?”

“I treat desserts like meals themselves,” I replied, chuckling.

“I like the sound of that. But do you mind waiting a few minutes? I have a half-shift on Thursdays, so we can go get lunch when my dad comes back from the post office.”

When she said 'get lunch' I thought she was thinking of going out, but instead Brooke led me through the back of the dining area to a set of stairs. Upstairs we found her mother, a hefty woman of about 400 pounds of pear-shaped corpulence, in the kitchen, cooking up a storm. It smelled divine: lasagna, garlic bread, fried calamari and angel hair pasta in alfredo sauce.

“Hey, mom. This is Mel. She just moved to town.”

Brooke's mother turned around, smiling warmly at first and then even wider when she got a good look at me.

“Welcome to our house,” she said, “I wish Brooke had told me we'd have another person at the table. I hope there's enough food.”

“Looks like there's plenty,” I said. Even by my gluttonous standards the spread on the dining room table looked like more than enough.

“Where mom is concerned, 'plenty' is not enough,” Brooke said to me aside. Her mother brought the last dish – a bowl of fist-sized meatballs in marinara sauce – to the table and called down a hall

“Michael! Lunch time!”

As I found my seat and got comfortable I grew anxious. Here it was. How much bigger than me was Michael?

I could hear his footsteps as he left his room and came down the hall, the floor creaking ominously. Casually, I turned around to see...
14133123111222132.title: “If you think I'm big, you should see my ...

choices: Go play video games with Michael and press him about his weight!
Go to the mall with Brooke and meet up with her friend!
Park my fat ass at the dinner table and let Mrs. Mathis feed me some more!
141331231112221322.content:
I turned towards the hall, and the source of the focused tremors that made the house quake, only to find that Michael was much bigger than I had expected. He was bigger than me—hell, he was bigger than big! I’d never seen anyone so… huge!

The first thing I saw as he lumbered down the hall was his belly. He practically eclipsed the hallway all by himself, but his gut was so big and round that it was hard not to stare. It swung at his knees, barely covered by his N7 t-shirt as it wobbled and flubbed with every pathetic step. As he slowly, awkwardly made his way into the kitchen, his features became more clear. His face was round and soft, with three chins to eclipse his neck and chubby cheeks to bunch into his field of vision. More impressively, he seemed to follow the same figure as his mother and sister. Michael’s ass was enormous; bigger than his Mom’s and even Brooke’s. He was dressed in stretchy pants—maybe maternity pants, judging by his size and their transparency in some places—and his fatty thighs rubbed together so loudly that I might have heard him coming if it weren’t for his thudding footsteps.

As he plopped down into two of the family’s chairs next to me, sweating and exhausted from such a minor trip, I could only guess that he weighed somewhere in the neighborhood of six hundred. Maybe seven. Fat guys with big butts always threw me off.

“There he is!” Mrs. Mathis said excitedly, scooping up the plate in front of her piggy son and whisking it away to load it up, “Michael this is Mel, Brooke’s new friend. She’ll be joining us for lunch today.”

“Hey.” He puffed in a noncommittal tone as his mother loaded up his plates for him, “Phew… sorry, just… y’know, long walk.”

We made modest to awkward small talk as Mrs. Mathis took our getting-to-know-you session to load up our plates for us, like she had for Michael.

“Eating lunch in your jammies again, Michael?” Brooke teased her enormous brother with a pinch of his arm fat, “Don’t you know people used to dress for dinner?”

“Hey, don’t tell me. I’m still waiting on New Semester Clothes money from Grandma.” He swatted her hand away, making his meaty arm wobble beneath his sleeve, “Not unlike some other people I know.”

“Whatever wide load, just make sure my friend here actually gets some this time.” She referred to me, “Just because you’re Mommy’s Little Piggy doesn’t mean you’re entitled to pig out on everything.”

“Oh my god, can you please not call me th—“

“That’s enough, kiddos. No fighting at the dinnertable.” I heard the Mathis matriarch say sternly as she returned with what looked like enough food for all of us, but that I quickly realized was just for Michael, “Mel, sweetie, hand me your plate. I’ll get you next…”

Let me tell you, it was no mystery how Michael and Brooke were so fat if how her mother fed them was any indication. Seriously, I think during the first course I had an entire plate of pasta. Like, the whole plate was just full of angel hair, meat and sauce and alfredo sauce, topped with those fist-sized meatballs, to go in tandem with the matching plate of lasagna and the half-a-fuckin’ loaf of garlic bread that came alongside it. And that was just the first course!

I mean… did I overdo it? Yeah. You bet I did. But can you really blame me?

I had spent the past few years purposefully ballooning up into this big bodacious blimp, thinking I was hot shit for weighing four hundred pounds, and then I come to live with my Aunts (one of whom had come to even outweigh me since I had seen her last!) and I find out all these other fatties have done it with almost no effort! Of course I overdid it!

We ate for… I don’t know… an hour? Maybe two? I seriously have no clue how long I spent at that dinner table, wolfing down food like it was nobody’s business. By the end of it all, I was stuffed like a turkey; my belly was so swollen that I had to scoot back from the table and it still bunched up against the edge. But as much as I had eaten, Michael had easily lapped me.

“Phew… oh wow.” He said with a pat of his gut, “That was really good, Mama.”

“Yeah Mom—urp—good job.” Brooke burped, rubbing her belly, “Way to lay it on thick for Mel, here.”

“Hey, I’m no stranger to a good meal.” I laughed weakly as I shook my tonnage of tummy, an action that I quickly regretted, “You didn’t have to impress me.”

“Well that’s good to hear!” Mrs. Mathis said contentedly, laying back to relax her own bloated belly, “Does that mean you’ll all have room for dessert? I have a pie in the oven that’s open for grabs!”

“Oh, wow… no. None for me, thanks.” Michael gripped the back of his chairs (his arms shaking with effort) “I’m stuffed. I got a text from Joseph, so I think I’m gonna play some Battlefront back in my room.”

“Yeah, me either.” Brooke rocked herself to a standing position, “Nat and I were going to go hit up the mall—Mel, you wanna come?”

Meanwhile I was way too full to really think straight. I mean, on one hand, I could have stayed at that kitchen table for hours. Mrs. Mathis was a chef par excellence, right up there with my Aunt Rhonda, and I definitely wouldn’t have minded staying and having a slice of (or the whole) pie. But on the other hand, I really wanted to get to know my competition. Michael was a hog, easily one of the biggest people I’d ever met. If there was anyone who could give me insight on how to eventually outweigh him, it’d be the man himself. But then there was Brooke, someone who I’d already found that I had a lot in common with and was another fatty of my caliber. She seemed more social than Michael, and I’d learned in Buttercombe that fatties usually travelled in packs. Maybe if I followed Brooke, I’d get a better (and bigger) picture of just how fat-friendly this town was…

I eventually decided to…
141331231112221322.title: Meatiest Michael, the Massive Meal Muncher

choices: Immersed in gaming, Michael & I play and binge the day away!
I manage to stay on track and ask him about his weight!
1413312311122213221.content:
I decided to hang out with Michael. My mind was made up as I stared at him waddle heavily down the hall and back to his room, observing his mountainous self wobble with each house-shaking footfall. Brooke had mentioned something about Michael being the family's taste tester, but there had to be more to it than that. There just had to be. How else could the youngest in the family get to crest comfortably at what, six to seven-hundred pounds? I had to get to the bottom of this for curiosity's sake and, most important of all, so I could catch up and then some.

Also, Michael being a gamer meant I had a chance to play some wonderful video games. It had been quite a while since the last time I played those, mostly thanks to friends, because a game console, at my house, with my mother? No way.

But that left me with a teeny problem. Brooke was still awaiting my answer to her offer to go to the mall. I felt a bit bad; Brooke is great, and I wanted to get to know her better so when I call her my best friend it sounds legitimate. Eh, I can already see myself becoming a regular for the Mathis' bakery business, especially given Mrs. Mathis' rather hospitable nature. I'll make it up to Brooke next time we hang out.

"Mall sounds fun, but I don't think I wanna get up right now," I smiled apologetically and winced, my hands cradling my belly. Man, I'm still feeling that epic meal. In fact, as though to make a point, my gut let out a pretty audible gurgle, followed by gas travelling up my throat until a loud burp came out. "Sorry. Next time?"

"Aww!" she pouted in mock disappointed, but then gave me a grin. "Alright, but you owe me one!" she raised her flabby arms and gestured grandly. "Feel free to make yourself at home!"

"Oh, I wouldn't wanna impose--"

"Mel," she cut me off flatly. "You just had lunch with me, my mom, and lil bro. And you and I seem to have hit it off pretty good, if me saying I've found a new food buddy in you doesn't stand. S'far as we're all concerned, you're one of us now. Isn't that right, Mom?"

"Oh absolutely!" Mrs. Mathis chirped from the kitchen, one hand using a wooden spoon to brew something in a pot while the other cradled her overstuffed middle. "The more mouths for me to feed, the better! Especially because any friend of Brooke's is extended family in my book!"

I was genuinely moved by that, and would've put a hand to where my heart is if not for, y'know, my belly currently being a mini-volcano churning with one hell of a molten food baby and thus needing both my hands to soothe it.

"See?" Brooke smiled widely as she waddled over to the stairs that lead down to the family bakery part of the building. "Anyway, gotta run. I'll see you later?"

"Sounds cool!" I gave a mock salute. "And try not to run!"

Once she was gone, I took an extra moment to catch my breath before rocking myself into a standing position. I winced as the movement sent me into a jiggle fit that really affected my belly most of all. Luckily, my stomach had digested a fair bit of that epic lunch, and so I felt better. Still full, but room opening up again. Score one for extended stomach!

But enough about that. Time for the main reason for which I sacrificed hanging out with Brooke for today.

"So, uh, would Michael mind if he got an extra, ehh, game partner to play games with him, maybe?" I queried the Mathis matriarch.

It was an innocent question. Just me asking for permission to play with her youngest. I certainly didn't think it would warrant said mother snapping her attention to me in an instant, looking at me like I was a godsend.

"Oh Mel, you big, absolute sweetheart!" Mrs. Mathis actually sounded emotional, plump hands clapped together as she stared at me in a somewhat revering light, which was kinda weird. "I already liked you just from being Brooke's friend and having a healthy appetite to match, but to want to be little Michael's friend, too? It's like my prayers have been answered!"

Again, I was moved, although I felt sheepish about her excessive praising. "He doesn't have many friends?"

"Oh no, he does!" she clarified cheerfully. "He and his group just don't socialize so much. They're more of the texting, video chatting, and video game playing sort. Not one to really to go out and enjoy the day like Brooke, y'know?"

Mrs. Mathis proceeded to pivot herself around, lumbering over to reach for a big bowl. Seriously, really big, like it was as wide and deep as a jumbo-sized popcorn container. She grabbed these double family-sized bags of chips and proceeded to just empty them into the bowl, humming to herself as a steady mountain of mixed cheesy cheddar and sour cream n onion chips rose up. With a satisfied, singsong "hmm!", she grabbed the bowl and approached me. She must have waddled a tad excitedly, because as soon as she was within reach of giving me the bowl, her gut bounced against mine, creating an ocean wave ripple-like effect as our fat sloshed from the tiny impact.

"Here," she handed me the bowl. "His regular batch of chips."

Regular? There were enough chips in this bowl for a group of ten.

"Feel free to take some!" she cooed motherly-like at me. "I'll send in more in a bit. Gotta do something about that pie in the oven, first. You sure you don't want a slice?"

"Maybe later," I smiled kindly. Seriously, snacks like chips were the only thing I felt like stuffing down my gullet. Such was how heavily my normally-bottomless appetite was trounced by the Great Mathis Lunch.

I waddled my way down the hall leading to Michael's room, taking a moment to marvel at the incredible width of the doorway. Even with the mega-wide space, I could still picture Michael having to squeeze his way through; seriously, guy had a butt that could occupy an entire couch. Which is why I knew I shouldn't be, but I still was amazed at the fact that I could go through the doorway no problem. No need for turning sideways, or sucking in my gut. This all served to further reinforce my goal to outweigh him someday.

Of course, what awaited me inside was another matter. The room was huge, obviously, very spacious with every super-fat friendly application to it. Super-wide, steel-reinforced computer chair near a study desk that provided enough room for a massive belly to spill down between the legs without swallowing the desk. A king-sized bed on floor level for easy access and plenty of space for one of so much girth. An incredibly wide set of closet doors, and I could only imagine the palace of organized clothes that awaited behind those doors. On the walls there were various posters of various media, from music bands, TV shows, and video game character posters. On the wall in front of the bed was quite possibly the biggest, widest flat-screen TV I had ever seen, which at the moment was displaying a colorful battlefield of lasers, spaceships, and other certain familiar aspects of a certain space opera franchise.

And there, right in the middle of this fat-friendly haven, lying like a king in a humongous beanbag chair was Michael himself, his meatiness melting onto the beanbag like a blob as he stretched comfortably. His piggy eyes were glued to the screen, fat hands gripping a PS4 controller resting on his monumental gut as he played. His fat face was creased in concentration as he belted out commands to other players via his headset. He was the epitome of anti-physical activity, and I felt my determination at surpassing increase a hundredfold.

"Hi there, Michael!" I made my presence known by speaking up loudly and stepping right by his side-glance line of vision.

My announcement had the desired effect. Michael let out this tiny, high-pitched squeak as he realized there was someone else in the room. A girl that was neither his sister nor mother. I could only imagine how small he must be feeling.

"Uh, hey!" he quickly yanked down his headset, which made his flabby cheeks and chins bounce and sway. "Uhhh, M-Mel, right?"

Okay, Michael may just have surpassed my sister Alice in the social awkwardness department. Clearly, he's never been alone with a girl that wasn't his mother or sister. Well, time to go into Cool Big Sis mode and put him at ease.

"Eeyup, yay, you remembered!" I beamed at him, holding out the big bowl of chips prominently like an offering to a god. "I come in peace! As a gesture of goodwill, I bring to you, the man of the house, a bowl of delicious chips, courtesy of the boss lady herself!" I said in a deep, hammy tone, and believe me, as soon as I was done, I was just about ready to bust a lung laughing.

My geek talk had the desired effect as Michael laughed a little, now looking much more chill as I placed the bowl right next to him. "I accept your offer, fair lady!" he wasted no time digging his hand into the bowl and dumping a fistful of chips into his maw. "Mmmm, your offering pleases, so you're cool!"

"Oh yeah!" I stuck my fist in the air, my arm wobbling. I then brought my arms behind my back as I struck a schoolgirl pose. "So Michael, got an extra controller?"

"Sure! But, you play?" he looked at me in surprise. Definitely never came across a gamer girl.

"You better believe it," I grinned. "So, may I join your campaign, or am I not cool enough?"

"Cool--er, yes, go ahead! You can use my computer chair."

"Neat!" I brought the chair forward and allowed myself to collapse on it.

It squeaked loudly, but held out well. I was even more impressed that my ass was not spilling over the edges. I felt like I was sitting on a throne. Michael gave me the extra controller, and I decided to get comfortable by kicking my sneakers off, enjoying the feeling of my bare feet on the carpeted floor.

"Ready?" Michael grinned, slipping his headset on.

"You know it," I smirked, making fists with my toes a la John McClane.

We both took a handful of chips, stuffed our mouths, munched, and just like that, the game was on!
1413312311122213221.title: Fatty Gaming Pals

choices: ...what did Brooke mean by a real Greenville Native?
...was Brooke trying to make Nat fat?
1413312311122213222.content:
I eventually decided to go to the mall with Brooke and meet up with her friend.

I mean, okay, hear me out. Yes, Michael was easily one of the biggest people I'd ever seen. The sight of him, just smothered in rolls, round as a beach ball and struggling to walk, was enough to make me cum a little. I didn't know people could get that fat, and here he was a couple years younger than me and almost twice my weight. I would have loved to have gotten to know him a little better. But if I knew one thing from living with my Aunts, it was that high-caliber feeders like Mrs. Mathis weren't going to just let me and Michael sit idly by. And even though I wasn't exactly shy about stuffing my fat face, I was stuffed. Like, actually stuffed. If I had so much as a biscuit before I left that house, I would have ralphed up everything I'd just eaten!

Also, side note, it would have been weird for me to hang out in a 17 year old boy's room while his Mom was in the other room when I came over to eat lunch with Brooke.

And besides, I didn't really do video games. Shopping I could do. Plus, I knew Brooke a little better, y'know?

So we packed ourselves into Brooke's minivan. I saw a lot of these around here, but I just figured that there were a lot of soccer moms, this being the South and all. I never made the connection that behind each and every one of those extra bulky vehicles were extra bulky drivers like Brooke, who was so suffocated by her weight that the lowest tier of her gut squished against the steering wheel. Her fluffy thigh practically popped the door open as soon as she pulled the latch, and we waddled inside the Greenville County Mall...

And you know, it was typical mall stuff. Dying economy, some closed stores. We walked into the food court and it seemed busy enough. Lots of chain restaurants were built into the walls, plenty of tables. I noticed a couple of fatties rolling through the atrium, but nothing like mine or Brooke's sizes. There was a Chic fil a, a Smokeyz Wingz, a Big Burger... the usual fair. I had just eaten, but living with my Aunts had turned me into something of a glutton. My rock hard gut was already gurgling for more in anticipation of all the sights and smells that this dumpy little place had to offer. I rubbed along its dimpled fleshy surface with both of my chubby hands without even thinking about it. No way I was gonna get stared at for rubbing my gut in a town like this, right?

Beside me, my big bootied escort was tugging at her heroic leggings as she hoisted one heavy pillar of leg over the other. Her distribution was a bit more bottom-heavy than mine, so I'd finally met someone that I could casually outpace without putting in too much effort. Her face, thinner than mine, was flush and her forehead was damp as her flabby arms shifted from side to side in an attempt to keep her momentum going.

"Hey, Brooke!" a voice rang over the mall's white noise of customers as a hand extended upwards, "Over here, I got us a table!"

The voice belonged to who I assumed was Nat. She was a pale brunette with vaguely Russian-esque features, maybe just shy of two hundred pounds. She kept her fudge-brown hair back in a ponytail and wore a cute little top with half-sleeves. She was pretty thick—even from here, I could see where her belly was eeking over the waistband of her jeans, and the little cut where the swell of her upperarm bulged a bit more than the rest of it. Her brown eyes were deep set behind her fat cheeks, and her nose was prominent but flattering.

Brooke looked at me, smiled, and said

"That's Nat."

If I didn't know any better, I would have sworn that Brooke's pace picked up. But I did know better, because there was no way that her big ass was going to move any faster than it already had been. She wiggle-waddled her way behind me as I bobbed belly-first up to the table that Nat had scored for us. Rather tables. She had gotten four or five of them and scooched them together, presumably because she had eyes and knew that Brooke could eat a table's worth of food in one sitting and not bat an eye.

If she had known that I was coming, she may have grabbed a couple more.

We big blondes grabbed a chair or two to ourselves and plopped down into jiggling, quivering piles of plumpness. We were both out of breath by the time we had made it there, and getting off my feet felt great. Even if it was only momentary. I hadn't been in this mall for more than five minutes, and I was already starting to forget that I was full...

"So this is the girl I was telling you about." Brooke said breathlessly, extending a wobbling arm in my direction across the tables, "Natalia this is Melanie, Melanie Natalia."

"My friends call me Nat." the (comparatively) smaller girl said with a smile as she sat down next to Brooke. She spoke with a hint of an accent

"And my friends call me Mel." I snorted, my jowls quivering

"Good job grabbing us a table, btw." Brooke gestured to the assorted surfaces we had been granted, presumably for when we inevitably decided to start stuffing our faces, "You're learning!"

"Well, it's either do it now or listen to you bitch about the tables squeaking." Natalie said, checking her phone idly, "Now are we going to get some food, or did I just steal all these tables for nothing?"

"You really are learning!" Brooke clapped her chubby hands together, making her gut ripple in delight, "I'm going to make you into a regular Greenville Native yet!"

And things just sort've continued like that. They'd go on back and forth, I'd try to enter without seeming too awkward because I literally just met these people today and despite the fact that I was outgoing as fuck, I didn't want to be rude. I had spent a lot of time in Greenville, and I was already beginning to understand that things weren’t exactly “normal”.

I weighed more than five hundred pounds, and I could barely scrape by with so much as a surprised raise of the eyebrows from some of the locals. Brooke and the rest of her family were huge, and this food court in the mall may as well have been its main attraction. My Aunt Sally had gotten enormous since the last time I had seen her, and I was pretty sure that my Aunt Rhonda was as much a chubby chaser as her wife was chubby. There were so many fat folks around here, and it was hard to wrap my head around, but I was doing my best.

That being said, Brooke’s constant encouragement of Nat was a bit much. Even for me.

“Hey, you look like you’re running low.” Brooke would say as her friend scraped the last bit of her fries, “You want some more? Why don’t I get you some more?”

“Are you gonna let a newbie show you how it’s done?” Brooke laughed when Natalie put her burger down on the wrapper, “Like, come on, don’t be a wimp.”

“My baby brother can eat more than that.” Brooke rolled her eyes, “God, it’s like you just like to waste money on food.”

Okay, so hear me out, I was totally okay with Natalie joining us. Moreso, I was totally okay with eating even more, despite having just gotten stuffed by Mrs. Masters. But I never expected Brooke to be like… well, this when it came to eating. She was a big girl like me, sure. But she seemed so… I don’t know. In control of it all. Like, I figured if she didn’t live in a house with meaty-ass Michael and her food-crazy Mom, Brooke would probably shrink down in no time. This was the most “foodie” I’d ever heard her be!

Granted, I hadn’t known her long, but…

It was weird, okay?

So I waited until Natalie had excused herself to the restroom. The rotund-bootied Russian had just waddled out of earshot when I leaned over, my belly cutting into the table, and asked

“Okay Brooke, what the hell?”

And the big blonde girl just sort’ve looked at me like she had no idea what I was talking about. Which was total bullshit because she hadn’t spoken to me once since we sat down and started eating (which was fine by me. I was too busy stuffing my face to really care whether or not I was being addressed in conversation!)

“Why, whatever do you mean, Melly?” she bat her big green eyes at me

“Natalie. You. Food.” I said, a little smile on my face, “Are you… trying to make Nat fat?”

And that’s when she looked at me, dead in the face, and said…

Best aunt ever, or what?

We hopped into her little luxury car and drove to a little pizzeria further into downtown, her Lexus leaning dangerously to one side as I clogged the passenger seat and then some. My last stop was at a Burger King about an hour ago, and since I was scraping the bottom of the barrel in my travel fund I couldn't exactly splurge on the triple Whoppers like I liked to. Needless to say, pizza sounded pretty good right about now. It didn't help that all the way over, Aunt Rhonda wouldn't shut up about how awesome this place was and how it was locally owned and how it was like some kind of "dive-bar-meets-Dominos." I was smacking my lips all the way over, my gut gurgling as loud as the engine.

We pulled up and parked (thank GOD we found a spot nearby, because she wanted to park down the street and walk the rest of the way) after about ten minutes of slow traffic. I heaved myself out of her shiny black car and slammed the door shut, already lumbering my way towards the entrance. I could smell the heavy aroma of cheese, sauce and deli meats and it was driving me wild. I paid no mind to the infinite amount of people on the sidewalk, or even the hipster I bumped into. All I could think about was pizza, and how much of it I could fit in my belly.

So my aunt and I got a booth and some chubby girl took our order.

"Hey Rhonda, good to see you." the waitress smiled at my aunt and I, "The usual, two slices and a Dr. Pepper?"

"Thanks Marianne, that sounds about right." my aunt smiled back, "And I'll be taking care of her too. Mel, do you need a minute to--"

"I'll have a large pepperoni with olives." I said greedily, my hands on my rumbling belly as it touched the lip of the table, "And a Coke. Refills are free, right?"

Okay, so yeah, in retrospect it might have been a little rude of me to get a whole pizza to myself. I probably should have asked if that was okay, considering my aunt offered to pay and all. But dammit I was hungry! Surely this was something she saw coming. I mean, come on.

"O-kay... one large pepperoni with olives and a Coke." the waitress chirped as she wrote the ticket and gave it to my aunt, "It'll be just a bit on your pizza, and I'll be right out with your drinks."

She walked away, leaving us alone.

"Jeez Mel, you really are starving." Aunt Rhonda snorted, "Don't hold back on my behalf or anything."

"Sorry." I said bashfully, "It's just... you know."

"Hey, no, I get it. I wouldn't offer if I didn't want you to get what you wanted." she got a couple of napkins ready, "Besides, it's your welcome party! You should get to indulge a little, right?"

"Did I ever tell you you're my favorite aunt?" I asked longingly from across the table, "Because if you're serious, I'll take you up on that offer right now. And I'll like... go buy you a trophy that says #1 Aunt on it, or something."

"I'm serious, go all out." my aunt laughed, "My treat, remember?"

I felt my stomach kick and a familiar tingle in my crotch. My stomach RSVP'd my aunt's invitation with a hungry growl. I resisted the urge to touch it, to feel its soft bloatedness between my chubby fingers. Just as the words left her lips, our waitress returned with our drinks.

"Hey, Marianne right?" I asked her as she put the glasses on the table, "Do you think maybe we could get some breadsticks or something?"

"Oh, sure." she nodded happily and scribbled something else down on the ticket, "Do you want the personal order or would you like to split--"

"We'll get the biggest size." I cut her off, already a little overstimulated, "And I'm gonna need to make that two pizzas."

Hey, Aunt Rhonda said she was paying and told me to go all out. It would be rude of me not to.

I don't know if she's the coolest or most irresponsible woman on the planet, but at this point I didn't really care.

I let out this monster burp that shook the windows. Seriously, I could hear everything in the whole place stop as soon as I let it out.

"Sorry I made such a...hff... hog out of myself, Aunt Rhonda..." I huffed trying desperately to wriggle my way out of the booth, as the pizzeria slowly came back to life, "You sure you're not...urp... mad at me?"

I did my best to heave myself up from the booth, but my fat ass and belly weren't going to be having any of that. My gut stuck out a lot further when I was stuffed to my max, and it seriously killed my already wonky sense of balance. My aunt had to walk over and help me up, which means she got a first-hand look at how sweaty I left that booth.

"Hey, I'm not the one who's gonna have to deal with all that pizza on the other end." she poked my belly (I almost threw up on her), "And hey, I'm the one who told you to go all out, right? Just... next time give me some warning, first?"

I nodded sleepily in response. When did it get so dark out?

"Come on, let's get you home." she pat my back and guided me towards the door, "I was gonna show you around today but then somebody ate our day away. Almost literally."

***


By the time we got home, I was ready to pass out. Aunt Rhonda walked me in, made sure I could fit through the front door, and told me where the guest room was and I just sort of lumbered in and passed out. I didn't change out of my clothes or anything. I just flopped down on my side and went right to sleep.

I wouldn't wake up until hours later...

The whole place shook as my feet came down heavily on the apartment floor. I stormed out of what I would later come to appreciate as a very nice bedroom for a downtown apartment, not realizing that I had at some point kicked off my pants. My stomach was untucked from my ratty pink panties, wobbling and slapping against my fat thighs audibly with every step I took. I might have been turned on if I weren't so upset about being woken up.

"Oh...pff...hey Mel..." my aunt was doing stretches in front of the flat-screen, all decked out spandex. She paused the Jillian Michaels workout and turned to face me, "How'd you sleep?"

"Rm..." I grumbled, my lower lip stuck out in an exaggerated pout, "Okay."

"Just okay?" she put her hands on her hips, "Those are eight hundred thread-count sheets. I'd hoped you'd sleep a little better than okay."

I grumbled. Two days in and I've already eaten sixty dollar's worth of pizza and insulted her expensive bedsheets. I definitely couldn't tell her that it was her stupid workout routine that woke me up, considering that she was letting me live with her.

"No, yeah, it was great." I lied sleepily, "Just, uh... still getting used to sleeping in a new place is all."

It was at that moment that my stomach let out the deepest, greediest growl it could make, taking away my aunt's attention for a minute. Considering all the pizza I ate last night, even I was surprised that I could be hungry so soon after. I smiled embarrassedly and brought both hands to my massive middle, scratching my lowermost roll as it swelled out from underneath my t-shirt and making it sway from side to side.

"Ah." Aunt Rhonda said knowingly, "So it wasn't the sheets."

"Yeah... I think that this might have had something to do with it." I grabbed both flanks of my gut and pressed inward slightly, making it bulge out a little farther "So, I hate to ask this of you again so soon but... do you think maybe we could go grab a bite to eat?"

Look, let me just start off by saying that she was fine.

"I am so sorry!" I apologized frantically, unable to really bend over. She held out an arm and I grabbed it, hoping to maybe pull her up off of the ground with my pathetic fat girl strength, "I-I should have been watching where I was going, a-and I didn't see you and--"

"So, um... weird question, considering I just bashed your head into the sidewalk." I said over the growling of my stomach, "My aunt told me about this place... Gerardo's? You ever heard of it? "Please." she rolled her eyes, snatching the bag out of my hand, "Something tells me you won't starve if I take this one."

"I might." I whine, rubbing my belly sensually in a way that only slightly gets me hot, "You don't know what it's like to have to deal with this big, greedy tummy of mine. She just wants to eat everything, and I just can't say no!"

We both share a laugh and start chowing down on what would now be considered brunch...

Mmm... Oh that hit a spot. I could just imagine it. Being so big and fat that I couldn't get out of Aunt Rhonda's apartment. "Who says I'm not?" I asked alluringly, putting the phone down to better emphasize the great curvature of my gut by squeezing it tightly between my chubby hands, jiggling it provocatively as it started dancing between my swollen legs, "What if I'm not just trying, but succeeding at being the fattest chick you've ever met?"

I had met this girl by bumping into her belly-first, then she took me to this really awesome restaurant, then we almost got into a fight and we'd spent the last few hours chilling at my Aunt's place like we'd known each other for years. Maybe it had something to do with having a sister that was bigger than her, but she didn't make me feel like a freak. Or make me feel bad for loving my body. Or for ordering four sub sandwiches and a large two liter. Aunt Rhonda would later make me feel bad for ordering it on her credit card, but that's neither here nor there.

"So... Mel..." Lily peeped back in after I'd hung up the phone, "You're not really trying to gain weight, are you?"

"Maybe." I inquired wryly, popping a Cheetoh in my mouth, "What's it to you?"

"Nothing, it's just..."
