And most of it, like me, went right to that cute little belly of hers. Beneath her tank top, I could see it bunch up into rolls as she cowered from the judgment of my prodding poking finger, her dramatic muffin top flopping out uncomfortably onto her lap. I didn't even know why she was still wearing those shorts; her lovehandles and her ass were practically pouring out of them.

"Hey, don't blame me." I smiled as I gave her tummy another little poke, "I'm not the one who makes you do stupid stuff like drink two slushies."

"Mel!" she whined, withdrawing herself even smaller into a tight little ball of Lily, picking her thicker legs up off the floor and wrapping her arms around them, "Knock it--URP!"

The tightness of her position, combined with the fullness of her belly, proved to be quite uncomfortable for all our snacks sloshing around inside of her.

"Aww, that was almost a real burp!" I teased, "You are picking up some bad habits, aren't you!"

"Sh-Shut up! I really am!" Lily's face was about as red as her hair, "Ever since I started helping you get fat, I've been surrounded by food! I can't control myself anymore!"

"Welcome to my world, Lils." I snickered, my vastness rippling in amusement, "So what's say you and me take up my offer and go get something to eat?"

Lily shrunk into her shoulders, pouting.

"Huh?" I asked with a big sarcastic grin, "Lily? Huh? Free food? Courtesy of my lawyer-rich Aunt Rhonda? Huh?"

Lily shrunk a little further down and muttered something that I couldn't quite make out.

"I said..." Lily's voice rose slightly...

"I just got these, like, a month ago!" Lily said angrily, a few minutes later. Her shorts had been replaced by yoga pants, and she was red in the face as she rambled. "Seriously, those were practically brand new, Mel!" Despite being angry about her shorts acquiring a new 5 inch hole, Lily was still more than happy to drive the two of us to a restaurant (some new place called Smokey's BBQ).

"I dunno what to tell you, Lily. Shit happens. I tend to rip a piece of clothing about once a week, to be honest." Lily sighed, then giggled.

"One can only hope that I'll never get so fat that I'm ripping things on a weekly basis..." She sort of trailed off at the end of that comment, and I imagined what a Lily with an additional 300 pounds would look like. I assumed it wouldn't be quite as evenly distributed- she'd probably be one of those fatties that accumulates all of their weight in their tits, I thought bitterly. Looking over, I could confirm my theory somewhat- Lily was definitely more stacked than she used to be, and I was a little surprised that she hadn't whined about having to get new bras while she was bitching about her pants. I mean, sure, she had gained mostly in her belly, but my boobs kind of... grew by default and her's definitely had plumped up. Say, why was I thinking about my best friends tits, anyways?

"Well, it doesn't look too busy, at least..." Lily said quietly as she maneuvered her car into one of the spaces. "Oh, hey, look! New opening prices- 9$ for the buffet!" She didn't even have to ask. We both knew what we wanted.

-----

"You know, for a place that has BBQ in the name, they sure don't have a ton of BBQ on the buffet line." I grumbled as I threw my tray down. Boy, I loved buffets that had trays, because I was an old pro, and could easily get 5 plates on there without too much overlap.

Lily swallowed her bite of biscuit before staring at me. "Mel... You literally have BBQ ribs, pulled pork, maple fried bacon, and a steak covered in BBQ sauce. That's... pretty much all there is to BBQ." I sighed, my mouthful of mashed potatoes muffling the sound a bit.

"You've clearly never been to Texas." I said, but I wasn't too salty about any of this. Shit, five plates might be enough to warm me up, at least, and by the time I hit that perfect level of stuffed where I wouldn't want to leave the table, I was sure Lily would get food for me. But it had been a while since I'd really, y'know, pushed myself. I mean, I always ate what would be enough to feed a family of 5, but it had been a while since I had eaten enough for a family of 15. Just... Broke down and ate. I tried to remember the last time I ate so much I couldn't move- it would've been at a buffet, but my Aunt wasn't too fond of them, so the only time I would go would be with Lily. And so-

"Hey, Lil, when did we go to a buffet last?"

"Are you kidding me Mel? It was like, 6 days ago."

"Yeah, but I would've remembered if I ate til I was like, actually full."

"You know, I'm not surprised you don't remember, because you only got 3 plates of food before you started bitching about how small the booth was, and we ended up leaving and just getting burgers."

"Oh." She was right, now I remembered- just because of the burgers. "Right." I thought for a second, before deciding I didn't care how creepy I sounded- it wasn't like Lily wasn't already hip to my summer plans. "I need to eat until I can't take another bite. Will you help me?"

It was kind of hard to read Lily's face- partially because she had a sloppy joe held right in front of it. She took a big bite, chewing slowly, before swallowing and answering. "I mean, sure, you're the one who paid, after all... But how serious are you being?" I wasn't quite sure what she meant, and it must have shown, because she elaborated. "I guess what I'm saying is, how will you know when you've had enough?"

That made me laugh, and I had to take a second to calm down before responding. "When you're my size, you know when you've had enough. So let's get to it."

143113231112321213221221121.content:
Okay, show of hands, how many people have gotten kicked out of a buffet?

One, maybe two?

Because that night, I got myself and Lily banned from Big Bob's BBQ Barn for life. I mean, Lily probably didn't help the whole "closing the place down" thing, but I did most of the grunt work. Seriously, you'd think a place run by a guy a not much skinnier than I was would understand a thing or two about letting loose at a buffet every now and then. I know how big he was because I got a first-hand look at how big this guy was when he came over to our table, personally, to ask us to please calm the fuck down with all the eating.

But the thing was, my brain had more or less shut down after the first hour or so. I hadn't gone into a place with my appetite cocked and ready to fire in so long that I went a little crazy. By the time the guy managed to waddle over there, I would say that Lily and I had probably been stuffing our faces (rather, my face) for the better part of three hours.

I was a mess. There was barbecue sauce everywhere. On my hands, on my face, down my shirt, even in my hair. What they lacked in variety (at least, what I considered variety) they made up for in quality. Seriously, I had to go home and smack my Aunt Rhonda in the face for suggesting that Lily and I should have gone to Little Pig's. This place had some of the best ribs I'd ever deep-throated, and the best sandwiches I'd ever put into my mouth. And I know sandwiches.

I clutched my gut, burbling and squelching richly as it did it's absolute best to not explode. My shirt, my poor shirt, had been absolutely ruined by barbecue sauce; and my belly had swollen so much that it may as well have just been a half-tee with red-brown stains anyway. My breathing was so labored that I vaguely recognized other customers looking over to our table, wondering just what in the hell was going on. My arms, doughy and flabbier than ever, ached after the intense workout I'd just put them through, and my jaw hung slack into the folds of my chins as I sat there, stuffed stupid.

Lily, who certainly hadn't been modest in her portions either, actually had to nudge me in the arm to get my attention. I heard the booth beneath her squeak as she tilted slightly to the right, and slapped my upper arm."Mel." she burped.

I was way too out of it to respond on the first shot, and way too concerned with thoughts of my own obesity to show any concern to the tall, bowling-ball shaped man that stared daggers at me from a good two feet behind his gut.

"Mel." she said a little more insistently, but still pretty groggy, "This guy wants to talk to you."

"Wuh?" I asked dumbly, my head rolling over to the side to face Bowling Ball Man, "Hey...rrrRURRRRP...'sup?"

"I'm gonna have t'ask y'all to leave." he looked and sounded an awful lot like Dr. Phil if he'd fallen off the wagon and locked himself in a bakery, "Y'all got more than yer fair share of barbecue, and I'd really hate to get the police involved."

"Whaaaat?"I replied drunkenly, slurring my words and punctuating my half-thoughts with hot belches, "That's... dumb. The sign says all you can eat!"

"Well you ladies have eaten enough." he said, crossing his arms over is moobs, "Come on. Out of the booth."

I was not well for that. I'd pretty much wedged myself into the space between the booth and the table, and (like a lot of booths in this town!) they weren't adjustable. My belly pushed itself into the table, my top-tiers oozing into a big blubbery puddle next to my graveyard of discarded courses. I honestly wasn't sure if I could get up. Thank God Lily was more coherent (and less voluptuous) than I was, because I'm pretty sure that I would have probably had to have been escorted out by Not-Doctor-Phil if I couldn't get myself out of there.So eventually, Lily helped pull me out of there. There was this big red mark across my gut as it sloshed and shook in front of me, bobbing with my every step to the rhythm of my huge tits. I held it by the flanks, hoping to relieve some of the pressure that gravity was putting on it by holding it up. But I wasn't that strong--no one was. Lily handled all the talking and got me out of there. She guided me out, wincing as my width scraped against the metal frame of the door, and let me plop myself down on the bench so I could center myself.

"I cannot believe you got me kicked out of a restaurant." Lily sounded more amused than upset, "I've never been kicked out of ANYTHING before!"

"I knoooo..." I remember burping as I leaned onto her, practically crushing her as we waited for our ride home, "It sucksss. That place was sooo good..."

"Yeah, I'm sure Big Bob in there is glad you think so." Lily looked into the inside, "He seems pretty pissed. Better hope our taxi comes by... I need to change into something stretchy. Pronto."

"Wanna get kicked out of Little Pigs' next?" I asked almost fliratiously, burping right into her face, "I'm not doing anything tomorrow. Or the next day."

"I'm gonna get so fucking fat hanging out with you, aren't I?"

So I started to black out a little. Anyone who's ever eaten a lot (hopefully not as much as I did) will tell you that you get pretty sleepy when all you do is eat for hours on end. It's a lot more tiring than you'd think! I flickered in and out for a while while we waited for our cab.. All I know for sure about the hour or so after we left was that, somehow, I made it home. And that, at some point, I'd stripped down to my birthday suit and passed out in my bed. And also that, the next morning, I gave that place the shittiest Yelp! review ever.

All You Can Eat my big fat ass.

***


So, as you can probably guess, I had the most awesome life ever. I got to eat whatever I wanted on someone else's dime, hang out with the best little gaining coach a girl could ask for, and I got to do it all while living with my Aunt Rhonda, who was about a bazillion times cooler than my Mom and pretty much let me do whatever the fuck I wanted judgement-free.

I ate hard, slept hard, and enjoyed every second of it.

After a while longer...

1431132311123212132212211212.content:
So let me put this into context for you—Lily was already kind of a pig before.

She hung out with me all the time, how could she not be? I made it a point to surround myself with so much food that I couldn’t not gain weight. Whenever she wasn’t in class, she was usually with me—binging out of my Aunt’s generous (and seemingly endless) wallet. We were either eating out at a restaurant, eating in her car, or eating on the couch at my Aunt Rhonda’s place; always. Even now that she had started school, Lily still found countless hours to spend with me almost every day as I spent my time ravenously devouring anything put in front of my face.

And I guess I had sort of… rubbed off on her.

I mean, yeah, she had already put on a lot of weight. But after we got kicked out of the barbecue hut that night, something inside Lily seemed to snap—it was like, once she realized she had gotten kicked out of a buffet (well, I had. She was more through association, though she had eaten a lot) Lily’s eating dial went into overdrive.

We had only known each other for about four months, and my little Lily had ballooned herself up to nearly two hundred pounds of pure, unadulterated appetite. Seriously, she was like a completely different chick. Her short stature made her look round and hungry, like a little red-headed Pac Man with tits the size of overripe cantaloupes. Her cute little pot belly had grown heavy and thick, with meaty lovehandles blooming on either side of her gut. Her ass filled the seat of any chair unlucky to have her, and rounded out prominently behind her. If I hadn’t spent every minute gorging alongside her, I would have never known that she was the same person.

My own healthy appetite, of course, hadn’t done anything other than blow myself up even further. I had put on a respectable forty pounds since that night at Big Bob’s, and it probably had a lot to do with my Gaining Coach turned Binge Buddy. Now that I had turned Lily to the Dark Side, we were literally constantly eating when we were together. My tits were huge, my ass was huger, and my hips were so wide that I was starting to brush against doorways when I walked. I had to swing my arms slightly when I walked to keep my fat ass moving, which was no easy feat because my arms were just as heavy and fat as the rest of me. Even my face had started retaining more weight; I’d officially come into my third chin, and my cheeks were so puffy that I was starting to get that cute little fold over the corners of my mouth. But the real star of the show—the top billing of my blubbery body—was my belly. It grew bigger and hungrier every day, just like me. I loved the way it felt when it slapped against the thick mattressy padding of my thighs, and I was just beginning to have to strain to wrap my arms around it. I was huge; bigger than ever.

Not to toot my own horn here, but I was doing a much better job of packing on the pounds than Lily was. I mean, come on. The first few hundred is easy, right? It’s keeping up your new figure that’s the hard part.

Anyway so like always, Lily and I went out to eat after she got out of classes. We parked ourselves at this little greasy spoon place that we’d found called Big Burger. It was one of the few places in town that was both able to accommodate my increasing girth and totally okay with the fact that I regularly performed miraculous feats of gastronomy on a daily basis. We’d actually been eating there a lot lately; it had sort of become me and Lil’s unofficial hangout.

So we’d pretty much become regular patrons at this place. I could waddle through the door and, just as soon as they saw my gut through the doorway, the waitresses would already have an order for us ready. They always had a little something different, and it was always enough to feed probably a family of five. At first, y’know, it was just sort of nice that they knew us well enough to start off with a big spread. But now, I’ll admit, I sort of expected it.

I was squeezed into the booth, my 460 pound self causing the cheap plastic that struggled to support me to creak and groan with my every movement. I was busy palming a burger the size of a hand fruit and shoving it into my face while Lily grabbed chicken tenders by the handful.

The girl definitely had potential, I remember thinking to myself as I tried not to choke on an unexpected pickle. I had only known her since the Summer, and she’d already packed on a lot of weight. More than I had, dare I say it. And this was coming from a girl who went to a school where, like, 90% of my graduating class couldn’t touch their toes.

So we were just sitting there, stuffing ourselves like normal, when…

She had longer, natural black hair, and while attractiveness on either gender was pretty beyond my scope of thought (since it didn't involve food), I would guess most guys (and girls, I suppose) would find her attractive.

"So, you wanna hang out with two big girls like us?"

She blushed in embarrassment, but still was able to...

“Marie’s… sheltered.” Lily explained, drawing out the word in a sympathetic sort of way and looking me dead in the eye as she did so, “The poor thing’s been in Catholic schools her whole life, and she doesn’t really have a lot of friends.”

“And?” I said sassily, putting my hand on one fatty hip as my feet started to get tired, “Then you should want us to hang out! She sounds like she could use a new friend like me—I’m awesome!”

“No, Mel… you’re not listening…” Lily’s little red brow furrowed as she started shivering, the autumn weather making her blobby body quiver in the afternoon breeze, “She’s… like, okay—Marie’s never had junk food before. Okay? I gave her a pack of Lay’s potato chips last week and she told me how her family’s like, super health crazy.”

“Gross.” I crinkled my nose and comforted my belly as it growled, “But that still doesn’t explain why you jumped down my throat, Lil. Or why you don’t want me and your little special snowflake to get close.”

Lily sighed and readjusted herself, tugging at her tightening Clemson hoodie and bundling her hands in the pocket. I could see her chins quivering as she fought back the chattering of her teeth—her plump cheeks getting blotchy and red just from standing out in the cold as she tried to find the right words.

“Okay, like… you know how if you don’t get your vaccinations when you’re a kid, you can get Chicken Pox or Polio or whatever?” Lily asked and I nodded, “Well, Marigold isn’t used to eating like a normal person. So a couple weeks around you, and she’ll be on the express route to Fattytown!”

“Oh, so now I’m some disease?” I asked sarcastically

“Mel, I’ve put on sixty pounds being your friend.” Lily shook the great swell of her gut beneath her hoodie, “And that’s just since the Summer started. I’m cool with it—mostly—but Marigold would be crushed if she just woke up one day and weighed as much as I do.”

I rolled my eyes. Whenever the negative parts of her being a cute little chub ball came up, some how everything came up to be my fault. But I wasn’t the one who made Lily all roly-poly. In a weird way, I could understand though. Lily probably would have wound up getting fat anyway (if those pictures of her family were any indication) but being around me had probably put her ahead by a few years.

That being said, I really didn’t want to lose my best friend—hell, my only friend since I moved here—just because she was worried about what me being around might do to Marie. Just because they went to college together didn’t mean that I should have had to give up my little ginger binger, did it?

“Can I still hang out with you guys?” I asked after a long pause, “I mean, Marie is going to order subs…”

“Only if you promise you’ll be good.” Lily shivered, “And that we can turn the heater on, like, ninety when we get to your Aunt’s place.”

“Deal!”

"So look, I came up with this little lyric to remember the order of the wars, right? So it's basically 'the battle of Verdun, is no fun', okay..."

Oh my God this was boring. Like, horribly boring. They were talking about a World War, but I'll be damned if I knew- or cared- which one. Luckily for me, there was a TON of food. An alarming amount, one might say. I was feeling adventurous, so I was currently holding a sub in one hand and a slice of pizza in the other, and was alternating, which was going about as well as one might expect. But food is food, so I just sort of drowned out the white noise of education and focused on eating everything in front of me, until...

"You have pizza sauce on your, uh... Everything." Mary quietly pointed out from across the table. I snapped out of my gluttony for half a second to see Mary staring at me, a pencil twirling in her hand. I swallowed the massive bite of pepperoni that I had jammed in my face and stared at her.

"Oh, yeah... I uh, I tend to get a bit messy. Where'd Lily go?" Apparently at some point between my second foot-long and my fifth slice of pizza Lily had disappeared.

"Bathroom." Marie responded, sounding bored. For some reason, I felt a little awkward. I felt a belch rumble up and before I could help myself, I let it out, long and hard. Marie made a face that I couldn't quite read.

"Uh, sorry? I guess I... Ate kinda fast." I suddenly felt very awkward. I mean, I didn't know a lot about the girl, other than all of the sudden I was kind of the crypt-keeper between her and getting as fat as me, at Lil's request. "Are you guys having fun?"

Shit, I sucked at this. "As much fun as you can have talking about history and prepping for a shitty test. How's the food?" I grinned- I couldn't talk much about college junk, but I could definitely talk about food!

"It's alright, I mean, Tino's has the best pizza, but their sandwiches aren't that great, which is why I was super psyched that you had gotten J&L's, and then, I mean, Mandarin Kitchen is a pretty solid choice, their crab rangoon is the best in town! I've only eaten there a few times, but, uh..." I trailed off. I think I had scared Marie a little, with my food talk. And she seemed kind of unsure of how to respond. An awkward silence overtook us. I started to panic- this girl and Lily seemed tight, what if she didn't like me? And then her and Lily would hang out all the time and I'd never see her and I'd have to sit at home and eat until I couldn't stand up and watch television and... Well, that didn't sound that bad, but it'd be way better to do with a friend.

I was pretty sure Lily would be hella pissed, but I did what felt natural to me. "Hey, you, uh, want a slice?" I mean, it was one slice. She nodded, and a slid a slice over on a piece of paper towel- and the girl fuckin' devoured it. Like, she could've put "hungry Mel" to shame. I swear the slice was gone in a second.

I could see her eyeing the remaining 2 slices of pizza hungrily, the way a dog will track your movement whenever you have anything they think might be edible. Panicking, I slammed the two slices together and jammed them into my mouth, chewing frantically. Marie's eyes grew wide. "Sorry, I was feeling hungry again." I managed to blurt out while my cheeks were swollen with pizza, somehow. She nodded, then began to stare at the remnants of sandwhich in front of me. Swallowing hard, I crammed the sandwich into my face, jamming way too much food into there at once, until my jaw started to hurt- And then I proceeded to almost choke when I felt a hand slap on my shoulder.

"Well, time to get back to it, Marie!" Lily shouted. I sighed with relief- or I would've if there was any sort of space in my mouth. Lily sat down (the chair letting out a light creak) and gave me a look that said, "I really hope you didn't offer her food." I tried to give her an innocent look, but I wouldn't know how it turned out, because they were already back to studying.

Of course, while they studied, I started to realize that this awkward situation was bound to repeat itself next time Lily ran off to the bathroom again- and judging by the way she was slamming Coke, it wouldn't be much longer. Feeling a little queasy from the bites of food I had forced down my throat, I began to diligently dig into the chinese food.

-----


I laid on the couch, feeling like I was on fire. "Lily, why is it so FUCKING HOT?" I shouted as angrily as I could, except I think the sheer amount of food weighing me down made me sound more pathetic than frustrated.

"It's hot because YOU cranked up the heat-"

"Because you asked me to!" I interrupted, but she kept going.

"-And because I'm pretty sure you ate like, 5 pounds of spicy pork and beef-"

"Again, because you asked me to!"

"-And also because you're just fat!"

Well, she got me with that one. But still, I was pissed! And stuffed. I let out what I hoped like was an angry burp as I sat on the couch and tried to not pass out.

"I mean, seriously, Mel, you must've eaten like six pounds of food..."

Ugh, there was no point in arguing with Lily- and I had a feeling I knew why she was so grumpy.

"...And you didn't even save any for me!"

Yup. I was just doing what she told me to!

Anyways, I guess things were kind of heating up in the college world, because I didn't see Lily or Marie for a little while, until I got a text from Lily...

"You sound surprised? I mean, am I not lovable-"

There was a long pause, before Lily spoke again. "Are you finally done?"

She finally cut me off. "Okay, Jeeze! Lay off the fucking drama for a second, Mel! It's just kind of... Excessive. Like, don't get me wrong, you're like my best friend, but she's only met you once, and the way she talks about you... Sheesh. It's just kinda weird, but if it'll make her happy, then that's fine. Tomorrow? Sixish?"

I swallowed the last bit of pizza, reached with my free hand for a new slice and found the box empty.

"Fine, but the pizza is on you two again."

Lily laughed on the other end of the line. "Great. I'll text you if things don't work out."

I passed the time the way I usually did. My lovely Aunt Rhonda would come home around 6ish, usually bearing either groceries or takeout, or both. She hadn't really exploded in weight after that initial burst of gain- I think maybe after she popped her 15th stitch or so, she realized that maybe eating Apple Dumpling's turnovers every day wasn't doing her any favors. Granted, she hadn't really gone on a diet, per-say, but it seemed to have sort of peaked. Still didn't stop her from chowing down with me every night for dinner.

So tonight was thai food, which I was perfectly happy with. The spicy dishes paired nicely with the half gallon of ice cream that I had stored away in the fridge for such an occasion. By 8ish, Rhonda was usually pretty beat, and if nothing was good on television, she'd peace out to her room for the night.

That was my cue to take my pants off. Don't get me wrong, I only wore stretchy pants- but with my new life of burning maybe 10 calories a day, combined with me cleaning out half the fridge every day, meant that even the stretchiest of elastic was strained by my blossoming gut.

Now pantsless, I'd usually scarf down whatever snacks sounded good- after the previously mentioned ice cream, I reheated the container of Thai that wasn't devoured, then heated up two bags of popcorn (extra butter, obvs) and scarfed them down with a side of soda.

In the morning, I'd usually wake up around 11:30- Aunt Rhonda would be long gone, which meant no pants for me. Then it was basically working through whatever was left in the fridge, or pantry. Occasionally I'd order some takeout if I was feeling adventurous, but the whole "not having a job" thing meant this was a rare occasion, usually when Rhonda left me some money for whatever.

So eventually, it was like, 6:15, and I was starving. Those two were taking their sweet-ass time and I had been so busy cleaning that I had really worked up an appetite.

I mean, I had thrown away, like, four pizza boxes. That takes effort.

And, on top of that, I had to force myself into pants, and even (because I didn't want to look like a slob! ) I had squeezed my massive chest into a bra. My boobs oozed over the cups (not entirely unexpected) and the straps dug angrily into my back, but I still persevered, for Mary's sake. It'd take a few more hangouts before I went braless around her.

Of course, my yoga pants were giving me such a ridiculous muffin top that It could easily be considered indecent, and my sweatshirt basically ended just above my bellybutton, giving everyone an excellent view of several inches of my pale, flabby stomach.

My stomach let out a very angry grumble as I texted Lily. "where are you guys im seriously starving, im gonna be a skeleton by the time u get here". I dramatically threw my phone away and fanned my forehead. Okay, maybe spending a lot of time at home not doing anything was making me a little stir-crazy.

My phone chirped happily and I scrambled across the couch to grab it, my belly folding into several various sized rolls as I did to, the springs creaking in the angry tone that I'd grown to know over the past few months. "Just, hold your damn horses. Mary's going a little crazy."

Well, that was ominous. I quickly texted back. "??? What ???" And then a bunch of confused looking cat emojis. I'm an obnoxious texter.

"She's just buying a lot of food. Chill. She said she, and I quote, "Wants to make sure Mel has enough"."

My eyes widened, remembering the absolute glut of food that I had shoveled into my face last time we hung out.

"i think i love mary, tell her that "

Lily didn't take long to respond:

"Ugh, Mel, don't be weird. We're on our way, try not to be too much of a crazy pig."

I grinned.

"fat chance."

Good pun, me.

Okay, so... yeah. I kind of had an idea in my head as to why Marigold was so into me.

I mean, not at first. I was a little preoccupied by the fact that my company for the evening came in bearing loads upon loads of junk food. Seriously, I don't think that I could see Lily's face over all the bags and packaging. Marigold leading the way, they practically bum-rushed to the couch and plopped themselves down; with all that yummy takeout within my immediate grasp, it was only a matter of time before I started eating.

And, see, that's where it started getting weird.

I had fully expected this to be a repeat of last time. Lily and Marie do some boring college studying while I'm presented with yet another opportunity to stuff myself beyond the comprehension of most mere mortals. Lily and I would take little breaks to regale Marie in our tales of extreme overeating, I'd zone out on the couch and maybe watch some TV, end of story.

But no. This time around, after seeing what damage I could do to even a mountain of food, Marie seemed much more interested in watching my each and every move. Like a kid watching a magician; she wanted to see just how all that food disappeared, I guess. I didn't even notice it at first, but after I finished every entree I would look up to see what was closest, only to fine Marie staring at me. It was pretty evident that she wasn't getting much studying done either--the background noise that was their studying quickly faded out without my knowledge, and quickly became Lily doing some guided reading while Marie watched my every move.

Eventually Lily had to get up and use the restroom, leaving just me and Marie. Alone. In my aunt's living room. Surrounded by the remains of several sub sandwiches and thai takeout containers. There was still a box of pizza left on the coffee table, thankfully. That gave me something to shove in my face so I didn't have to face how awkward this was getting. But eventually, I had to say something.

"Marie? Did, uh... are you on some over dosage of Riddelin? Because you haven't stopped staring at me all night." I finally said, uneased by the fact that her eyes were glued to my belly, "I mean, normally I like the attention but... y'know. Kinda weird."

Marie began to bloom an immediate shade of pink.

"N-No!" she let out a flustered huff, "I-It's just... uh... m-maybe a little..."

"Come on Marie, spill it." I said before taking another bite of pizza, "You brought all this food over for free, so that makes us friends in my book; just tell me what's up and, more importantly, why you've been giving me the creep stare all night."

"I..." Marie said quietly before sputtering out a series of mumbling whispers, "mumminamummina..."

"I'm sorry, what was that?" I cupped my hand to my ear, "I couldn't hear you over your crippling social anxiety."

"I-I said..." Marie began, a little more firmly this time...

I grabbed as much belly fat as I could in each hand and jiggled it, leaving greasy fingerprints on my shirt before going back to holding pizza in each hand and alternating biting each slice- one bacon and pepperoni, one deluxe.

She blushed in a way that I could only compare to a tomato, before responding with yet another series of incomprehensible whisper-mumble hybrids. "thatsnothruminameanthurminamurminahdurn"

I spared a moment from scanning the table for something to wash my pizza down with to give her a strict glance. "Look, Marie, lesson one around me: I'm not a fan of mumbling! Speak up! Also where's those chili-dogs, I can smell them but I can't see them!"

Yeah, I was kind of being a dick. But...

1. I was still kinda hungry -no, who was I kidding, seriously- I wasn't hungry at all but I still craved food- a downside of being massively overwheight, I suppose.

and

2. I was serious- Mumbling pisses me off. I'm loud, proud, and constantly getting attention. Quiet meek folks do not mesh with me.

Anyways...

She actually fucking handed me a platter of chili dogs. I like girls anyone who hands me food! And along with the chili dogs, she managed to actually talk at a volume level I could comprehend.

Marie blinked once. Twice.

"I remember when Sister Davis told me that I shouldn't... Be eating, junk food, like chips, and- Um..." Marie trailed off, presumably because I was giving her the fussiest stare I could give, while still having a ring of chili around my mouth.

"...Is Sister Davis here?" Marie shook her head no. "Are your parents here?" One more shake of her head, a frown prominent. "Are you over the age of 8?" A small smile.

I sighed, but it wasn't a bad sigh. "Marie, take a bite of this pizza before I devour it. Hell, eat the rest. I may be fat, but I'm not heartless." She resisted, but I slid it towards her until it bumped her pencil and paper off the table, and rested directly under her nose- which twitched eagerly. "You're an adult, a woman. Your parents and your presumably horrible Catholic school mentors can't see you now, so indulge, girl."

I'm not sure why I was so encouraging- perhaps I saw a bit of myself within Marie- struggling with resisting her upbringing. Of course, my resistance came early. Marie just needed some... Encouragement.

For a brief second, I found myself wondering what Marie would look like at my size. She struck me as the kind of girl that only gained below her waist- all hips and ass. Of course, it'd take her years and years to get even close to my size, and even then I'd probably be way bigger at this rate, probably too big to-

Urrrrrrrp!

My eyes went wide, and I stared at Marie, who looked just as shocked. I turned around and saw Lily, standing there looking more than a bit bloated- hey, I wasn't the only one eating this stuff!

She waddled over to her seat, before sighing. "Alright, where were we?"

I wasn't sure if it was because no one had sat Marie down and talked to her like that before, if she was trying to branch out of her sheltered Catholic-School bubble, or if I just straight-up scared her into submission, but I distinctly remember that after that night on the couch Marie started acting differently around me. She wasn't as shy, she didn't gawk as much, and she actually started to... I don't know, open up to me, I guess. It was weird at first, but then again I guess I had sort of forgotten how to have more than one friend at a time by that point.

It makes sense, I guess. I mean, if the worst thing that could happen between us was me sitting her down and telling her to grow up and take charge of her own appetites, and I had already done it, what more reason was there to hold back? I was real with Marie, and I guess she appreciated it.

We started hanging out some after that. Like by ourselves and everything. I'll admit that we didn't quite "click" the same way that Lily and I had; it was a little awkward at first. It probably would have helped if we could all hang out together more than once a week, y'know, to help us ease into things. But I was more than willing to give it a shot, so long as she was.

...and as long as she kept the snacks coming.

Turns out, girlfriend was loaded. Which, y'know, makes sense when you look back on our first few hangouts together. She fronted the bill for everything, and didn't so much as think twice about it! Coming from a girl with more inches than dollars and less sense than cents, I was more than ready to take Miss Moneybags's invitations to hang out with her.

"Mel, what's a good place to eat?" she'd ask me almost every time we hung out, practically licking her lips, "I can't decide."

And so I told her. Mexican Pepper, Apple Dumplin's, Big Burger, just about every one of my own discoveries and hangouts soon became Marie's. Honestly, I'd spent so much of my life going out to eat that it didn't really strike me as odd that it was Marie asking. I was just happy to accept the invitation, and eventually just happy to stuff myself with someone who was more than willing to front the bill for the two of us.

"Mel, I don't really feel like going to Biology today..." Marie asked me more than a few times, "Wanna go grab some breakfast?"

And, I mean, who was I to say no to Marie's new "blossoming"? She was finding herself! Letting go, making herself happy and all that noise. I'd be a damn hypocrite if I didn't at least help her steadily work the rod that those nuns and parents of hers had wedged up her ass. So we started to hang out more.

"Hey, Marie wants to know if you wanna come eat with us at our cafeteria?" Lily asked me over the phone, "She's paying, and it's meatloaf night."

And more.

"M'so fulllll!" Marie whined one night at my Aunt's place, cradling a distended gut, "Why'd you guys let me eat so much?!"

And more.

"So you're saying that you and Lily knew about deep-deep dish pizzas..." Marie said with a crazed look in her eye, "And neither of you told me about it?!"

I mean, I never really stopped to look at how much Marie was changing in the coming weeks. I saw her every other day or so, but to me she was just getting more comfortable hanging out with me and Lily. She stopped being so quiet, for the most part, and we started introducing her to our shows... I mean, she just sort of became one of the girls!

Look, y'know how when you're really close to someone and you don't realize that they're changing but they are and...

Screw it; I'll just come right out and say it: I had done literally what Lily asked me not to do and pushed Marie off the deep end.

Which, in retrospect, was kind of a bitchy thing to do. I understand now why Lily was so intent on keeping us apart, but in all honesty it wasn't like I had done a bad thing. I helped a girl grow up! So what if she was gonna grow out too? And besides, Marie was way more fun now that she had finally let loose. She laughed more, talked more, and honestly seemed more friendly. So she had maybe developed an unhealthy relationship with food. Who didn't have one of those? As far as I was concerned, this little development was for the best.

Except maybe...

My phone vibrated and scared me half to death. I was currently in the process of trying to buy a damn pair of yoga pants that might actually, y'know, not rip within ten days of me ordering them? I was deep in thought, wondering if maybe it was the material, rather than the size itself. So I was kind of in this weird trance where I was on wikipedia and about five different clothing websites, looking at the "recommended waistline" and then comparing the materials when it happened.

Once my heart rate dropped back down to acceptable levels, I checked my phone- of course it was Lily. My aunt pretty much didn't text me anymore- hell, I barely saw her, and when I did, she'd comment about work being hell and duck into her room. And, well, my list of friends wasn't exactly a mile long. "Whats up- I'm at the mall and bored as hell- join me and ill buy lunch."

Now, there was a serious dilemna here- mainly the cost-benefit analysis.

Pros:

Free lunch

I get to see Lily

Maybe I can find some new pants (haha yeah fuckin' right, though)

Cons:

I have to move

I have to deal with everyone who isn't Lily

I have to put on pants.

But...

"Pretty please?" Came the next text, along with a picture of Lily pouting- complete with what I now saw was the makings of a third chin. Bad angle, I guessed. Phone vibrated again: "Hell, I'll buy you two dinners. I haven't seen you in like a week!"

Which was true. And last time, I had met them at their cafeteria and they sat there and just talked about numbers or whatever and I had to keep getting up to get food. It sucked.

So I sighed, picked my fat ass up off the couch- slightly alarmed with how winded it made me, because if getting off the couch was bad, walking around the damn mall was gonna be bad. But whateves. Again: free food.

So look- busses suck when you're fat. Like, I get it, bitch, my fat ass takes up two of these shitty plastic bus seats and it means you can't sit down, but I deserve to sit too! This lady totally shot me the stink eye all the way to the mall!

Of course, at some point I realized that my gut was oozing out of my shirt by like, 3 inches, exposing my pale blubbery belly for everyone to see. She might have been staring at that. Still rude, though.

Luckily, the bus stops right in front of the area with the highest clustering of restaurants. "where we eating?" I said, simply and sweet. I waddled my way through the glass doors, almost bouncing into an older lady who looked at me like I was a freak because I was too busy texting. I didn't bother apologizing- it was lunch time, lady. I'm not nice when I'm hungry.

"Well, I'm at Johnny's, so come here first."

First. I liked the sound of that.

Johnny's was alright. It was a local chain, I think, maybe seven or eight of them? You know the type though- Americana through-and-through, even kitsch to make even the tackiest of grammas roll their eyes. Still, their food was alright- Hell, I had heard a rumor that they made their shakes with lard, like the old days. I immediately spotted Lily's beacon of red hair across the way. "Gawd..." Lily bit into a bagel (that girl had a surprisingly big mouth!) "It just feels so good to... mm... say it, y'know?"

"Fuck your size." Lily cut me off (a-fucking-gain!) with a smack of her lips as she stuffed more bagel into her mouth, "I wanna be bigger. God if I feel like this now imagine how I'll feel when I'm... when I'm..."

I saw her stare at me for a second, and I can only imagine that she took that time to imagine what she would look like if she were as fat as I was. Is it weird to admit that I did too? I mean, people do that, right? Imagine their friends fat? Anyway, I could totally see it. Lily'd have a lot more difficulty moving around at my weight than I did considering she was so friggin' short; and her tits would be just the biggest fucking things in the world. I punctuated my statement—no, my challenge—with a slap of my oceanic gut. It wobbled in place between my legs, rippling as far up as my chins and bingo wings as I smiled triumphantly to the lesser fatty. Somehow having Lily get fat, getting so fat anyway, provided me with a nice little anchor point for me. Anyone else would have looked at Lily's transformation since Summer and think "damn, girl got BIG!". But I was nearly twice the size of this cow, and still growing! Any time I needed to feel fat, like I wasn't gaining enough or if I just wasn't as big as I ought to have been, I could look at Lily.

Lily watched my belly shake in what I imagine was envy. She bit her bottom lip and let out a low stream of air through her nose.

"Mel... please..." she said weakly, "Y-You're the fattest girl.. the fattest person I've ever met. Will you... will you help me?"

For a minute there, I saw the old Lily. The skinny little Lily that I bumped into my first day in my new home. The one who, in retrospect, just desperately needed a friend. Someone to nudge her into the right direction. How could I have possibly refused? That would have made me a big, fat hypocrite!

...like, literally. A big fat hypocrite.

"Alright, just so long as you know what you're getting into..." I trailed off, Lily's smile preemptively returning to us, "I'll get you where you need to be."

"THANKYOUTHANKYOUTHANKYOU!!" Lily squealed as she tackled my fat ass, wrapping around my neck and pressing my face directly into her airbag titties, "Oh you're the best, just the bes—"

It was about damn time I started getting a paycheck!

I mean, the money wasn't great, but it was decent pay for the amount of work that I would be doing. Basically I'd get paid weekly, and it'd be performance based. My Aunt said (and she was very clear about this) that I could earn up to nine dollars an hour. Which basically meant "don't half-ass this Mel, or I'll be super pissed at you."

Well I showed her—I intended on going at this with my whole ass. That's right all of my ass was going into making sure that I was the best damn teaching assistant that I could be!

I mean, the teacher that I would be assigned to worked in a local high school. I mean, how hard could it really be to keep everything organized? We had teachers like Ms. Walker at Buttercombe Academy, and she didn't do shit. I figured that she was just some overworked woman (or one who was in over her head!) and needed an extra hand. I wasn't going to look a gift horse in the mouth, but I honestly wished that I had a lot more information before my Aunt just went ahead and signed me up without even consulting me as to just whom I would have liked to be assisting. I guess that's the price you pay when you and your fatass friend break a couch, but still.

I still intended to keep my promise to Lily—I'd help her get as big as she wanted, but at least this gave me something to do while she and Marie were at school so I didn't have to sit at my Aunt's place like a sad puppy. A big, fat puppy. Who wasn't so much sad as she was hungry...

Anyway, so my first day "on the job" (if you could really call it that) was via Skype. I was supposed to video-chat with the teacher that I had been assigned so that we could get some one on one time about her expectations in my assisting her. Which was totally fine—all I had to do was pretty myself up from the tits up and throw on something that didn't look too casual, and I was ready to go.

That being said, I was still almost completely naked from my waist (alright, my mid-tummy) down. I had thrown on a sweater that fit over my giant tits and put on some makeup, but other than that I was same-old Mel. No pants, fat hanging out everywhere, cereal bowl sitting on my belly. And now I could be that Mel while getting a paycheck for doing what most people considered housekeeping. So yeah, life was pretty sweet!

As I opened up my laptop and called my teacher (promptly at nine thirty, her only planning period btw!) I came face to face with...

Turns out, technology can't be trusted- nothing is working!  Shit!
1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.content:
"Oh, drat, I can never get this thing to work on the first try..." A quiet, even-toned voice came out of my speakers, surprising me. I had audio, but no video. "Melissa?" Ugh. Hate that.

"Um, no, it's Melanie- but please call me Mel." I said, keeping my tone friendly, but firm.

"Oh, wonderful, Mel it is! I already have two Melissa in my class, must be how I got this confused. Now, hold on a second, I just need to- ah, here we go!" My screen went from the blue blank-faced profile of "No Video Found" to a pixelated image of, presumably, Ms Calliope. Much like myself, I could barely see anything past her chin, but she had a rounder, older face. She seemed friendly enough, giving a big grin when she finally saw her camera was working.

"I can see you now, Ms. Calliope! Hello!" I waved a hand, hoping my neck didn't wobble so much that the camera froze- could that even happen? I wondered idly.

She smiled again and looked, and I heard a rustling of papers. "Okay, Ms. Carlyle-" I guess that worked- she probably didn't want to call me Melissa on accident again, plus calling people by their last name seemed to be a thing of teachers of her generation. "This should be a pretty simple job for you. I'll basically be sending you emails through the email the school should have set up for you- Is it M.Carlyle@TempraSchools.com?" It was- I felt very professional with a title like that, so I nodded in the affirmative.

"Excellent! I sent you a test e-mail, did you...?" The laptop beeped alarmingly loud, and I felt my phone go apeshit in my pocket. I pulled it out and saw an email notification- one I could only read on my computer, through the proprietary software they had given me. I assumed it was for security purposes or some shit.

"Yup, it just came through- It looks like everything's in order!" I smiled pleasantly. I idly glanced over at the kitchen, wondering how long it'd be before I could get my mid-morning snack on- normally, I wouldn't even have breakfast in my belly by now, but I had slammed down a metric ton of bacon and sausage and eggs beforehand- a hearty breakfast is the cornerstone of any successful day, or whatever. But a snack sounded good...

"Ms. Carlyle, did I cut out for a second? Oh, this whole webcam thing would be wonderful if it actually worked..." I snapped out of it and looked back at the screen.

"Oh, yes, it did go quiet for a second- you were saying?" Focus, Mel. Now is not the time.

"Ah, well. Maybe someday we'll get there, eh? At any rate- I'm going to be sending you tests and quizzes primarily- I'll also send you answer sheets. There may come a time- usually around mid-terms and finals- where I'll need some help grading essays. In those instances I'll probably have another webcam session with you to go over what I need to see in those, but it's all pretty straightforward. In fact, I was told that all teaching assistants should be sent some practice files, but that seems like a waste of both of our time-" Heyyy, I liked this lady already! "So I'm just going to send you some quizzes some my first period. Look it over, mark up the wrong answers, total up the correct answers, and send them back by, oh, let's say noon. I have plenty of faith in you- it's not exactly difficult work, it's just there's so much of it to do."

I nodded happily, letting off another signature Carlyle smile. "Sounds right up my alley, Ms. Calliope."

We said our quick goodbyes, and I immediately snapped my laptop shut and launched (read: struggled for about 20 seconds) out of the recliner that had become my temporary sitting location until our new couch arrived tomorrow. I never liked recliners- they seem to naturally sense my weight and recline back no matter what I do, and if you think getting out of a recliner that's at a 45 degree angle is hard normally, try it when you're at a weight where most scales won't give you a readout.

That video call went very well, I felt, and that deserved a reward. A reward that I had been (kind of) saving- except in reality I had forgotten about it when it got jammed behind a bag of breakfast sausages. Grinning, I pulled out my treat- a chocolate drizzled cheesecake- 8 thick slices on a platter that was easily 10"- including crumbled oreo crust! This, I felt, was accurate reparation for wasting a whole, what, 15 minutes of my morning on a video call? Plus, I needed my energy for the upcoming day. Suffice to say, I didn't use a plate. Just plopped back down in the recliner, groaned unhappily as it staggered backwards, and began to absolutely destroy the cheesecake. Twenty minutes later, an empty platter sat on the side table, and I was letting out these tiny little hiccup/burp hybrids that one tend's to get after eating over a pound of pure sugar in under a half hour. However, my brief silent respite was interrupted by the feeling of a very hearty buzz against my thigh from my pocket.

PLEASE CHECK YOUR @TEMPRASCHOOLS ACCOUNT

I grabbed the laptop from beside the chair and cracked it open, refreshing the email and seeing what I had to work with. Pssh, only 14 quizzes to score? And they were only 10 questions each- multiple choice? Hello, easy street.

I popped them open in the grading app- damn, this Tempra School program had it all- and began manually placing bright red X's against incorrect answers on each quiz. It was pretty menial work, to be honest, and by the time I graded the last one and glanced at the clock, I saw it wasn't even 10:45 yet! "Pssh, Mel Carlyle, Teacher Assistant l' extraordinaire." I briefly pictured that 9$ an hour paycheck going into my bank account- I think to celebrate, I'd try that new pizza place that had been aggressively sending us coupons.

And this program was easy as hell to use. I saved the batch of quizzes, clicked the "Graded" button, and it automatically sent them back to Ms. Calliope. Just to be safe (and prove how good of a damn assistant I was) I sent her a quick email saying I had wrapped up, and to make sure that the quizzes had sent through.

Then I got up and heated up a frozen pizza. Thinking about pizza made me want, well, pizza.
1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.title: Ms. Calliope is a Kind, Old... Pushover

1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.content:
Let me just say that this was pretty much the easiest job ever.

Not only did I get to stay at home and lay around all day, but I got paid to stay at home and lay around all day. I was grading 9th grade English assignments, so even when I wasn't provided an answer key, it wasn't like I was struggling to find the correct answers. My whole job was basically to keep Ms. Calliope organized for all four classes; which, I'll have you know, was a skill I had been cultivating since my days as Ms. Nelson's TA back at Buttercombe Academy. I graded papers, sent them back on time, organized her lesson plans, read through her notes once in a while, all while laying lapaciously laying around the house in nothing but my pajamas and clearing out our fridge at home. For nine dollars an hour, I was stupid for not signing up for this program earlier!

Needless to say, my Aunt Rhonda was pretty pleased with me—and with herself, I imagined. I mean, here I was, her niece who got kicked out of her sister's house for being such a colossal fatass that she broke a couch. Not only was she being the best aunt ever and letting said fatass live with her, she also turned me into a semi-functional member of society with a job and everything. She was so proud of me that she pretty much didn't mention the whole couch thing after I showed her what a good job I'd been doing. And whenever she was in the room, I made sure to look like I was hard at work, never letting her in on just how cushy my new job actually was. She eased off me soon enough, and things went right back to normal—good old enabling Aunt Rhonda was back in the fold, ready to reward me for doing such a good job!

Not that she needed to. Y'know, because I was gettin' paid like you wouldn't believe!

Well, I mean... you'd probably believe it. It wasn't like, the best job in the world or anything, but to a girl who had literally never had a job before? That moolah may as well have made me Dolly Parton rich! And since my Aunt didn't bug me about setting up a saving's account, I was free to squander my wealth as I saw fit, plus my allowance, once it was returned to me. I slipped her forty bucks a week as "rent" (read: reembursment) but the rest was mine to keep!

I sat at Mexican Pepper for the first time in months, draped in the favorites of all my new clothes. It was Summer once more, meaning that the unbearable Carolina heat had reared its ugly head again. I was dressed in a custom-ordered tank-top that let my wide wobbly arms hang free in the sunlight, and gave a generous view of my epic amounts of side-boob. I hadn't had something that covered me completely in so long, it felt almost weird to not have my belly roll hanging out over my shorts.

I had graduated to taking up an entire side of a booth by myself; the consequence of all my rich decadence since I'd taken up the burden of employment. I was somehow even less mobile. Now that I couldn't spend all my time out and about with Lily and Marie (more on them later!) I was practically permanently parked on my couch. My Aunt had been nice enough to give me a ride over to grab a bite so I could go out and be social on one of my first days off (yus, teacher work days...), but I was going to have to squeeze my fat ass into someone's back seat in order to get home.

Anyway, while I was marvelling at how nice it was to finally get out of the house when it was, y'know, daylight, my visiting party Sfinally arrived. It was...

1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.content:
Foof went the weird pleather booth cushion from across from me, and I assumed my guest had arrived. Assumed, because I was currently deciding which three of the appetizers I could order in the "Gordo Grande Appetizer Special" (hint: the owners were definitely white). Nachos were a given, of course. Salsa came with the act of getting seated- I should know, I had already cleared out our bowl twice. I decided my other two would be refried beans and ceviche- hadn't gotten seafood in a while.

"Sup?" I said casually while I flipped to the next page- Entrees, of course.

"Oh, not much..." Came the reply from the other end. My dear friend Marie was here, that was nice. Hadn't seen her in a while, of course- my job was keeping me "busy"- I had spoken to Lily here and there, but other than that, I had been a bit of a introvert while I got used to my new schedule. I briefly glanced over the menu before deciding on just getting the Carne Asada/Chicken Taco party platter, which proudly boasted to feed six people- I guess we would find out if it could feed just one obese girl who already had a few rounds of appetizers in her gut.

I quietly flipped down my lamented menu and gave Marie the once-over. She was looking... Well, not like the Marie I had met. At all. I had know a few skinny, meek girls in my day (Hell, I was related to one!) but girl had really taken an opportunity to change and RAN with it. She was definitely looking more... Well, normal! She was no longer a twig, but sported a chubby figure- but rest assured, she was the type that took the weight well.

Sometimes, well, at least at Buttercombe, you'd get these stick thin girls, much like Marie, and when they'd gain weight, well- You ever see a girl who's hips look like they're thrice as wide as her torso? Or a girl with gigantic, billowing belly that overwhelms her, while she still has the slim, pointed face of a supermodel? Point being, Marie could've told me she had been "kinda chubby" her whole life and I would've bought it. She had a tummy, sure- but she dressed for it, with a pair of casual jeans (courtesy of Lily, I was certain), thicker thighs, average boobs- you know, just your everyday chubby girl.

She flopped her menu down on the table and grinned at me. "Pork belly tacos would be the greatest right now. I may have to get a double order..." Just then, our server stopped by- she started with me first, and by the time she had finished jotting everything down, I guess she assumed I was ordering for the two of us- because she walked away. Imagine her surprise when she came back with a spare water for Marie, and Marie immediately demanded a double order of tacos!

We both shared a giggle about this, then got down to business. "I'm honestly kind of surprised that you texted me- it seems like Lily made plans for the two of us nine times out of ten." Lily gave me a weird look, the kind you give a kid before you tell them the dog got put down.

"Uh, what? Did I say something wrong?" I asked, curious about the sudden mood change.

"No, nothing, I- Oh, sweet!" My Our appetizers arrived, and before I could even say anything Marie was chowing down.

Of course, appetizers don't last forever, and so by the time I had gotten my second wind, I decided I wasn't in the mood for puzzle solving- I needed to know what was up. "So, Marie- why did you suddenly decide to text me? I mean, granted, I haven't seen you in a while, but..."

"No, that's not it." And all of a sudden, I saw the old Marie- the quiet, awkward, uncomfortable Marie. I reached a chubby hand out and grabbed hers. "Seriously, what's up?"

She looked up at me and gave a tiny smile, which reassured me. Finally, she said, "Hey, so, not trying to put you on the spot or whatever, but-"
1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.title: Mexican Mow-Down with Marie

1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.content:
Let me just say that, as someone who had long passed the prudish notion of "self-restraint", I would have had a hard time believing that Marie knew anything about what "out of control" truly meant to someone like me. For someone as big as I was and as greedy as my gut got? "Out of control" to Marie might have very well been "Sudden craving for cake" for me. But I could tell by the way that Marie was looking at me that she was serious—whatever Lily was doing that had made her so upset was at least worth a little investigation, if only to make that sad little look on her face go away.

"Okay, like..." I did my best to say this without sounding like I wasn't concerned, but I have my reservations as to whether or not Marie bought it, "How is she out of control? What, is she eating a lot more or something?"

"Mel, please, you and Lily only do 'a lot'." Marie said with a puff of exasperated air, "I mean... yeah, she is eating a lot more, but that's not really the issue..."

And so I delved a little deeper; my journey into the weeks past catered by the good people at Mexican Pepper. While Marie talked, I ate. And while I listened, I ate. And while I steadily grew more and more upset, I ate.

Apparently my little talk with Lily many moons ago had been... effective, to say the least. I didn't tell Marie about my part in any of this, of course, and I wasn't entirely sure that I had anything to do with it, really. But I heard Marie's tale of Lily's frequent absenteeism in their (and probably all of her) classes. From what Marie gathered (read: probably indulged in a few times) Lily had taken up my nasty habit of shirking responsibilities in favor of the immediate gratification of food. Furthermore her grades had (expectedly) been slipping; what's more, she was talking to everyone less and less, not just me and Marie.

"So I asked her about what her schedule was for next semester, right?" Marie said as she dipped a chip in queso, "And she tells me that she's transferring to this online school—I'm really worried about her, Mel! She's not going to class, she's switching to a different school, she's not talking to me!"

"Uh-huh..." I nodded, my chins flexing as I pieced together the puzzle in my head—had I really been so busy with my new job that all of this had managed to slip by me?—"So... what do you think we should do?"

"I-I don't know, that's the thing!" Marie said, snapping her chip between her teeth, "I really feel like we should go talk to her. Do you think she's avoiding me?"

"I, uh..." I paused, deciding to keep my conversation with Lily a secret for fear of any blame for her strange new behavior shifting towards me, "Maybe? I don't know. Lily's... a weird chick sometimes."

I couldn't help but think that my little discussion with Lily the night we broke my aunt's couch must have had something to do with all of this. She seemed pretty serious about getting fatter—and staying at home all day, skipping classes, and transferring to an easier way to do both of those things definitely sounded like things that I would do if I were a college girl trying my hardest to plump up. I paused, pushed my empty plates forward, and told Marie...
1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.title: Lily's Losing Control!

1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.content:
Blugh, busses. I assured Marie that I'd go and talk to Lily- fun is fun and all but I kinda felt she was jumping the shark here- dropping her classes, falling off the map socially? There's laziness- hell, I'd like to think I'm the epitome of it- and then there's just bad decisions. This definitely sounded like it was going into the latter category.

Speaking of bad decisions- I was starting to wonder if not grabbing the handicap seat when I had the chance was a mistake. Embarrassingly enough (not to mention, you know, super awesome) I was hitting a point where taking up two seats on the bus was a necessity- so I was definitely getting a lot of angry glares from the folks who had to stand because my ass was easily taking up half of the seat next to me, rendering it unusable by someone who didn't have a waist size of, like, negative 2. Whoops. I made a mental note to either not take the bus at the busiest time, or just grab the handicap seat and hope no-one in a wheelchair got on. Eventually the bus screeched to a stop in front of the apartment complex that Lily lived in, so heavily hefted my girth out of the seat and squeezed past several people- pushing them hard into seated bus riders and hand rails, even when awkwardly shuffling sideways down the aisle. I briefly thought about just getting an Uber driver whenever I needed to go somewhere- but the idea of crawling into a compact and making the rear bumper drag against the ground made me both shiver with delight and blush with embarrassment. I'd have to figure something out eventually, but for right now I guess people on the bus would just have to deal.

Lily lived in a tiny studio apartment that was reserved for college students- I think there was like, 30 units crammed into a 4 story building- and of course, Lily lived all the way on the second floor. I steeled myself, grabbed firmly onto the handrail (fuck you for not having an elevator, fuck you fuck you fuck you) I thought angrily as I clambered up the stairs, overly aware that my face was now bright red. I ambled slowly down the hall, angry that I had to tackle the stairs and knocked probably a bit too hard on Lily's door- good ol' room 25. But the girl who answered was decidedly NOT Lily- she was a lithe Asian girl who looked very angry that someone had banged on her door. "Can I, like, help you?" She asked in a tone that I did not appreciate one bit.

"Um, yeah- I'm looking for Lily- she lives here?" I said, trying to sound snarky but probably failing due to being red-faced and panting from all my physical exertion in the past 5 minutes.

"Yeah, not anymore- she asked if we could swap rooms like, last week- she lives in 12 now, downstairs. She gave me 100 bucks to swap with her." Ugh. Figures. I was really looking forward to sitting down and having a soda or five. "Anything else you want, or can I go back to studying?" The annoyed girl asked.

Jeeze, what a bitch. I bit my tongue though, said thanks, and slowly shuffled down the stairs. Lily must have really gone all in on this weight gain thing if she had swapped rooms with a girl. One would assume she had signed some sort of agreement regarding her room, but whatever. Finally, I banged on 12, now thoroughly pissed off at how much wasted effort I had put into getting to Lily. There was a muffled groan from inside the apartment, but no response. I banged on the door again and heard a louder noise- it sounded suspiciously like a belch. Now fully annoyed, I decided to try the door- thankfully, it was unlocked. I threw the door open and heard the tell-tale sound of wrappers crinkling as they shifted out of the way. I stepped inside to what could easily be described as a pig-sty, and something that would definitely give my mom a heart attack. I mean, there was a LOT of trash. Like, six or seven pizza boxes stacked up next to a trash can that was filled up with wrappers- I spotted several fast food bags, bags of chips, boxes of cookies- all stuff I would have loved to get my hands on, you know, to recover my stamina. The counter, too, was covered in various wrappers, empty bottles of soda, even some cans of beer- naughty, naughty, I found myself thinking. Wondering how Lily got her hands on beer, I scanned the small living area, and realized Lily was probably in her bed.

Her bedroom was in a better shape- but only barely. A large mass was covered by blankets, and small hiccups emanated from underneath. "Hey, Lils." I said flatly- I was pretty annoyed by now. I had texted her when I left the mall, and she hadn't responded, so I was unsure if she expected me or not, but all I got in response was a groan. I waddled over and flopped down on the corner of the bed, which creaked loudly and angrily in a way that reminded me alarmingly of the noise my couch made when we broke it, but it held. "Hey, wake up- I wanna talk to... You." I had grabbed the blanket and ripped it off, only to expose a very naked Lily underneath. "Jeeze!" I shouted, and threw the blanket awkwardly back onto her. "Get dressed!" I stood up, and Lily let out a sleepy belch.

"Yer not my mom, y'know..." She said grumpily, and didn't shift one bit.

"Yeah, but I'm your guest, and we need to talk. Now." I wasn't going to sugercoat this, because that was never my strong suite. She let out a sigh, so I poked her in the belly, hard.

"Ow!" She yelped, and kicked her feet at me in a half-assed attempt at retribution. "Fine, fuckin' hell. Gimme a minute."

I pushed myself off her bed- luckily, it sat at a perfect height so I didn't have to struggle, and made my way into her kitchen. I cracked open the fridge as I heard her rustle around in her room, and found just what I needed- a half empty two liter of Sprite. I screwed off the cap and guzzled it down, barely stopping between gulps- I was parched and annoyed, and needed some sugar to get my spirits back up. I heard the door creak open to her room, as the last few drops of the soda slid down my throat. I popped the bottle out of my mouth and let out a satisfied belch, which earned me an upset glare from Lily. "That was the last of my soda, y'know."

I gave her a look over, and before I could help it, I said, "Doesn't seem like you need it!" She had crammed herself into a tank top, which- while technically covering her tits, it let her quivering gut hang free, which was laced with several stretch marks, and looked much, much larger than the last time I had seen her, a few weeks ago. Her chest had obviously expanded as well, and each breast hung slightly to the side of her stretched belly. I could barely see the leg of the stretchy shorts she had squeezed herself into, which gave her a muffin top of epic proportions.

"Yeah, well, I do- and I don't appreciate you drinking the last of it. Want some pizza?" She asked, and whipped out her phone. Before I could even say yes, she had put it away again.

"Um, I guess not?"

Lily gave me a look. "You can just text your orders, now. I got a double of what I usually get, along with extra soda, but you owe me." She slowly ambled over to the couch, cleared off an empty bag of chips, and collapsed heavily onto it. She took up enough space that I knew I wouldn't be able to fit on it with her, so I sat on the loveseat- noting, with some satisfaction, that my hips brushed both sides.

"Yeah, well you owe me an explanation- and you owe Marie an apology. The poor girl's been worried sick about you- what's this about you switching schools?" Lily rolled her eyes, but I could tell I had caught her off guard with the Marie comment.

"I didn't switch schools- if I did, I couldn't live here anymore. I just switched to online courses. And... Well, yeah, I guess I haven't been checking my phone a lot, lately..." I smirked as I looked around the room.

"Too busy eating?" I said cheekily, grabbing a bag of pretzels from the side of the loveseat- empty, of course.

She nodded, her chins folding into thirds. "Well, yeah. I wasn't kidding around, Mel. I wanna be... big." She blushed, and I began to realize I may have created a monster.

I tried to be understanding, but firm. "Yeah, Lily, I understand that, obviously- but this is kind of ridiculous. Even at my size, I still do... Stuff, besides eat. Not a lot of stuff, but I'm social, I have a job, you know... That kinda stuff. As appealing as it sounds, you can't spend all your time eating- you need to spice it up once in a while." I knew I was bullshitting her- I really did spend about 95% of my waking hours either eating or recovering from eating so I could eat more, but still.

However, Lily saw right through me. "Why the hell can't I? I get money from my parents, my college is paid for- what's stopping me?"

I gestured around the room. "Seriously? This place is a fucking disaster! You gotta take out the trash sometime, you know? And seriously, you really hurt Marie's feelings..." I decided that guilt was the only way I'd get a better response out of her. She stared at the ground for a bit. "Yeah, well..."
1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.title: Languished Lily

1431132311123212132212211212221321232211.content:
"You're riiiight..." Lily said with a huff, "I gotta be better about talking to you guys... 'n shit."

Okay, so it wasn't exactly what I was aiming for, but it was good enough. Even Lily just realizing that she had been acting like a crazy person (read: exactly how I wanted to act, all the time) and worrying the shit out of everyone was good enough for me. But I had to admit, it would be nice to get to see my little ginger binger a little more often. The only faces I had seen for the past few weeks in any regularity were Ms. Calliope and my aunt's. Having someone that actually shared my interests in being absolutely useless and as lazy as possible sounded pretty good.

"And about being a productive member of society?" I crossed my arms over the top of my titty-tastic tonnage, my eyebrows raised in a very mom-ish fashion, much to Lily's chagrin, "Doing more than just laying around and stuffing your face?"

"UUUUGH." Lily threw herself horizontally on the couch, her bigger body bouncing wildly at the sudden impact, "You suuuuck."

"Lilyyyy."

"No fair!" Lily relented belaboredly, "You got to spend, like, all Summer laying around being fat and useless!"

She laid on the couch, all sprawled out like a cat, as her flab jiggled and jostled every which way. My little Lily was turning into quite the plumper; she was already average-everyday-American fat. With our shared fervor for weight gain, this wasn't exactly surprising, but it still always shocked me when I saw just how big she was getting...

"You're the worst." Lily pouted, "Makin' me get up and... and and do shit."

"It's for your own good, fatty." I laughed, making my belly quiver, pressed between my crowded thighs, "Even I go out and socialize... sometimes. It's where I get all my stares and funny looks in."

"Mmm... call me fatty again." Lily said with a (semi-)playful purr as she stroked her belly, "I like it."

***


Okay, so that was one fire put out. It wasn't long before I had re-integrated Lily back into society and she and Marie made nice-nice. Marie did her best, but couldn't quite talk her out of switching to an all-online class schedule; honestly, I didn't blame her. Lily wanted to be bigger than me, and at her height, that meant that she was going to lose a lot of mobility. Quickly. I was in no position to judge her, considering that I had pretty much become fused to my Aunt's couch after it got repaired. In fact, I was all for Lily laying around as much as possible. Again, it'd have been hypocritical if I didn't! So long as she was actually making sure to come out into the sun and make friends with my fat ass, I was all for her being as lazy as she wanted.

And, I mean, I guess things just sort've went back to normal. Marie went to classes, I still had my job, and Lily... did Lily shit. Now that she didn't have to actually go to classes, Lily was pretty much free to spend all day laying around in underwear that she was rapidly outgrowing. I saw her a lot more, which was fun, but I couldn't partake in her fat-girl shenanigans as much as she (or I!) would have liked to now that I had a job. Responsibilities and shit.

And also my own fat girl shenanigans to attend to.

But details.

Anyway, so things were all fine and dandy...
