1431132311123212132212211212221331123213.content:
So, I wasn't exactly starving, but that didn't mean I was going to abstain from tucking right into the little (okay, little for a family of four, maybe) fast food bonanza as we made our way (me waddling, her sniffling and slouched) over to the couch.

I grunted as I flopped back down, bringing up a rather aggressive belch, which managed to get a little smile to light up Sally's saddened face, puffy from tears. "So..." I began, a little awkwardly. "Ex problems? Uh, again?" Sally gave a pathetic little snort as she laid her head onto my thick thigh.

"Yeah, you could say that..."

I allowed her to lay there, because it left both arms open for grabbing food and/or beverage from the coffee table without having to navigate around a second person. It was cute, though- it had been a while since I intimately sat on a couch with someone. "I'll try not to drop food in your face." I added as an afterthought, which got me another smile.

"Thanks..." She trailed off, closing her eyes.

"You uh... Wanna talk about it? Or did you just come over here to feed me?"

She sighed, sniffled, and began. "So. You know, with us just meeting like, what, two weeks ago, I feel like you're gonna think I'm like, a slut- you shouldn't have to hear about two of my exes within like, three days of each other- but... Well, you're gonna have to trust me on this one, I don't have a lot of them- exes, you know, and I just-"

I shushed her by putting my less salt-coated hand on her lips. "Sally, we're both adults- I don't really give a shit how many people you've dated."

That got a smile that seemed more genuine than the previous. "Well, for the record- it's three. I'm not a fan of dating around or whatever... But with my track record, well..." I took an eager bite out of my second burger, waving my hand in a 'get on with it' kind of fashion.

"Look, before Tess there was this guy, Ross. I, uh, wasn't sure of my... Preferences back then, and he was- well, he wasn't charming. He wasn't even nice. He was just, kinda... There. When I was... Lonely." She blushed. "I sound like a fuckin' scumbag."

"Mmph-" I paused to swallow, reaching for my drink and accidentally dripping the condensation on her face, which she wiped away with a frown. "No, no- trust me, I get it... I went to an all girls school, I know about wants and needs." She grimaced at me, but continued.

"I mean, there isn't much to say- we dated for like 8 months, he was an asshole all the time, we broke up and I thought he moved away for good. I guess he's back in town though... He was always on my shit about getting into shape-" Her voice took on a mocking tone. "Sally, you're lucky you have me, no other guy would put up with your fat ass, you need to get to a gym..." She let out another sniffle, and looked on the verge of tears. "I didn't used to be so self confident, you know? And, well, he came in today, did his whole 'Oh shit, it's Sally!' thing to all his douchebag bros, and then just... You know... Said shit... About me." She closed her eyes and turned her head and I felt the warmth of tears on my leg. "I understand the irony of letting comments about my body get to me, what with..." She trailed off, but I got the point.

I slowly put down my drink, careful not to drip on her again. "Sally. Hey." She kept her eyes closed, but when I put my hand on her arm, she grabbed it with her opposite hand. "That guy? He doesn't matter. You're... Well, you're absolutely gorgeous- who the fuck cares what he thinks? I know we haven't really known each other for long, but, for what it's worth, I think your ass is amazing. And so is the rest of your body." She smiled, and turned her head back upwards to face me. I saw her eyes glisten with tears.

"You think so?"

I smirked. "Trust me, girl, if I didn't, I would not have let any of this stuff between us happen. But the things you made me feel, back at your place? Let's just say, it hasn't left my mind since."

I could tell by her current shade of blushing that my last comment had done the trick. "You know, you're right- fuck Ross." I gasped as Sally snapped upwards and kissed me, flipping awkwardly on the couch and cradling my gut, nuzzling affectionately into it in an awkward crouched position, jutting her sizable ass up into the air slightly. That was impressive in it's own right, and for a split second I had my doubts about finishing multiples of the thing...

"Mel? Sweetie?" Sally was waving a hand in front of my face. I swallowed my tremendous bite of burger and glanced at her.

"I mean... I, uh... I have friends." I said, lamely. My gut grumbled and I dutifully took a bite. Maybe my doubts about eating more than one of these had been unjustified.

Sally grinned at me. "Some friends they must be, if you've almost never mentioned them... And I don't see them blowing up your phone or anything..."

I frowned. She wasn't wrong, I hadn't spoke with Marigold or Lily in more than a hot minute- Sally and I were hanging out almost every day, and every day I was usually glutted into such a state that I slept until I heard from her again- often, my post-binge comas tended to last upwards of nine hours before I was even in a remotely coherent state, and by then Sally was usually blowing up my phone about all the food she was gonna jam in my face.

Plus, I'm pretty sure I had gained like, two pounds a day since Sally and I began hooking up constantly, and all that extra weight, on top of all the extra weight I was already lugging around, meant I was basically the human incarnation of lethargy and laziness, which meant getting a hold of old friends wasn't really high on my list of things to spend energy on.

On a whim, I grabbed my phone (after wiping my hand off on a napkin, of course- no sense gunking the thing up) and pulled up my contacts. Sally watched, one eye cocked at me. The phone buzzed not even five seconds after I had sent my text, and I quickly replied before putting the phone down.

"Guess what?" I said smugly before jamming the last chunk of burger into my mouth, and almost immediately regretted it- this burger was pretty dense, especially with all the toppings.

"What?" She asked happily, reaching into the bag and pulling out, which gave me a bit of a pause, and I swallowed happily before responding.

"We're going on a double date tomorrow- also, how many burgers did you bring?" Sally grinned at the words double date, and her smile grew alarmingly wide at the burger question.

"Double date sounds fun. And for the record, I've brought four burgers-" I felt my stomach rumble, but was it out of hunger or apprehension? "They won't be too much for you, will they?" Now it was my turn to grin.

"Let's find out..." I said as I snatched one from her hands.

Well, long story short, I ate until I felt fit to burst, which is something that I could safely say I hadn't felt in a while- While Sally kept me stuffed on the daily, either at my Aunt's house place or at her new swanky digs (but more often than not, my Aunt's place, mostly because me moving around was, y'know, hard to do).

Hell, I was so stuffed that I barely remembered saying goodnight- by the time I had forced down that final burger I was fit to burst and it was all we could do to get to bed, but I did remember that Sally and I agreed to meet up at four, so we could meet up with Marie and Lily.

I learned the next day that Sally had thoughtfully set an alarm for me to wake up at two in the afternoon. So I showered (which, at my size, meant a lot of creative usage of a detachable shower head), managed to find something semi-decent to squeeze into... Sally had graciously gone out and bought me some pants and shirts with at least five X's in the size description. And I am fairly certain she is a miracle worker, because, again, I was able to squeeze into them without ripping anything, which was nice.

So she picked me up in her awesomely oversized SUV ("It had my name on it!" she had claimed when I finally asked why she owned a vehicle more suited for a family of five, and given her taste in women, it was obvious she liked things big.) and we made our way to our current destination... A wonderful Italian place with decent prices and absolutely outrageous serving sizes- which meant I could order shrimp alfredo, chicken puttanesca, baked ziti, fill up on bread, and still have the bill be less than triple digits.

It had been Marigold's suggestion.

When we pulled up, I suddenly got anxious. I hadn't seen Lily or Mary in a while, and while Sally felt like the missing link in my life and I had no problem spending any amount of time with her, or talking with her, or getting intimate with her, I suddenly didn't know how I was going to deal with the closest thing I had to best friends around these parts.

But Sally was as bubbly as ever, her charm oozing out of every pore as she hopped out. "What?" She asked, sticking her head in the door of the car. "You need help getting out? That'd be kinda hot, all things considered..." She purred.

"No, I just... I haven't seen these two in a while. I mean, last time we hung out, I don't think they were really even a 'thing', it's just..." Sally shut her door and was around on my side before I even registered- for such a thick-bootied girl, she could certainly move when she wanted to.

"Look, hon, you are one wonderful, sexy, perfect woman and anyone would be lucky to call you your friend, now lets get in there- you need yourself some heavy Italian dishes, I can tell..."

Well, that was certainly enough to get me motivated. I got out of the car (with no help from Sally, thank you) and we headed inside- where we were immediately accosted by a very cheerful Marigold.

She looked almost nothing like the meek, timid Marigold I remembered. Sure, she was still basically a stick, but she was actually wearing a dress that one might call "casual-formal", which is something I'd never catch the Mary I thought I knew in.

"MEL?" She practically shrieked, before burying herself heavily into my side fat, which immediately enveloped her lithe form. Such an outburst certainly wasn't her usual MO, neither was a bodily hug. "I was so so so excited when Lily told me you texted her! And this place? It was my suggestion!" She let go me and gave me a wink, before turning to Sally. "And you... You must be Sally!" Sally's eyes had gone wide- this skinny little thing had basically accosted me, whereas my description of Marigold was "Tiny and quiet". It wasn't long before Sally was embraced as well.

"Uh, yeah, hey Marigold, sorry I haven't gotten a hold of you or Lily in a while, I just-" I began, but was quieted with a wave of her hand.

"Don't even mention it- I can see you've been busy..." This got a tiny smile, but a knowing one nonetheless. "Well, we already got a table, although Lily had to run to the bathroom, she should be here soon!"

"I can't wait!" I said sincerely, and Sally agreed.

Of course, when Lily did finally show up...

"That was over a hundred dollars of groceries, Mel!" She threw her hands in the air, gesturing to the pile of garbage around me. I realized that Sally looked incredibly worn down- a far cry from her usual bubbly self.

"Um... Are you okay?" I asked, trying to ignore the incessant grumbling happening in my core.

"No! I've worked overtime twice this week, and I've spent my entire paycheck feeding you! You haven't said thank you to me once for all the fucking food I bring you, my boss got on my ass about how much food I've been bringing home, and you- you just aren't acting like yourself!"

"I thought you liked this. Y'know, this whole fat girl thing. Were you just using me? Just another fetish-fueling girl for you to-"

"Fuck you, Mel. Seriously. I wasn't using you, I really cared about you! But you don't care about me, you just care about stuffing your fucking face- on MY dollar, mind you." I started to stand up- struggling to find the energy to get my hefty frame off the couch, it took me several tries to get enough momentum to shift my bulk upwards. "What are you doing?" She asked, clearly on the verge of tears.

"To get some food." I responded, and began to waddle towards the door.

"Without pants?" She asked wearily. Fuck. I turned and slowly waddled into her bedroom, where my clothes were laying in a pile on the floor. I collapsed onto her bed and began the arduous process of shifting my massive, meaty thighs into the stretchy lycra leggings, all too aware that I probably outgrew them. I turned to face her, already panting from the small amount of physical exertion. "After everything?" I narrowed my eyes.

"I'm not... I just... I need some food. And some time. To think, y'know?" She nodded sadly. "I'll text you or something."

And with that, I waddled out the door. And to be honest, I really was just hungry, and I really was gonna text her once I got home. But... As I made my way home via the bus, (which, I realized sadly, was probably the last time I'd ever be able to do so, judging by how much my ass hung over the two seats I occupied) I was overtaken by just how loooong it had been since I ate. So I got off the bus early, and waddled to McDonalds, where I pulled out my last 20$ bill and ordered 19 cheeseburgers (fuck taxes, by the way) and proceeded to eat all of them in, oh, about 10 minutes. Then I made my way back to the bus, got on, and took it home.

But then, when I walked in the door, my phone was almost dead- and when I made my way to plug it in, my Aunt came out, saw my sad face, put two and two together, and ordered us a pizza feast, which put me into yet another food coma... And when I woke up from that, my Aunt had ordered sandwiches for us, and also bought some ice cream to "cheer me up", even though she ate her fair share of it... And I just kinda fell back into my habit of eating all the time and blocking out the world.

“So what is this place?” Lily asked as we rounded the corner (don’t even think I walked all the way there, we were parked a few yards back).

“It’s a Mongolian buffetURP” I half belched as we neared the building.

“Mongolian? Really? That’s kind of odd for a small town” Lily questioned whilst absentmindedly rubbing her first (of hopefully many) belly-rolls between her thumb and forefinger.

“Well, so long as they serve big portions I don’t care what they serve!” I laughed, my massive gut wobbling heavily as we reached the large double doors, a helpful waitress opening them as we entered.

“Welcome welcome” came a rather smarmy man who dressed a little more importantly than the waitresses and waiters scattered around the place. “Table for two? Or would you like our couples table?”

“Table for two” Lily requested, “Although I would like to try this couples table with Marigold another time....” Lily pondered as the hand-rubbing man led us to our seats.

“That’s if they don’t bar us for what I am about to do here” I chuckled as the foolish greeter seated us far too close to the buffet for the restaurants own good, “This is going to be fun” I added, patting the top of my gigantic gut as we were left to our own devices. The pat however jostled out an odd hiccup. I was trying to hide from Lily just how much I had glutted myself throughout the day until later, so she could marvel all the more on what she was about to witness. Unfortunately I probably ate a bit TOO much.

Lily raised an eyebrow: "Mel..." she said slowly "how much have you already had to eat?" Shit, cover blown. Might as well use it.

"Welll not THAT much," I said nochalantly, my hands vainly spread across my vast gut, "there was that pizza you saw. Then the Chinese takeout. URP. Then the Thai place. Then the Mexican. ooooh then takeout from the Doornail..."

"Ok I get it, you're beyond stuffed. So WHY do you think you can handle another meal?"

I chucked, "to show you, Lil, how I got all thisss" I slapped my hands on the thunderous flanks of my gut, and wobbled it around, entrancing her with its shaking blubber and soft churning. "I have room for...HIC*burble*...everything here...and ANYTHING...HIC...*bubble*.” My hands sunk deep into my fat despite my gorged state. An explosion of rich bubbling erupted from the mountain of food from my previous meals, the disturbance jostling up a few more belches and hiccups as well from the depths of the overglutted vat of my gut. "Alright, Lily. start getting me platters, and I'll show you...HIC...how much I c'n handle!" She rolled her eyes and heaved her chubby body up, grateful that we were so close to the buffet.

Working nimbly, she vastly overloaded a towering platter of rich, greasy barbecue, and with a significant grunt, hefted it over to me. I squealed a thank you, and commenced gorging myself with the ferocity of a starving animal. And I ate...and ate...and ate. Oh my GOD did I GORGE! Driven by the need to show Lily my capacity, and the stares of the other diners, I caused food to flood into my mammoth stomach at truly unprecedented rates, and I felt my gut rapidly begin expanding and churning in futile digestion that I ignored completely in my blissful feasting. More, MORE and MORE food avalanched into my overburdened body.
As more and more and more piles of eastern delicacies slammed into my overglutted gut, the my belly continued to swell further and further, and it must have looked stupendously massive and heavy. My shirt rolled up even further, reduced to nothing but a crop-top, and the seams on the side nonetheless started to creak ominously. I was in my zone.

After God knows how long I slumped back for a second, hands draped helplessly across the explosive swell of my mammoth belly, my breath coming in ragged hiccups: "HIC…HICCC…HICCCCCC!!! Oh GOSH…UUURRP…what a feast! HIC! So much fooood...God I love…HIC…being so fucking FAT URRP." I woozily sat there, a stupidly happy smile plastered on my face.

Sarah had just returned with another platter, which she set down with a relieved "Whoof...God DAMN Melly you weren't shitting me. Ready for more or you good?"

"I toldja thiss gutt can handle anything...HIC" I winked. "oh you bet, I have only begun to gorge...URP". Giggling, I grunted and hefted myself back into a sitting position and began glutting yet again. So much food, so much eating, so much fat; All I had to do was cram food into my mouth, filling, double filling, and triple overfilling my exploding stomach with as much food as I could possibly shove down my throat. I thought it could last forever, but with a loud SNAP, I was brought to reality by my chair breaking beneath me. I tumbled down to the floor with a *plop* that shook the whole restaurant, and caused the greeter to come running.

Uh Oh

1431132311123212132212211213.content:
As you know by now, I’m never one to do things in half measures, and so for the next two and a half weeks, I absolutely let myself go into a life of laziness, lassitude, and insane gluttony. The weeks passed in an absolute blur of food. Now come to think of it, I don’t think there was a moment that I could remember (granted, I did black out many MANY times) when I wasn’t heavily glutting myself, sleeping, or thinking of eating. I don’t know what it was, but I just couldn’t help myself. I gorged myself with as much food as my massive stomach could handle, sloshed my way home, slept it off, and repeated the process, always aided and abetted by my lovely Lily. To be honest, I don't think I was ever completely not stuffed for an entire four weeks. It was truly incredible. Speaking of Lily, she had put on a fair bit of weight too, and was looking decidedly portly, but she had shown a remarkable resistance to the lure of eating, especially around someone like me. Or she was too busy making sure my gut was nearly always packed to bursting with as much food as I could cram down.

Of course such incredible exertions (I told you eating was hard work) and unbelievable sloth didn’t go with consequences. Wonderful, plush consequences. I had packed on another 15 pounds, and was sitting pretty at just over 460 pounds. I. Was. MASSIVE. Long having soared past my highest weight to date, as far as I was concerned, the SKY was the limit. As usual, my mammoth belly was bearing the vast amount of my gaining, and it was easily the most stupid big thing I ever dreamed of growing, especially when glutted to explosive levels. This was a fat girl’s paradise, and I was MORE than content to linger forever. As long as Aunt Rhonda didn’t mind, and Lily remained happy, things couldn’t get any better. Or so I thought.

Oh yeah, I had gotten banned from Little Pigs too, but after some hunting around, Good ol’ Lily had found this new buffet, the Doornail, and for the past week, it had been the perfect place to stuff myself stupid, with crazy delicious downhome delicacies, and a laid, back downhome staff to match. It was there that I found myself at 3pm on a Wednesday, deep within the lunch-phase of my typical daily glut. Frenetically stuffing gravy-slathered fried chicken pieces into my mouth, and ignoring the rich burbling of my pleading gut, I was so in the zone, that it took a particularly heavy punch from Lily to get my attention. Leaning back heavily against the wall of the booth (adjustable! Yay!) I licked my fingers and patted the vast upper swell of my bulging, half-sheathed belly: “Hiccuuuurrpp!! Whaazatt for?”

“Wake Up, Tubby, I think we got trouble. Those twats who we met that first day just entered.” Lily whispered sharply. I looked up, still woozy, but curious. I recognized the ugly clothes and stereotypical haute couture outfits even in my food-drunken state. But there was something else that caught my eye, something that made me focus, even just a little...
1431132311123212132212211213.title: We ran into those snotty brats from before—bu...

14311323111232121322122112132.content:
But there was something else that caught my eye, something that I could tell was just off about them. And then I realized; both of those snooty snobs had put on a noticeable amount of weight!

I mean, I hadn’t seen them for months. The first and only time I had the displeasure of making their acquaintanceship was when my belly knocked over their table back at Mexican Pepper, but that had been a few months and about sixty pounds ago. If they hadn’t pitched such a bitch fit (and if Lily’s lame-ass excuse about me being blind) didn’t stick out so much in my mind, I probably would have forgotten that those twiggy snots even existed.

They were so inconsequential to me, in fact, that I almost didn’t even register what the trouble was. I was too engrossed in stuffing myself to give them a second thought on my own. But then Lily casually reminded me about the day we met, and the day we met them, and things clicked immediately into place.

“Ohhh…” I burped, smacking my lips, “That’s them?”

Lily snickered as I gave them a snarling second glance, my nostril curled distastefully at their Fall Casual.

“Right?” she said cattily, “I almost didn’t recognize them!”

And really, you probably wouldn’t have either. Both girls looked to have put on at least thirty pounds since we’d seen them last. The blonde one with the outsized sunglasses and the platinum blonde dye-job (Lindsey, if my eavesdropping skills were correct) was sporting quite the tummy. It stretched her halter top enough to outline the distinct curve of her pot, and it rode up a little around her muffin top—leaving an inch or two of skin bubbling over the sides of her jeans. Her face looked doughy, and her tits had gone up a couple sizes. Meanwhile the beta brunette (Who, as far as we could tell, was named Stephanie) had put on a lot of weight in her lower body. Her hips flared out noticeably, giving her a distinct bell-shape. And from the angle she was standing at, Lily and I could plainly see the great growth of her ass. Her belly rounded out a little in front, but Stephanie’s booty had definitely done some ballooning.

I noticed the tell-tale signs of recent acts of gluttony too—smeared lip-stick, quiet little burps into their hands, the fact that the stupid brunette one still had some ketchup on her tee…

You know, the little things.

“Damn.” Lily said maliciously, “They got big.”

“Like you’re one to talk.” I poked Lily in her left melon, inadvertently gathering that she had gone braless yet again

“Like you’re one to talk.” Lily snorted, batting my hand away, “What do you think happened?”

“I don’t know…” I paused, “But…
14311323111232121322122112132.title: Pudgy People Watching

143113231112321213221222.content:
So the rest of my day mostly went as was usual by this point. I kept eating after Aunt Rhonda left. Then I went out with Lily and ate some more, with her help. Then I went back home, or I guess I should say-- no, it pretty much was my new home. Point is, I went back, digested for a while, and then ate some more. Nothing you haven't already heard about.

         Oh, and just for the record: I didn't say anything about Auntie getting fat to Lily. I thought if I did, I'd let it slip I was...checking her butt out, I guess? Like, not sexually, obviously. But I might've made it sound that way.

         Look, would you wanna risk creeping your only friend out like that?

         Yeah, that's what I thought.

         But whatever. I ate a lot that day. Nothing new.

         The actual difference in routine started when my aunt came back from work. Or with her coming back, because she got home later than usual. I noticed she was bringing in groceries (plus her usual bear claws and donuts), but didn't think much of it.

         But then she started bringing in clothes. Like, all kinds of clothes. Shirts, skirts, panties, everything. And there was enough to last her about a week. "New clothes, huh?" I said to her after she brought in the last of them.

         "Uh-huh," she replied, setting the bags down in front of the couch. Then she sat down and kicked off her high heels. "None of my stuff fits right anymore, so I figured it was time to update my wardrobe." She leaned back and sighed, her little belly just barely peeking out of her business clothes.

         I thought back to this morning and tried not to look guilty. "Oh yeah?"

         "Yeah." She pat her belly. Wait, did that mean she- "I've just gotten a little too big for my clothes now. Too much fat."

         So she did notice. Either she skimmed through the denial phase or just skipped it altogether. Good on her all the same. "You noticed, huh?"

         "It's hard not to when everything pinches you."

         "True."

         And then we fell into this sort of awkward silence. I didn't know where to take the conversation from there, and I'm pretty sure my aunt was in the same boat. Like, I think we both knew where to go from there, but not how.

         After a bit, Auntie said, "It's all the food, isn't it?"

         "Huh?"

         "The food." She gestured at all the snacks on the coffee table. "You've always got some out, and we spend a lot of time together when we can, so..."

         "Oh, right. That." Great, now I had no choice but to feel guilty. For a single woman, she seems to have mother-type stuff down pretty good.

         "Oh, no, no! I'm not blaming you!" she said kind of quickly. I must've been acting guilty too. "It's my fault for eating so much!"

         "Yeah, but I'm pretty much always tempting you with the stuff."

         Auntie shrugged. "Hey, it's both our faults, let's be honest."

         "That's fair." I leaned back a little and rubbed my gut when something hit me. "Uh, come to think of it, when's the last time you did any exercise?"

         She frowned and looked down. "Good question..." After a moment, she looked back up. "It's been a few weeks, I thi--"

         A loud growl cut her off. Not my stomach, if you can believe that. No, it was hers. We both stared at her pot-belly, then at each other. She blushed and got up. "Right! Dinner! Sorry! Let me go order those pizzas!" And she hurried off to the phone.

         I just grinned to myself. God, I'm so glad Aunt Rhonda's nothing like her sister. Mom'd be freaking out like she was dying or something. Just another reason to stay here and as far away from my old home as possible.

         ... Not like Mom would let me come anywhere near my old home at this point anyway, but y'know.

         Putting that aside, Aunt Rhonda's recent gains were a bit of a more pressing matter for me. I mean, sure, she realized it was happening and why, but what was she gonna do now?

14311323111232121322123.content:
Okay, so I kind of figured that this was coming.

I get it, living with me is expensive. I'm a big, fat, foodee. I eat a lot, and I go through clothes pretty quickly too. Plus, I always kind of guessed that Aunt Rhonda would expect me to start paying rent eventually. She told me that I had to either get a job, or start selling stuff on eBay. And since I didn't have any stuff, job it was.

The only problem was that I had never really been... "employed" before.

"Oh come on Mel, there's plenty of places to work around here!" Lily exclaimed as she lead me down the street (the freakishly hot, humid street!)

"Says Little Miss College Education." I snorted, taking a big bite out of my third corndog, "Seriously, I've never had a job before! Do you know how hard it is to find a job in this economy?!"

"You went to private school." Lily retorted, looking at a copy of my resume, "Seriously, they didn't prepare you for employment in Buttercombe Academy?"

"No, they were too busy making sure all the important students were taken care of." I wheezed, struggling to keep up with my itty-bitty weight gain coach, "Seriously... I'm at a loss."

It was the first Saturday of the month, and everyone was out and about. People on bikes, lots of cars honking, and lots of pedestrians. And then there was me. I'd put on a good twenty pounds or so thanks to Lily, and believe me I was feeling it. I'd begged Aunt Rhonda for some new clothes a few weeks ago, but they were already gettiing tight. My belly had only gotten bigger, but my ass had officially made every single bottom I owned obselete. Even my gross highlighter-yellow shorts, which I had quite literally exploded out of three days ago.

"Well... how about a job in food service?" Lily looked at my resume, "You've got all these culinary classes listed on your resume. Why not put them to good use?"

"I...pff... I guess." I wheezed, taking a slurp from my Pepsi snowcone, "But I'm really more into... eating food than... making it."

"Hey, do what you know, right?" Lily laughed, patting my big sweaty belly beneath my tank-top a few times. It sloshed and shook in front of me, upsetting my pace, "Come on, there's nothing wrong with working with food. You'll actually probably get a discount."

"Fuck it. I'm sold." I laughed breathlessly, stopping right there in the middle of the sidewalk, "So where should I apply?"

"Well..."

143113231112321213221232.content:
“Apple Dumplin’s is hiring.” Lily looked at the app on her phone as she walked, “Y’know, that little bakery that just opened?”

“Fuuuuuck.” I moaned, slurping down my snowcone “That’s halfway across downtown. And it’s so fuckin’ hot…”

“Text your Aunt?” Lily suggested hopefully, “Maybe she’s on her lunch break? Do… do lawyers get lunch breaks?”

As it turned out, they did. I whipped out my phone and typed out a message to my aunt with my pudgy little fingers that I had decided to apply at Apple Dumplin’s, waited about five seconds, and felt my phone vibrate against my flabby hip. She was fucking ecstatic—not only that I was taking her empty threat of kicking me out seriously, but that I was looking into a career at a place that was quickly becoming her guilty pleasure. Aunt Rhonda was probably going to go by Apple Dumplin’s anyway—the woman had a serious addiction to bear claws.

So we waited, stopping in one of the local fast food joints for a quick pit-stop, spent about twenty more dollars on lunch for me and Lil (mostly me) and my aunt swung by. She was kind enough to bring me a pair of freshly laundried jeans the size of a tent, and a t-shirt to better cover my obscene amounts of cleavage and arm fat. We piled into the car and drove, Aunt Rhonda’s intervention turning my hellish walk through the sun-baked urban jungle into a cushy five-minute ride with air conditioning.

We stopped a little farther away, allowing me to sneak my fat ass into a restroom and change. And then promptly take too long, have to have Lily come in and help me. I emerged ready and raring to go—having only split a seam or two in my struggle to keep my bodacious bigness halfway decent.

“You ready to get your first job, Mel?” Lily said excitedly with a pump of her little arms

“No.” I groaned, rubbing the vicious overhang of my belly blubber as it spilled over the waistband of my jeans, “Can barely… breathe in these…”

“Atta girl.” Lily pat my malleable massiveness, making it quiver in delight underneath my top, “Don’t worry—you’ll be able to buy new pants. Pants that maybe shouldn’t scream every time you breath.”

And so Lily led me by the chins next door as my Aunt drove off, dozens of donuts in tow for her firm’s breakroom. Every labored step took an extraordinary amount of willpower because seriously, these jeans were not comfortable. It took me twice as long as it normally would have, to give you a rough estimate of how fucking unpleasant my monster muffin top made walking. Every other step I had to stop and adjust my shirt, pulling it back over my belly bulges.

Eventually, we made it. I walked right through the double doors, recognized Savannah the waitress, stood straight up, looked as professional as possible, and asked her if there was a position open.

“Well~” she said in that Southern way that I was beginning to recognize, “We are accepting positions for…

Okay, look, she was totally fine.

She was a complete and total bitch, but she was fine.

"Hey, watch where you're going you fatass!" this short, scrawny little redhead barked at me from the sidewalk, "You could have killed me with that thing!"

1431132312.title: Little Lily with a Big Mouth

14311323122.content:
So, confession time. This wasn't the first time I'd inadvertently run into someone with my belly, and it probably won't be the last. I mean, it's not a regular occurrence or anything, but it just happens sometimes. Totally not my fault. Well, kind of my fault, considering I very deliberately stuffed it full of calories over the course of several years, turning it into the wrecking ball it is today, but I digress. My point is that the incident with Lily (whose name I would not learn until later), while unfortunate, was not a novelty for me. I was prepared to write off that redhead and just forget the the whole thing had ever happened. Of course, that wasn't what happened.

Well, I'll start off by saying that I eventually made it to Gerardo's. I had to take a few breaks here and there, but in my defense it was really hot. I'm pretty sure I managed to sweat off at least a pound of water, maybe more. Anyway, as I was saying, Gerardo's. It looked like pretty much every Mexican restaurant that I've ever been to. Mexican flag hanging from the ceiling? Check. Pictures of bullfighters adorning the walls? Check. Red and yellow wallpaper in shades that subconsciously trigger feelings of hunger in people? Double check.

Anyway, despite the fact that I'd made it to the place that supposedly made the best breakfast burritos in town, I was feeling pretty pissed. According to the clock on the wall, it was almost noon. This meant that I'd gone several hours without a good meal, had instead spent said hours exercising, and in the process probably missed out on trying the breakfast burrito since it was no longer breakfast time. Still, I was here now, and I resolved to give this place a fair shake. At any rate, I'd have to eat quite a bit to make up for all of the calories that I'd wasted getting here in the first place.

As I stepped in the place, I saw a familiar shade of red hair. It took me a moment to recognize that this was the same girl who I'd bumped into before. As it turned out...
14311323122.title: Little Lily with a Big Mouth. Again.

143113231221.content:
So the person up front had taken me to a table and handed me a menu. It was one of those little tables for one, which meant it was probably going to get pretty crowded with plates, but seeing as all the bigger tables were currently being used, so I'd just have to make do. Anyway, I was just looking over the menu when I saw the skinny red head at the other end of the restaurant. Her face was redder than her hair, and she was pointing and gesturing at me while having a whispered argument with this tall, chubby woman who I'm guessing was her supervisor. I decided to ignore them after a moment, seeing as I had a menu in front of me and I wanted to know what I was going to order before the server got to my table. Get the food over here a little quicker, you know?

Anyway, I'd just decided on a few choice morsels (You can tell that I'm being sarcastic, right?) when I hear someone clearing their throat. I then look up to see the person who'd be bringing me my food today. You have three guesses about who it was, and the first two don't count.

"Hi! My name is Lily, and I'll be your server today! Can I start you off with something to drink?" she said in the most cheerless cheerful voice I'd heard in my life. About the only thing more fake than that voice was the smile on her face. I'd been on the receiving end of quite a few "I'm smiling at you because I'm socially obligated to smile at you" smiles in my life, and this one had to be in the top ten, at least. Her skinny body was as tense as... well, it was really tense. All-in-all, her attitude and posture said, "I don't want to be here and I don't want deal with you, but I have to because I need to get paid."

I responded that I was actually ready to order, to which she responded, "So what can I get you then?" She then coughed, which I'm pretty sure she did to hide muttering the word "fatass" from me. So it was going to be that way, huh?

Anyway, after that, things proceeded as they usually do when I go to a restaurant. I ordered a lot of food (sadly, there were no breakfast burritos served after 12:00, as Lily informed me with one of the most unapologetic apologies I'd ever heard), the server asked if I actually meant to order it all, I responded with a yes, and then the waiting game began. Fortunately, I didn't have to wait too long. Pretty sure that Lily was trying to expedite things so that she could be rid of my fat ass as quickly as possible, but since it meant the food got to me sooner I wasn't complaining. And as it turned out, Gerardo's was pretty good. It wasn't the best Mexican food I'd ever had, but then it's hard to top the kind of cuisine you can get at my alma mater.

Anyway, after a few burritos, some tacos, and a taco salad (the only kind of salad worth eating), I was feeling pleasantly full. I would have stuffed myself further, but a part of me was cognizant of the fact that I would have to walk back home. Which sucked, but bothering Aunt Rhonda at work just to have her drive me home felt like a bad move to make if I wanted to continue staying with her. So I was preparing myself for the odyssey home when Lily brought me the check. She was still wearing that fake smile, but she was also looking really tired. I actually felt kind of bad for her. It wasn't like I'd meant to ruin her day, but I guess that had happened nonetheless.

Anyway, I looked over the check (not as much as I thought it would be, even considering how much I ate), and took out the money that Aunt Rhonda had given me to pay for it.

Trust me, she was fine.

I hadn't really been paying attention, but that was no excuse for me to have not seen this girl. Seriously, she was huge. A little short, but that just made her all the more round. She had more than enough padding to survive our fender-belly-bender unscathed and thensome. She just sort of looked up at me with her big plate face, her chubby cheeks all red from embarassment, and her double chin started wobbling as she started apologizing profusely.

"Oh my god, I'm so sorry!" her voice was deep and slow, and her big belly was still shaking from the impact, "I was just on my way to lunch and I wasn't watching where I was going and..."

"It's cool, I'm fine." I laughed, my own body still quivering from our meeting of mass, "I'm the one who bumped into you, anyway."

Seriously, this girl was a grade-A fatass. Her belly was so big it spread her legs apart, and her tits were so huge I was wondering how she was even walking. I couldn't exactly see behind her, but I was guessing that she was proportionate enough to have a bumper to match that huge fender of a rack. Her face was all round and chubby too, along with her doughy arms that hung at her side. Seriously, short fat girls had all the luck. It was so much easier for them to get bigger...

"So... where were you going to get lunch?" I asked her, "I'm kinda new in town and... no offense, but I'm guessing you're the kind of girl who knows where to get a good meal?"

"Yeah." she laughed, patting what bit of belly she could reach with pride, "I was just about to head to this little chinese buffet down the road. You?"

"Gerardo's." I said, suddenly craving Chinese

"Oh blech." my fellow foodie gagged, "Gerardo's is nasty."

"What? My aunt loves Gerardo's!" I said defensively

"Does she look like she would know a good meal as well as I would?" the big round redhead put a hand on her hip, "Because, seriously, Gerardo's is shit."

"Alright, alright... point taken" I submit to the skinniness of my Aunt Rhonda, "My name's Mel."

"Lily." the fat girl smiled and pushed past me, "Now come on, let's get you a real meal..."
1431132313.title: Largest Lily and our Collision of Corpulence

choices: College. Yeah, that's right, I've got a brain to match this belly!"
My Mom kicked me out. Something about our food bill..."
I got a job! Seriously, it's for this not-at-all suspicious company!"
14311323131.content:
So I'll admit, the two of us together must have been some kind of something, because people could not stop staring.

I mean, they were probably staring at me considering just how big I was, but I'll admit that Lily might have had some gravity too. Just a little. We were two hugely fat chicks, taking up so much sidewalk with our supremely wide figures that people had to move around us, panting up a storm at the very not-so-slight exertion of having to haul our fat asses a grand total of one city block. What's worse, I was just a little bit bigger than I thought my top could contain--my belly kept trying to wriggle its way out of my tank top, and it threatened to flop right out of my jeans.

But we made it there, barely, and we only caused half as much of a scene when we barged in through the doorway. We were both pretty starved by the time we got there, running on fumes and Asian aromas alone. I could hear Lily's gut groaning as she picked up her pace, her little body waddling fiercely in an attempt to get in before I could.

"Welcome!" said a surprisingly size-tolerant hostess, "Table for two?"

***


"Jesus Mel, save some sweet and sour chicken for the rest of us, why don't ya?"

I stuck my tongue out at Lily as I leaned into the self-service booth, my wobbly arm extended with tongs, my platter filled with sticky orange chicken. My belly pooled onto the tray slider as I held my plate up at chest-level.

"Height makes might, shorty." I stuck the tongs into the empty bin and let one side collect sweet and sour sauce, which I then drizzled over the already drowned chicken, "Not to mention girth, too."

"Ugh, you bitch." Lily's fat face twisted into a frown as I waddled back to our booth, "I'm getting all the sesame chicken, just for that short joke!"

"You can have it!" I hollered back, my big belly sloshing back and forth

As I collapsed into my seat, the whole restaurant seemed to shake. I wriggle-waddled my way further into the booth, my fat rolls pressing lightly against the table as I struggled to move my collossal ass. We had been eating for about an hour now, with no signs of slowing down. It was nice to finally eat with someone who could at least keep up with me--the last person who could do that was my roommate back at Buttercombe, but that seemed like forever ago.

Lily followed suit not long after, her own humongously little body struggling to fit into the booth as much as mine was. She was easily as fat as I was, if she didn't weigh the same. Her long rust-red hair framed the chubby curvature of her cheeks, threatening to dribble into the sesame sauce. She hadn't been seated for more than a second before she started digging in.

"Mm... so... how long have you... been here?" I asked nonchalantly between animalistic mouthfuls of hot, gooey chicken, "South Carolina, I mean."

"Just...urp...just moved here." she answered in a similar fashion, "Like...wh-urrrp... a week ago?"

"Mmph... me too." I bit into the sweet meat of my meal, orange sauce beginning to coat my lips as I swallowed with reckless abandon, "Just moved in with...mm, this is good... just moved in with my aunt."

"Cool." Lily said almost disinterestedly, as if I were somehow less interesting than chicken, "I'm here 'cuz...
14311323131.title: Buffet Blitz

143113231313.content:
“I’m here ‘cuz I got a job.” Lily snorted through her mouthful of chicken, “Which, y’know, is pretty cool, but I’m not going to lie when I say I would have loved to be one of those people who works from home in their underwear all day.”

“I hear that.” I chuckled, suddenly very aware that I had never so much as had a paper route to earn my own money—being a prep school kid kept me more or less out of the working crowd, “So where do you work?”

“YFP.” Lily stated simply, not so much as a pause for dramatic effect, “It’s like this food company.”

“A food company?” I repeated incredulously, harpooning some chicken with my fork and drowning it my pool of sweet and sour sauce, “Come on fat girl, enunciate—use your words.”

“Ugh.” Lily exhaled sharply in a playful way, but I was very able to tell that she was rather put out by having to stop eating to explain to me what her job was, “It’s like… okay, so you know how restaurants and fast food places have to get their food from somewhere? That’s UFS.”

“Uh-huh.” Somehow that named seemed kind of familiar, but I couldn’t quite place how, so I just let it go, “That’s really cool Lily. Congrats, girl!”

“Thanks.” Lily had resumed eating not a second she finished explaining her job to me, and I had just happened to catch her between bites, “I was really psyched I got the job—I didn’t even think I’d get it, considering I don’t have my degree yet. But they said it wasn’t a problem!”

With a stretch of her round little arm, Lily snatched the soy sauce from the middle of the table and proceeded to drown her own dwindling hillock of chicken and rice in a waterfall of sticky brown liquid. I never much cared for the stuff, but Lily obviously did.

“Oh, hey!” Lily said suddenly, garnering my own attention briefly, “We actually supply this place—I recognize the bottle!”

“Sweet.” I said rather flatly, just now getting back into the swing of stuffing my face, “Wanna donate one of those eggrolls to the Fellow Fat Girl charity?”

“Hm? Oh, yeah sure.” Lily looked past her own heaving chest onto her plate, where she went to pluck one of her uneaten rolls, “Oh crap, I got soy sauce on them. Do you mind?”

I really kinda did. I didn’t much care for soy sauce—it was way too strong, and I already had some of that “home-made” sweet and sour sauce they were so crazy about advertising. It wouldn’t really “mesh” well, y’know? But at the same time, I really wanted one of those eggrolls because come on, eggrolls.

So, caught in a fat girl quandary, I...
143113231313.title: Lily and YFP

choices: The next day, Lily invites me to lunch.
A few days pass before I hear from her.
14311323133.content:
One fat girl walking down the street would have drawn a few stares, but two of them, side-by-side filling the sidewalk, should have made cars stops because of rubbernecking. Or so I thought. As we walked I was attuned to the people around us (OK, I was hoping to catch people staring at us), but no one noticed us. It's not like we didn't stand out; people had to walk around us when they passed, but then they were on their way, ignoring us.

I didn't have much time to ponder this; after just a couple blocks Lily grabbed my arm and said

“Oh, wait! Fat Burger! They don't have that where you're from, do they?”

“No, I've never heard of it.” I followed her eyes across the intersection to a fast food place billing itself as 'The Last Great Hamburger Stand.'

“You've got to try it.” I let her drag me across the street; not like hamburgers weren't a tempting lunch themselves.

My neutral mood turned positive when I saw the menu. In addition to small, medium and large burgers they also had XL, XXL and XXXL. Yeah, Lily knew where to find real food.

And she knew how to eat. While I mulled my order, she asked for a pair of XXXLs and three orders of fries, plus a large soda and two large shakes (one chocolate, one strawberry). I was starving myself, and also feeling a little... defensive about my own appetite. I couldn't let her see me eating like a bird, could I? So I got pretty much the same thing, preferring the southwestern bacon clubs to the regular burgers.

The staff must have recognized Lily, because they all straightened up when she came in, and they were so quick with our order I wondered if we should have tipped them.

It wasn't until we were deep into our meal that something occurred to me. Breaking the silence (if you count chewing and moans of pleasure to be 'silence') I asked

“How did you know I'm not from around here?”

Lily finished chewing her mouthful of fries before she answered.

“It's a small town, and I know I'd remember seeing someone like you. No way would someone as fat as you stay off my radar for long.” She smiled when she said it, some private joke on her mind.

My first thought was she was a lesbian, attracted to obese women, but I couldn't think of how to test those waters so soon into our acquaintanceship without it sounding weird. Not that I was automatically averse, but I had just met her.

I let the matter drop, returning to my food. It was a filling meal, even by my standards, and at the end I was happily stroking a belly that purred like a content kitten.

“Still want to hit the buffet?” Lily asked me when we were back on the street.

“I've still got room,” I decided. “Lead the way.”

But after another block we were passing an El Pollo Loco.

“You mind if we stop here?” Lily asked, rubbing her belly. “I could go for a burrito or two.”

Once inside, a quick snack didn't seem good enough. The smells, the pictures on the menu; they made our mouths water. We ended up sharing a 12-piece meal, complete with sides. I can't remember who suggested it, but it didn't matter. Hands greasy, we were both bent over the table, dropping bones picked clean on a plate between us.

“OK (belch). Now we can go to the buffet,” Lily announced, as if both stops had been the opening act to the real meal.

We were moving a lot slower now, weighed down by swollen guts churning and digesting the food we had already eaten. I was still up for a little more, but I didn't think I had it in me for a full buffet stop. I mean, when I go to a buffet I have certain expectations about how much I'll get for my money, you know? I was along for the ride more to find out where this supposedly awesome buffet was for future reference than I was for a real meal.

But when I saw the Dairy Queen I had a suspicion we wouldn't make it to the buffet.

Sure enough, Lily wanted to stop and get some dessert. We demolished half a dozen sundaes plus pieces of cheesecake and root beer floats, and at the end I couldn't pretend I could still go on.

Fortunately, Lily had hit her limits as well.

“Guess I overdid it,” she said, hands on her bulging middle pressed against the table. “It's happened before. I have no self-control when it comes to food; even if I'm walking to one place I'll have to stop anywhere that looks tasty.”

“You don't have to apologize to me,” I said. “You think I have any self-control when it comes to food? At least I know where a few places to eat are.”

“I'm just sorry we couldn't get to the buffet. You would have loved it.”

“Another time.” I said. “I'm new in town, and I'm learning where everything is. Here,” I got out a pen and wrote on a napkin. “Call me sometime, we can get lunch again.”

“Oh, definitely,” she said, brightening noticeably. “I love to meet new gluttons. Oh!” She put a hand in front of her mouth. “I'm sorry, that was a bit presumptive of me.”

I laughed, a full-on belly-jiggling chortle.

“It's fine. After watching me eat just now, how can you think I'm not a greedy piglet?”

“Not all fat people enjoy eating,” she said, “Only a certain kind of person embraces their appetite. Only some people can.”

For the second time I wasn't sure how to respond, so I just nodded and kept my lips sealed.

We parted ways, Lily saying she had some obligation later that afternoon, and I headed back to Aunt Rhonda's apartment. A nap would be nice.

Lily seemed cool, and I thought about how great it was I had made a friend my first day in town. And not just a friend, but, as she put it, a fellow glutton. I couldn't wait to see her again.
14311323133.title: Lily and I never made it there... too many temp...

choices: …to church?”
…to a family get-together?”
143113231331.content:
Lily called me the next morning.

“Hey, you want to go to the buffet now? They open at 10:30, so if we hurry we can get there first.”

That turned out to be a little optimistic. Even though I knew where to go and had enough self-control to not stop anywhere along the way (alright, it was the promise of a buffet and unlimited trips to the serving stations that kept my eyes looking forward), I didn't know the bus routes or schedules yet, so I had to hoof it. And at my size, walking just a few blocks was a commitment of time and energy.

When I got to the restaurant – The Golden Fan – I was panting and my belly was growling. Lily was standing out front, wearing stretchy leggings and a college football jersey. I had on jeans and a button-down blouse, perhaps not the best choice for a marathon eating session.

“It may not look like much from the outside,” Lily said, leading me in, “but I like to think of it as a well-kept secret.”

She wasn't wrong on either part. The exterior of the building was gray stucco with one of those electric signs that was just a piece of plastic with fluorescent lights behind it, but the interior was surprisingly spacious and well-lit.

“Welcome back!” the hostess said, recognizing Lily. “And you brought a friend. Welcome.”

“Table for two,” Lily said. “Benches.”

“Of course,” the hostess said. “Right this way.”

Benches, I wondered, but when I saw the dining area it made sense. Most of the place was tables and booths, with regular chairs at the former. But a few of them had thick, sturdy benches instead.

And I could see why. We weren't the first people there, it turned out. A tremendously fat man, weighing at least twice as much as me, was seated at one of the benches. He was wearing a blue and white track suit, along with small black glasses that were apparently for aesthetic rather than practical purposes, for as a waitress brought over a tray of food he looked up and smiled. There was no way this guy could squeeze into a booth, and even with two chairs under him the restaurant would be risking destruction of property.

He had a small ring of plates and bowls in front of him, the waitress running back and forth between him and the buffet to keep his table full. I couldn't help but stare, for a number of reasons. Jealousy, mostly, of both his size and how he was being waited on personally.

“What does it take to get service like that?” I asked Lily. We had been shown to our table and were now heading to the food.

“Get as fat as him. Special customers get special treatment, but we're not at that point yet.”

“Yet,” I echoed, smiling. It felt good to be hanging with a fellow gainer.

The food lived up to Lily's promise, and even if I didn't 'need' to be making several trips to fill my belly I wanted to try some of everything. And then I wanted seconds and thirds of the stuff I really liked.

Our meal went on long enough for the lunch rush to get into full swing, couples and individuals coming in and filling the regular tables and booths, and a couple other gargantuan fatties getting seated and waited upon. One of them, a middle-aged woman in a sleeveless dress with a belly that came past her knees, exchanged a glance with Lily. They don't look related, but they knew each other. She also looked me over, smiling at something. I don't think she knew I saw her, but I did.

“I've seen maybe one or two mega-obese people in my life,” I said to Lily, circling the issue. “But now there's three here in one place. Does this town have a ton of really fat people?”

“Maybe more than usual,” she said, “We're in the South, you know. Southern cuisine is pretty fattening, and we're not shy about enjoying our food. But I think it's more that we fatties know each other, we know where the best restaurants are. And this place has such excellent service, it's a favorite spot for all the big eaters.”

It sounded like a reasonable answer, so I let it drop. Still, I was starting to get the feeling there was something else going on.

But my suspicions died as we kept eating, and I lost myself to the gluttony. We ate for over an hour and a half, each unintentionally pushing the other on because we were too proud to yield. When it was done we couldn't move, and we sat there for a while stroking our bellies and chatting about our lives. Lily was particularly interested about Buttercombe.

“An entire school of fat girls. That's sounds awesome.”

“It was, and I hated leaving. But this place doesn't seem so bad. Good Chinese food is always a plus.”

“Oh, there's plenty more places in town you have to check out. We haven't even scratched the surface of what this town has to offer.”

And that set the agenda for the next few days: I would meet up with Lily and we would go to this or that restaurant, she introducing me to the best meals in town or just where to find certain franchises I loved. At every place we gorged with total abandon, and at almost every place I saw at least one mega-fat person. A couple times it was someone I had already seen, like Track Suit or Sundress Woman, but most of the time it was a new person. How many supremely fat people were there in this town, I wondered. And why did they all live here?

I got something of an answer that weekend. On Friday Lily and I were at a seafood place that sold buckets of fried clams, and in the middle of our third or fourth one she said

“Hey, this is kind of last minute, but on Sunday would you be willing to come with me
143113231331.title: The next day, Lily invites me to lunch.

choices: I realize something odd about the congregation
Aunt Rhonda asks where I'm going every Sunday, and she doesn't like the answer
1431132313311.content:
…to church?”

That was an unexpected question, if ever there was one. I know I was in the Bible Belt now, but Lily hadn't given any sign of being religious.

I didn't want to offend her, so instead of saying 'No' I said

“I guess I could. I'm not a huge believer or anything.”

She smiled, then smacked her forehead.

“Oh, duh! I should probably explain, it's not Christian.”

“Really? What is it?”

“It's... I guess you would call it pagan. My parents and I are Old World. We go to a temple that worships Ceres, the goddess of the harvest and abundance.”

“Huh,” I said. “That's interesting. Never expected to meet a pagan down here.”

“We're not big on labels or anything. In fact, our temple doesn't even look like a religious place. There's just a couple dozen of us, so we rent out a hall on the edge of town every week and get together for a feast. It's how we show our gratitude to the Goddess, by enjoying the fruits of her gift.”

“Why didn't you just say there would be food?” I asked. “Could have gotten right to the point.”

“I didn't want to surprise you when you got there. I know some people would think it was weird, worshiping a goddess of food.”

“Not me. That sounds like one theology I can get behind.”

On Sunday Lily and her parents came by my aunt's apartment to pick me up. Her parents were even fatter than her, but not as fat as some people in town. Around 550, maybe 600 pounds apiece, her father being bigger than her mother.

“I don't know how much Lily explained to you,” her father said as we drove, “but this meeting isn't big on rituals or ceremonies. There's no sermon or blessings, no hymns or whatever. There may be a prayer at the start of the feast, the temple mother consecrating the meal and offering thanks to Ceres, but then it's just a big meal. It's more of a social event than anything.”

“Sounds fun,” I said. “Thanks for inviting me.”

“Don't mention it,” Lily's mother said. “We always like to meet other people with appetites. They're the ones blessed the most by Ceres, Deena always says.”

“Deena?”

“The temple mother,” Lily said. “Head of the church. Other than handling finances, it's a mostly ceremonial position.”

“It's an important role,” her mother said. “She embodies the image of Ceres and her abundant gifts. She's the spiritual center of our congregation.”

I was fighting mightily not to roll my eyes. On the subject of gods and goddesses I was of the mind that they (if they existed) seemed to like staying in the background, and that was fine by me. They did their thing, I did mine. But Lily's family was being nice to me, inviting me to a free meal like this, and I didn't want to be rude.

The hall was so unassuming I wondered if I wasn't be put on. Other than a sign near the road that said 'McGreevy Hall' there was nothing special or noteworthy about it, no indication of why it had been built or what purpose it served now.

Inside it was just as blandly forgettable. A plaque to one side of the entrance (linoleum floor, wood-panel walls) explained who McGreevy had been, and there was a community events bulletin board that was sorely in need of updating. But as I followed my hosts through the entrance and to the main hall I could tell something was going on.

It was the smells, first of all. Even before I saw the food I could smell it, the aromas of all the dishes mingling together but each striking on its own. It was better than any restaurant I had been to.

And once I saw the food I almost had my own religious epiphany right then and there. There was a rectangle of tables in the center, with dozens of trays and bowls of the biggest servings of food I had ever seen, and the most tantalizing. No buffet I had been to (and I had been to a lot in the past four years) rivaled this spread.

So taken with the sight of the food was I, it took me several breaths to turn and take in the other... congregants, I'll call them. I recognized almost all of them, the fattest of the fatties I had seen around town. Men and women and a few teenagers, it was like a secret meeting of the biggest eaters in town. No wonder Lily had said she would recognize someone as fat as me.

The ones I didn't recognize were a few skinny people setting the tables, a portly man about my size but at least a decade older, and a woman who broke all conceived notions I had about the limits of obesity. The man was chatting with some of the other people waiting to eat, probably just a regular member of the church. But the woman... She was sitting on what I assumed was a small platform, her turgid immensity a pile of blubbery rolls rising from the ground up to her head like a pyramid of flesh. At her size it was relative if she was more belly-heavy or bottom-heavy; everything about her was packed with fat, from her cheeks that made her eyes look small to the chubby toes of her feet poking out of her sandals.

She was wearing a great white dress, and her chestnut hair was done in several braids. She had an 'Earth mother' vibe to her, only it was more real than what your typical hippie liked to conjure.

“I suppose that's Deena,” I said to Lily.

“Got it in one. Come on, I'll introduce you.”

I was a little in awe of her; outclassed as a glutton but also feeling more like a child than an adult. There was something primal in the majesty she exuded. Still, I followed Lily over.

“Deena, this is Mel. She just moved to town a few days ago.”

Her warm smile did little to put me at ease, but I shook her hand when offered it.

“Welcome to our temple.”

“Thank you for having me, um, temple mother.”

She laughed, a surprising lilting tone to her voice.

“Deena is fine. You've already seen we don't care much for ostentatious appearances, not like the Catholics, and neither do we focus on hierarchy or ranks. I hold the title of temple mother, but it is not who I am.

“I hope you enjoy the meal here today, and that you will enjoy it to the fullest you can. If you leave here unsatisfied, it will be a mark of shame on us.”

“I don't think you have to worry about that. Everything looks so good, I'll probably be upset when I have to stop eating because I'm full.”

“I remember that feeling,” Deena said, “To see food and not be able to eat it. So frustrating.” She looked at the clock on the wall. “Time for the meal to begin. Again, enjoy yourself.”

The congregants circled around the tables, Lily and I finding space near her parents, though nobody sat down. Once we were all assembled the platform or whatever it was Deena was sitting on moved forward, completing the circle.

“Welcome all,” she said, raising her voice to be heard, “old friends and new. We are gathered here today to enjoy the blessings of our patron goddess, Ceres, She of the crop and the harvest, She of abundance. In celebration we will feast. Take all that you want, eat to your fill.”

As far as prayers went, I'd heard worse. Once she was done we all sat down and began eating. Like a Thanksgiving meal we took from what was in front of us and then passed the dishes around. With so many dishes it took some time before everyone had a chance at everything, but like I said, the portions were so huge that nobody missed out on something.

There will little talking at first, but into the fifth or sixth course several conversations broke out. I was sitting next to Track Suit, who introduced himself as Kenji, so we talked about both being transplants to the city.

“I came here three years ago,” he said. “I was a lot skinnier then, but my job involved just sitting in a cubicle all day, and after a while I was packing on the pounds. When I was invited here my weight started to skyrocket.”

“Invited?” I asked. I turned toward Lily. “I wouldn't guess you guys do a lot of evangelizing.”

“We aren't trying to convert anyone,” she said. “Most of the people here were raised in the church, or if we see someone who looks like they'd belong we invite them. Like you.”

“Like me,” I said. “Are you guys going to try to indoctrinate me?”

“We don't do that. If you want to come back in the future, you're welcome to, but we're not a cult. We're not going to take control of your life.”

Lily was dead serious; she clearly believed in this Ceres stuff, and my attempts to keep the tone light were shot down by her earnest defense of it. Hours later, after we had all eaten our fill and were shambling out of the hall cradling painfully swollen bellies, Lily repeated

“I meant what I said earlier. If you want to come back, you can. You're exactly the type of person who we want here.”

After eating the best, most indulgent meal of my life I couldn't refuse the offer, so a week later (a week filled with stuffing myself around town) I was again picked up by Lily's family and driven out to the hall.

From there this quickly became a normal thing for me, and then the highlight of my week. I was enjoying myself binging at this or that restaurant, but none of them were as good as the temple meetings.

It was after a few weeks of these feasts that I was starting to feel like a part of the 'congregation.' I had gotten to know a lot of the people in the temple, all of them having the same love of food and fat I had, and this was becoming as much of a family as my real one. Maybe a nicer one, since none of them filled the role of my fat-shaming mom.

But it was also then that something upset the status quo.
1431132313311.title: …to church?”

There is something, and it's not just in the skinny congregants.
14311323133111.content:
Almost a month of my new life, which was even more lazy and gluttonous than my old one at Buttercombe, had gotten my weight gain moving again. Moving up, of course. I had come to Carolina weighing about 400 pounds, and I was proud to say I was close to hitting 500 now. A lot of it came from Aunt Rhonda being super accommodating, never getting on my case to get a job, always having money in her purse to give to me, and always buying any snacks or goodies I put on her grocery list.

“I never really saw motherhood as for me,” Aunt Rhonda told me at one point, when I ventured to mention how awesome and un-mom-like she was being, “especially not with an infant or young child. But having a teenage daughter, someone I can talk to and relate to? That seemed pretty nice. And having you here is as good as it'll ever get. I'm loving this.”

And then we did each other's nails and talked about cute guys on TV shows we liked.

But the other thing helping my gain was the weekly 'church' meetings, which were always a massive feast that lasted all afternoon. Every week I went hog wild, cramming my face with everything on offer and only stopping when I was too full to move. Everyone else ate themselves stupid, but I was getting compliments and recognition even from Deena, the temple mother, for my appetite.

I should say 'almost everyone,' actually, because after a few weeks I noticed something: there were quite a few skinny people at the temple. They never ate with us fatties, and I had been so overwhelmed with getting to know the other big eaters that I hadn't noticed the people who set the tables, brought the food out, and started to clean up after we were all done.

I asked Deena about it one week, before we started the feast.

“Yes, they're members of the temple,” she said, “but no, they don't eat with us.”

“Why not?” I hadn't asked many – or really, any – questions about the temple and its theology until now, but this seemed like such an obvious lapse in the avowed 'worship through eating' when members of the congregation didn't have a literal seat at the table.

“This may sound strange if you've heard about the Judeo-Christian god being all-loving and having infinite compassion, but we don't believe Ceres shows Her love equally to all people. She hates no one unless they deserve it, and She will help any sincere petitioner, but She reserves special privilege for those who capture Her fancy. Appetite, girth, and other gifts go to those She chooses, but everyone should find contentment in their own station.”

I mulled that over while we ate, now paying closer attention to the skinny people when they popped up after the feast. They worked quickly, efficiently clearing the table and rushing back to the kitchen to clean the plates and silverware. I also noticed that Deena wasn't completely done eating yet; one of the skinnies was bringing her plates of food so she could continue eating while the rest of the congregation said their goodbyes and departed.

There was something about the skinnies, something in the way they held themselves and moved hurriedly, that seemed out of place. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something.

After the Ceres feast I was driven home, where I went to my room and caught a quick nap. Sleep off the 'itis,' give my belly a chance to empty before dinner.

Dinner tonight was a honey-baked ham and potatoes au gratin. Aunt Rhonda wasn't ever going to be a world class chef, but she had a good head for down-home cooking. The feast earlier didn't impede my performance at the dinner table, cleaning plate after plate and downing glass after glass of soda.

“Enjoying it, Mel?” Aunt Rhonda asked, her eyes fixed on me.

“It's great,” I said, mouth half-full of ham. I drained my glass, the two-liter next to my plate empty. “Is there any more soda?”

“Oh! Of course.” Aunt Rhonda almost bolted out of her chair, speed-walking back to the kitchen and returning with a chilled bottle of Cherry Coke. “Do you want anything else?”

“No,” I said, a little unnerved by seeing the temple skinnies' efficient behavior mirrored in my aunt. “Thanks.”

“Any time,” she said, and then she went back to her own seat.

That could have been a weird coincidence, I thought to myself as I laid in bed that night. Had to have been.

But no. Over the next couple days I was more aware of Aunt Rhonda's behavior towards me. She was quicker to get me something if I asked for it, and more than once she offered me something I hadn't asked for (snacks, a dessert before I went to bed). She had been totally cool with my appetite until now, but this went from enabling to encouraging.

Not that I was complaining, but a voice in my head was telling me there was something behind this, and not knowing what it was made me nervous. I didn't want something bad to happen to Aunt Rhonda.

I mentioned all of this to Lily on Friday. We were at an Italian place, eating whole pizzas or the occasional order of cheese bread, our bellies both bunched up against the table and our butts crammed into our chairs. As I said aloud what I had been obsessing over the past few days I was struck at how silly this sounded, but Lily was quiet and attentive as I spoke.

When I was done, she finished chewing the food in her mouth and said

1431132313311121.content:
“It makes perfect sense. It's your aura.”

“My what?” I asked.

“Your aura. It's a gift from Ceres. You're giving off positive vibrations that makes people around you feel happier, compelling them to make you happy.”

“Seriously?” I asked, not stopping myself in time to avoid the chance of offending Lily and her religious beliefs.

“You remember when you first moved here, and you saw Kenji at the Golden Fan, being waited on? That was because of his aura. The waitstaff at any restaurant he goes to will wait on him hand and foot, and they won't even think about doing so. Like with your aunt.”

I wanted to laugh that off, but I couldn't.

“I'm so jealous,” Lily said, taking another bite of food. “I've been going to temple since I was a kid, trying to get myself as fat as possible and hoping for Ceres' gifts, but you come in and after just a month you're already this far.”

“Thank you?” I said. She sounded a little upset.

“You should enjoy it. Ceres only shares her gifts with people She has big plans for. There's no telling how far you can go with this.”

Silly as this was, I couldn't help but imagine myself as big as Kenji, or even Deena, people bringing me food while I sat back and relaxed. Like a queen, being tended to and not having to lift a finger herself.

Walking into the apartment and being greeted with the smells of a veritable smorgasbord did nothing to bring me down to Earth. Aunt Rhonda was in the kitchen, cooking up a storm.

“That you, kiddo?” she called. “Hope you didn't eat too much for lunch, I kind of went overboard with dinner.”

“It smells great,” I said, walking to the kitchen.

“Does it? I'm glad.” Aunt Rhonda was wearing a red apron; she had taken off her suit's jacket, but she was still wearing the blouse and pencil skirt gone to work in. As if she had started cooking as soon as she got home. “I found a couple cookbooks during my lunch hour and I just had to try some of the recipes. Don't make any plans for the weekend, because I need you on hand to taste-test all of this.”

“Well, I'll be out Sunday afternoon,” I said. She turned around and put her hands on her hips.

“That's right. You're always gone on Sundays. What is it you're doing?”

She sounded genuinely curious, and I hated the idea of lying to her, so I told her the truth.

“There's a sort of New Age, Wiccan group I hang out with. We get together and eat a big lunch.”

“A big lunch, you say.” Gears were turning in her head. “Do they need any cooks?”

That Sunday Lily and her parents didn't pick me up. Instead, Aunt Rhonda drove me out to McGreevy Hall (I knew the directions with my eyes closed) to see this for herself. As we entered the hall you could see a change coming over her. I led her to the dining hall itself, but as I made introductions she was fidgety. When I introduced her to Deena she blurted out

“So where's the kitchen? You guys probably need some help there feeding this many people, right?”

“It's through the doors in the back there,” Deena said, indicating the double-doors even if she couldn't turn around and point. Aunt Rhonda practically skipped out of the hall, leaving me and the temple mother alone.

“Is she OK?” I asked, now definitely worried by her swiftly changing behavior.

“Perfectly fine,” Deena replied. “Lily told me your aura has revealed itself, so I understand this is new to you, but you have no reason to worry. Your aunt is still herself, and she's still in her right mind. She's just focused on pleasing you and the rest of us than she is her own desires.”

“She's been acting different for a few days now, but when she got here it was like a total transformation.”

“It was the combined auras of all of us here. When you two go home today she'll come down, so to speak. But she'll still be happy to please you. I say you should make the most of it.”

I couldn't see anything truly bad going on, so rather than worry I settled back into my happy glutton role. I spent the afternoon gorging like always, Aunt Rhonda never coming out of the kitchen until the feast was over. Like Deena said, she seemed to mellow out when we were on the road and putting distance between us and everyone else.

Not that she returned to complete normalcy. As soon as we were back home she said

“I'm going to get started on dinner, sweetie. Why don't you have a nice nap? I'll wake you when it's ready.”

The dinner she made was bigger than any meal she had made before. She had filled almost the entire dining room table with food.

“I got to talking with the other people in the kitchen at the temple,” she said; not 'hall,' but 'temple.' “They were all really nice, giving me tips and tricks when cooking. They even gave me some new recipes to try.”

Again, I couldn't think of anything to do except roll with this, so I sat down and filled my gullet with what turned out to be amazing food. Aunt Rhonda must have learned something while at the hall. It was so good I even ate a little beyond my usual stopping point; I just didn't want to leave anything sitting there! But finally I had to yield to the limits of my stomach.

“Are you sure you don't want anything else?” my aunt asked as she cleared the table. I merely groaned, shutting my eyes at the thought of even another bite.

How long could this go on, I wondered. Was Aunt Rhonda really going to be fixing me these huge, delicious meals every day? I couldn't see a downside to it, I admit, but part of me still thought there was something skeevy about her almost being hypnotized like this.
